<p>This page is for <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#nominate" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">nominations</a> to appear in the "<a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYK" title="Wikipedia:DYK" class="mw-redirect">Did you know</a>" section on the <a href="/wiki/Main_Page" title="Main Page">Main Page</a>. For the discussion page see <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">WT:DYK</a>.</p>

Current time is 03:23, October 20, 2015&#160;<a href="/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time" title="Coordinated Universal Time">UTC</a>&#160;<span style="font-size:80%;">(<span class="noprint plainlinks purgelink"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=purge"><span title="Purge this page">purge</span></a></span>)</span></small></td>

<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Instructions_for_nominators">Instructions for nominators</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-1" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Create a subpage for your new DYK suggestion and then list the page below under the <b>date the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#article" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">article</a> was created or the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#expansion" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">expansion</a> began</b> (<u><b>not</b></u> the date you submit it here), with the newest dates at the bottom. Any registered user may <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#nominate" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">nominate</a> a DYK suggestion (if you are not a registered user, please leave a message at the bottom of <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">the DYK project talk page</a> with the details of the article you would like to nominate and the hook you would like to propose); <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#self-nom" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">self-nominations</a> are permitted and encouraged. Thanks for participating and please remember to check back for comments on your nomination (consider <a href="/wiki/Help:Watchlist" title="Help:Watchlist">watchlisting</a> your nomination page).</p>
<center><i><b>If this is your first nomination, please read the DYK rules before continuing:</b></i></center>
<center><i>Official DYK criteria:</i> <b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know#DYK_rules" title="Wikipedia:Did you know">DYK rules</a></b> and <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Supplementary_guidelines" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Supplementary guidelines">supplementary guidelines</a></center>
<center><i>Unofficial guide:</i> <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Learning_DYK" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Learning DYK">Learning DYK</a></center>
<p><span id="How_to_list_a_new_nomination"></span></p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="To_nominate_an_article"><span id="How_to_post_a_new_nomination"></span>To nominate an article</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-2" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quotebox" style="margin: auto; width:50%; padding: 6px; border: 0px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div class="" style="background-color: #F9F9F9; color: black; text-align: center; font-size: larger; font-weight: bold;">Read these instructions completely before proceeding.</div>
<div class="" style="position: relative; text-align: center;">
<div>
<p><i>For simplified instructions, see <a href="/wiki/User:Rjanag/Quick_DYK_2" title="User:Rjanag/Quick DYK 2">User:Rjanag/Quick DYK 2</a>.</i></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<table style="width:100%;">
<tr>
<td style="background-color:#ffff99"><span style="font-family:Verdana,Arial,serif"><b>I</b>.</span></td>
<td>
<div style="font-size:100%;width:12em;max-width:30%;float:left;margin:2px 0px 2px 0px;border:1px solid #ffcc00;padding:.1em;text-align:center;background-color:#ffff99;">Create the nomination subpage.</div>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<p>Enter the article title in the box below and click the button. (To nominate multiple articles together, enter any or all of the article titles.) You will then be taken to a preloaded nomination page.</p>
<div class="mw-inputbox-centered" style="background-color: clear;">
<form name="createbox" class="createbox" action="/w/index.php" method="get" id="createbox">
<p><input type="hidden" value="edit" name="action" /><input type="hidden" value="Template:T:TDYK/preload" name="preload" /><input type="hidden" value="Template:T:TDYK/editintro" name="editintro" /><input type="hidden" name="summary" /><input type="hidden" name="nosummary" /><input type="hidden" value="Template:Did you know nominations/" name="prefix" /><input type="hidden" name="minor" /><input type="text" name="title" class="mw-inputbox-input mw-ui-input mw-ui-input-inline createboxInput" value="" placeholder="YOUR ARTICLE TITLE" size="50" dir="ltr" /><br />
<input type="submit" name="create" class="mw-ui-button mw-ui-progressive createboxButton" value="Create nomination" /></p>
</form>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color:#ffcc00"><span style="font-family:Verdana,Arial,serif"><b>II</b>.</span></td>
<td>
<div style="font-size:100%;width:12em;max-width:30%;float:left;margin:2px 0px 2px 0px;border:1px solid #ffcc00;padding:.1em;text-align:center;background-color:#ffff99;">Write the nomination.</div>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<p>On the nomination page, fill in the relevant information. See <a href="/wiki/Template:NewDYKnomination" title="Template:NewDYKnomination">Template:NewDYKnomination</a> and <code>{{<a href="/wiki/Template:NewDYKnomination/guide" title="Template:NewDYKnomination/guide">NewDYKnomination/guide</a>}}</code> for further information.</p>
<ul>
<li>Not every line of the template needs to be filled in. For instance, if you are not nominating an image to appear with your hook, there is no need to fill in the image-related lines.</li>
<li>Add an edit summary e,g, "Nominating YOUR ARTICLE TITLE for DYK" and click <i>Save page</i>.</li>
<li>Make sure the nomination page is on your watchlist, so you can follow the review discussion.</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color:orange"><span style="font-family:Verdana,Arial,serif"><b>III</b>.</span></td>
<td>
<div style="font-size:100%;width:12em;max-width:30%;float:left;margin:2px 0px 2px 0px;border:1px solid #ffcc00;padding:.1em;text-align:center;background-color:#ffff99;">Post at <strong class="selflink">Template talk:Did you know</strong>.</div>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<p>In the <a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Did_you_know#Current_nominations" title="Template talk:Did you know">current nominations section</a> find the subsection for the <b>date on which the article was created or on which expansion began</b>, not the date on which you make the nomination.</p>
<ul>
<li>At the <i>top</i> of that subsection (before other nominations already there, but below the section head and hidden comment) add <code>{{<a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/YOUR_ARTICLE_TITLE" title="Template:Did you know nominations/YOUR ARTICLE TITLE">Did you know nominations/YOUR ARTICLE TITLE</a>}}</code>.</li>
<li>Add an edit summary e.g. "Nominating YOUR ARTICLE TITLE for DYK" and click <i>Save page</i>.</li>
<li>Consider adding <code>{{<a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/YOUR_ARTICLE_TITLE" title="Template:Did you know nominations/YOUR ARTICLE TITLE">Did you know nominations/YOUR ARTICLE TITLE</a>}}</code> to the article's talk page (<i>without</i> a section heading—​the template adds a section heading automatically).</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="How_to_review_a_nomination">How to review a nomination</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-3" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">Main page: <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Reviewing_guide" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Reviewing guide">Wikipedia:Did you know/Reviewing guide</a></div>
<p>Any editor who was not involved in writing/expanding or nominating an article may review it by checking to see that the article meets all the DYK criteria (<a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Article_length" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Article length">long enough</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/New_article" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/New article">new enough</a>, no serious <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know#contentrules" title="Wikipedia:Did you know">editorial or content issues</a>) and the hook is cited. Editors may also alter the suggested hook to improve it, suggest new hooks, or even lend a hand and make edits to the article to which the hook applies so that the hook is supported and accurate. For a more detailed discussion of the DYK rules and review process see the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Supplementary_guidelines" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Supplementary guidelines">supplementary guidelines</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Reviewing_guide" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Reviewing guide">WP:Did you know/Reviewing guide</a>.</p>
<p>To post a comment or review on a DYK nomination, follow the steps outlined below:</p>
<ul>
<li>Look through this page, <strong class="selflink">Template talk:Did you know</strong>, to find a nomination you would like to comment on.</li>
<li>Click the "Review or comment" link at the top of the nomination. You will be taken to the nomination subpage.</li>
<li>The top of the page includes a list of the DYK criteria. Check the article to ensure it meets all the relevant criteria.</li>
<li>To indicate the result of the review (i.e., whether the nomination passes, fails, or needs some minor changes), leave a signed comment on the page. Please begin with one of the 5 review symbols that appear at the top of the edit screen, and then indicate all aspects of the article that you have reviewed; your comment should look something like the following:
<blockquote>
<p><code>Article length and age are fine, no copyvio or plagiarism concerns, reliable sources are used. But the hook needs to be shortened.</code></p>
</blockquote>
If you are the first person to comment on the nomination, there will be a line <code>:* &lt;!-- REPLACE THIS LINE TO WRITE FIRST COMMENT, KEEPING :* --&gt;</code> showing you where you should put the comment.</li>
<li>Save the page.</li>
</ul>
<p>If there is any problem or concern about a nomination, please consider notifying the nominator by placing <b>{{subst:DYKproblem|Article|header=yes|sig=yes}}</b> on the nominator's talk page.</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Frequently_asked_questions">Frequently asked questions</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-4" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Backlogged.3F">Backlogged?</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-5" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>This page is often backlogged. As long as your submission is still on the page, it will stay there until an editor reviews it. Since editors are encouraged to review the oldest submissions first (so that those hooks don't grow stale), it may take several weeks until your submission is reviewed. In the meantime, please consider reviewing another submission (not your own) to help reduce the backlog (see instructions above).</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Where_is_my_hook.3F">Where is my hook?</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-6" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>If you can't find the hook you submitted to this page, in most cases it means your article has been approved and is in the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#queue" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">queue</a> for display on the main page. You can check whether your hook has been moved to the queue by reviewing the <b><a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know/Queue" title="Template:Did you know/Queue">queue listings</a></b>.</p>
<p>If your hook is not in the queue or already on the main page, it has probably been deleted. Deletion occurs if the hook is more than about eight days old and has unresolved issues for which any discussion has gone stale. If you think your hook has been unfairly deleted, you can query its deletion on the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">discussion page</a>, but as a general rule deleted hooks will only be restored in exceptional circumstances.</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Search_archived_DYK_nomination_discussions">Search archived DYK nomination discussions</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-7" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="mw-inputbox-centered" style="background-color:&#160;;">
<form name="searchbox" class="searchbox" action="/wiki/Special:Search" id="searchbox">
<p><input class="mw-inputbox-input searchboxInput mw-ui-input mw-ui-input-inline" name="search" type="text" value="" placeholder="" size="60" dir="ltr" /><input type="hidden" value="Template:Did you know nominations" name="prefix" /><br />
<input type="submit" name="fulltext" class="mw-ui-button" value="Search archived DYK nomination discussions" /><input type="hidden" value="Search" name="fulltext" /></p>
</form>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Instructions_for_other_editors">Instructions for other editors</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-8" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="How_to_promote_an_accepted_hook">How to promote an accepted hook</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-9" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul>
<li>See <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Preparation_areas" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Preparation areas">Wikipedia:Did you know/Preparation areas</a> for full instructions.</li>
<li>In one window, open the DYK nomination subpage of the hook you would like to promote. In another window, open the <b><a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know/Queue#Prep_areas" title="Template:Did you know/Queue">prep set</a></b> you intend to add the hook to.</li>
<li>In the prep set...</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Paste the hook into the hook area</li>
<li>Paste the credit information (<span class="nowrap">{{DYKmake}}</span> and/or <span class="nowrap">{{DYKnom}}</span>) into the credits area.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>Back on DYK nomination page...</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>change <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code>{{DYKsubpage</code></span> to <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code>{{<b>subst:</b>DYKsubpage</code></span></li>
<li>change <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code class="nowrap">|passed=</code></span> to <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code class="nowrap">|passed=yes</code></span></li>
<li>Add an edit summary e.g. "Promoted to Prep 3", and save.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="How_to_remove_a_rejected_hook">How to remove a rejected hook</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-10" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul>
<li>Open the DYK nomination subpage of the hook you would like to remove. (It's best to wait several days after a reviewer has rejected the hook, just in case someone contests or the article undergoes a large change.)</li>
<li>In the window where the DYK nomination subpage is open, replace the line <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code>{{DYKsubpage</code></span> with <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code>{{<b>subst:</b>DYKsubpage</code></span>, and replace <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code class="nowrap">|passed=</code></span> with <span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;"><code class="nowrap">|passed=no</code></span>. Then save the page. This has the effect of wrapping up the discussion on the DYK nomination subpage in a blue archive box and stating that the nomination was unsuccessful, as well as adding the nomination to a category for archival purposes.</li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="How_to_remove_a_hook_from_the_prep_areas_or_queue">How to remove a hook from the prep areas or queue</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-11" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul>
<li>Edit the prep area or queue where the hook is and remove the hook and the credits associated with it.</li>
<li>Go to the hook's nomination subpage (there is usually a link to it in the credits section).
<ul>
<li>View the edit history for that page</li>
<li>Go back to the last version <i>before</i> the edit where the hook was promoted, and revert to that version to make the nomination active again.</li>
<li>Leave a comment explaining that the hook was removed from the queue, and why, so that later reviewers are aware of this issue.</li>
<li>If the day title for the section that contained the hook has been removed from this page, restore that section.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>If you removed the hook from a queue, it is best to either replace it with another hook from one of the prep areas, or to leave a message at <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">WT:DYK</a> asking someone else to do so.</li>
<li>Add a link to the nomination subpage at <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Removed" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Removed">Wikipedia:Did you know/Removed</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="How_to_move_a_nomination_subpage_to_a_new_name">How to move a nomination subpage to a new name</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know/Header&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-12" title="Template talk:Did you know/Header">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul>
<li>Don't; it should not ever be necessary, and will break some links which will later need to be repaired. Even if you change the title of the article, you don't need to move the nomination page.</li>
</ul>
<h1><span class="mw-headline" id="Nominations">Nominations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Nominations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h1>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Older_nominations">Older nominations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Older nominations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_July_18">Articles created/expanded on July 18</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on July 18">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Maria_of_Bosnia">Maria of Bosnia</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMaria_of_Bosnia&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Maria_of_Bosnia&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that, if King <a href="/wiki/Louis_I_of_Hungary" title="Louis I of Hungary">Louis I of Hungary</a> is to be trusted, his in-law <b><a href="/wiki/Maria_of_Bosnia" title="Maria of Bosnia">Maria of Bosnia</a></b> had children in her fifties and lived to be over 90?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that the higher rank and wastefulness of <b><a href="/wiki/Maria_of_Bosnia" title="Maria of Bosnia">Maria of Bosnia</a></b> has traditionally been blamed for the downfall of her husband's <a href="/wiki/House_of_Helfenstein" title="House of Helfenstein">House of Helfenstein</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Paul-%C3%89douard_Delabri%C3%A8rre" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Paul-Édouard Delabrièrre">Paul-Édouard Delabrièrre</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough and long enough. AGF on offline source in a language that I do not know (just a query: Why is the title of this book initially in German and then in Bosnian?). Article is well sourced, including on the hooks, although only having one source (page numbers/quotations for each inline would help, but not essential for being on DYK). QPQ done. <a href="/wiki/User:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User:The Almightey Drill">'''tAD'''</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User talk:The Almightey Drill">talk</a>) 22:52, 24 July 2015 (UTC)</li>

Isn't anything more written about her? <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 23:38, 3 August 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dl>
<dd>There is much more<a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="https://www.google.ba/search?tbm=bks&amp;hl=en&amp;q=%22maria+von+bosnia%22#hl=en&amp;tbm=bks&amp;q=maria+von+bosnien+helfenstein">[1]</a> but in German, which I don't speak. If I understand correctly, a single source is far from ideal but not an insurmountable issue. <a href="/wiki/User:Surtsicna" title="User:Surtsicna">Surtsicna</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Surtsicna" title="User talk:Surtsicna">talk</a>) 10:53, 4 August 2015 (UTC)

<dd>
<ul>
<li>It's my understanding, per <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Supplementary_guidelines#Other_supplementary_rules_for_the_article" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Supplementary guidelines">Rule D12</a>, that a single source may be sufficient for an obscure topic such as an extinct species, but not for a biography. Perhaps you could get some help from a German editor? <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 11:57, 4 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I would contend that a 15th century countess is a rather obscure topic as well. An English language <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://fmg.ac/Projects/MedLands/BOSNIA.htm#StjepanKotromandied1314A">genealogy website</a> (generally considered reputable) has some info about her. Would that help? The cited source is the only comprehensive biography of the subject. <a href="/wiki/User:Surtsicna" title="User:Surtsicna">Surtsicna</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Surtsicna" title="User talk:Surtsicna">talk</a>) 15:32, 21 August 2015 (UTC)</li>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/User:Surtsicna" title="User:Surtsicna">Side note</a>: there's rather more sources when you look for <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.google.co.jp/webhp?ie=UTF-8#tbm=bks&amp;q=%22ulrich+v%22+helfenstein+maria"><span class="Unicode">⟨</span>"Ulrich V" Helfenstein Maria<span class="Unicode">⟩</span></a>. Additional note: you can also go by <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:RD/H" title="Wikipedia:RD/H" class="mw-redirect">WP:RD/H</a> and beg for some help with the German.<br />
Now, that said, it's my understanding, per what <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know/Supplementary_guidelines#Other_supplementary_rules_for_the_article" title="Wikipedia:Did you know/Supplementary guidelines">Rule D12</a> <u>actually says</u>, that a single source is insufficient <i>for a biography of a living person</i> who might sue or be damaged by inappropriate treatment. D12 has nothing whatsoever to do with notability, but countesses count anyway and she's plenty notable—as noted—in German. The lack of English information is just a side effect of some <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:BIAS" title="Wikipedia:BIAS" class="mw-redirect">WP:BIAS</a>. There's no problem here. Genealogy websites, on the other hand, are <u>not</u> in any way, shape, or form a reliable source. Per The Almightey Drill, this <i>should</i> be good to go but leave me a note on my talk page if you need another set of eyes first.&#160;—&#160;<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LlywelynII" title="User talk:LlywelynII"><span style="text-shadow:#BBBBBB 0.1em 0.1em 0.1em; class=texhtml">Llywelyn<font color="Gold">II</font></span></a> 09:12, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>And did the conference paper go through peer review? <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:SCHOLARSHIP" title="Wikipedia:SCHOLARSHIP" class="mw-redirect">WP:SCHOLARSHIP</a> emphasises the need for peer review for a source to be reliable.&#160;—&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Crisco_1492" title="User:Crisco 1492">Chris Woodrich</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Crisco_1492" title="User talk:Crisco 1492">talk</a>) 23:13, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<li>Just an innocent bystander here, but according to <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ff-eizdavastvo.ba/Docs/Upute_autorima.pdf">these guidelines</a> from the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ff-eizdavastvo.ba">publication's website</a> (and Google Translate) it does appear that submissions are peer reviewed. The article seems to have been initially presented at a university department roundtable but later published in this journal. <a href="/wiki/User:Nsteffel" title="User:Nsteffel">Nsteffel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nsteffel" title="User talk:Nsteffel">talk</a>) 20:41, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dd>I have been terribly busy lately, but I am not sure I have much to add anyway. If the source is deemed reliable, and DYK rules do not require more sources in this case, the situation is as simple as it can be. If it is necessary to add aditional (German-language) citations verifying basic facts such as her existance/name, country of origin, name of her husband, possibly year of death, I suppose can do that despite not speaking German. I honestly do not see the point of using redundant lower grade sources other than to formally satisfy a requirement. The article does not have the potential to reach GA status, but it is DYK material. <a href="/wiki/User:Surtsicna" title="User:Surtsicna">Surtsicna</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Surtsicna" title="User talk:Surtsicna">talk</a>) 22:44, 17 October 2015 (UTC)

However, I would want a clear description of the (one) currently cited source before this nom went any further (i.e. if it was published in an academic journal then what, where, when?). The ALT1 hook seems far better, less ambiguous and more interesting. <a href="/wiki/User:Sionk" title="User:Sionk">Sionk</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sionk" title="User talk:Sionk">talk</a>) 09:51, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_July_24">Articles created/expanded on July 24</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on July 24">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Safeword_.28game_show.29">Safeword (game show)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSafeword_%28game_show%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Safeword_%28game_show%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that game show <i><b><a href="/wiki/Safeword_(game_show)" title="Safeword (game show)">Safeword</a></b></i> involves celebrities berating each other in order to avoid ejection?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:05, 24 July 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article is new (2 days old), long enough at 1865 characters of prose, and there are no copyvio problems. The main problem I have is that most of the content is cited to the TV episode itself, which is a bit weak. I'd prefer a synopsis of the programme or a feature on it, such as the <i><a href="/wiki/Radio_Times" title="Radio Times">Radio Times</a></i> or ITV's own website, particularly for the key word "berating" in the hook (and ejection from <i>what</i> exactly?) Without that, the article does give the impression of being "stretched" to meet the 1500 character limit. Can you find better sources for the show? Also, "roasting" could do with a link to <a href="/wiki/Roast_(comedy)" title="Roast (comedy)">roast (comedy)</a> as I'm not sure everyone (particularly Brits) are familiar with the term outside of what happens to chicken and beef in an oven. <a href="/wiki/User:Ritchie333" title="User:Ritchie333"><b style="color:#7F007F">Ritchie333</b></a> <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ritchie333" title="User talk:Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(talk)</sup></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Ritchie333" title="Special:Contributions/Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(cont)</sup></a> 09:43, 26 July 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I would assume most Brits are familiar with the term (I'm a Brit myself) but I've added a link. Neither the Radio Times nor ITV go into that much detail on it, but UKGameshows.com (as linked in External links) has an article on it. Their Weaver's Week column will probably cover that sort of detail, though they pledged to review <a href="/wiki/Hive_Minds" title="Hive Minds">Hive Minds</a> in next week's issue and I doubt they'll do two reviews in a week. Nonetheless, I've fixed most of the other issues. (Disgusted to see that this article is apparently the only article on the web to <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.google.co.uk/webhp?sourceid=chrome-instant&amp;ion=1&amp;espv=2&amp;ie=UTF-8#safe=strict&amp;q=%22safeword%22+itv2+%22hacked%22+%22burned%22+%22slam+down%22">give round names</a>.)--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 11:20, 28 July 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> A QPQ is needed for this nomination. <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 22:06, 29 July 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a>:</span> Sorry to be a pain in the proverbial, but what makes UKgameshows.com a reliable source? Also, how can I verify the information cited to the TV show itself when it's been and gone from the airwaves? (I'm not saying you're lying or anything, but mistakes can be made). <a href="/wiki/User:Ritchie333" title="User:Ritchie333"><b style="color:#7F007F">Ritchie333</b></a> <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ritchie333" title="User talk:Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(talk)</sup></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Ritchie333" title="Special:Contributions/Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(cont)</sup></a> 14:49, 8 August 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I'd rather be interrogated now than have the hook returned. Safeword airs 10pm on Thursdays or you can use ITV player, though I'm uneasy about providing a link because most broadcasters only hold shows on their servers for so long. UKGameshows.com is primarily edited by <a href="/wiki/David_J._Bodycombe" title="David J. Bodycombe">David J. Bodycombe</a>, a man who has 25 years experience in the field of gameshows and was responsible for bringing the nation <a href="/wiki/The_Crystal_Maze" title="The Crystal Maze">The Crystal Maze</a>. I consider him a reliable source.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 17:30, 8 August 2015 (UTC)

<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Right, I've picked this up again. I'm happy to AGF that the video is an official source that can satisfy everything in the article is verifiable, but could I ask a quick favour and cite the specific <i>times</i> in the video each claim occurs (not for the general concept, I get that from just a cursory look, just the round names, "a swift and nasty exit", and rules specifics. Then I think we will be good to go. Sorry about the wait. <a href="/wiki/User:Ritchie333" title="User:Ritchie333"><b style="color:#7F007F">Ritchie333</b></a> <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ritchie333" title="User talk:Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(talk)</sup></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Ritchie333" title="Special:Contributions/Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(cont)</sup></a> 11:21, 8 September 2015 (UTC)</p>

<dd>I no longer have a copy of that episode, so I've just replaced it with its <a href="/wiki/UKGameshows.com" title="UKGameshows.com">UKGameshows.com</a> entry which covers all the bases.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 17:45, 8 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I think we're going round in circles. Really sorry about the wait, but I think somebody else has to have a look at this. Just to confirm, I think the main problem is the article itself and its verifiability generally, rather than anything specifically to do with the hook. <a href="/wiki/User:Ritchie333" title="User:Ritchie333"><b style="color:#7F007F">Ritchie333</b></a> <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ritchie333" title="User talk:Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(talk)</sup></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Ritchie333" title="Special:Contributions/Ritchie333"><sup style="color:#7F007F">(cont)</sup></a> 11:56, 11 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article is new enough, long enough, and what isn't cited is easily verifable. Hook which is catchy and cited. The article is neutral and free from copyright issues. And here, hopefully, ends the debate. <a href="/wiki/User:FrogmanOfTheSahara" title="User:FrogmanOfTheSahara">FrogmanOfTheSahara</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:FrogmanOfTheSahara" title="User talk:FrogmanOfTheSahara">talk</a>) 06:19, 15 September 2015 (UTC)</li>

<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I don't think there is anything wrong with using the show a the source for the description of the gameplay as this is the equivalent of using a film or TV programme as the source for the plot, but you have made it quite confusing by citing the UK Gameshows article as the source repeatedly in this section when most of the information (I guess) still comes from the show itself. The remaining sourcing problem is that there are no sources to indicate the broadcasting details; this does need clearing up before this nom can be passed. There also seem to be a lot more sources available (from extensive research I've done by typing "safeword ITV" into Google; go me, Queen of Research! ) Other non-DYK problems: "roulette" is not right, "carousel" could be but I haven't seen the show so I can't say for certain; there's no indication in the episode list of which of the guests were the targets; and it is unclear if the seven episodes are the complete series. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>) 08:10, 17 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<dl>
<dd>I replaced the episode source with the UKGameshows.com source because ITV take stuff off ITV player after four weeks. (Had I looked, I would have found many of the episodes are routinely repeated...) The rest of the information is offered <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.comedy.co.uk/guide/tv/safeword/episodes/">here</a>, which I'll add in.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 14:29, 25 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I'm not entirely sure what makes a "Created and run by fans for fans" site like www.comedy.co.uk a reliable source for the episode info, but as that information hasn't been added in yet the point isn't (yet) germane. Since that site does have <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.comedy.co.uk/news/story/000001826/itv2_safeword_rick_edwards_katherine_ryan_morgan/">an article</a> that states it's a "seven-part series", I imagine that information is available elsewhere as it looks like a press-release reprint. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a>, further thoughts on what needs to be included and whether comedy.co.uk would be a sufficiently reliable source? <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 18:10, 27 September 2015 (UTC)

However, they do not work alone, valuing the assistance of a group of regular volunteer contributors, lead by Ian, the main curator of our TV &amp; radio schedule." That's good enough for me.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 19:31, 27 September 2015 (UTC)

One news article does not make a TV programme on a minor TV channel notable. The page is almost entirely unsourced at the moment, suggesting it is more of a fan page than an encylopedic article. I notice there is an edit dispute currently, with an IP editor removing all of the primary sources. The hook is poor too, it should at least say "British television game show" or even "ITV2 game show", but that is minor in comparison with the major unresolved issues with the article itself. <a href="/wiki/User:Sionk" title="User:Sionk">Sionk</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sionk" title="User talk:Sionk">talk</a>) 10:04, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_July_25">Articles created/expanded on July 25</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on July 25">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Supplication_of_Abu_Hamza_al-Thumali">Supplication of Abu Hamza al-Thumali</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_supplication_of_Abu_Hamzah_al-Thumali&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Supplication_of_Abu_Hamza_al-Thumali&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Supplication_of_Abu_Hamza_al-Thumali" title="Supplication of Abu Hamza al-Thumali">supplication of Abu Hamza al-Thumali</a></b> is a <a href="/wiki/Invocation" title="Invocation">Dua</a> narrated by <a href="/wiki/Ali_ibn_Husayn_Zayn_al-Abidin" title="Ali ibn Husayn Zayn al-Abidin">Ali ibn Husayn Zayn al-Abidin</a>, the forth <a href="/wiki/Shia" title="Shia" class="mw-redirect">Shia</a> <a href="/wiki/Imam" title="Imam">Imam</a>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Supplication_of_Abu_Hamza_al-Thumali" title="Supplication of Abu Hamza al-Thumali">supplication of Abu Hamza al-Thumali</a></b> was recited by <a href="/wiki/Ali_ibn_Husayn_Zayn_al-Abidin" title="Ali ibn Husayn Zayn al-Abidin">Ali ibn Husayn Zayn al-Abidin</a>, the fourth <a href="/wiki/Shia" title="Shia" class="mw-redirect">Shia</a> <a href="/wiki/Imam" title="Imam">Imam</a>, on every night or dawn of <a href="/wiki/Ramadan" title="Ramadan">Ramadan</a>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 15:24, 26 July 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

Good to go. I suggest using the original hook.--<a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) 23:08, 4 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> There's currently no in-line citation on the fact that Zayn al-Abidin narrates the Dua, which is required by DYK criteria. ~ <b><a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">Rob</a></b><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:BU_Rob13" title="User talk:BU Rob13">Talk</a></sup> 15:51, 12 August 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">BU Rob13</a>:</span>There are several in-linecitation in the article that indicate the hook is correct (Ref 1,2,3,and 4).<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>) 08:39, 18 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a>:</span> The only mention of Zayn al-Abidin in the article is in the first sentence of the section "The narrator", and this sentence does not have an in-line cite. The DYK criteria requires an in-line cite no later than the end of the sentence that contains the hook fact. Also, now that I'm looking at this more closely, the article appears to say in the lead that <a href="/wiki/Abu_Hamza_al-Thumali" title="Abu Hamza al-Thumali">Abu Hamza al-Thumali</a> narrated this Dua, which would contradict the hook fact. This apparent contradiction would need to be resolved before this hook runs (or the hook updated, if you intended for al-Thumali to be in the hook). ~ <b><a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">Rob</a></b><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:BU_Rob13" title="User talk:BU Rob13">Talk</a></sup> 10:07, 18 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">BU Rob13</a>:</span>You nominated two issues. The first is unclear for me. Is it your mean&#160;:"there is no source to establish the <a href="/wiki/Zayn_al-Abidin" title="Zayn al-Abidin" class="mw-redirect">Zayn al-Abidin</a> is a narrator of supplication? If your answer is yes, I try to find reliable source but we can use ALT1 as hook. Is not it? Abot the apparent contradiction, you are right. For first time, <a href="/wiki/Zayn_al-Abidin" title="Zayn al-Abidin" class="mw-redirect">Zayn al-Abidin</a> read this supplication, then Abu Hamza learnt it from Imam and conveyed to other. So my question is that who is the narrator?Imam or Abu hamza.Can you clear to me the meaning of narrator!<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>) 08:24, 19 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>It doesn't necessarily have to do with whether you have a source that supports it, just that the information doesn't appear in the article with an in-line citation. If you wanted to do the narrator hook, you would need to put that fact in the article and provide a source that supports it at the end of the sentence where you put the fact. As for ALT1, the fact that Zayn al-Abidin invocated it is in the article and cited, but you would need to add the fact that he was the fourth Shia Imam to the article with a cite. ~ <b><a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">Rob</a></b><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:BU_Rob13" title="User talk:BU Rob13">Talk</a></sup> 10:19, 19 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">BU Rob13</a>:</span>Can you clear to the meaning of in-line citation? What would I do to resolve the problem? If I put the source after the fact, the problem is solved or not? Do I nominated to the hook in another place of the article except of lead? Please check the recent changes. Thanks!<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>) 12:41, 19 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> In-line citation means the numbered citations in the article (i.e. the numbered references that are "in-line" with the text). With the recent changes, ALT 1 is good to go. AGF on the foreign language source with regards to when he invocated the dua. ~ <b><a href="/wiki/User:BU_Rob13" title="User:BU Rob13">Rob</a></b><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:BU_Rob13" title="User talk:BU Rob13">Talk</a></sup> 14:39, 19 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I've pulled the hook from prep; the article needs a thorough copyedit before it can be featured on the main page. The final paragraphs of the "Chain of authority" and "Reception" are particularly opaque. I would like to strongly recommend that "invocated" not be used in the ALT1 hook (and article, since the hook is taken directly from it), since the verb "invocate" is listed by dictionaries as "archaic" and there is probably a better way to phrase it so people won't stumble over an obsolete word. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 20:53, 22 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>From my point of view, this is barely English. It needs serious work and anyone who was involved with accepting it for main page inclusion should take a second look. Seriously, what the hell does "<span class="example good-example" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #006400;">advised to croon a little part of dua with feeling and meditate upon its Words. He nominated that don’t read fast this meaningful supplication and think a bout it</span>" mean? <a href="/wiki/User:The_Rambling_Man" title="User:The Rambling Man">The Rambling Man</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Rambling_Man" title="User talk:The Rambling Man">talk</a>) 21:02, 22 August 2015 (UTC)</li>

ALT1 has inline citations, although one citation appears to be the text to the supplication rather than a reference to the fact that it was invoked by Ali ibn Husayn Zayn al-Abidin. The second citation links to a site in a language I do not speak, so I could not confirm the citation. Perhaps someone else should double check this point. <dl>
<dd>As <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> noted, article is new enough, long enough, and has inline citations.</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>In the last sentence of the article ("He recommended reading this meaningful supplication slowly and thinking about it as one reads.") the word "meaningful" seems editorial enough to compromise NPOV. I think it should be either quoted and attributed, or replaced with a more neutral word.</li>
<li>Perhaps I'm missing something (very possible, as I am not well-versed in Islam) but the source cited for the phrase "Imam al-Sajjad, the fourth Shia Imam" seems to identify 'Ali Zain al-Abidin as the fourth Imam. If these are two names for the same person I believe a source should be cited establishing that.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Imam al-Sajjad and Ali Zayn al-Abidin are one person. I replaced all Imam al-Sajjad by Ali Zayn al-Abidin.<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>) 09:47, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>Of the sources cited for the remainder of that sentence ("invoked the supplication of Abu Hamza al-Thimali every night or dawn during Ramadan.") the first one appears to be just a rendering of the supplication, and does not seem to mention when the supplication was invoked. I searched the book for "morning" and "evening" but could not find substantiation of the claim.</li>
<li>The second source cited for the timing of the invocation of the supplication seems to be in Persian. However, Google Translate was of no help as there does not appear to be content on the page. I'm afraid I can't give this source an AGF pass, <a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a>, given the issues with the other sources cited for the hook.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> There appear to still be sourcing issues with the hook. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 22:41, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_August_14">Articles created/expanded on August 14</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on August 14">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Varaha_Upanishad">Varaha Upanishad</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVaraha_Upanishad&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Varaha_Upanishad&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 100px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Varaha_halebid.jpg" class="image" title="Varaha"><img alt="Varaha" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Varaha_halebid.jpg/100px-Varaha_halebid.jpg" width="100" height="150" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Varaha_halebid.jpg/150px-Varaha_halebid.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Varaha_halebid.jpg/200px-Varaha_halebid.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2432" data-file-height="3648" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Varaha</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... <s>that in the <b><a href="/wiki/Varaha_Upanishad" title="Varaha Upanishad">Varaha Upanishad</a></b> <a href="/wiki/Varaha" title="Varaha">Varaha</a> <i>(pictured)</i> enlightens sage <a href="/wiki/Ribhu" title="Ribhu" class="mw-redirect">Ribhu</a> who attained godhood by austerities?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Province_of_Isernia" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Province of Isernia">Template:Did you know nominations/Province of Isernia</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Nvvchar" title="User:Nvvchar">Nvvchar</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nvvchar" title="User talk:Nvvchar">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 08:35, 17 August 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough when nominated. Long enough at 10,817 characters. Article meets DYK policies. Hook is short enough, and has been verified by the online source provided, but may be hard to comprehend by people unfamiliar with the subject. Image is used in the article, on Commons and has a valid license. QPQ done. Good to go. <span style="color:black"><a href="/wiki/User:Sovereign_Sentinel" title="User:Sovereign Sentinel">sovereign</a>°<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sovereign_Sentinel" title="User talk:Sovereign Sentinel" class="mw-redirect">sentinel</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Sovereign_Sentinel" title="Special:Contributions/Sovereign Sentinel">(contribs)</a></span> 14:21, 10 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Okay, I'll be the fly in the ointment here. Not being of this faith, it seems to me the entire second paragraph in the lead of the nominated article is maybe the gist of the hook. And there's a citation at the end of the paragraph. And the source depicts that process by how that happened. Did I get that correct? I'm a little bit concerned this might be perceived as somewhat vague like, "Jesus ascended to heaven because he led a good life." If that makes sense. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 20:38, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Hello. As I have been editing some articles relating to <a href="/wiki/Hindu_philosophy" title="Hindu philosophy">Hindu philosophy</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hinduism" title="Hinduism">Hinduism</a> itself recently, I also want to join the conversation. I certainly believe the Varaha Upanishad deserves a DYK, as it is such an important work, whether you are religious or not. In my opinion, the current DYK info is a bit too general to by catchy on its own. And as it has been pointed out it might not make much sense to people without much "inside" knowledge on the subject. There are so much in this particular Upanishad that will make very interesting DYKs, so I have made a small list of examples here below:</p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT1</b> ... the X year old Varaha Upanishad is the first text to describe how the <a href="/wiki/Om" title="Om">Om</a> mantra washes away all sins and assures salvation?</s></li>
<li><s><b>ALT2</b> ... the X year old Varaha Upanishad is the first text to elaborately describe the concept of <a href="/wiki/Brahman" title="Brahman">Brahman</a>?</s></li>
<li><s><b>ALT3</b> ... the <a href="/wiki/Yamas" title="Yamas">Yamas</a> described in the Varaha Upanishad X years ago, closely matches the <a href="/wiki/Ten_Commandments" title="Ten Commandments">Ten Commandments</a> from Christianity?</s></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>As the article stands right now, it lacks information on its origin. It is truly very old in the order of 3.000 years, but the article really needs more information on it as it is. That's is why I wrote the "X" above.</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:RhinoMind" title="User talk:RhinoMind">talk</a>) 21:19, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Reviewer needed to check the three suggested Alt hooks. And perhaps have a look at the article for what <a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a> suggests is lacking. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 21:28, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a>:</span> <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">Maile66</a>:</span> The article is based on translations of the original Sanskrit text which is dated between the 13th and 16th centuries. I have added this fact in the lead with a reference. The article is highly philosophical and runs into 247 hymns. I have abridged most of it within this article. However, I have added a few more lines at the end of lead which may be interesting. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a>'s observation on the hook is correct. I don't think I can improve on it further as the subject is abstract. I, therefore, suggest that <b>ALT 1</b> hook suggested by <a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a>, with the period mentioned, may be considered for approval. I am suggesting it as</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><s><b>ALT4</b> hook ... the <b><a href="/wiki/Varaha_Upanishad" title="Varaha Upanishad">Varaha Upanishad</a></b> <i>(pictured Varaha)</i>, dated between 13th and 16th century, is the text that describes how the <a href="/wiki/Om" title="Om">Om</a> mantra washes away all sins and assures salvation?</s></dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nvvchar" title="User talk:Nvvchar"><span style="font-variant:small-caps;color:#003366">Nvvchar</span></a><b>. 06:52, 22 September 2015 (UTC)</b></p>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> ALT4 mentioned in the article, specific enough in wording, and sourced. Striking the others so the promoter does not get confused. Does <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a>:</span> have any comments? <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 12:23, 22 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<dl>
<dd>Hi. Thanks for adding the origins information Nvvchar and notifying me Maile66. I must say that I am surprised it only dates to the 13th-16th century, as most other Upanishads are 3,000 years old. Or am I completely off on that one too? I better check up on all this. It might be, that the source you writes from Nvvchar, is a compilation with some added verses from that period, while the original text is much older. I dont know and I better discuss it on the articles own TalkPage when I have done some proper research on it.
<dl>
<dd>Update: yes the Upanishads that are viewed as part of the Vedas, are generally 3,000 years old, written in 900-600 BCE. I have now learned, that there are a plethora of more recent so-called Upanishads also. But as only some groups view them as part of the Vedas, they are often called "the sectarian Upanishads" in scholarly terms. Guess you learn something new every day&#160;:-) I have moved this particular discussion to the proper TalkPage for now. <a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:RhinoMind" title="User talk:RhinoMind">talk</a>) 02:29, 23 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>As it was I who suggested the ALT DYK, I think its a great idea&#160;:-), but could we perhaps sharpen the DYK further with the addition that it was "the <i>first</i> text to describe ..."? Or is this not true either? I have made a bummer with the dating I guess, so this might also be untrue perhaps. But then: which text did mention it first then? An open and interesting question. <a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:RhinoMind" title="User talk:RhinoMind">talk</a>) 01:42, 23 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>Since my three ALTs relies heavily on an ancient dating, that turned out to be wrong, I am not sure which DYK would fit best. I am open to anything. <a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:RhinoMind" title="User talk:RhinoMind">talk</a>) 02:33, 23 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>

Then he needs to make sure it's mentioned that way and sourced in the article.<a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 13:46, 23 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<p><b>ALT6</b>... that in the <b><a href="/wiki/Varaha_Upanishad" title="Varaha Upanishad">Varaha Upanishad</a></b> <a href="/wiki/Varaha" title="Varaha">Varaha</a> <i>(pictured)</i> enlightens sage <a href="/wiki/Ribhu" title="Ribhu" class="mw-redirect">Ribhu</a>, who attained godhood by austerities, on all <a href="/wiki/Hindu_texts" title="Hindu texts">Hindu scriptural texts</a>? <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nvvchar" title="User talk:Nvvchar"><span style="font-variant:small-caps;color:#003366">Nvvchar</span></a><b>. 04:10, 25 September 2015 (UTC)</b></p>

<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I essentially re-checked this article against all the criteria. It does need some clean-up, but nothing major, and main page exposure hopefully attract some editors willing to copy-edit the article. I'm approving <b>ALT 6</b>, as it meets the hook criteria and seems the most satisfactory one reached after long discussion. I've taken the liberty of striking Alts 4 and 5, and moving 6 out so that it is more visible for the prepping editor.--<a href="/wiki/User:3family6" title="User:3family6"><font color="navy"><b>3family6</b></font></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:3family6" title="User talk:3family6"><font color="black"><u>Talk to me</u></font></a> | <small><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/3family6" title="Special:Contributions/3family6"><font color="purple">See what I have done</font></a></small>) 19:34, 3 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Sorry, but "austerities on Hindu texts" makes no sense. I haven't had time to check this nom thoroughly, but at the very least the hook will need rephrasing. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 14:11, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a>, it's actually "austerities, on Hindu texts." Ribhu, who practiced austerities, is being enlightened on all Hindu texts, no Ribhu practiced austerities on Hindu texts. Even so, maybe "who attained godhood by austerities" could be reworded to "who attained godhood through austerity" or "practicing austerity."--<a href="/wiki/User:3family6" title="User:3family6"><font color="navy"><b>3family6</b></font></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:3family6" title="User talk:3family6"><font color="black"><u>Talk to me</u></font></a> | <small><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/3family6" title="Special:Contributions/3family6"><font color="purple">See what I have done</font></a></small>) 14:39, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Thank you for the explanation, but quite honestly, "enlightened on all Hindu texts" doesn't make much sense to me either, especially given that "enlightened" usually has a more specific meaning in this context. Again, I am going to have to take a closer look at the article and its sources before drawing any further conclusions. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 14:50, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<dd>Is this thread still active? <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> Yes, reading the text carefully, it all makes sense, as 3family6 explains. But I can see that the phrasing is easy to misunderstand, and it might ease things, if the commas are simply replaced by dashes. Like this:</dd>

<dl>

<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>"... that in the <b>Varaha Upanishad</b> Varaha <i>(pictured)</i> enlightens sage <a href="/wiki/Ribhu" title="Ribhu" class="mw-redirect">Ribhu</a> - who attained godhood by austerities - on all Hindu texts?"</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Yes "<b>enlightens</b>" can mean many things in a religious context, but here it simply means enlightenment, as it is used in the context of education. Varaha made sure Ribhu understood the Hindu scriptures. Nothing special.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><b>Austerities -&gt; Austerity</b>. I would not endorse this, although it seems a very small thing. Austerity - in Christianity in particular - has a very specific meaning. In a Hindu context there are many "austerities" to work with. They are mainly summed up in the <a href="/wiki/Yamas" title="Yamas">Yamas</a>. These Yamas are somewhat similiar to the Ten Commandments in Christianeity, so the word "austerities" has a much broader meaning than how the word "austerity" is usually understood in a western cultural context. With just a superficial understanding of Hinduism this aspect is clear. Not trying to be condescenting, just stating and explaining explicitly.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<dd>
<dl>

<dd>
<dl>
<dd>About researching. Nvvchar has made a great contribution by writing up a summary of this important text in English from the sanskrit version. I am not sure there is any English translation of this text available anywhere. If you know of, or has access to one, the article can be greatly improved if you put in a link or reference.</dd>

<li><a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a>, <a href="/wiki/User:RhinoMind" title="User:RhinoMind">RhinoMind</a> and <a href="/wiki/User:3family6" title="User:3family6">3family6</a> I have fixed reference to <b>ALT6</b> suggested by <a href="/wiki/User_talk:3family6" title="User talk:3family6">User talk:3family6</a> which is in chapter II hymns 5 (b) -7 (a). I have also added the original Sanskrit version of the Upanishad but there is no verbatim translation of this text in English.<b><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nvvchar" title="User talk:Nvvchar"><span style="font-variant:small-caps;color:#003366">Nvvchar</span></a></b>. 10:28, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
