<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_August_16">Articles created/expanded on August 16</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on August 16">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Murder_of_Shuja_Khanzada">Murder of Shuja Khanzada</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMurder_of_Shuja_Khanzada&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Shuja_Khanzada&amp;action=history">Shuja Khanzada</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2015_Attock_bombing&amp;action=history">2015 Attock bombing</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Pakistani politician and ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b> was assassinated in the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">bomb explosion at his home</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, which killed more than 20 and injured more than 20 others?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that Pakistani politician and ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b> was killed in the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">bomb explosion at his home</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a> alongside more than 20 others, which also injured more than 20?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b>, until his recent assassination in the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">bomb explosion at his home</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a> that caused 20+ deaths and 20+ injuries, fought in the <a href="/wiki/1971_Indo-Pakistani_war" title="1971 Indo-Pakistani war" class="mw-redirect">Indo-Pakistani war in 1971</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Irene_Purcell" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Irene Purcell">Irene Purcell</a> and <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Takeshi_Hirayama" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Takeshi Hirayama">Takeshi Hirayama‎</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: <s>Currently nominated for ITN, but that nomination was overdue and going stale despite unanimous support.</s> ITN nomination is too late and now archived. Also, writing combined two-article hook isn't easy for me. I welcome your alternatives.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Wikimandia" title="User:Wikimandia">Wikimandia</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wikimandia" title="User talk:Wikimandia">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:Mar4d" title="User:Mar4d">Mar4d</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mar4d" title="User talk:Mar4d">talk</a>), and <a href="/wiki/User:%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%AF_%D8%A7%D9%81%D8%B6%D9%84" title="User:محمد افضل">محمد افضل</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%AF_%D8%A7%D9%81%D8%B6%D9%84" title="User talk:محمد افضل">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) at 23:47, 22 August 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<li>As someone who contributed significantly to this page, I don't feel it's appropriate for a DYK. A bit too morbid and disrespectful of the dead IMHO. An updated hook can be used for ITN. <a href="/wiki/User:Wikimandia" title="User:Wikimandia"><font color="#0066CC">—<i><b>Мандичка</b></i></font></a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wikimandia" title="User talk:Wikimandia"><font color="#6600CC"><i><b>YO</b></i></font></a></sup> 😜 01:46, 23 August 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dd>
<ul>
<li>Unfortunately, the ITN nomination was late, and many unrelated news from the same day of the incident were posted on ITN. Therefore, the story is... running out of its time to be posted. Once archived, it'll be too late. As for these hooks, I'll add more <i>without</i> being morbid and disrespectful:</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT3</b>: ... that Pakistani and politician ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b>, before <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">his demise at his home</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, fought in the <a href="/wiki/1971_Indo-Pakistani_war" title="1971 Indo-Pakistani war" class="mw-redirect">Indo-Pakistani war in 1971</a>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT3</b>: ... that, before he was assassinated by <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">house bomb explosion</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, Pakistani politician and ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b> fought in the <a href="/wiki/1971_Indo-Pakistani_war" title="1971 Indo-Pakistani war" class="mw-redirect">Indo-Pakistani war in 1971</a>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT4</b>: ... that Pakistani and politician ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b>, before <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">his demise at his home</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, served as instructor in 1974–78 and 1982–83 throughout his military career?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT4</b>: ... that, before he was assassinated by <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">house bomb explosion</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, Pakistani politician and ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b> served as military instructor in 1974–78 and 1982–83?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT5</b>: ... that Pakistani and politician ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b>, before <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">his demise at his home</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, commanded the <a href="/wiki/13th_Lancers" title="13th Lancers">13th Lancers</a> in 1983–85 throughout his military career?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT5</b>: ... that, before he was assassinated by <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Attock_bombing" title="2015 Attock bombing">house bomb explosion</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Shadikhan" title="Shadikhan">Shadikhan</a>, Pakistani politician and ex-colonel <b><a href="/wiki/Shuja_Khanzada" title="Shuja Khanzada">Shuja Khanzada</a></b> commanded the <a href="/wiki/13th_Lancers" title="13th Lancers">13th Lancers</a> in 1983–85?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>I wasn't able to add details of the explosion, but I'm trying my best. <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) 03:05, 23 August 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Full review needed. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 20:23, 6 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough. ALTs 3-5 short enough and sourced, but would all require a reference after them. No neutrality problems found, no copyright problems found. QPQ done and image properly licensed.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 12:21, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<dl>
<dd>What do you mean "require a reference after them"? <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) 14:22, 14 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I imagine he means that one or more of the facts in those hooks need to be given inline source citations in the articles by the end of the sentence that contains them. However, ALTs 3 through 5 are very confusing in their intro; ALT1 was acceptable in that regard, but these three are not. You also might want to consider putting the second clause ("before his demise at his home in Shadikhan") first, which would allow the rest of the hook to run without interruption ("that before his demise at his home in Shadikhan, Pakistani politician and ex-colonel Shuja Khanzada fought/served/commanded..."). ALT4 and ALT5 also end with "throughout his military career", which don't make sense in the context of a single assignment from that career. Finally, while I realize you were trying to address the feelings by one of the authors of the articles that the initial hooks were "morbid and disrespectful", the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:EUPHEMISM" title="Wikipedia:EUPHEMISM" class="mw-redirect">euphemistic</a> phrase "his demise at his home" makes it sound like he died of a fall, not from assassins' bombs. If the line in the lead of the Shuja Khanzada article, <span class="inline-quote-talk" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #008560;">Appointed Home Minister in 2014, Khanzada spearheaded the campaign against terrorism and sectarian militancy in Punjab.</span> could be sourced, that fact might make an effective hook in tandem with the attack. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 15:21, 14 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Anything wrong with "demise at the the hands of assassins' bombs"?--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 17:29, 14 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>That would make hooks longer. <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) 21:16, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd>Rewrote ALTs. <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) 21:16, 14 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I don't have time to check them now, but does it make them longer than 200 characters? I'll check later, but if not, then what's the problem?--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 16:50, 15 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a>, "demise at the the hands of assassins' bombs" is wordy as proposed and it's more than a bit odd to have "hands" and "bombs"? Why not "death from assassins' bombs"? <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a>, not only did you fail to fix "Pakistani and politician ex-colonel", you retained "throughout his military career", which is not only a waste of characters but makes no sense in context. If you aren't going to take more care with the hooks you propose in response to the issues raised, you need to be prepared for the nomination to be closed as unsuccessful. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 18:07, 15 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Good enough for me. I await an appropriate ALT.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 21:15, 15 October 2015 (UTC)

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_August_18">Articles created/expanded on August 18</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on August 18">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Du.27a_Arafah">Du'a Arafah</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDu%27a_Arafah&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Du%27a_Arafah&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that during <a href="/wiki/Hajj" title="Hajj">Hajj</a> pilgrims, <a href="/wiki/Muslims" title="Muslims" class="mw-redirect">Muslims</a> from all over the world go to <a href="/wiki/Mount_Arafat" title="Mount Arafat">Arafat</a> desert for chanting <b><a href="/wiki/Du%27a_Arafah" title="Du'a Arafah">Du'a Arafah</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Du%27a_Arafah" title="Du'a Arafah">Du'a Arafah</a></b> is a <a href="/wiki/Du%27a" title="Du'a" class="mw-redirect">Du'a</a> chanted by <a href="/wiki/Shia" title="Shia" class="mw-redirect">Shia</a> <a href="/wiki/Muslims" title="Muslims" class="mw-redirect">Muslims</a> every year on the <a href="/wiki/Day_of_Arafah" title="Day of Arafah">day of Arafah</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Hajj" title="Hajj">Hajj</a> at <a href="/wiki/Mount_Arafat" title="Mount Arafat">Arafat</a> desert?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Du%27a_Arafah" title="Du'a Arafah">Du'a Arafah</a></b> is a <a href="/wiki/Du%27a" title="Du'a" class="mw-redirect">Du'a</a> that was narrated by <a href="/wiki/Husayn_ibn_Ali" title="Husayn ibn Ali">Husayn ibn Ali</a>, the third <a href="/wiki/Imam" title="Imam">Imam</a> of <a href="/wiki/Shia" title="Shia" class="mw-redirect">Shia</a>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:39, 22 August 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Not so much a review, but I would suggest that before this is seriously considered the prose be brought up to standard English. It's got too much of a non-native speaker feel to it as is. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 05:35, 20 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a>:</span> Can you help to copy edit the article?<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>) 06:01, 20 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough. Hook short enough and sourced, but uninteresting - see below. No neutrality problems found, no copyright problems found. QPQ unnecessary and image properly licensed. An informative article - I thought until recently the Arafat Desert was banned at the same time as <a href="/wiki/Trans_fats" title="Trans fats" class="mw-redirect">trans fats</a>.</dd>
</dl>

Hooks on the topic of that are probably going to be more interesting.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 16:46, 4 October 2015 (UTC)

<ul>
<li>This is a great little article, but as much as I'd like to send it on it's not ready. The references are done inconsistently and incompletely, esp. notes 9 and 10. Notes 4 and 5 are from the same source but done differently; I don't know what the GGKEY part means in note 2. Also, I cannot tell whether Noormag is a reliable source (plus, I'm ashamed to say, I can't read it). And it still needs copyediting, but I think that needs to be done by someone with solid knowledge of the subject matter: that person is not me. I glanced through the list at Category:Muslim Wikipedians, but didn't see anyone I know. That person, an experienced Wikipedia editor who also knows the subject matter, can also take care of the references. <a href="/wiki/User:Drmies" title="User:Drmies">Drmies</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Drmies" title="User talk:Drmies">talk</a>) 03:47, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li>According to <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Guild_of_Copy_Editors/Requests/Archives/2015">this page</a>, copy editing of the article is completed.<a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>) 07:53, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_August_21">Articles created/expanded on August 21</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on August 21">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2015_Thalys_train_attack">2015 Thalys train attack</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F2015_attack_in_Thalys_train_car&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2015_Thalys_train_attack&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:150824-F-RN211-147.jpg" class="image" title="Four awarded men with French President François Hollande"><img alt="Four awarded men with French President François Hollande" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8d/150824-F-RN211-147.jpg/120px-150824-F-RN211-147.jpg" width="120" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8d/150824-F-RN211-147.jpg/180px-150824-F-RN211-147.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8d/150824-F-RN211-147.jpg/240px-150824-F-RN211-147.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4100" data-file-height="2728" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Four awarded men with French President <a href="/wiki/Fran%C3%A7ois_Hollande" title="François Hollande">François Hollande</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... <s>that in the <a href="/wiki/Thalys" title="Thalys">Thalys</a> train heading to Paris, when the attacker's rifle was jammed, six passengers <i>(four pictured)</i> were able to subdue him, ending the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Thalys_train_attack" title="2015 Thalys train attack">attack with five injuries</a></b>, including the attacker?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:<s>... that six men were awarded <a href="/wiki/Legion_of_Honour" title="Legion of Honour">Legion of Honour</a> <i>(four pictured)</i> for subduing the perpetrator in the <a href="/wiki/Thalys" title="Thalys">Thalys</a> train heading to Paris, which ended the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Thalys_train_attack" title="2015 Thalys train attack">2015 Thalys train attack</a></b> attack with five injuries, including the perpetrator himself?</s></li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Shekou,_Shenzhen" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Shekou, Shenzhen">Shekou, Shenzhen</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Failed ITN nomination</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Unibond" title="User:Unibond">Unibond</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Unibond" title="User talk:Unibond">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:Sandra_opposed_to_terrorism" title="User:Sandra opposed to terrorism">Sandra opposed to terrorism</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sandra_opposed_to_terrorism" title="User talk:Sandra opposed to terrorism">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:Callinus" title="User:Callinus">Callinus</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Callinus" title="User talk:Callinus">talk</a>), and <a href="/wiki/User:Wikimandia" title="User:Wikimandia">Wikimandia</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wikimandia" title="User talk:Wikimandia">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) at 03:55, 25 August 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>

<li><a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a>, I've edited the hooks so "attack on the Thalys train" is the bold link; since the article is "2015 Thalys train attack" is makes no sense to fail to include "Thalys train" in the article link. I've also relabeled the second ALT3 as ALT4, and revised the death/injury clauses, since they had wording problems and couldn't have passed as is. I'm not sure why you've gone from "six" to "several", so I left that unchanged, although the lack of a firm number makes the hook inherently less interesting. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 23:46, 4 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_August_26">Articles created/expanded on August 26</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on August 26">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Railway_of_the_Prince_Imperial">Railway of the Prince Imperial</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRailway_of_the_Prince_Imperial&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Railway_of_the_Prince_Imperial&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg" class="image" title="Railway of the Prince Imperial"><img alt="Railway of the Prince Imperial" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg/120px-WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg" width="120" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg/180px-WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg/240px-WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="431" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Railway of the Prince Imperial</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Railway_of_the_Prince_Imperial" title="Railway of the Prince Imperial">railway of the Prince Imperial</a></b> was the first documented <a href="/wiki/Model_railway" title="Model railway" class="mw-redirect">model railway</a> in the world?</s></li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:NearEMPTiness" title="User talk:NearEMPTiness">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 08:43, 29 August 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article is new enough, long enough (over 2,300 characters), and neutral, although it is quite problematic in that it has no inline citations and the only two references (listed at the end) do not link to resources available online. For this reason, I am unfortunately unable to judge the citation quality of the article or check for copyright concerns. The hook (to which I have made a few minor modifications) is short enough and quite interesting, but I am unable to confirm its veracity due to the aforementioned issue with the article's references. Furthermore, the nominator only has two previous DYKs, so QPQ is not required. In further good news, <a href="/wiki/File:WP_Chemin_de_fer_du_Prince_imp%C3%A9rial.jpg" title="File:WP Chemin de fer du Prince impérial.jpg">the image</a> is public domain due to age and is used in the article. If this article can be properly referenced, I'll be happy to review the citations and check for any copyright issues, but I can't pass this nomination without proper inline citations. Sorry. <a href="/wiki/User:Michael_Barera" title="User:Michael Barera">Michael Barera</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Michael_Barera" title="User talk:Michael Barera">talk</a>) 02:17, 8 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Thank you for the review. As this article is a translation from the German Wikipedia, I do not have access to the references either. I will ask the German author for help. --<a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:NearEMPTiness" title="User talk:NearEMPTiness">talk</a>)
<dl>
<dd>Thank you for your help, and for understanding that I can't pass this nomination without inline citations. <a href="/wiki/User:Michael_Barera" title="User:Michael Barera">Michael Barera</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Michael_Barera" title="User talk:Michael Barera">talk</a>) 00:34, 11 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I have now added two inline citations into the article. --<a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:NearEMPTiness" title="User talk:NearEMPTiness">talk</a>) 07:39, 11 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I am accepting the inline citations in good faith, as I unfortunately cannot read either French or German, although on the other hand having foreign-language citations essentially precludes the possibility of plagiarism by definition. I know that having just two citations in an article is quite unusual for DYK, but considering the length of this article as well as its subject matter I think that it is passable in this case. If other users disagree with me on this assessment, however, please speak up and voice your concerns. To me, though, I think that this article is good to go (again accepting the sources in good faith). <a href="/wiki/User:Michael_Barera" title="User:Michael Barera">Michael Barera</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Michael_Barera" title="User talk:Michael Barera">talk</a>) 01:51, 12 September 2015 (UTC)

<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Links to the references are <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/bpt6k63742031/f6.image">here (middle column)</a> and <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/bpt6k63742031/f5.image">there (illustration)</a>. --<a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:NearEMPTiness" title="User talk:NearEMPTiness">talk</a>)</dd>

<p><span class="outdent-template" style="display:block; margin-top:-0.5em; color:#AAA;"><span style="display:inline-block; overflow:hidden;">┌</span><span style="display:inline-block; overflow:hidden; word-wrap:normal; width:15.2em;">────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────</span><span style="display:inline-block; overflow:hidden;">┘</span></span> <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Thanks. I've added the URL for the first of the two references to the template in the article, but the second reference (the illustration) is not the Reder (German-language) source, is it? So, I'm still accepting both references in good faith because I can't read French or German. <a href="/wiki/User:Michael_Barera" title="User:Michael Barera">Michael Barera</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Michael_Barera" title="User talk:Michael Barera">talk</a>) 01:38, 15 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I have returned this from prep 4 because the hook is uncited. It seems there are only one or two references for this claim, one offline and another in French. If someone can translate the French, the hook might be verified that way. There is another uncited claim in the article that this was the first known photograph of a model railroad, which should also be cited. Otherwise, it might be worthwhile doing a google search for "world's first model railroad" to try and find further verification. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 15:02, 24 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>I found this on an enthusiasts' website: <i>Mathias Baldwin, founder of the Baltimore Locomotive Works, made an early passenger train model in the 1830s. By the end of that decade, several other toymakers had produced their own versions. George Brown &amp; Co., of Connecticut is credited with making the first known self-propelled American model train in 1856. It utilized clockworks.</i> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.o-gauge.com/Model_Train_History.htm">Model Train History</a>. I guess the first self-propelled model train is not the same as "the first documented model railway" though, as the latter would seem to indicate a fixed display. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 15:29, 24 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><img alt="Pictogram voting comment.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Pictogram_voting_comment.svg/15px-Pictogram_voting_comment.svg.png" width="15" height="15" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Pictogram_voting_comment.svg/23px-Pictogram_voting_comment.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Pictogram_voting_comment.svg/30px-Pictogram_voting_comment.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="250" data-file-height="250" />&#160;<b>Comment</b> While I had accepted the references in good faith, I think that it may be better to have someone who can read French, and maybe also German, review this article and its citations more closely. <a href="/wiki/User:Michael_Barera" title="User:Michael Barera">Michael Barera</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Michael_Barera" title="User talk:Michael Barera">talk</a>) 23:57, 24 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>From my limited French, the first source only contains a first hand description of the railway. I don't have access to the German book and, even if I did, it lacks a page number (not feeling like going through ~250 pages for this). Pinging <a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">the nominator</a>. <a href="/wiki/User:Fuebaey" title="User:Fuebaey" class="mw-redirect">Fuebaey</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Fuebaey" title="User talk:Fuebaey">talk</a>) 01:54, 25 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><img alt="Pictogram voting comment.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Pictogram_voting_comment.svg/15px-Pictogram_voting_comment.svg.png" width="15" height="15" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Pictogram_voting_comment.svg/23px-Pictogram_voting_comment.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/Pictogram_voting_comment.svg/30px-Pictogram_voting_comment.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="250" data-file-height="250" />&#160;<b>Comment</b> I read French without difficulty. The <i>Monde Illustré</i> source definitely does <b>not</b> confirm that the railway of the Prince Imperial was the first documented model railway in the world. Nor does it support a number of other statements in the article, a good part of which – through no fault of the nominator – appears to consist of speculation or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:OR" title="Wikipedia:OR" class="mw-redirect">WP:OR</a>, compounded by poor understanding of the source (for example, the engine is described in the source as being 50 cm wide, but the Wikipedia articles (en, de, da) give that as a length). <a href="/wiki/User:Justlettersandnumbers" title="User:Justlettersandnumbers">Justlettersandnumbers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Justlettersandnumbers" title="User talk:Justlettersandnumbers">talk</a>) 10:47, 25 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Thank you for your comment on the confusion about width and length ("Sa locomotive, qui peut avoir cinquante centimetres de largeur,...") which has now be corrected in both the German and English article. --<a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:NearEMPTiness" title="User talk:NearEMPTiness">talk</a>)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a>:</span> The hook does not appear to be sourced. If you're still working on this nom, please add an in-line citation to the sentence or provide another suitable hook. <a href="/wiki/User:Fuebaey" title="User:Fuebaey" class="mw-redirect">Fuebaey</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Fuebaey" title="User talk:Fuebaey">talk</a>) 18:32, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that the oldest known photograph of a model railway shows the <b><a href="/wiki/Railway_of_the_Prince_Imperial" title="Railway of the Prince Imperial">railway of the Prince Imperial</a></b>? --<a href="/wiki/User:NearEMPTiness" title="User:NearEMPTiness">NearEMPTiness</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:NearEMPTiness" title="User talk:NearEMPTiness">talk</a>) <span style="font-size:smaller;" class="autosigned">—Preceding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Signatures" title="Wikipedia:Signatures">undated</a> comment added 18:56, 9 October 2015‎ (UTC)</span></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Reviewer needed to check proposed ALT1 hook. I've struck the original hook due to its lack of required sourcing. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 21:26, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Although it appears that the claim in <b>ALT1</b> is supported by an offline source (and referenced by an inline citation in the article), I think there are a few other reasons why this article is likely ineligible at the moment. <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKSG" title="Wikipedia:DYKSG" class="mw-redirect">Supplemental rule</a> A2 states that block quotations should not be counted when determining article length. If you exclude the large block quotation in this article, it falls below the required 1500 characters. Additionally, rule D6 says an article is likely to be rejected if there are <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DT" title="Wikipedia:DT" class="mw-redirect">dispute tags</a> in the article. As of this moment, I count four dispute tags in this article (and one more could arguably be placed on the unsourced sentence at the end of the "Historic documents" sentence). I think this hook could make for a very interesting DYK, but the article first needs to be expanded and the citation issues still need to be resolved. Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 22:41, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_August_29">Articles created/expanded on August 29</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on August 29">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Antoni_Koper">Antoni Koper</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAntoni_Koper&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Antoni_Koper&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>...that Polish resistance fighter <b><a href="/wiki/Antoni_Koper" title="Antoni Koper">Antoni Koper</a></b> helped rescue Jews from the Warsaw Ghetto, one of whom he later married?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:...that Polish resistance fighter <b><a href="/wiki/Antoni_Koper" title="Antoni Koper">Antoni Koper</a></b> risked his life to help rescue Jews from the Warsaw Ghetto?</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I welcome suggestions for stronger hooks. An image of subject may be available in another week.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Malcom_Gregory_Scott" title="User:Malcom Gregory Scott">Malcom Gregory Scott</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Malcom_Gregory_Scott" title="User talk:Malcom Gregory Scott">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:48, 4 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article is new enough and long enough. Koper seems to have been an admirable man and either hook would do. However, some of the article text is too close to the original. Here are some examples:</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>Source "Koper brought Margulies to his apartment where, to her astonishment, she discovered that Koper was already sheltering Bronisława and Henryk Finkelstein, and Dr. Maximillian Ciesielski, also fugitives from the ghetto."</li>
<li>Article "He took her to his apartment in central Warsaw, where Margulies discovered to her astonishment that Koper was also hiding Bronislawa and Henryk Finkelstein, and Dr. Maximilian Ciesieleski.</li>
<li>Source "Despite the danger, threats, and attempted extortion, Koper continued with his humanitarian activities."</li>
<li>Article "Facing danger, threats, and extortion, Koper persisted in his resistance and humanitarian efforts."</li>
</ul>
<p>These are just examples and the whole article needs to be gone through, not just changing the odd word while maintaining the sentence structure, but by being rewritten in your own words. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 05:30, 18 September 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Close paraphrasing remains in the article and <a href="/wiki/User:Malcom_Gregory_Scott" title="User:Malcom Gregory Scott">the nominator</a> has not edited since the end of September. If anyone cares to salvage this nom feel free, else marking for closure. <a href="/wiki/User:Fuebaey" title="User:Fuebaey" class="mw-redirect">Fuebaey</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Fuebaey" title="User talk:Fuebaey">talk</a>) 19:00, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Reopening this as nominator has not been available to edit and has now resolved the problems mentioned above. Another reviewer needed. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 06:40, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, neutral, no copyvios detected. Both hooks are interesting but--perhaps I overlooked it--I didn't see where either hook as written is supported by inline citations. <a href="/wiki/User:SojoQ" title="User:SojoQ">SojoQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SojoQ" title="User talk:SojoQ">talk</a>) 21:04, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I'm new at this, so please forgive me if I have strayed too far from the sources in search of a hook. I interpreted yadvashem.org and the Sophie Koper interview to support the claims in both hooks, but now I see that the claim Koper "risked his life" is interpretative and not specifically supported by the cited sources alone. I regret, however, I don't understand your objection to the claim in the other hook: Koper helped rescue Jews from the ghetto, one of whom he later married. Can you tell me what I'm missing? I'm really not trying to be obnoxious; just trying to understand so I can avoid these mistakes, and regardless the outcome of the DYK nomination, I would like to improve the article as much as possible. Thank you for your patience and assistance. <a href="/wiki/User:Malcom_Gregory_Scott" title="User:Malcom Gregory Scott">Malcom Gregory Scott</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Malcom_Gregory_Scott" title="User talk:Malcom Gregory Scott">talk</a>) 11:21, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I feel confident the nomination will pass--the hook just needs to be sorted. It could just be my interpretation of the hook rules. I'm used to hooks relating more directly with what's actually written in the text. For example, the sentence: "Once hostilities ended, Koper married Sophie Margulies, who had also fought in the Warsaw Uprising as a nurse, treating Polish Home Army casualties during the battle" refers to his marriage to Sophie Margulies, but doesn't mention she was also someone he rescued from the Ghetto, which came from another part of of the page. Likewise, the sentence that talks about about his personal risk doesn't specifically mention the rescuing Jews from the Warsaw Ghetto, although that was mentioned earlier on the page as well. The citations on the page, overall, are fine, I just thought the info in the hooks needed to be all in one sentence with appropriate inline citations. Perhaps a more experienced editor can weigh in. I definitely don't want to hold up the nomination and defer to a more expert opinion. <a href="/wiki/User:SojoQ" title="User:SojoQ">SojoQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SojoQ" title="User talk:SojoQ">talk</a>) 15:55, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_3">Articles created/expanded on September 3</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 3">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="That_We_Can_Play">That We Can Play</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThat_We_Can_Play&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=That_We_Can_Play&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Too_many_synths,_Oneohtrix_Point_Never,_2nd_March_2010.jpg" class="image" title="Games (now Ford &amp; Lopatin) in March 2010"><img alt="Games (now Ford &amp; Lopatin) in March 2010" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Too_many_synths%2C_Oneohtrix_Point_Never%2C_2nd_March_2010.jpg/120px-Too_many_synths%2C_Oneohtrix_Point_Never%2C_2nd_March_2010.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Too_many_synths%2C_Oneohtrix_Point_Never%2C_2nd_March_2010.jpg/180px-Too_many_synths%2C_Oneohtrix_Point_Never%2C_2nd_March_2010.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Too_many_synths%2C_Oneohtrix_Point_Never%2C_2nd_March_2010.jpg/240px-Too_many_synths%2C_Oneohtrix_Point_Never%2C_2nd_March_2010.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1200" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Games (now <a href="/wiki/Ford_%26_Lopatin" title="Ford &amp; Lopatin">Ford &amp; Lopatin</a>) in March 2010</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the EP <i><b><a href="/wiki/That_We_Can_Play" title="That We Can Play">That We Can Play</a></b></i> by <a href="/wiki/Oneohtrix_Point_Never" title="Oneohtrix Point Never">Daniel Lopatin</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Ford_%26_Lopatin" title="Ford &amp; Lopatin">Games</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, a duo with Joel Ford, was highly praised by critics for their use of their 1980s influences?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Everything_Starts_With_An_%27E%27" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Everything Starts With An 'E'">Everything Starts With An 'E'</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:EditorE" title="User:EditorE">EditorE</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:EditorE" title="User talk:EditorE">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 12:41, 5 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article is new enough, created 2 days before nomination. <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> It's long enough, at 7659 characters by my count. <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> It follows NPOV, though the tone is unencyclopedic in some places (e.g. "majorly"), and uses inline citations appropriately.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> There are a number of instances of too-close paraphrasing that will have to be corrected before this article can run as a DYK.</dd>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Hook is short enough (though I would strike the "highly" and the second "their") and interesting enough. Facts in the hook are cited in the body of the article but not yet in the lead — that's easily fixed, though. Hook is compliant with BLP.</dd>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I was baffled by the results from <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/betacommand-dev/cgi-bin/dyk.py">the QPQ check tool</a>... is there documentation somewhere? (I am new to DYK review.)</dd>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Image is freely licensed; I'm not convinced it works at DYK thumbnail size, though.</dd>
<dd>As I have virtually no experience at DYK review, I'd ask a more experienced reviewer to check my work. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 03:28, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New reviewer requested to check inexperienced reviewer's work. Note to <a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a>: please only use one summary icon per review, since the software will assume the most recent icon is the one that counts, but in this case the final icon (the tick) does not reflect what the final assessment should be, that the too-close paraphrasing means that the article is not approved and needs further work. (Giving at least one or two examples of the close paraphrasing is a good idea, as it helps the nominator find and correct them.) <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 01:24, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Oops! Sorry about that, <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a>, and thanks for fixing it for me. Here are a few examples of the close paraphrasing:</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>article "A week of demos had been recorded during the summer of 2009 at Ford's parents' home in Massachusetts"; source "We did a week of demos during the summer of 2009 at Joel's parents' house in Massachusetts." (Pitchfork)</li>
<li>article "the two decided to move into an apartment together in 2010 to get the project going."; source "it took us moving into an apartment together this year to really get the project going again." (Pitchfork)</li>
<li>article "'Planet Party' has dusty handclaps, cheesy, violent orchestra hits, howling wah-wah'd guitar synths"; source "The dusty handclaps, cheesy orchestra hits, and baying keyboards of 'Planet Party'" (Boston Globe)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>I (belatedly) followed the link to the Everything Starts With An 'E' nomination above and confirmed that <a href="/wiki/User:EditorE" title="User:EditorE">EditorE</a> reviewed it. I'm still confused by the QPQ Check tool, though. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 21:03, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>

<li>Thanks for the issues addressed! I'm trying to make my articles as little of a quote farm as possible, and I promise these issue will be resolved. <a href="/wiki/User:EditorE" title="User:EditorE"><font style="color:Green; font-family:OCR A Extended">和DITOR</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:EditorE" title="User talk:EditorE"><font style="color:black"><b>E</b></font></a><a href="/wiki/User:EditorE/Details" title="User:EditorE/Details">tails</a> 22:35, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Shelby_Gem_Factory.2C_Larry_Paul_Kelley">Shelby Gem Factory, Larry Paul Kelley</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FShelby_Gem_Factory&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Shelby_Gem_Factory&amp;action=history">Shelby Gem Factory</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Larry_Paul_Kelley&amp;action=history">Larry Paul Kelley</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:ICTBuilding.jpg" class="image" title="Shelby Gem Factory"><img alt="Shelby Gem Factory" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/ICTBuilding.jpg/120px-ICTBuilding.jpg" width="120" height="73" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/ICTBuilding.jpg/180px-ICTBuilding.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/ICTBuilding.jpg/240px-ICTBuilding.jpg 2x" data-file-width="727" data-file-height="443" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Shelby Gem Factory</div>
</div>
</div>
<p>... that the Shelby Gem Factory (pictured), founded by Larry Paul Kelley, makes more varieties of synthetic and man-made gemstones than any other company in the world?</p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Municipalities_of_Yucatan" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Municipalities of Yucatan">Dzilam González Municipality</a> and <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Municipalities_of_Yucatan" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Municipalities of Yucatan">Mocochá Municipality</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:00, 3 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>To be clear, I am not reviewing this nomination; someone else will have to do that. The reasons I'm not doing the review are 1) I'm too new at reviewing DYK noms, in my own estimation, and 2) I'm going to be going in and trying to edit at least one of the articles so that it has a chance of passing NPOV. As of now, much of both articles reads like advertisement. I have to wonder whether <a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">user:Doug Coldwell</a> has a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:COI" title="Wikipedia:COI" class="mw-redirect">personal and/or business relationship with Shelby Gem Factory and/or Larry Paul Kelley</a>. Personally, I think the hook would be stronger without mentioning Mr. Kelley at all; his name in there feels too promotional. All that said, I have a passing interest in gemstones, so I'm feeling motivated to tweak at least the one article to save it from being nominated for deletion. We'll see what my Google-fu brings up for sources... —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist">talk</a>) 22:10, 8 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<dd>

<dl>
<dd>No, it's still too close. One specific example is "Kelley learned that making ruby laser rods was interesting, but didn’t prove profitable" vs "But making rubies for laser rods, while interesting, didn’t prove very profitable", but the problem is more pervasive than that single phrase. <a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nikkimaria" title="User talk:Nikkimaria">talk</a>) 02:48, 2 October 2015 (UTC)

<dd>O.K. I'll continue to make improvements to the Kelley article today.--<a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>) 09:44, 2 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a>:</span> I further copyedited and improved the Kelley article. I have reduced the Earwig's Copyvio Detector from 1.0% to <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Larry+Paul+Kelley&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">0.0% confidence on all websites.</a> I also double checked by entering in each line into Google, without quotes, and not once did it come to the website <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.northernexpress.com/michigan/article-5988-a-flaming-success-at-the-shelby-gem-factory.html">A Flaming Success at the Shelby Gem Factory.</a> I would think if there was close phrasing used that it would bring up that site at least one time on one of the sentences. Will that work for a green tick?--<a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>) 19:08, 2 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>No, it won't. We can't rely on automated tools like Copyvio Detector to determine close paraphrasing, because they aren't "smart" enough to see what humans can - phrases that are close in wording or structure but not identical to the source. Another example of this from Shelby Gem Factory: "These are chemically and physically indistinguishable of those unearthed. The man-made gemstones have a nearly flawless composition, because the factory controls the ingredients and cooking temperature. It is very rare to find flawless natural gems" vs "which are chemically and physically identical to stones dug from the ground. “Most of the gems we make are nearly flawless, because we control the ingredients and the cooking temperature,” Larry says. “It is rare to find a flawless natural ruby". There needs to be some more significant rewriting here. <a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nikkimaria" title="User talk:Nikkimaria">talk</a>) 20:27, 2 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a>:</span> Problem solved. The paragraph you are concerned about has been removed.--<a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>) 20:57, 2 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a>:</span> Looking over your DYK on <a href="/wiki/Sant%27Ambrogio_della_Massima" title="Sant'Ambrogio della Massima">Sant'Ambrogio della Massima</a> it looks like double-standards. The lead on the article is identical wording, word for word, <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Sant%27Ambrogio+della+Massima&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">for a paragraph in several sources you used.</a> --<a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>) 21:47, 2 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>The sources being flagged by that tool are explicitly copying from Wikipedia (automated tools don't understand what "from Wikipedia" means), are direct quotes properly cited (tools can't determine that), or are unoriginal phrasings like "the name of the church" (a judgement a tool can't make). If by manually comparing the article and its sources you feel there are any that are being too closely paraphrased, I'd be happy to discuss that with you at the article's talk page. The only purpose it serves here is to demonstrate the limitations of automated tools. <a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nikkimaria" title="User talk:Nikkimaria">talk</a>) 22:19, 2 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a>:</span> I rewrote both articles. It is now time to <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Drop_the_stick_and_back_slowly_away_from_the_horse_carcass" title="Wikipedia:Drop the stick and back slowly away from the horse carcass">stop beating the dead horse</a>. Best regards. <span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><a href="/wiki/User:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#060">7&amp;6=thirteen</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User talk:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#000">☎</b></a>)</span> 14:01, 3 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Nikkimaria" title="User:Nikkimaria">Nikkimaria</a>:</span> <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Shelby+Gem+Factory&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">Earwig's copy violation detector: Shelby Gem Factory</a> <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Larry+Paul+Kelley&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">Earwig's copy violation detector: Larry Paul Kelley</a> <span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><a href="/wiki/User:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#060">7&amp;6=thirteen</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User talk:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#000">☎</b></a>)</span> 10:53, 4 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
