<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_6">Articles created/expanded on September 6</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 6">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Boile_Run">Boile Run</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBoile_Run&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Boile_Run&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 100px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Boile_Run_2.JPG" class="image" title="Boile Run in its lower reaches"><img alt="Boile Run in its lower reaches" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Boile_Run_2.JPG/80px-Boile_Run_2.JPG" width="80" height="120" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Boile_Run_2.JPG/120px-Boile_Run_2.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Boile_Run_2.JPG/160px-Boile_Run_2.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2056" data-file-height="3088" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Boile Run in its lower reaches</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... <s>that an erroneous version of <b><a href="/wiki/Boile_Run" title="Boile Run">Boile Run</a></b>'s <i>(pictured)</i> name was in local use for at least 95 years?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Farmersville_Islamic_cemetery" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Farmersville Islamic cemetery">Template:Did you know nominations/Farmersville Islamic cemetery</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakec</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 15:12, 6 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, neutrally written, well referenced, no close paraphrasing seen. Hook ref verified and cited inline. Images are form Commons. QPQ done. GTG. --<a href="/wiki/User:Rosiestep" title="User:Rosiestep">Rosiestep</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rosiestep" title="User talk:Rosiestep">talk</a>) 19:15, 7 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I pulled this hook from prep 6 as the hook appears to be incorrect - it looks to me as if the source says the <i>correct</i> version of the name was in use for at least 95 years rather than the incorrect one. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 09:52, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a>:</span> Nice catch, I modified the article now. I think the opposite hook could fly just as well: <b>ALT1:</b> ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Boile_Run" title="Boile Run">Boile Run</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> was referred to as "Boyle Run" in a 1953 <a href="/wiki/USGS" title="USGS" class="mw-redirect">USGS</a> map, even though the name "Boile Run" had been in local use for decades? --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 14:15, 6 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I will need some time to think about that alt - at the very least, I think it could use a copyedit to avoid the repetition of "Boile Run". <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 14:19, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
<dd>I am not very keen on the proposed alt. How about this:</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT2:</b> ... that the name of <b><a href="/wiki/Boile_Run" title="Boile Run">Boile Run</a></b> was still in question 95 years after its first documented use? <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 12:31, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Something doesn't seem quite right about ALT2, I heavily lean towards ALT1. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 23:02, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>The problem with ALT1, <a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakec</a>, is that it just isn't interesting. Who cares that a name was misspelled on an official document one time? It's a yawn as a hook, made worse by the fact that it's a wordy yawn. Also, we have already featured at least one other hook using essentially the same fact. I think ALT2 is a lot more interesting and I see no problem with it; it's a fact that the USGS were recommending the adoption of the spelling "Boile Run" 95 years after its first documented use. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 08:50, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>ALT2 is not entirely accurate; it makes it sound like the name was in question the whole time, which it wasn't. And we don't know that 1874 is the first documented use of Boile Run. It's just the first that can be found from publicly available online sources. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 11:17, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakec</a>, it's not from "publicly available online sources", it's from a 1965 document, long before there was any such thing as "online". And that USGS document states that the name has been in use "approx. 95 years" and cites an 1874 map, so yes, the 1874 map must be the first documented use. I guess you have a point about the "still in question" phrase, however. Try this instead: *<b>ALT3:</b> ... that government officials recommended adopting the name "<b><a href="/wiki/Boile_Run" title="Boile Run">Boile Run</a></b>" for a tributary of the <a href="/wiki/Susquehanna_River" title="Susquehanna River">Susquehanna</a> 95 years after its first documented use? <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 15:06, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Celebrity_Fifteen_to_One">Celebrity Fifteen to One</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCelebrity_Fifteen_to_One&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Celebrity_Fifteen_to_One&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that the revival of <a href="/wiki/Fifteen_to_One" title="Fifteen to One">Fifteen to One</a> has produced 4275% more <b><a href="/wiki/Celebrity_Fifteen_to_One" title="Celebrity Fifteen to One">celebrity specials</a></b>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/2015_Chattanooga_shootings" title="Template:Did you know nominations/2015 Chattanooga shootings">2015 Chattanooga shootings</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: 35/2 = 17.5, 10/4 = 2.5, 17.5 x 2.5 = 43.75. 4375% - 100% = 4275%.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:04, 6 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I am not sure I get the math here at all and I am an engineer. So the first show had 2 out of 35 celebrity shows, or 5.7% of all shows in the original. Reviewed show had 4 out of 10 or 40% - Correct so far? I just don't see the leap to 4275%, I mean that would mean it would have to produce 42 times more celebrity shows = 84 shows? Not sure what 35/2 gives us? that there was a ratio of 17.5 to 1 I guess? But that's not a percentage. I don't get the math and the cited hook is not sourced either so it's hard to pass this one on that part alone. If the hook can be explained/supported by facts then maybe otherwise I'm not sure this could be passed. <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a>:</span> I would love a few details on this. <a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 03:24, 17 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li>Reading the two articles just gives me a headache - So Non Celebrity Original series, 2265 episodes, non celebrity revival series 100 episodes? 2 original show Celeb episodes, revival had 10? original 0.08% Celebrity Specials, new one 0.9%-ish Celebrity specials. `I am not seeing how you get the 4275 number at all.<a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 03:32, 17 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li>You've lost me now! The first 35 series contained just 2 celebrity specials. 1 special per 17.5 series. In the revival series, the four series contain 10 specials. 2.5 specials per series. 17.5 x 2.5 = 43.75, or 4375%, minus 100%. Clearer?--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 18:58, 17 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd>'*but.... 17.5 to 1 is not a percentage, it is a ratio - and why multiply two ratios with each other? That definitly does not turn it into a percentage. To me the math is unclear, potentially wrrong and there is no source for it. Yes it is "synthesized" from facts, but the calculations are not clear at all. <a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 20:19, 17 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>by your logic the first show had 17.5% specials and the new one had 250% specials? Since you.went 43.75 = 4375%? I am trying to see the math, but the jump from ratio to percent does not make sense.<a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 20:24, 17 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>17.5:1 divided by 1:2.5, or 17.5 divided by 0.4, is 43.75. Converted to a percentage, 43.75 is 4375%. 4375% is 4275% <i>more</i> than the 100% of the original.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 21:47, 17 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I get the math until you turn a ratio into a percentage straight up - you basically say that 2 is 17.5% of 32. That math does not check out at all.<a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 23:10, 17 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
<dd>Actually it is wrong right off the bat should be 1/17.5 and 10/4. Which equals 0.05 and 2.5 respectively. If we follow your logic we go to 0.05/2.5 = 0.0228...
<dl>
<dd>At this point I can fail the DYK for being unsourced and not logical, or you can ask for a second opinion on your math.<a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 23:16, 17 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>The alternative is for me to produce another hook, such as <b>ALT1</b>: ... that <a href="/wiki/Gyles_Brandreth" title="Gyles Brandreth">Gyles Brandreth</a> is the only person to have appeared in episodes of <b><a href="/wiki/Celebrity_Fifteen_to_One" title="Celebrity Fifteen to One">Celebrity Fifteen to One</a></b> presented by both <a href="/wiki/William_G._Stewart" title="William G. Stewart">William G. Stewart</a> and <a href="/wiki/Adam_Hills" title="Adam Hills">Adam Hills</a>? <dd>Unbelievable. To answer your question, they are gold, silver and bronze.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 16:17, 20 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Oh so literally 1st, 2nd, 3rd. <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_7">Articles created/expanded on September 7</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 7">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="El_Hijo_de_Dos_Caras">El Hijo de Dos Caras</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEl_Hijo_de_Dos_Caras&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=El_Hijo_de_Dos_Caras&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestler" title="Professional wrestler" class="mw-redirect">professional wrestler</a> <b><a href="/wiki/El_Hijo_de_Dos_Caras" title="El Hijo de Dos Caras">El Hijo de Dos Caras</a></b> needed an opponent's help to hold a ladder so he could win a <a href="/wiki/Ladder_match" title="Ladder match">Ladder match</a> as planned??</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestler" title="Professional wrestler" class="mw-redirect">professional wrestler</a> <b><a href="/wiki/El_Hijo_de_Dos_Caras" title="El Hijo de Dos Caras">El Hijo de Dos Caras</a></b> wrestles wearing a modified version of his father, <a href="/wiki/Dos_Caras" title="Dos Caras">Dos Caras</a>', <a href="/wiki/Wrestling_mask" title="Wrestling mask">wrestling mask</a>??</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Lee_Remick_(The_Go-Betweens_song)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Lee Remick (The Go-Betweens song)">Lee Remick (The Go-Betweens song)</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I took a redirect and turned it into an article</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Converted from a redirect by <a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK">MPJ-DK</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:50, 13 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Length and history verified. But I need to know more about the sources used for the hook facts. For the main hook, the source is a blogspot blog. Is <i>Estrellas de Ring</i> considered a reliable source within the Mexican wrrestling community? For the second, I ran the source through Google Translate and the nearest thing that supports the hook fact is a <i>comment</i> sort of asking the question. I think we need a better source than that. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 03:35, 13 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Yes it is considered reliable for what it is, match results and interviews with wrestlers. The author Ruiz Reyes writes about lucha libre for a number of different sites that covers Lucha Libre.</dd>
<dd>You mean the "hold the ladder" comment? First of all I want to point out the first picture in the actual article, showing Morgan (opponent) and referees holding the ladder for Hijo de Dos Caras. (Is that considered 1000 words on the subject&#160;;-) kidding) Also this from my built in browser translator <i>"In the final moments, I tired of so many failed attempts and a third ladder in the ring, the Pirate Morgan knowing that weight nobody could help, I'd rather help the son of two faces hung literally belt that resisted loose tie that held it down and could finally be declared Heavyweight new monarch of the IWRG"</i>.
<dl>
<dd>I hope that helps clarify? <a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 12:29, 13 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Well, that helps with the main hook, which I like more anyway. My query about the source cited for ALT1 is still open, though, and I'd rather not clear this for takeoff before either a) we have resolved this or b) we've decided to drop it. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 05:14, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>woops did not realise there was a question for the alt1 as well. That is sourced in the "Hijo del Dos Caras" section to an interview in SuperLuchas magazine 507. <a href="/wiki/User:MPJ-DK" title="User:MPJ-DK"><b><span style="background:blue;color:white;border: 1px solid blue">&#160;MPJ</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:MPJ-DK" title="User talk:MPJ-DK"><span style="background:red;color:white;border: 1px solid blue"><b>-US</b>&#160;</span></a> 11:33, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_9">Articles created/expanded on September 9</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 9">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Tenerife_Sea">Tenerife Sea</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FTenerife_Sea&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tenerife_Sea&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that "<b><a href="/wiki/Tenerife_Sea" title="Tenerife Sea">Tenerife Sea</a></b>", a song by <a href="/wiki/Ed_Sheeran" title="Ed Sheeran">Ed Sheeran</a>, was first thought to be about <a href="/wiki/Taylor_Swift" title="Taylor Swift">Taylor Swift</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Comment</i>: QPQ to follow. --<a href="/wiki/User:Efe" title="User:Efe">Efe</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Efe" title="User talk:Efe">talk</a>) 10:55, 12 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Efe" title="User:Efe">Efe</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Efe" title="User talk:Efe">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:55, 12 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article was 5x expanded on date of nomination and the article is over 1500 characters. The hook is under 200 characters and interesting, if true. There is a trademarked logo in the article, but I think the placement of the image in the article is justified by fair use (disclaimer: this is not a legal opinion of whether the use is lawful -- it is merely my personal interpretation of Wikipedia policies and guidelines). However, there are a few issues with this nomination that I hope can be addressed.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>One easily fixable issue is that the nominator still needs to complete QPQ. My biggest concern with this nomination is that I'm not sure this hook is supported by a reliable source. The assertion in the hook (that the song may be about Taylor Swift) is supported by an inline citation to an MTV <a href="/wiki/Listicle" title="Listicle">listicle</a> titled "54 Taylor Swift Duets That’ll Make You Wonder Who She Hasn’t Performed With." The listicle says, <span class="inline-quote-talk" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #008560;">"Ed reunited with Taylor once again when they sang his song “Tenerife Sea” (which some thought was about Taylor at one point in history) at Rock in Rio in Las Vegas in 2015."</span> I certainly don't think every <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:RS" title="Wikipedia:RS" class="mw-redirect">reliable source</a> has to identify its sources, but <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:QS" title="Wikipedia:QS" class="mw-redirect">WP:QS</a> explains that sources relying upon <span class="inline-quote-talk" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #008560;">"unsubstantiated gossip, rumor or personal opinion"</span> are generally not reliable. It sounds to me like this source is relying on rumors or unsubstantiated gossip. Although the hook simply seems to be saying that <i>rumors existed at one time that the song was about Taylor Swift</i>, we still have the same problems with <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:RS" title="Wikipedia:RS" class="mw-redirect">WP:RS</a> and <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:V" title="Wikipedia:V" class="mw-redirect">WP:V</a> because the existence of these rumors is, itself, based on unsubstantiated gossip. I realize this is all rather circular, but I think we need more definitive proof that someone actually argued/claimed at one point in time that this song was about Taylor Swift. -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 23:38, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I'm afraid I can't agree with <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> about the use of the Spotify logo in this article; fair use for logos generally only covers them appearing in articles about the company or product whose logo it is, as <i>necessary</i> to identify that company or product. I would think that the logo would need to be removed before this article could run on the front page.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>However, the callout created by the logo and its caption in the article suggested a new (and better sourced) direction for the hook:</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b> ... that the song "<b><a href="/wiki/Tenerife_Sea" title="Tenerife Sea">Tenerife Sea</a></b>" was ranked #14 in <a href="/wiki/Spotify" title="Spotify">Spotify</a>'s list of the most-streamed tracks in the category sleep?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b> ... that "<b><a href="/wiki/Tenerife_Sea" title="Tenerife Sea">Tenerife Sea</a></b>" is one of the most popular songs in both the sleep and dance categories?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>What do you think, <a href="/wiki/User:Efe" title="User:Efe">Efe</a>? —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 15:11, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a>, you may very well be correct that the use of the Spotify logo is inappropriate in this article. To be honest, I know very little about trademark law; my background involves other areas of the law. I assumed that because the use was not for a commercial purpose and there would be little "likelihood of confusion," the use of the logo would be okay. Nevertheless, I am going to go ahead and remove the image until we can establish that the use is, in fact, justified. I am also going to remove the sentence that suggests the song is about Taylor Swift, because the source that supports the assertion relies upon unsubstantiated gossip. As for the new hooks, I like <b>ALT1</b> a lot. I had no idea that "sleep" was a musical genre! Is it the kind of music that puts the listener to sleep? Also, we still need a QPQ before we can approve any hooks. Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 15:32, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><s><a href="/wiki/User:Efe" title="User:Efe">Efe</a>, just a reminder that we still need a QPQ</s>. -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 22:32, 19 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Scratch the above comment. According to <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/betacommand-dev/cgi-bin/dyk.py?user=Efe">this</a>, Efe only has two DYK credits. <b>ALT1</b> is good to go. Per my review above, the article was 5x expanded within one week of nomination, the article is long enough, the hook is under 200 characters, interesting, and supported by an inline citation. The article complies with relevant policy considerations (neutrality, plagiarism, etc-). The Spotify image has been removed from the article, and the only remaining image is within policy. -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 22:40, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Emilie_von_Berlepsch">Emilie von Berlepsch</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEmilie_von_Berlepsch&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Emilie_von_Berlepsch&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg" class="image" title="von Berlepsch"><img alt="von Berlepsch" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg/120px-Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg" width="120" height="196" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg/180px-Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg/240px-Emilie_von_Berlepsch2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="540" data-file-height="882" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">von Berlepsch</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... <s>that <b><a href="/wiki/Emilie_von_Berlepsch" title="Emilie von Berlepsch">Emilie von Berlepsch</a></b> told German readers about <a href="/wiki/Mary_Wollstonecraft" title="Mary Wollstonecraft">Mary Wollstonecraft</a> and the nature of <a href="//en.wiktionary.org/wiki/misogyny" class="extiw" title="wikt:misogyny">misogyny</a>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... have a go</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Maiasmokk" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Maiasmokk">QPQ = Maiasmokk</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Copyedit by a German speaking editor very welcome</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:21, 9 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Interesting life and writing! Few sources, but good, - German has more, literature could be copied for those interested. I don't see Goethe in the German article, but Jean Paul. I think the name of the first husband should be mentioned. If possible avoid squeezing text between infobox and image. Hook fine, subscription source accepted AGF. Image free and a good illustration! --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 15:02, 13 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Thanks <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a>:</span>. Goethe's in the Emglish source. I can see that she was briefly engaged to Jean Paul. That's notable but I don't have the skills/courage to find/add a German source. Useful to include. I have added a bit about Robert Burns and her first husband. OK? thx again. <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 12:23, 14 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Fine. Jean Paul should be added for interest's sake, but his name missing is not in the way of approval. I though again about the hook. Can you add a hint at early writing on women's rights, for those who don't know Wollstonecraft and misogyny? At least link the latter which I had to look up? Our readership is international&#160;;) --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 13:18, 14 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Hmmm ... I've tried to take the ideas and remove the need for prior knowledge. <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 14:12, 15 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><b>Alt1</b>: ... <s>that <b><a href="/wiki/Emilie_von_Berlepsch" title="Emilie von Berlepsch">Emilie von Berlepsch</a></b> told German readers about how <a href="/wiki/Mary_Wollstonecraft" title="Mary Wollstonecraft">a woman</a> writes about <a href="/wiki/A_Vindication_of_the_Rights_of_Woman" title="A Vindication of the Rights of Woman">Women's Rights</a>?</s></dd>
<dd><b>Alt2</b> ... <s>that <b><a href="/wiki/Emilie_von_Berlepsch" title="Emilie von Berlepsch">Emilie von Berlepsch</a></b> told German readers about why it appeared that <a href="/wiki/Misogyny" title="Misogyny">men hated women</a>?</s>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> All hooks possible, I prefer the slightly quirky touch of Alt1, said "a" instead of "the" because she wasn't the only one, right? --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 14:37, 15 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><small>I fixed the link to the Misogyny article above. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 15:26, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</small></dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Those hooks don't look right to me. I will take a closer look at this one tomorrow. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 14:27, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Apologies for not following up on this one sooner. Both alts are awkward in my opinion and inaccurate, I don't think either are acceptable. The original hook looks viable in terms of fact but again is a bit awkwardly expressed - does "told about" mean "introduced to" (ie Wollstonecraft)? And I don't think you can say she "told about" the nature of misogyny either, as if she's an impeccable authority - she merely had an opinion and wrote about it. So I think this hook at least needs some clarification. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 07:02, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>If Berlepsch did indeed introduce Wollstonecraft to German readers (the article says only "discussed" so that would need to be clarified) then I think the original hook could be reworded to something like:</li>
<li><b>ALT3:</b> ... that aristocrat <b><a href="/wiki/Emilie_von_Berlepsch" title="Emilie von Berlepsch">Emilie von Berlepsch</a></b> wrote about women‍ '​s rights and <a href="/wiki/Misogyny" title="Misogyny">misogyny</a> and introduced German readers to the work of <a href="/wiki/Mary_Wollstonecraft" title="Mary Wollstonecraft">Mary Wollstonecraft</a>? <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 07:08, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Are you telling us about this or writing about it? I'm not sure there is a difference. I'm quite happy with either or even if you are "introducing" your view to us. I presume this difference is important and I'm happy with any of these very similar interpretations. This alt doesn't address Gerda's objections (who can read de:wiki) however which I feel have been ignored. <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 14:24, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I think the difference is that "told" can mean a lot of different things and have different connotations, whereas "introduced" has a more precise meaning. However, you didn't confirm for me that Ms. Berlepsch did actually introduce Germans to Wollstonecraft - the article still only says she "discussed" W. for German readers - any chance you could clarify that in the article? Regarding Gerda's comments, they weren't really objections, rather suggestions as to how the article might be improved, which are beyond the scope of this process, as I think the article already meets the criteria. We really only need to confirm the hook at this point. <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 14:48, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Gerda said " I though again about the hook. Can you add a hint at early writing on women's rights, for those who don't know Wollstonecraft and misogyny?". This is not about the article and it is the reason why the hooks were written. The original hook said "told". I would have thought that translations might be useful for introducing a writer to German readers but maybe she was just discussing/telling/saying/writing. If you want to insist on Alt3 then I suggest you change it to the word you like. I think introduce could have read re-introduce but discuss will do. <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 16:55, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I added "womens rights" to the hook (and also "aristocrat" as I think it adds to the interest). How does it look now? <a href="/wiki/User:Gatoclass" title="User:Gatoclass">Gatoclass</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gatoclass" title="User talk:Gatoclass">talk</a>) 10:12, 19 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>(still watching, on vacation:) please don't change hooks which have caused comments, because it makes the discussion hard to follow. "Aristocrat" is redundant for readers who know that the "von" in her name stands for that. Mentioning women's rights and Wollstonecraft and misogyny seems one thing too many to me, please decide on two of the three. Is "introduced" now in the article and sourced? --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 17:12, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>

</ul>

<dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Sigala_.28musician.29.2C_Good_Times_.28Ella_Eyre_song.29">Sigala (musician), Good Times (Ella Eyre song)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSigala_%28musician%29%2C_Good_Times_%28Ella_Eyre_song%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sigala_%28musician%29&amp;action=history">Sigala (musician)</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Good_Times_%28Ella_Eyre_song%29&amp;action=history">Good Times (Ella Eyre song)</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Sigala_(musician)" title="Sigala (musician)">Sigala</a></b> co-wrote "<b><a href="/wiki/Good_Times_(Ella_Eyre_song)" title="Good Times (Ella Eyre song)">Good Times</a></b>" by <a href="/wiki/Ella_Eyre" title="Ella Eyre">Ella Eyre</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Charles_Larimore_Jones" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Charles Larimore Jones">Template:Did you know nominations/Charles Larimore Jones</a>, <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Martin_Allwood" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Martin Allwood">Template:Did you know nominations/Martin Allwood</a></li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_11">Articles created/expanded on September 11</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 11">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Vida_Latham">Vida Latham</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVida_Latham&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vida_Latham&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Vida_Latham" title="Vida Latham">Vida Latham</a></b> had a DDS and an MD?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Vida_Latham" title="Vida Latham">Vida Latham</a></b> advocated for women in dentistry and medicine throughout her career in both fields?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Oligoryzomys_longicaudatus" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Oligoryzomys longicaudatus">Template:Did you know nominations/Oligoryzomys longicaudatus</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I suck at writing hooks, please feel free to suggest less-sucky ones.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Keilana" title="User:Keilana">Keilana</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Keilana" title="User talk:Keilana">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 18:51, 17 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Review, acceptable stuff -&gt; New enough (barely). Long enough. <b>ALT1</b> is sourced, short enough and better, plus I added "in both fields". Acceptable rephrasing. QPQ done. No image. <a href="/wiki/User:Starship.paint" title="User:Starship.paint"><b>starship</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Starship.paint" title="Special:Contributions/Starship.paint"><b>.paint ~</b></a> <b><span style="border:2px solid black"><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Starship.paint" title="User talk:Starship.paint"><font style="color:white;background:black;">KO</font></a></span></b> 04:24, 24 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Keilana" title="User:Keilana">Keilana</a>:</span> issues to be solved <a href="/wiki/User:Starship.paint" title="User:Starship.paint"><b>starship</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Starship.paint" title="Special:Contributions/Starship.paint"><b>.paint ~</b></a> <b><span style="border:2px solid black"><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Starship.paint" title="User talk:Starship.paint"><font style="color:white;background:black;">KO</font></a></span></b> 05:36, 24 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>(a) Source 2 states she received some early education in Cambridge, not London.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Source 1 says "University of London" for her MSc in 1889.
<ul>
<li>Yes, but we're talking about <b>early</b> education here ... Masters is already postgraduate.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>(b) Source 1 does not mention that the College of Pharmacy was Northwestern's</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Both the College of Pharmacy and College of Physicians and Surgeons were Northwestern.
<ul>
<li>I'm going to need a source for that. Source 1 uses the same ";" between all her positions, if they used a "," before the College of Pharmacy I'd be more understanding. Plus, Source 1 says the College of Physicians and Surgeons is from Chicago.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>(c) microanalyst and physician from 1929, not 1931, according to Source 1?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Fixed.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>(d) Source 2 states she moved to Chicago in the US as she could not practice dentistry in the UK with an American degree</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I don't think this contradicts anything in the article - are you asking me to clarify/add this?
<ul>
<li>Yes, please add this.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>(e) Source 2 does not state she published her <i>first</i> papers in 1888, It does state that they were on pain and tooth anatomy.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Fixed.</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>(f) Source 1 does not state cancer, but pulp <a href="/wiki/Neoplasm" title="Neoplasm">neoplasm</a> (tumor?)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>In this case it means a malignant neoplasm, aka cancer.
<ul>
<li>I'm afraid I can't accept the assumption that the neoplasms she researched on are solely malignant ones. Source 1 simply does not indicate that.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li>(g) Not entirely sure the lede saying "known for her work in publishing and her research on oral surgery and anatomy." is reflective. Suggest removing, or I need convincing.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>She was the editor of several prominent journals and "published extensively" in reference to her dental research. I think this is more than enough to support this sentence. <a href="/wiki/User:Keilana" title="User:Keilana">Keilana</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Keilana" title="User talk:Keilana">talk</a>) 19:30, 26 September 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li>Well now that I re-read the article, I'm thinking, why restrict it to merely oral surgery and anatomy? How about adding "oral tumours" because there's tooth pulp and palate tumors plus oral cavity cysts as well - you should probably group them so. <a href="/wiki/User:Starship.paint" title="User:Starship.paint"><b>starship</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Starship.paint" title="Special:Contributions/Starship.paint"><b>.paint ~</b></a> <b><span style="border:2px solid black"><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Starship.paint" title="User talk:Starship.paint"><font style="color:white;background:black;">KO</font></a></span></b> 05:30, 27 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd><a href="/wiki/Ada_Lovelace_Day" title="Ada Lovelace Day" class="mw-redirect">Ada Lovelace Day</a> is October 13th and this one might be relevant. Please consider helping move articles <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 23:34, 10 October 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Keilana" title="User:Keilana">Keilana</a>:</span> bump <a href="/wiki/User:Starship.paint" title="User:Starship.paint"><b>starship</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Starship.paint" title="Special:Contributions/Starship.paint"><b>.paint ~</b></a> <b><span style="border:2px solid black"><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Starship.paint" title="User talk:Starship.paint"><font style="color:white;background:black;">KO</font></a></span></b> 06:16, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea">Corruption in Equatorial Guinea</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCorruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that despite having the highest per capita GDP of all African nations, <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a> is ranked one of the lowest countries by measure of the quality of life?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a>'s per capita GDP is on par with <a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel">Israel</a> and <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, despite more than 60 percent living on less than one dollar a day, due to <b><a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">corruption</a></b>?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Teodoro_Nguema_Obiang" title="Teodoro Nguema Obiang" class="mw-redirect">Teodoro Nguema Obiang</a> of <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a> has accumulated a vast fortune of over $300 million despite an annual salary of $100,000, allegedly through <b><a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">embezzlement</a></b>?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a>'s per capita GDP is on par with <a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel">Israel</a> and <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, while most of the population lives in poverty worse than <a href="/wiki/Chad" title="Chad">Chad</a> or <a href="/wiki/Afghanistan" title="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a> due to <b><a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">corruption</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:DaltonCastle" title="User:DaltonCastle">DaltonCastle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:DaltonCastle" title="User talk:DaltonCastle">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:09, 16 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT4</b>:<s>... that while live in California, the son of <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a>'s President, <a href="/wiki/Teodoro_Nguema_Obiang" title="Teodoro Nguema Obiang" class="mw-redirect">Teodoro Nguema Obiang</a>, owned a fleet of 32 motorcycles and auto-mobiles, including <a href="/wiki/Ferrari" title="Ferrari">Ferraris</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bentley" title="Bentley">Bentleys</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rolls_Royce" title="Rolls Royce" class="mw-redirect">Rolls Royces</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lamborghini" title="Lamborghini">Lamborghinis</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maybach" title="Maybach">Maybachs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mercedes" title="Mercedes" class="mw-disambig">Mercedes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Porche" title="Porche" class="mw-redirect">Porches</a>, an <a href="/wiki/Aston-Martin" title="Aston-Martin" class="mw-redirect">Aston-Martin</a>, and a <a href="/wiki/Bugatti" title="Bugatti">Bugatti</a> bought with <a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">embezzled funds</a>?</s></li>
<li><b>ALT5</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Teodoro_Nguema_Obiang" title="Teodoro Nguema Obiang" class="mw-redirect">Teodoro Nguema Obiang</a>'s commission for a $380 million "Mega Yacht" was rescinded after the plan was made public to critics of high levels of <b><a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">Corruption in Equatorial Guinea</a></b>?</li>
<li><b>ALT6</b>:... that despite having the highest per capita GDP of all African nations, <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a> is ranked one of the lowest countries by measure of the quality of life due to <b><a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">corruption</a></b>?</li>
<li><b>ALT7</b>:... that while live in California, the son of <a href="/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea" title="Equatorial Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a>'s President, <a href="/wiki/Teodoro_Nguema_Obiang" title="Teodoro Nguema Obiang" class="mw-redirect">Teodoro Nguema Obiang</a>, owned a fleet of 32 motorcycles and auto-mobiles bought with <b><a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_Equatorial_Guinea" title="Corruption in Equatorial Guinea">embezzled funds</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_13">Articles created/expanded on September 13</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 13">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship_.28IGF.29">IWGP Heavyweight Championship (IGF)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FIWGP_Heavyweight_Championship_%28IGF%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship_%28IGF%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>...that on February 17, 2008, <a href="/wiki/Inoki_Genome_Federation" title="Inoki Genome Federation">Inoki Genome Federation</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship_(IGF)" title="IWGP Heavyweight Championship (IGF)">IWGP Heavyweight Championship</a></b> was <a href="/wiki/Championship_unification" title="Championship unification">unified</a> with <a href="/wiki/New_Japan_Pro_Wrestling" title="New Japan Pro Wrestling">New Japan Pro Wrestling</a>'s <a href="/wiki/IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship" title="IWGP Heavyweight Championship">IWGP Heavyweight Championship</a>.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:...that <a href="/wiki/Brock_Lesnar" title="Brock Lesnar">Brock Lesnar</a> was stripped of the <a href="/wiki/IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship" title="IWGP Heavyweight Championship">IWGP Heavyweight Championship</a> by <a href="/wiki/New_Japan_Pro_Wrestling" title="New Japan Pro Wrestling">New Japan Pro Wrestling</a> but <a href="/wiki/Inoki_Genome_Federation" title="Inoki Genome Federation">Inoki Genome Federation</a> continued to recognize him as the <b><a href="/wiki/IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship_(IGF)" title="IWGP Heavyweight Championship (IGF)">IWGP Heavyweight Champion</a></b>.</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Philip_Baxter" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Philip Baxter">Philip Baxter</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Wrestlinglover" title="User:Wrestlinglover">Wrestlinglover</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wrestlinglover" title="User talk:Wrestlinglover">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 12:31, 13 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> new enough, long enough, inline citations and refs checks, interesting and factual hook. Good 2 go.<a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) 12:23, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a>, I don't see any mention that you checked for close paraphrasing or neutrality, the other "within policy" checks. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Jared_Tebo.2C_2007_IFMAR_1:10_Electric_Off-Road_World_Championship">Jared Tebo, 2007 IFMAR 1:10 Electric Off-Road World Championship</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJared_Tebo&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jared_Tebo&amp;action=history">Jared Tebo</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2007_IFMAR_Electric_Off-Road_World_Championship&amp;action=history">2007 IFMAR Electric Off-Road World Championship</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/2007_IFMAR_1:10_Electric_Off-Road_World_Championship" title="2007 IFMAR 1:10 Electric Off-Road World Championship">2007</a></b> and defending world champion, <b><a href="/wiki/Jared_Tebo" title="Jared Tebo">Jared Tebo</a></b> took up radio-controlled racing as an alternative to regular hospital visits sustained <a href="/wiki/Motocross" title="Motocross">motocrossing</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/2007_IFMAR_1:10_Electric_Off-Road_World_Championship" title="2007 IFMAR 1:10 Electric Off-Road World Championship">2007</a></b> and defending world champion, <b><a href="/wiki/Jared_Tebo" title="Jared Tebo">Jared Tebo</a></b> considered radio-controlled racing to be <a href="/wiki/Motocross" title="Motocross">motocrossing</a> without the hospital visits?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Donnie_Park" title="User:Donnie Park">Donnie Park</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Donnie_Park" title="User talk:Donnie Park">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:37, 13 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Will prefer this to be posted on its opening day. October 3—5 (2015 IFMAR 1:10 Electric Off-Road World Championship, 2WD class) as Tebo is the defending champion in that class.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Touran_Mirhadi" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Touran Mirhadi">Touran Mirhadi</a> (<a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Laura_Jordan_Bambach" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Laura Jordan Bambach">here</a>) and <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Laura_Jordan_Bambach" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Laura Jordan Bambach">Laura Jordan Bambach</a> (<a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Touran_Mirhadi" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Touran Mirhadi">here</a>) considering I assume that for a double hook nomination, need two reviews. <a href="/wiki/User:Donnie_Park" title="User:Donnie Park">Donnie Park</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Donnie_Park" title="User talk:Donnie Park">talk</a>) 20:34, 27 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_14">Articles created/expanded on September 14</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 14">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p><br /></p>
<p><br /></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Bibi_Bourelly">Bibi Bourelly</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBibi_Bourelly&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bibi_Bourelly&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Bibi_Bourelly" title="Bibi Bourelly">Bibi Bourelly</a></b>, the writer for <a href="/wiki/Rihanna" title="Rihanna">Rihanna</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Bitch_Better_Have_My_Money" title="Bitch Better Have My Money">Bitch Better Have My Money</a>, is the daughter of guitarist <a href="/wiki/Jean-Paul_Bourelly" title="Jean-Paul Bourelly">Jean-Paul Bourelly</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/The_Interview_(2014_film)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/The Interview (2014 film)">Template:Did you know nominations/The Interview (2014 film)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 00:03, 14 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I have concerns about using a Forbes article as a main source for a BLP. The Forbes article is written by a "contributor", not a staff, and may not be sufficiently reliable. <small>As a side note, I would recommend linking this article from the <a href="/wiki/Bitch_Better_Have_My_Money" title="Bitch Better Have My Money">Bitch Better Have My Money</a> article.</small> <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">flyer</a></sup> 16:55, 27 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I regard all interviews as inherently reliable; information from interviews can be sourced not to the paper, but to the artist.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 18:10, 27 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>That is an unusual view Lbr. Many people exaggerate or underplay their contribution. Wikipedia is meant to be an objective view and interviews are usually a subjective view. <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 10:12, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_17">Articles created/expanded on September 17</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 17">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Marathwada_Liberation_Day">Marathwada Liberation Day</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMarathwada_Liberation_Day&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Marathwada_Liberation_Day&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that, though <a href="/wiki/India" title="India">India</a> became <a href="/wiki/Indian_independence_movement" title="Indian independence movement">independent</a> on <a href="/wiki/Independence_Day_(India)" title="Independence Day (India)">15 August 1947</a>, still <a href="/wiki/Marathwada" title="Marathwada">Marathwada</a> region of <a href="/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a> was not part of India till <b><a href="/wiki/Marathwada_Liberation_Day" title="Marathwada Liberation Day">17 September 1948</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Human3015" title="User:Human3015">Human3015</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Human3015" title="User talk:Human3015">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 19:05, 23 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_18">Articles created/expanded on September 18</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 18">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2008_TNA_World_X_Cup_Tournament">2008 TNA World X Cup Tournament</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F2008_TNA_World_X_Cup_Tournament&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2008_TNA_World_X_Cup_Tournament&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Total_Nonstop_Action_Wrestling" title="Total Nonstop Action Wrestling">Total Nonstop Action Wrestling</a> (TNA) held a <b><a href="/wiki/2008_TNA_World_X_Cup_Tournament" title="2008 TNA World X Cup Tournament">World X Cup Tournament in 2008</a></b> featuring wrestlers from around the world?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Rare_Replay" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Rare Replay">Rare Replay</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Wrestlinglover" title="User:Wrestlinglover">Wrestlinglover</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wrestlinglover" title="User talk:Wrestlinglover">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:23, 19 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Comment: the hook is not interesting at all. A world cup tournament would of course have participants from around the world. A better hook should be featured on the Main Page.--<a href="/wiki/User:Skr15081997" title="User:Skr15081997">Skr15081997</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Skr15081997" title="User talk:Skr15081997">talk</a>) 10:40, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>The issue here is this is a very very rare event in wrestling. WWE does not have tournaments consisting of wrestlers from other promotions. This was only the third one ever to happen and had travel issues involved. I find it very interesting since it doesn't happen much.--<a href="/wiki/User:Wrestlinglover" title="User:Wrestlinglover"><font color="red"><b>Will</b></font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wrestlinglover" title="User talk:Wrestlinglover"><font color="blue"><b>C</b></font></a> 20:25, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Skr15081997" title="User:Skr15081997">Skr15081997</a>:</span> - Can I suggest that we take your point and point it up - this will need a ref adding - Japan the USA and Mexico were 75% of the contestants <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 13:01, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li>(alt1) ... that the <b><a href="/wiki/2008_TNA_World_X_Cup_Tournament" title="2008 TNA World X Cup Tournament">World X Cup Tournament in 2008</a></b> had wrestlers in four teams, Japan, Mexico, USA and the rest of the world?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>If the above can get approved I'm indifferent. The reference named WV4 should be able to cover the above fact. If needed, a report of Victory Road can also cover it.--<a href="/wiki/User:Wrestlinglover" title="User:Wrestlinglover"><font color="red"><b>Will</b></font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wrestlinglover" title="User talk:Wrestlinglover"><font color="blue"><b>C</b></font></a> 22:41, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Full review needed. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 17:38, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
