<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_19">Articles created/expanded on September 19</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 19">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ragged_Ass_Road_.28street.29">Ragged Ass Road (street)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRagged_Ass_Road_%28street%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ragged_Ass_Road_%28street%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road,_Yellowknife,_NT.jpg" class="image" title="Looking north along Ragged Ass Road from Brock Drive"><img alt="Looking north along Ragged Ass Road from Brock Drive" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d5/Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/120px-Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg" width="120" height="150" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d5/Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/180px-Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d5/Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/240px-Looking_north_along_Ragged_Ass_Road%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3416" data-file-height="4272" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Looking north along Ragged Ass Road from Brock Drive</div>
</div>
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign,_Yellowknife,_NT.jpg" class="image" title="Ragged Ass Road official sign"><img alt="Ragged Ass Road official sign" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/120px-Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg" width="120" height="32" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/180px-Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/240px-Ragged_Ass_Road_blade_sign%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5088" data-file-height="1368" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Ragged Ass Road official sign</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that although <b><a href="/wiki/Ragged_Ass_Road_(street)" title="Ragged Ass Road (street)">Ragged Ass Road</a></b> has had that name since 1970, the city of <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a> did not put it on official street signs <i>(pictured)</i> until very recently?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that in <a href="/wiki/Kathy_Reichs" title="Kathy Reichs">Kathy Reichs</a>' novel <i><a href="/wiki/Bones_Are_Forever" title="Bones Are Forever">Bones Are Forever</a></i>, <a href="/wiki/Temperance_Brennan" title="Temperance Brennan">Temperance Brennan</a> describes the <a href="/wiki/Architectural_style" title="Architectural style">architectural style</a> of <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/Ragged_Ass_Road_(street)" title="Ragged Ass Road (street)">Ragged Ass Road</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> as "northern hodgepodge"?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/North_Branch_Shamokin_Creek" title="Template:Did you know nominations/North Branch Shamokin Creek">North Branch Shamokin Creek</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I thought after I uploaded the pics in the infobox that I'd just touch this one up a bit. Instead I wound up expanding it enough to make this nomination possible.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:32, 20 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article has been expanded 5X and seems reasonably compliant with policy. I'm less happy with the hooks. Their sourcing seems ok but they are a bit dull and I reckon we can do better. I'll be suggesting another ALT but can't approve that myself. There's no QPQ but I'm not sure how many DYKs the nominator has done. And there might be an issue with the picture of the road sign – as it is text in a particular visual form, which is sold commercially as a souvenir, there might be some intellectual property rights to consider. To be safe, we should use a picture which shows the street more than just the sign. <a href="/wiki/User:Andrew_Davidson" title="User:Andrew Davidson">Andrew D.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Andrew_Davidson" title="User talk:Andrew Davidson">talk</a>) 13:57, 15 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>There is a QPQ ... see "reviewed" above. As for the street sign, that's the one the city placed. Even if it were, text in a common font that doesn't make a complete sentence (I think) is ineligible for copyright, in <i>both</i> the US and Canada (We wouldn't have <a href="//commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Street_signs_in_Canada" class="extiw" title="commons:Category:Street signs in Canada">this Commons category</a> otherwise. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 04:37, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Thanks for pointing out the QPQ - I have trouble registering the word "reviewed" as meaning the same thing. I take your point about the copyright issue and would be happy to pass on this aspect myself. That just leaves the hook to be decided. <a href="/wiki/User:Andrew_Davidson" title="User:Andrew Davidson">Andrew D.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Andrew_Davidson" title="User talk:Andrew Davidson">talk</a>) 07:10, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ragged_Ass_Road_(street)" title="Ragged Ass Road (street)">Ragged Ass Road</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> was formerly known as Privy Road because it had many <a href="/wiki/Outhouse" title="Outhouse">outhouses</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Added the city it's in to the hook ... always a good idea to tell people where these places are. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 04:38, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've taken it out again. My thinking is that hooks should be brief so that the reader can easily grasp them and should be mysterious so that the reader is intrigued and clicks through to the article. <a href="/wiki/User:Andrew_Davidson" title="User:Andrew Davidson">Andrew D.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Andrew_Davidson" title="User talk:Andrew Davidson">talk</a>) 07:06, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Fine, but I also think that not at least giving a clue where something like this is constitutes <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:BIAS" title="Wikipedia:BIAS" class="mw-redirect">systemic bias</a>. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 17:35, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>We need a third opinion, in any case, to choose between the hooks. I'm not understanding your point about bias. We're providing a clue by giving them a link to click. The more we tell them in the hook, the less likely they are to click through on the link. Anyway, let's see what the next reviewer says. <a href="/wiki/User:Andrew_Davidson" title="User:Andrew Davidson">Andrew D.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Andrew_Davidson" title="User talk:Andrew Davidson">talk</a>) 18:05, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>My point is that we are assuming everyone who reads DYK lives in North America, an assumption some people resent because it's not true. I've written a lot of NRHP articles about historic places, and always, always, in the hook, I have included at least the city and state (I don't think it will make much of a difference as far as the mystery goes, because a) most Canadians know Yellowknife is one of their country's territorial capitals but might not be sure of which one (especially since <a href="/wiki/Nunavut" title="Nunavut">Nunavut</a> was sawed off the NT 16 years ago), b) most Americans might know Yellowknife is somewhere in Canada but not much more than that and c) outside of North America, the name "Yellowknife" won't ring any bells. Just my (ahem) case. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 02:39, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="One_Hundred_And_Eighty">One Hundred And Eighty</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FOne_Hundred_And_Eighty&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=One_Hundred_And_Eighty&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that although <b><a href="/wiki/One_Hundred_And_Eighty" title="One Hundred And Eighty" class="mw-redirect">One Hundred And Eighty</a></b> offers a £20,000 jackpot, scoring 180 wins only £500?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Hud_(film)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Hud (film)">Template:Did you know nominations/Hud (film)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 22:21, 19 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough. Long enough. QPQ done. Both references have "Missing or empty title=". Could you add URLs for the relevant webpages please? Hook is "hooky" enough. Where the hook fact appears in the article, there needs to be a citaition at the end of that sentence, not just the end of the paragraph. Not yet checked for close paraphrasing issues, copyright violations and plagiarism. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 13:20, 20 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Both fixed. I'd filled in both, but not the series parameter. That must be a common error - where can I have a bot do it?--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 14:36, 25 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Thanks. Maybe I'm missing something, but I'm still struggling to review this properly. As far as I can figure it, the main source seems to be an episode that you watched. On the one hand, this source mostly supports content similar to a movie plot, which wouldn't need to be cited as such. On the other hand, it might be seen by some as skirting close to <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:OR" title="Wikipedia:OR" class="mw-redirect">WP:OR</a>. As for the hook, "£500" has a citation, but it is to that episode again; the "20,000 jackpot" needs a cite. It would be most appreciated if you could hunt online for more webpages to support the article! <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 14:27, 2 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Well, I've added a cite to the jackpot.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 10:45, 3 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_20">Articles created/expanded on September 20</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=23" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 20">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Country_Joe_and_the_Fish">Country Joe and the Fish</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCountry_Joe_and_the_Fish&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Country_Joe_and_the_Fish&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png" class="image" title="Country Joe and the Fish in 1967"><img alt="Country Joe and the Fish in 1967" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/77/Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png/120px-Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png" width="120" height="117" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/77/Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png/180px-Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/77/Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png/240px-Country_Joe_and_the_Fish.png 2x" data-file-width="872" data-file-height="848" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Country Joe and the Fish in 1967</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Country_Joe_and_the_Fish" title="Country Joe and the Fish">Country Joe and the Fish</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> was among the influential groups centered in the <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco_Sound" title="San Francisco Sound">San Francisco music scene</a> during the mid to late-1960s?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Back_to_Stone" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Back to Stone">Back to Stone</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:TheGracefulSlick" title="User:TheGracefulSlick">TheGracefulSlick</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:TheGracefulSlick" title="User talk:TheGracefulSlick">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">SSTflyer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer" title="User talk:SSTflyer">talk</a>) at 08:43, 24 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Find another hook. Technically, "among" means they were standing around at a festival where other bands appeared. And refers to the unsourced sentence <span class="inline-quote-talk" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #008560;">While the band waited to record their debut album, they were present at the Human Be-In, along with other influential San Francisco musical acts including Jefferson Airplane, Big Brother and the Holding Company, and Quicksilver Messenger Service.</span> And even there, since they had not even yet recorded an album, "influential" is a POV if meant to refer to Country Joe. The lone source at the end of that paragraph does not mention influence, and is mostly Country Joe looking back at the 1960s. The article does not give any examples of their influence, but focuses on their brief recording and performing career. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 21:02, 24 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1:</b> ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Country_Joe_and_the_Fish" title="Country Joe and the Fish">Country Joe and the Fish</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> was initially formed with only <a href="/wiki/Country_Joe_McDonald" title="Country Joe McDonald">Country Joe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Barry_Melton" title="Barry Melton">The Fish</a>?<br />
<b>ALT2:</b> ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Country_Joe_and_the_Fish" title="Country Joe and the Fish">Country Joe and the Fish</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> performed "<a href="/wiki/The_%22Fish%22_Cheer/I-Feel-Like-I%27m-Fixin%27-to-Die_Rag" title="The &quot;Fish&quot; Cheer/I-Feel-Like-I'm-Fixin'-to-Die Rag">The Fish Cheer</a>" as "The <a href="/wiki/Fuck" title="Fuck">Fuck</a> Cheer" in New York City in 1968?<br />
<a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> --<a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">flyer</a></sup> 01:55, 26 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li>Note: ALT1 is best used with the image. <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">flyer</a></sup> 05:47, 1 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a>:</span> per your comment on my talk page. I was making a comment above, not doing a review. Sorry for the confusion, but you are more than welcome to do a review of this nomination. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 12:04, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Thanks for clarifying, <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">Maile66</a>. Right then, here we go, <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">SSTflyer</a>:</p>
<ul>
<li>Article was nominated within a week of its promotion to GA. It is hence more than long enough and within policy, particularly as to neutrality, use of inline citations, and (based on 7 spot checks) avoidance of close paraphrasing or other copyright issues. However:
<ul>
<li>I'd like to see a citation for the sentence "The EP fulfilled the band's ambitions to incorporate electric instruments into their music, effectively melding the instrumentals and pioneering an early template for the musical subgenre of acid rock."</li>
<li>Citation would also be desirable for "All the while, the group looked to capitalize on the momentum from Woodstock and their appearance in the film, <i>Zachariah</i>, by releasing their fifth album, <i>CJ Fish</i>, in May 1970."</li>
<li>The formatting of the citations should be standardized, particularly as some of the works cited, e.g. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Independent" title="The Independent">The Independent</a></i>, are not in italics as they should be. (This does not count against the DYK review.)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>I agree that the original hook was not sourced as well as it should have been. ALT1 and ALT2 are both strong hooks, short enough and interesting enough. I also think the image works equally well with either ALT. However:
<ul>
<li>Since "The Fish" is Barry Melton's nickname, it should be in quotation marks in the hook.</li>
<li>The sentence "The first line-up of Country Joe and the Fish formed in mid-1965, when Country Joe McDonald (vocals, acoustic guitar) and Barry "The Fish" Melton (lead guitar, vocals) came together as a duo", which substantiates ALT1, is unreferenced. I suspect the reference at the end of the following sentence is meant to cover it, and that's fine by normal Wikipedia standards, but for DYK the hook's citation must come no later than the end of the statement asserting the hook fact(s). Should be easily fixed.</li>
<li>The sentence "The song met unprecedented exposure among the band's young audience after a performance at the Schaefer Music Festival in New York City, in the summer of 1968", which substantiates ALT2, is also unreferenced. I suspect that, again, the reference at the end of the following sentence is meant to cover it. Should similarly be easily fixed.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>QPQ is done and image appears to be properly in the public domain.</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Excellent choice of nominations, SSTflyer (and excellent work on bringing the article up to GA by <a href="/wiki/User:TheGracefulSlick" title="User:TheGracefulSlick">TheGracefulSlick</a>). Once the few issues mentioned above are addressed this will be good to go. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 14:59, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<p><br /></p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_21">Articles created/expanded on September 21</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=24" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 21">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Brendan_Clouston">Brendan Clouston</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBrendan_Clouston&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brendan_Clouston&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Eilean_Aigas_House,_2010-12-16.jpg" class="image" title="Eilean Aigas House"><img alt="Eilean Aigas House" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Eilean_Aigas_House%2C_2010-12-16.jpg/120px-Eilean_Aigas_House%2C_2010-12-16.jpg" width="120" height="72" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Eilean_Aigas_House%2C_2010-12-16.jpg/180px-Eilean_Aigas_House%2C_2010-12-16.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Eilean_Aigas_House%2C_2010-12-16.jpg/240px-Eilean_Aigas_House%2C_2010-12-16.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2060" data-file-height="1228" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Eilean Aigas House</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the holder of the Scottish title Baron of Dunure is a <b><a href="/wiki/Brendan_Clouston" title="Brendan Clouston">Canadian telecoms billionaire from Montreal</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Brendan_Clouston" title="Brendan Clouston">Brendan Clouston</a></b>, his brother and father were president of three corporations, <a href="/wiki/Tele-Communications_Inc." title="Tele-Communications Inc.">Tele-Communications Inc.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sargento" title="Sargento">Sargento</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Gorton%27s_of_Gloucester" title="Gorton's of Gloucester">Gorton's of Gloucester</a> respectively?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that in 2012, "reclusive" billionaire <b><a href="/wiki/Brendan_Clouston" title="Brendan Clouston">Brendan Clouston</a></b> put up for sale his Scottish <a href="/wiki/Eilean_Aigas" title="Eilean Aigas">Eilean Aigas</a> estate <i>(pictured)</i> for £15 million, but sold it in 2015 for only £3 million?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Horace_Brodzky" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Horace Brodzky">Horace Brodzky</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Gareth_E_Kegg" title="User:Gareth E Kegg">Gareth E Kegg</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gareth_E_Kegg" title="User talk:Gareth E Kegg">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) at 17:46, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Al-Istibsar">Al-Istibsar</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAl-Istibsar&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Al-Istibsar&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Al-Istibsar" title="Al-Istibsar">Al-Istibsar</a></b> is the fourth collection of <a href="/wiki/The_Four_Books" title="The Four Books">four major works of Shiite Islamic traditions</a> authored by <a href="/wiki/Shaykh_Tusi" title="Shaykh Tusi">Shaykh Tusi</a>, a great <a href="/wiki/Shia" title="Shia" class="mw-redirect">Shia</a> scholar?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Al-Istibsar" title="Al-Istibsar">Al-Istibsar</a></b> is major works of <a href="/wiki/Shiite" title="Shiite" class="mw-redirect">Shiite</a> Islamic Tradition by great Shia scholar <a href="/wiki/Shaykh_Tusi" title="Shaykh Tusi">Shaykh Tusi</a>, summarized of his book <a href="/wiki/Tahdhib_al-Ahkam" title="Tahdhib al-Ahkam">Tahdhib al-Ahkam</a>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Saff_V." title="User:Saff V.">Saff V.</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Saff_V." title="User talk:Saff V.">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 09:54, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Expansion and length are good. Your inline citation, however, seems to say it is the third book in the collection. I'd reword the hook to say it is a "book", rather than a collection, to avoid confusion, and would also remove the word "great" as I think that's POV. Also where is you QPQ? <a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Freikorp" title="User talk:Freikorp">talk</a>) 23:22, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="1989_.28Ryan_Adams_album.29">1989 (Ryan Adams album)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F1989_%28Ryan_Adams_album%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=1989_%28Ryan_Adams_album%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Taylor_Swift" title="Taylor Swift">Taylor Swift</a> wrote the lyrics for <a href="/wiki/Ryan_Adams" title="Ryan Adams">Ryan Adams</a>' album <i><b><a href="/wiki/1989_(Ryan_Adams_album)" title="1989 (Ryan Adams album)">1989</a></b></i>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Keegan" title="User:Keegan">Keegan</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Keegan" title="User talk:Keegan">talk</a>) and <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Sendu1984&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Sendu1984 (page does not exist)">Sendu1984</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sendu1984" title="User talk:Sendu1984">talk</a>). Self-nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Keegan" title="User:Keegan">Keegan</a> at 06:40, 23 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This is a very nitpicky point, but I can't find any sources that say, definitively, that Taylor Swift wrote the lyrics for every song on the album. At the moment, you support this claim by citing the Amazon page for Ryan Adams' album, but I could not find information about authorship there. I also looked at other sources; I found some sources that credit her as a "composer" for every song on the album (see, e.g., <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.allmusic.com/album/1989-mw0002726289">this source</a>), but how do we know she didn't compose music for lyrics that were written by someone else? -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 15:23, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<li><b>ALT1</b> ... that <a href="/wiki/Milwaukee_Brewers" title="Milwaukee Brewers">Milwaukee Brewers</a>' <a href="/wiki/General_manager_(baseball)" title="General manager (baseball)">general manager</a> <b><a href="/wiki/David_Stearns" title="David Stearns">David Stearns</a></b> is younger than Brewers' <a href="/wiki/Outfielder" title="Outfielder">outfielder</a> <a href="/wiki/Ryan_Braun" title="Ryan Braun">Ryan Braun</a>?</li>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that although players can use created characters in <i><b><a href="/wiki/Sword_Art_Online:_Lost_Song" title="Sword Art Online: Lost Song">Sword Art Online: Lost Song</a></b></i>'s story mode, the story will progress as if protagonist Kirito had been used?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Don%27t_Say_You_Love_Me_(M2M_song)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Don't Say You Love Me (M2M song)">Template:Did you know nominations/Don't Say You Love Me (M2M song)</a></li>
</ul>

<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:ZappaOMati" title="User:ZappaOMati">ZappaOMati</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ZappaOMati" title="User talk:ZappaOMati">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:56, 27 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough when nominated (moved to mainspace and nominated on September 27, so should be placed in the September 27 section instead of September 22), long enough at 3465 characters, neutral and adequately sourced. Copyvios is OK apart from a false positive caused by <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://ikwiz.com/watch.asp?id=18909&amp;name=SWORD+ART+ONLINE%3A+Lost+Song+Video+Game+Reaction+PS4%2C+PS3%2C+PS+Vita+">a webpage</a> published after the article is created and is obviously a copy-and-paste of this article. The hook is neutral, interesting and short enough, but cited to a Japanese source that is AGF accepted. QPQ done. Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">✈</a> 15:54, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Lee_Ee_Hoe">Lee Ee Hoe</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLee_Ee_Hoe&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lee_Ee_Hoe&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Lee_Ee_Hoe" title="Lee Ee Hoe">Lee Ee Hoe</a></b> was conferred the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Rising_Sun" title="Order of the Rising Sun">Order of the Rising Sun</a> for his contributions to tourism between Japan and Malaysia?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Roland_Paoletti" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Roland Paoletti">Roland Paoletti</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Wendyapplenian&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Wendyapplenian (page does not exist)">Wendyapplenian</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wendyapplenian" title="User talk:Wendyapplenian">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Rainbow_unicorn" title="User:Rainbow unicorn">Rainbow unicorn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rainbow_unicorn" title="User talk:Rainbow unicorn">talk</a>) at 00:49, 24 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> File was created on 25 August, taken to mainspace on 22 September and nominated on 24 September, new enough. 2787 char long enough, no apparent copy-vio. Hook is verified and under character count. QPQ completed by nominator. Issues,</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Peacock" title="Wikipedia:Peacock" class="mw-redirect">WP:Peacock</a> need to eliminate the excess puffery, "vast experience", "wealth of knowledge", "expert", "big role", to make article more neutral.</li>
<li>Several sentences are missing in-line citations, and specifically the one claiming that he is "the first foreign recipient from the travel industry to receive this award". Sources indicate his company is, not him personally and since he has a partner, you would need to provide a source showing it was only for him or change it to reflect it is a company achievement. In any case, there is no citation provided for the claim. Also missing cites for final information in topic "Business career" and "International business ventures".<a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>) 19:09, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a>, I have edited the article to fix these issues. <a href="/wiki/User:Rainbow_unicorn" title="User:Rainbow unicorn">Rainbow unicorn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rainbow_unicorn" title="User talk:Rainbow unicorn">talk</a>) 23:47, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <a href="/wiki/User:Rainbow_unicorn" title="User:Rainbow unicorn">Rainbow unicorn</a> Thank you. After editing is now 2444 char, still meets requirements and is now neutral. In-line citations are now complete. GTG. <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>) 00:59, 20 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Tracy_Dahl">Tracy Dahl</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FTracy_Dahl&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tracy_Dahl&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Tracy_Dahl" title="Tracy Dahl">Tracy Dahl</a></b>'s voice has been described as "filled with sunshine, rainbows and laser light"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Courtney_Garrett" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Courtney Garrett">Courtney Garrett</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Smrondeau&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Smrondeau (page does not exist)">Smrondeau</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Smrondeau" title="User talk:Smrondeau">talk</a>). <dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article is new enough and long enough. It was created via "Articles for creation" and is largely neutral but a bit peacocky in places. The hook fact is well-cited and I didn't detect any policy issues. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 06:12, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I came by to promote this, noted the peacock comment, and did some copyediting on the article to bring it up to Wikipedia standards. I added several "when?" tags to clarify her debut dates. <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 00:41, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dd><a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a>, I found the date for one <a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=fOcCAAAAMBAJ&amp;printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&amp;q=%22tracy%20dahl%22&amp;f=false">[2]</a> but I couldn't find the others. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Edward_Hart_.28settler.29">Edward Hart (settler)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEdward_Hart_%28settler%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Edward_Hart_%28settler%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that although the town clerk, <b><a href="/wiki/Edward_Hart_(settler)" title="Edward Hart (settler)">Edward Hart</a></b>, wrote the <a href="/wiki/Flushing_Remonstrance" title="Flushing Remonstrance">Flushing Remonstrance</a> of 1657, no one knows who most inspired its moving appeal for freedom of conscience in colonial New Netherland.</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Delabrede" title="User:Delabrede">Delabrede</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Delabrede" title="User talk:Delabrede">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 19:10, 22 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLizzie_Halliday&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lizzie_Halliday_(Eliza_Margaret_McNally).png" class="image" title="Lizzie Halliday"><img alt="Lizzie Halliday" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Lizzie_Halliday_%28Eliza_Margaret_McNally%29.png/120px-Lizzie_Halliday_%28Eliza_Margaret_McNally%29.png" width="120" height="196" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Lizzie_Halliday_%28Eliza_Margaret_McNally%29.png/180px-Lizzie_Halliday_%28Eliza_Margaret_McNally%29.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Lizzie_Halliday_%28Eliza_Margaret_McNally%29.png/240px-Lizzie_Halliday_%28Eliza_Margaret_McNally%29.png 2x" data-file-width="467" data-file-height="762" /></a>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FScaptotrigona_postica&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Scaptotrigona_postica" title="Scaptotrigona postica">Scaptotrigona postica</a></b></i> workers can trace the scent markers of workers from other colonies in order to find food sources?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Mira.tbaum" title="User:Mira.tbaum">Mira.tbaum</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mira.tbaum" title="User talk:Mira.tbaum">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 04:01, 2 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Lenuzzi.27s_Horseshoe">Lenuzzi's Horseshoe</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLenuzzi%27s_Horseshoe&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lenuzzi%27s_Horseshoe&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Donji_grad" title="Donji grad">city centre</a> of <a href="/wiki/Zagreb" title="Zagreb">Zagreb</a>, <a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">Croatia</a> is home to <b><a href="/wiki/Lenuci%27s_Horseshoe" title="Lenuci's Horseshoe" class="mw-redirect">a horseshoe of parks</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Open to better hook ideas. I have four DYK credits (<i><a href="/wiki/L.A._Takedown" title="L.A. Takedown">L.A. Takedown</a></i>, <a href="/wiki/Croatian_Natural_History_Museum" title="Croatian Natural History Museum">Croatian Natural History Museum</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vrtare_Male" title="Vrtare Male">Vrtare Male</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ferdinand_Budicki" title="Ferdinand Budicki">Ferdinand Budicki</a>), so I gather I'm exempt from QPQ.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFireweed_Studio&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fireweed_Studio&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fireweed_Studio,_Yellowknife,_NT.jpg" class="image" title="Front view of cabin, 2015"><img alt="Front view of cabin, 2015" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Fireweed_Studio%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/120px-Fireweed_Studio%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg" width="120" height="86" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Fireweed_Studio%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/180px-Fireweed_Studio%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Fireweed_Studio%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg/240px-Fireweed_Studio%2C_Yellowknife%2C_NT.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5286" data-file-height="3810" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Front view of cabin, 2015</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that contrary to what its interpretive plaque says, the <b><a href="/wiki/Fireweed_Studio" title="Fireweed Studio">Fireweed Studio</a></b> (<i>pictured</i>) <a href="/wiki/Log_cabin" title="Log cabin">log cabin</a> in <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a> was never used as a <a href="/wiki/Blacksmith" title="Blacksmith">blacksmith</a>'s shop?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Mawza_Exile" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Mawza Exile">Mawza Exile</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Santa_Maria_in_Turri">Santa Maria in Turri</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSanta_Maria_in_Turri&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Santa_Maria_in_Turri&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Canon_(priest)" title="Canon (priest)">canons</a> of <a href="/wiki/Old_St._Peter%27s_Basilica" title="Old St. Peter's Basilica">the old St. Peter's Basilica</a> would meet the <a href="/wiki/Holy_Roman_Emperor" title="Holy Roman Emperor">Holy Roman Emperor</a> at the church <b><a href="/wiki/Santa_Maria_in_Turri" title="Santa Maria in Turri">Santa Maria in Turri</a></b> and greet him "as a brother"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Thomas_Bell_(antiquarian)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Thomas Bell (antiquarian)">Thomas Bell (antiquarian)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Alekjds" title="User:Alekjds">Alekjds</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Alekjds" title="User talk:Alekjds">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 08:51, 23 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This interesting article is new enough and long enough. The hook fact is accepted in good faith. It, and most of the rest of the article, is sourced to an Italian language book which I inspected but lacked skills to understand. The article is neutral but I could not judge whether there were any copyright issues. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 05:21, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_24">Articles created/expanded on September 24</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=27" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 24">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Mercedes_Gleitze">Mercedes Gleitze</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMercedes_Gleitze&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mercedes_Gleitze&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Mercedes_Gleitze" title="Mercedes Gleitze">first British woman to swim the English Channel</a></b> used swimming and singing to found the Mercedes Gleintz Homes?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Punishment_of_Lust">The Punishment of Lust</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Punishment_of_Lust&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Punishment_of_Lust&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg" class="image" title="The Punishment of Lust, 1891"><img alt="The Punishment of Lust, 1891" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg/120px-Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg" width="120" height="68" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg/180px-Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg/240px-Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2993" data-file-height="1702" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i>The Punishment of Lust</i>, 1891</div>
</div>
<div class="floatright">
<div style="width: 100px; height: 100px; overflow: hidden;">
<div style="position: relative; top: -90px; left: -100px; width: 400px"><a href="/wiki/File:Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Giovanni Segantini - The Punishment of Lust - Google Art Project.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg/400px-Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg" width="400" height="227" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg/600px-Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg/800px-Giovanni_Segantini_-_The_Punishment_of_Lust_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2993" data-file-height="1702" /></a></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the Walker Art Gallery changed the name of Giovanni Segantini's painting <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Punishment_of_Lust" title="The Punishment of Lust">The Punishment of Lust</a></b></i> (<i>pictured</i>) to avoid offending the Victorian public?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:<s>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Punishment_of_Lust" title="The Punishment of Lust">The Punishment of Lust</a></b> is to float around in the Alps?</i></s></li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/List_of_accolades_received_by_Blue_Is_the_Warmest_Colour" title="Template:Did you know nominations/List of accolades received by Blue Is the Warmest Colour">List of accolades received by Blue Is the Warmest Colour</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: The image is a bit pathetic at DYK size, don't you think? But it really needs some image unless we go with the second hook, so I've given a mysterious cropped detail.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 13:39, 25 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Interesting topic, on good sources. I am afraid I like the complete image better than the crop. It should be pictured! In the description, does everybody know "in limbo"? "the inclusion of withered trees symbolises" - can you include who says so? I like the original hook, giving a feeling for time and taste. Can you get a bit more of "The mysterious atmosphere set by the painting is in line with the painter's metaphysical views about the connection between human and natural life." in the article? <small><span class="autosigned">—&#160;Preceding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Signatures" title="Wikipedia:Signatures">unsigned</a> comment added by <a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a> • <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Gerda_Arendt" title="Special:Contributions/Gerda Arendt">contribs</a>) 10:34, 07 October 2015 (UTC)</span></small></dd>
</dl>

<dd>Thanks for cleaning up after me, Mandarax, --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 09:10, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_26">Articles created/expanded on September 26</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=29" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 26">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Picturesque_Palestine.2C_Sinai.2C_and_Egypt">Picturesque Palestine, Sinai, and Egypt</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPicturesque_Palestine%2C_Sinai%2C_and_Egypt&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Sinai%2C_and_Egypt&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg" class="image" title="The cave under the Dome of the Rock, from Picturesque Palestine"><img alt="The cave under the Dome of the Rock, from Picturesque Palestine" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg/120px-Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg" width="120" height="95" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg/180px-Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg/240px-Jerusalem_dome_of_rock_2_1880.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4920" data-file-height="3896" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">The cave under the <a href="/wiki/Dome_of_the_Rock" title="Dome of the Rock">Dome of the Rock</a>, from <i><a href="/wiki/Picturesque_Palestine" title="Picturesque Palestine" class="mw-redirect">Picturesque Palestine</a></i></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i>Social Life in Egypt</i>, an 1884 supplement to <i><b><a href="/wiki/Picturesque_Palestine" title="Picturesque Palestine" class="mw-redirect">Picturesque Palestine</a></b></i>, argued that poor treatment of women was Egypt's primary stumbling block in modernizing itself?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Charles_William_Wilson" title="Charles William Wilson">Sir Charles Wilson</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, <a href="/wiki/Royal_Engineer" title="Royal Engineer" class="mw-redirect">Royal Engineer</a> and editor of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Picturesque_Palestine" title="Picturesque Palestine" class="mw-redirect">Picturesque Palestine</a></b></i>, undertook his studies of <a href="/wiki/Jerusalem" title="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Levant" title="Levant">Levant</a> for <a href="/wiki/British_Intelligence_Department" title="British Intelligence Department" class="mw-redirect">British intelligence</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Harry_Fenn" title="Harry Fenn">Harry Fenn</a> and <a href="/wiki/J.D._Woodward_(artist)" title="J.D. Woodward (artist)" class="mw-redirect">J.D. Woodward</a>, the artists for <i><b><a href="/wiki/Picturesque_Palestine" title="Picturesque Palestine" class="mw-redirect">Picturesque Palestine</a></b></i> <i>(pictured)</i>, earned <span class="nowrap">$10 000</span> a year each in royalties from the phenomenally popular series?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that the illustrations for <i><b><a href="/wiki/Picturesque_Palestine" title="Picturesque Palestine" class="mw-redirect">Picturesque Palestine</a></b></i> <i>(pictured)</i> were engraved from sketches and watercolors composed on site in the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Syria" title="Ottoman Syria">Ottoman Empire</a> and <a href="/wiki/Khedivate_of_Egypt" title="Khedivate of Egypt">Khedivate of Egypt</a> in the late 1870s?</li>
<li><b>ALT4</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Harry_Fenn" title="Harry Fenn">Harry Fenn</a> and <a href="/wiki/J.D._Woodward_(artist)" title="J.D. Woodward (artist)" class="mw-redirect">J.D. Woodward</a>, the artists for <i><b><a href="/wiki/Picturesque_Palestine" title="Picturesque Palestine" class="mw-redirect">Picturesque Palestine</a></b></i>, received special permission to sketch within and beneath <i>(pictured)</i> the <a href="/wiki/Dome_of_the_Rock" title="Dome of the Rock">Dome of the Rock</a> in <a href="/wiki/Jerusalem" title="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Xiaoxing_Xi" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Xiaoxing Xi">Professor X</a></li>
<li><i>Notes</i>: Pic for OP: <a href="/wiki/File:Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Social Life in Egypt.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg/15px-Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg" width="15" height="21" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg/23px-Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg/30px-Social_Life_in_Egypt.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2462" data-file-height="3424" /></a>. Pic for ALT1: <a href="/wiki/File:Charles_William_Wilson.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Charles William Wilson.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Charles_William_Wilson.jpg/15px-Charles_William_Wilson.jpg" width="15" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Charles_William_Wilson.jpg/23px-Charles_William_Wilson.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Charles_William_Wilson.jpg/30px-Charles_William_Wilson.jpg 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="1024" /></a>. Pic for ALT2 &amp; ALT3: <a href="/wiki/File:Picturesque_Palestine,_Division_I.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Picturesque Palestine, Division I.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Division_I.jpg/15px-Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Division_I.jpg" width="15" height="21" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Division_I.jpg/23px-Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Division_I.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Division_I.jpg/30px-Picturesque_Palestine%2C_Division_I.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3527" data-file-height="4869" /></a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Referendums_in_the_Netherlands">Referendums in the Netherlands</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FReferendums_in_the_Netherlands&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... <s>that the Election Council will decide on 14 October whether the <a href="/wiki/Ukraine%E2%80%93European_Union_Association_Agreement" title="Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement">Ukraine–EU Association Agreement</a> will be subject to a <b><a href="/wiki/Referendums_in_the_Netherlands" title="Referendums in the Netherlands">a referendum in the Netherlands</a></b></s>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <a href="/wiki/Ukraine%E2%80%93European_Union_Association_Agreement" title="Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement">Ukraine–EU Association Agreement</a> will be subject to <b><a href="/wiki/Referendums_in_the_Netherlands" title="Referendums in the Netherlands">a referendum in the Netherlands</a></b>?</li>

</ul>
</dd>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

</ul>
</div>
<ul>

</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that "<b><a href="/wiki/Bad_Timing_(Adventure_Time)" title="Bad Timing (Adventure Time)">Bad Timing</a></b>", an <i><a href="/wiki/Adventure_Time" title="Adventure Time">Adventure Time</a></i> episode, is visually framed to have its main action occur in the center, while polygonal creatures comprise the outer margins?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that "<b><a href="/wiki/Bad_Timing_(Adventure_Time)" title="Bad Timing (Adventure Time)">Bad Timing</a></b>" was called the <i>pièce de résistance</i> of <i><a href="/wiki/Adventure_Time" title="Adventure Time">Adventure Time</a></i>?</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Yusuf_al-.27Azma">Yusuf al-'Azma</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FYusuf_al-%27Azma&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Yusuf_al-%27Azma&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg" class="image" title="Portrait of Yusuf al-Azma, 1920"><img alt="Portrait of Yusuf al-Azma, 1920" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg/120px-Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg" width="120" height="148" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg/180px-Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg/240px-Yusuf_Al_Azma.jpg 2x" data-file-width="365" data-file-height="450" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Portrait of Yusuf al-Azma, 1920</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Yusuf_al-Azma" title="Yusuf al-Azma" class="mw-redirect">Yusuf al-Azma</a>'</b>s (<i>pictured</i>) death confronting the <a href="/wiki/Army_of_the_Levant" title="Army of the Levant">French Army</a>'s push towards <a href="/wiki/Damascus" title="Damascus">Damascus</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Maysalun" title="Battle of Maysalun">Battle of Maysalun</a> made him a national hero in <a href="/wiki/Syria" title="Syria">Syria</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Arab_world" title="Arab world">Arab world</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Jordan_Sibert" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Jordan Sibert">Jordan Sibert</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Province_of_Reggio_Calabria">Province of Reggio Calabria</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FProvince_of_Reggio_Calabria&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that a project to provide employment in the <b><a href="/wiki/Province_of_Reggio_Calabria" title="Province of Reggio Calabria">Province of Reggio Calabria</a></b> failed because the price of steel collapsed?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Qiu_Yanpeng" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Qiu Yanpeng">Qiu Yanpeng</a></li>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Another good article. Lots of good quality refeencing. Hook is fine and checks out to on line source. No picture offered. Its neutral. I did spot an identical (and relevant!) short para to <a href="/wiki/Province_of_Catanzaro" title="Province of Catanzaro">Province of Catanzaro</a> (2nd para in history) which was surprising and I couldn't see the acknowledgement (required I'm told even if its your text). This is only four lines so it should not compromise the 5x expansion which still looks credible. However I don't currently have access to the official tool. Could someone check the expansion for me after setting aside the short para mentioned above? Thanks for this <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 15:54, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Red_Throne">The Red Throne</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Red_Throne&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Red_Throne&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Roddy_Piper" title="Roddy Piper">Roddy Piper</a> and <a href="/wiki/Keith_David" title="Keith David">Keith David</a>, who throw punches at each other in <i><a href="/wiki/They_Live" title="They Live">They Live</a></i> (1988), provided their voices for "<b><a href="/wiki/The_Red_Throne" title="The Red Throne">The Red Throne</a></b>" in which their characters engage in a similar fight?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the combat sequence in <i><a href="/wiki/They_Live" title="They Live">They Live</a></i>, starring <a href="/wiki/Roddy_Piper" title="Roddy Piper">Roddy Piper</a> and <a href="/wiki/Keith_David" title="Keith David">Keith David</a>, is parodied in "<b><a href="/wiki/The_Red_Throne" title="The Red Throne">The Red Throne</a></b>" to which both actors lent their voices?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/VT1000" title="Template:Did you know nominations/VT1000">VT1000</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> all systems go (sorry I missed this) <a href="/wiki/User:Casliber" title="User:Casliber">Cas Liber</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Casliber" title="User talk:Casliber">talk</a> <b>·</b> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Casliber" title="Special:Contributions/Casliber">contribs</a>) 11:10, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="List_of_Padma_Bhushan_Award_recipients_.281954.E2.80.931959.29">List of Padma Bhushan Award recipients (1954–1959)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FList_of_Padma_Bhushan_Award_recipients_%281954%E2%80%931959%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_Padma_Bhushan_Award_recipients_%281954%E2%80%931959%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg" class="image" title="Homi Jehangir Bhabha"><img alt="Homi Jehangir Bhabha" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg/120px-Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg" width="120" height="169" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg/180px-Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg/240px-Homi_Jehangir_Bhabha_1960s.jpg 2x" data-file-width="664" data-file-height="936" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Homi Jehangir Bhabha</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Padma Bhushan, India's third highest civilian award, was instituted in 1954, and the "father of Indian bomb" <i>(pictured)</i> was one of its <b><a href="/wiki/List_of_Padma_Bhushan_Award_recipients_(1954%E2%80%931959)" title="List of Padma Bhushan Award recipients (1954–1959)">first recipients</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/High_diving" title="Template:Did you know nominations/High diving">High diving</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Would be nice to get promoted on 30 October, Homi Jehangir Bhabha's 106th birthday</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Vivvt" title="User:Vivvt">Vivvt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Vivvt" title="User talk:Vivvt">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 19:13, 26 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've tweaked the hook slightly, in the interests of concision. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 11:55, 30 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Abandoned_mine_drainage">Abandoned mine drainage</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAbandoned_mine_drainage&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Abandoned_mine_drainage&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG" class="image" title="A creek impacted by abandoned mine drainage"><img alt="A creek impacted by abandoned mine drainage" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG/120px-Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG" width="120" height="180" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG/180px-Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG/240px-Shamokin_Creek_looking_downstream_at_Millers_Run.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2056" data-file-height="3088" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">A creek impacted by abandoned mine drainage</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Abandoned_mine_drainage" title="Abandoned mine drainage">abandoned mine drainage</a></b> <i>(effects pictured)</i> has been used in <a href="/wiki/Hydraulic_fracturing" title="Hydraulic fracturing">hydraulic fracturing</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Abandoned_mine_drainage" title="Abandoned mine drainage">abandoned mine drainage</a></b> <i>(effects pictured)</i> is sometimes called "acid mine drainage" even though it is not always acidic?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Abandoned_mine_drainage" title="Abandoned mine drainage">abandoned mine drainage</a></b> <i>(effects pictured)</i> has been used in <a href="/wiki/Hydraulic_fracturing" title="Hydraulic fracturing">hydraulic fracturing</a> and shows potential in capturing mercury emissions from coal-fired power plants?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Abandoned_mine_drainage" title="Abandoned mine drainage">abandoned mine drainage</a></b> <i>(effects pictured)</i> impacts thousands of miles of streams in the eastern United States?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/The_Dominican_Convent,_Ilanz" title="Template:Did you know nominations/The Dominican Convent, Ilanz">Template:Did you know nominations/The Dominican Convent, Ilanz</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I could also swap in <a href="/wiki/File:Quaker_Run_looking_downstream.JPG" title="File:Quaker Run looking downstream.JPG">this picture</a> or <a href="/wiki/File:Coal_Run_looking_downstream.JPG" title="File:Coal Run looking downstream.JPG">this one</a> (the latter one is a Commons VI)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Bombus_hyperboreus_2">Bombus hyperboreus</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBombus_Hyperboreus&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Megxb" title="User:Megxb">Megxb</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Megxb" title="User talk:Megxb">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:50, 1 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

I may be missing something obvious here, but I cannot find the hook fact mentioned in the article. <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">✈</a> 09:58, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
