<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Haute-Loire">Haute-Loire</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FHaute-Loire&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Haute-Loire&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Haute-Loire" title="Haute-Loire">Haute-Loire</a></b> was the birthplace of <a href="/wiki/Claude-Jean_Allouez" title="Claude-Jean Allouez">Claude-Jean Allouez</a>, seventeenth century missionary and explorer in North America?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/James_Johnston_(missionary)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/James Johnston (missionary)">James Johnston (missionary)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 05:42, 1 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Scott_Duncan_.28referee.29">Scott Duncan (referee)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FScott_Duncan_%28referee%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Scott_Duncan_%28referee%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG" class="image" title="Duncan refereeing in 2014"><img alt="Duncan refereeing in 2014" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f8/Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG/120px-Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG" width="120" height="200" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f8/Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG/180px-Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f8/Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG/240px-Scott_Duncan_12-04-2014_1.JPG 2x" data-file-width="930" data-file-height="1547" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Duncan refereeing in 2014</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that English <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> <a href="/wiki/Referee_(association_football)" title="Referee (association football)">referee</a> <b><a href="/wiki/Scott_Duncan_(referee)" title="Scott Duncan (referee)">Scott Duncan</a></b> officiated a <a href="/wiki/Football_League_Two_play-offs" title="Football League Two play-offs">League Two play-off</a> match between <a href="/wiki/Fleetwood_Town_F.C." title="Fleetwood Town F.C.">Fleetwood Town</a> and <a href="/wiki/York_City_F.C." title="York City F.C.">York City</a> at <a href="/wiki/Highbury_Stadium_(Fleetwood)" title="Highbury Stadium (Fleetwood)">Highbury Stadium</a> on 16 May 2014?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Fukushi_Masaichi" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Fukushi Masaichi">Fukushi Masaichi</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Mattythewhite" title="User:Mattythewhite">Mattythewhite</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mattythewhite" title="User talk:Mattythewhite">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:20, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Dull hook. Everyone has to start their career somehow, somewhere. Unless there's something interesting about this particular match. <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>) 21:44, 30 September 2015 (UTC)</li>

</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Music_of_Ni_no_Kuni">Music of Ni no Kuni</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMusic_of_Ni_no_Kuni&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Music_of_Ni_no_Kuni&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG" class="image" title="Joe Hisaishi"><img alt="Joe Hisaishi" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG/120px-Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG" width="120" height="160" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG/180px-Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG/240px-Joe_Hisaishi_in_Krakow.JPG 2x" data-file-width="3000" data-file-height="4000" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Joe Hisaishi</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Music_of_Ni_no_Kuni" title="Music of Ni no Kuni">music of <i>Ni no Kuni</i></a></b> was composed by Joe Hisaishi <i>(pictured)</i>, known for his previous work on <i><a href="/wiki/Princess_Mononoke" title="Princess Mononoke">Princess Mononoke</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Spirited_Away" title="Spirited Away">Spirited Away</a></i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <i><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn" title="Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn">Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn</a></i> was shipped on a 4-gigabit <a href="/wiki/Nintendo_game_card" title="Nintendo game card">game card</a>, in order to fit the <b><a href="/wiki/Music_of_Ni_no_Kuni" title="Music of Ni no Kuni">orchestral music</a>?</b></li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Joe_Hisaishi" title="Joe Hisaishi">Joe Hisaishi</a> <i>(pictured)</i> wrote the <b><a href="/wiki/Music_of_Ni_no_Kuni" title="Music of Ni no Kuni">music of <i>Ni no Kuni</i></a></b> in seven days?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Until_Dawn" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Until Dawn">Until Dawn</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Rhain1999" title="User:Rhain1999">Rhain1999</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rhain1999" title="User talk:Rhain1999">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 02:08, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ni_no_Kuni:_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn.2C_Ni_no_Kuni:_Wrath_of_the_White_Witch">Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn, Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNi_no_Kuni%3A_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ni_no_Kuni%3A_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn&amp;action=history">Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ni_no_Kuni%3A_Wrath_of_the_White_Witch&amp;action=history">Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Japanese animation film company <a href="/wiki/Studio_Ghibli" title="Studio Ghibli">Studio Ghibli</a> produced the animated sequences for the video games <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn" title="Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn">Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn</a></b></i> and <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Wrath_of_the_White_Witch" title="Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch">Wrath of the White Witch</a></b></i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Wrath_of_the_White_Witch" title="Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch">Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch</a></b></i> is an enhanced version of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn" title="Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn">Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn</a></b></i>, featuring significantly different artwork, graphics and specifications?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Wrath_of_the_White_Witch" title="Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch">Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch</a></b></i> was developed for the <a href="/wiki/PlayStation_3" title="PlayStation 3">PlayStation 3</a>, which allowed for advanced rendering not possible in <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni:_Dominion_of_the_Dark_Djinn" title="Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn">Ni no Kuni: Dominion of the Dark Djinn</a></b></i>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Untitled_Cullen_brothers_film" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Untitled Cullen brothers film">Untitled Cullen brothers film</a>, <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Avalanche_Studios" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Avalanche Studios">Avalanche Studios</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Converted from a redirect by <a href="/wiki/User:Rhain1999" title="User:Rhain1999">Rhain1999</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rhain1999" title="User talk:Rhain1999">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 02:02, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Articles is recently converted from redirects, and is new enough, easily long enough, and neutral. The hook is interesting, long enough, and supported by reliable sources. Personally prefer ALT1 and ALT2 (never heard of <i>Dominion of the Dark Djinn</i> before actually). QPQ done. Well done. <a href="/wiki/User:AdrianGamer" title="User:AdrianGamer">AdrianGamer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:AdrianGamer" title="User talk:AdrianGamer">talk</a>) 03:10, 28 September 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="George_Givot">George Givot</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FGeorge_Givot&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=George_Givot&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that when <b><a href="/wiki/George_Givot" title="George Givot">George Givot</a></b> played <a href="/wiki/Mae_West" title="Mae West">Mae West</a>'s character's black lover in the 1931 <a href="/wiki/Broadway_theatre" title="Broadway theatre">Broadway</a> play <i>The Constant Sinner</i>, producers had him remove his wig after each performance to show the audience he was white?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that when <b><a href="/wiki/George_Givot" title="George Givot">George Givot</a></b> played <a href="/wiki/Mae_West" title="Mae West">Mae West</a>'s character's lover in <a href="/wiki/Blackface" title="Blackface">blackface</a> in the 1931 <a href="/wiki/Broadway_theatre" title="Broadway theatre">Broadway</a> play <i>The Constant Sinner</i>, producers had him remove his wig after each performance to show patrons he was white?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/HMS_Trial_(1744)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/HMS Trial (1744)">HMS Trial (1744)</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: The Afd has been withdrawn by the nominator.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Clarityfiend" title="User:Clarityfiend">Clarityfiend</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clarityfiend" title="User talk:Clarityfiend">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:11, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I think the hooks would be less cumbersome, and the meaning would be unaffected, if you removed "character's". <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 10:29, 30 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>It's also one way to make sure the hooks are not over the DYK maximum of 200, since they are currently 202 and 204 characters, respectively, and thus too long. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 21:59, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I thought that "that" wasn't counted. Anyhoo, I'd rather just delete the play title instead.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd><b>ALT2</b>: "... that when <b><a href="/wiki/George_Givot" title="George Givot">George Givot</a></b> played <a href="/wiki/Mae_West" title="Mae West">Mae West</a>'s character's lover in <a href="/wiki/Blackface" title="Blackface">blackface</a> in a 1931 <a href="/wiki/Broadway_theatre" title="Broadway theatre">Broadway</a> play, producers had him remove his wig after each performance to show patrons he was white?" <a href="/wiki/User:Clarityfiend" title="User:Clarityfiend">Clarityfiend</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clarityfiend" title="User talk:Clarityfiend">talk</a>) 01:12, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_28">Articles created/expanded on September 28</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=31" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 28">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Internet_and_cats">The Internet and cats</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Internet_and_cats&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Internet_and_cats&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that although <b><a href="/wiki/The_Internet_and_cats" title="The Internet and cats" class="mw-redirect">cats have an unprecedented popularity on the internet</a></b>, no one is entirely sure why?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that CNN estimated there were about the same number of <b><a href="/wiki/The_Internet_and_cats" title="The Internet and cats" class="mw-redirect">cat pictures on the internet</a></b> as living humans on earth?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that in 2015, the "How <b><a href="/wiki/The_Internet_and_cats" title="The Internet and cats" class="mw-redirect">Cats Took Over The Internet</a></b>" exhibit opened at the Museum of the Moving Image in New York?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that the annual <b><a href="/wiki/The_Internet_and_cats" title="The Internet and cats" class="mw-redirect">Internet Cat</a></b> Video Festival celebrated and awards the Golden Kitty to cat videos?</li>
<li><b>ALT4</b>:... that Tim Berners-Lee was surprised to discover <b><a href="/wiki/The_Internet_and_cats" title="The Internet and cats" class="mw-redirect">his invention being widely used for kitten content</a></b>?</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Those are just some random ideas for the tagline. You guys can probably come up with something better. We are no where near searching every notable source for all its juicy information, so I'm sure we'll uncover some more exciting facts soon. Also, feel free to drop by and hit the edit button if this topic appeals to you.&#160;:)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:GliderMaven" title="User:GliderMaven">GliderMaven</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GliderMaven" title="User talk:GliderMaven">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:Coin945" title="User:Coin945">Coin945</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Coin945" title="User talk:Coin945">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:McGeddon" title="User:McGeddon" class="mw-redirect">McGeddon</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:McGeddon" title="User talk:McGeddon">talk</a>), and <a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">Northamerica1000</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Northamerica1000" title="User talk:Northamerica1000">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Coin945" title="User:Coin945">Coin945</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Coin945" title="User talk:Coin945">talk</a>) at 13:53, 5 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Khumarawayh_ibn_Ahmad_ibn_Tulun">Khumarawayh ibn Ahmad ibn Tulun</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FKhumarawayh_ibn_Ahmad_ibn_Tulun&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Khumarawayh_ibn_Ahmad_ibn_Tulun&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Khumarawayh_ibn_Ahmad_ibn_Tulun" title="Khumarawayh ibn Ahmad ibn Tulun">Khumarawayh ibn Ahmad ibn Tulun</a></b>, the second <a href="/wiki/Tulunid" title="Tulunid" class="mw-redirect">Tulunid</a> ruler, reportedly lay on air-filled cushions floating on a basin filled with <a href="/wiki/Mercury_(element)" title="Mercury (element)">quicksilver</a> to be rocked to sleep?</li>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Khumarawayh_ibn_Ahmad_ibn_Tulun" title="Khumarawayh ibn Ahmad ibn Tulun">Khumarawayh ibn Ahmad ibn Tulun</a></b>, the second <a href="/wiki/Tulunid" title="Tulunid" class="mw-redirect">Tulunid</a> ruler, was so profligate that in the twelve years of his reign, he managed to squander the ten million <a href="/wiki/Gold_dinar" title="Gold dinar">gold dinars</a> left to him by his father?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Barrage_Vauban" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Barrage Vauban">Barrage Vauban</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Horace_Brodzky">Horace Brodzky</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FHorace_Brodzky&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Horace_Brodzky&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska,_1913_(Tate_Gallery).jpg" class="image" title="Horace Brodzky"><img alt="Horace Brodzky" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska%2C_1913_%28Tate_Gallery%29.jpg/120px-Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska%2C_1913_%28Tate_Gallery%29.jpg" width="120" height="160" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska%2C_1913_%28Tate_Gallery%29.jpg/180px-Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska%2C_1913_%28Tate_Gallery%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska%2C_1913_%28Tate_Gallery%29.jpg/240px-Portrait_bust_of_Horace_Brodzky_by_Gaudier-Brzeska%2C_1913_%28Tate_Gallery%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="1200" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Horace Brodzky</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Henri_Gaudier-Brzeska" title="Henri Gaudier-Brzeska">Henri Gaudier-Brzeska</a> created a <a href="/wiki/Portrait_bust" title="Portrait bust" class="mw-redirect">portrait bust</a> of his friend <b><a href="/wiki/Horace_Brodzky" title="Horace Brodzky">Horace Brodzky</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Bowman_Creek" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Bowman Creek">Bowman Creek</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Smerus" title="User:Smerus">Smerus</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Smerus" title="User talk:Smerus">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 15:53, 28 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough. Long enough. QPQ done. NPOV. <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:AGF" title="Wikipedia:AGF" class="mw-redirect">WP:AGF</a> on the citations, as none are available online. Nonetheless, the hook fact needs a citation at the end of the article sentence in which it appears. I have confirmed the hook fact to be correct from the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.tate.org.uk/art/artworks/gaudier-brzeska-horace-brodzky-t00129/text-catalogue-entry">Tate catalogue entry</a> for the bronze bust itself. Not possible to confirm that the article is free of close paraphrasing issues, copyright violations and plagiarism, but the creator has a good track record. Last para needs a cite. Hook is good enough. In my view, the article would look better with headings! <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 18:05, 28 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Thanks for this. I have put in some headings, and a ref for the last para (not I think strictly needed for DYK). Can I point out that, in fact, <i>all</i> the citations are online without subscription requirements, and links are given, so checking should be straightforward. The hook fact was substantiated by the citation at the end of the paragraph, but I have now repeated this at the end of the relevant phrase. I hope this may be sufficient for you to consider the article OK for DYK. Best, --<a href="/wiki/User:Smerus" title="User:Smerus">Smerus</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Smerus" title="User talk:Smerus">talk</a>) 18:17, 28 September 2015 (UTC)</li>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVal-d%27Oise&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Val-d%27Oise&amp;action=history">Val-d'Oise</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/L%27Isle-Adam,_Val-d%27Oise" title="L'Isle-Adam, Val-d'Oise">L'Isle-Adam</a></b> is a picturesque town with a beach beside the <a href="/wiki/Oise_(river)" title="Oise (river)">River Oise</a> in <b><a href="/wiki/Val-d%27Oise" title="Val-d'Oise">Val-d'Oise</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/L%27Isle-Adam,_Val-d%27Oise" title="L'Isle-Adam, Val-d'Oise">L'Isle-Adam</a></b> is a commune beside the <a href="/wiki/Oise_(river)" title="Oise (river)">River Oise</a> in <b><a href="/wiki/Val-d%27Oise" title="Val-d'Oise">Val-d'Oise</a></b>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Mus%C3%A9e_d%27art_moderne_(Saint-%C3%89tienne)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Musée d'art moderne (Saint-Étienne)">Musée d'art moderne (Saint-Étienne)</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Also reviewed <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Lhasa_(prefecture-level_city)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Lhasa (prefecture-level city)">Template:Did you know nominations/Lhasa (prefecture-level city)</a>. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Huawei_Watch">Huawei Watch</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FHuawei_Watch&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Huawei_Watch&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Huawei_Watch" title="Huawei Watch">Huawei Watch</a></b> is the first smartwatch of Huawei?</li>
<li><b>ALT1</b> ... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Huawei_Watch" title="Huawei Watch">Huawei Watch</a></b> is the company's first smartwatch?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Shwangtianyuan" title="User:Shwangtianyuan">Shwangtianyuan</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Shwangtianyuan" title="User talk:Shwangtianyuan">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 02:51, 29 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Length, newness, hook verified. There is limited close paraphrasing in the following text which has to be modified:
<blockquote class="toccolours" style="float:none; display:table;">
<div style="padding: 10px 15px 10px 15px;"><i><b>It's powered by a 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor with 512MB of RAM and 4GB of internal storage. Sensors include a gyroscope, accelerometer, vibration motor, and heart rate sensor. The Huawei Watch is made of 316L stainless steel with sapphire crystal glass on front.</b></i> ...There is wireless support for WiFi and Bluetooth 4.1 LE, <i><b>but there is no GPS receiver for run tracking or mapping without a smartphone connection.</b></i></div>
</blockquote>
</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_September_30">Articles created/expanded on September 30</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=33" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on September 30">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Province_of_Tarragona">Province of Tarragona</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FProvince_of_Tarragona&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Province_of_Tarragona&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg" class="image" title="Les Ferreres Aqueduct"><img alt="Les Ferreres Aqueduct" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg/120px-Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg" width="120" height="77" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg/180px-Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg/240px-Roman_aqueduct_Tarragona.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1092" data-file-height="699" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Les Ferreres Aqueduct</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Les_Ferreres_Aqueduct" title="Les Ferreres Aqueduct">Les Ferreres Aqueduct</a>, built in Roman times in the <b><a href="/wiki/Province_of_Tarragona" title="Province of Tarragona">Province of Tarragona</a></b>, is part of a <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Site</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Lasioglossum_figueresi" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Lasioglossum figueresi">Lasioglossum figueresi</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:47, 4 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> 5x expansion checks. QPQ checks. Image has appropriate licensing for the main page. I'm not seeing anything in the inline citation though that it has "been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2000." <a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Freikorp" title="User talk:Freikorp">talk</a>) 23:47, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a>:</span> I have added an extra reference. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 07:31, 8 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Hi. The new source certainly confirms that the Archaeological Ensemble of Tarraco is world heritage listed, and I understand the <a href="/wiki/Les_Ferreres_Aqueduct" title="Les Ferreres Aqueduct">Les Ferreres Aqueduct</a> is part of the Archaeological Ensemble of Tarraco, but the source doesn't seem to mention the 'Les Ferreres Aqueduct' at all, while your hook does. Even though it's clear that your hook is correct, I'm not sure if we're allowed to make a leap like that, however, i'll mark it as good to go and see what the closer had to say. <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a>. <a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Freikorp" title="User talk:Freikorp">talk</a>) 12:21, 8 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a>:</span> OK, I have found a better link that does mention the aqueduct. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 13:33, 8 October 2015 (UTC)

<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Definitely good to go now.&#160;:) <a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Freikorp" title="User talk:Freikorp">talk</a>) 14:17, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="National_Socialist_Workers.27_Party_of_Norway">National Socialist Workers' Party of Norway</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNational_Socialist_Workers%27_Party_of_Norway&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=National_Socialist_Workers%27_Party_of_Norway&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that a surge of activity in the <b><a href="/wiki/National_Socialist_Workers%27_Party_of_Norway" title="National Socialist Workers' Party of Norway">National Socialist Workers' Party of Norway</a> (NNSAP)</b> was used as pressure against <a href="/wiki/Vidkun_Quisling" title="Vidkun Quisling">Vidkun Quisling</a> to form <a href="/wiki/Nasjonal_Samling" title="Nasjonal Samling">Nasjonal Samling</a>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:User2534" title="User:User2534">User2534</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:User2534" title="User talk:User2534">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:36, 4 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_1">Articles created/expanded on October 1</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=34" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 1">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="St_Edmund_Church.2C_Godalming.2C_Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel.2C_Godalming_Friends_Meeting_House.2C_Salvation_Army_Hall.2C_Godalming.2C_Godalming_Congregational_Church">St Edmund Church, Godalming, Meadrow Unitarian Chapel, Godalming Friends Meeting House, Salvation Army Hall, Godalming, Godalming Congregational Church</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSt_Edmund_Church%2C_Godalming_and_four_other_articles&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=St_Edmund_Church%2C_Godalming&amp;action=history">St Edmund Church, Godalming</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel&amp;action=history">Meadrow Unitarian Chapel</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Godalming_Friends_Meeting_House&amp;action=history">Godalming Friends Meeting House</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Salvation_Army_Hall%2C_Godalming&amp;action=history">Salvation Army Hall, Godalming</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Godalming_Congregational_Church&amp;action=history">Godalming Congregational Church</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel,_Meadrow,_Godalming_(April_2015)_(3).JPG" class="image" title="Meadrow Unitarian Chapel, Godalming"><img alt="Meadrow Unitarian Chapel, Godalming" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel%2C_Meadrow%2C_Godalming_%28April_2015%29_%283%29.JPG/120px-Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel%2C_Meadrow%2C_Godalming_%28April_2015%29_%283%29.JPG" width="120" height="84" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel%2C_Meadrow%2C_Godalming_%28April_2015%29_%283%29.JPG/180px-Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel%2C_Meadrow%2C_Godalming_%28April_2015%29_%283%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel%2C_Meadrow%2C_Godalming_%28April_2015%29_%283%29.JPG/240px-Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel%2C_Meadrow%2C_Godalming_%28April_2015%29_%283%29.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4300" data-file-height="3000" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Meadrow Unitarian Chapel, Godalming</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Godalming" title="Godalming">Godalming</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/St_Edmund_Church,_Godalming" title="St Edmund Church, Godalming">Roman Catholic</a></b>, <b><a href="/wiki/Godalming_Friends_Meeting_House" title="Godalming Friends Meeting House">Quaker</a></b> and <b><a href="/wiki/Meadrow_Unitarian_Chapel" title="Meadrow Unitarian Chapel">Unitarian</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> places of worship, former <b><a href="/wiki/Godalming_Congregational_Church" title="Godalming Congregational Church">Congregational chapel</a></b> and former <b><a href="/wiki/Salvation_Army_Hall,_Godalming" title="Salvation Army Hall, Godalming">Salvation Army hall</a></b> are all Grade II <a href="/wiki/Listed_building" title="Listed building">listed buildings</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <s><i>Pending...</i> Please bear with me while I review 5.</s> <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Oligoryzomys" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Oligoryzomys">Template:Did you know nominations/Oligoryzomys</a> (a five-article hook with <a href="/wiki/Oligoryzomys" title="Oligoryzomys">Oligoryzomys</a>, <a href="/wiki/Oligoryzomys_stramineus" title="Oligoryzomys stramineus">O. stramineus</a>, <a href="/wiki/Oligoryzomys_flavescens" title="Oligoryzomys flavescens">O. flavescens</a>, <a href="/wiki/Oligoryzomys_destructor" title="Oligoryzomys destructor">O. destructor</a> and <a href="/wiki/Oligoryzomys_magellanicus" title="Oligoryzomys magellanicus">O. magellanicus</a>)</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: <a href="/wiki/St_Edmund_Church,_Godalming" title="St Edmund Church, Godalming">St Edmund Church, Godalming</a> was expanded starting on 1st October, and I have added <a href="/wiki/User:Pjposullivan" title="User:Pjposullivan">User:Pjposullivan</a> (who created the article) manually to the credits. The other articles were created between 2nd and 5th October.</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Umpqua_Community_College_shooting">Umpqua Community College shooting</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FUmpqua_Community_College_shooting&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Umpqua_Community_College_shooting&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the shooter's name of the <b><a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College_shooting" title="Umpqua Community College shooting">mass shooting</a></b> at <a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College" title="Umpqua Community College">Umpqua Community College</a> went public, although a county sheriff has refused to reveal the name?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT1</b>:... that, according to a global news director's tweet at <a href="/wiki/Buzzfeed" title="Buzzfeed" class="mw-redirect">Buzzfeed</a>, some <a href="/wiki/4chan" title="4chan">4chan</a> users sent phony suspect information at Twitter about <b><a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College_shooting" title="Umpqua Community College shooting">mass shooting</a></b> at <a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College" title="Umpqua Community College">Umpqua Community College</a> to news media?</s></li>
<li><s><b>ALT2</b>:... that a global news director tweeted at <a href="/wiki/Buzzfeed" title="Buzzfeed" class="mw-redirect">Buzzfeed</a> that some <a href="/wiki/4chan" title="4chan">4chan</a> users were using Twitter to send phony suspect information about the <b><a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College_shooting" title="Umpqua Community College shooting">mass shooting</a></b> at <a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College" title="Umpqua Community College">Umpqua Community College</a> to news media?</s> (Removed from article as "undue")</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that, before committing <b><a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College_shooting" title="Umpqua Community College shooting">mass shooting and then suicide</a></b> at <a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College" title="Umpqua Community College">Umpqua Community College</a>, Christopher Harper-Mercer uploaded a documentary on the <a href="/wiki/Sandy_Hook_Elementary_School" title="Sandy Hook Elementary School" class="mw-redirect">Sandy Hook Elementary School</a> <a href="/wiki/Sandy_Hook_Elementary_School_shooting" title="Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting">shooting</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT4</b>:... that, before being identified as the shooter of the <a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College" title="Umpqua Community College">Umpqua Community College</a> <b><a href="/wiki/Umpqua_Community_College_shooting" title="Umpqua Community College shooting">shooting</a></b>, Christopher Harper-Mercer uploaded a documentary on the <a href="/wiki/Sandy_Hook_Elementary_School" title="Sandy Hook Elementary School" class="mw-redirect">Sandy Hook Elementary School</a> <a href="/wiki/Sandy_Hook_Elementary_School_shooting" title="Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting">shooting</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Georgia_Flood" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Georgia Flood">Georgia Flood</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Failed ITN nomination (I voted "oppose" there). I could not name everybody else involved in this. Feel free to credit others whom I missed.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Ktr101" title="User:Ktr101">Ktr101</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ktr101" title="User talk:Ktr101">talk</a>), <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Versus101&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Versus101 (page does not exist)">Versus101</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Versus101" title="User talk:Versus101">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:AMERIXANPSYCHO" title="User:AMERIXANPSYCHO">AMERIXANPSYCHO</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:AMERIXANPSYCHO" title="User talk:AMERIXANPSYCHO">talk</a>), and <a href="/wiki/User:Alvandria" title="User:Alvandria">Alvandria</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Alvandria" title="User talk:Alvandria">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:George_Ho" title="User:George Ho">George Ho</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:George_Ho" title="User talk:George Ho">talk</a>) at 04:49, 6 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Vasile_Mor.C8.9Bun">Vasile Morțun</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVasile_Mor%C8%9Bun&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in 1888, <b><a href="/wiki/Vasile_Mor%C8%9Bun" title="Vasile Morțun">Vasile Morțun</a></b> became the first socialist elected to the <a href="/wiki/Romanian_Chamber_of_Deputies" title="Romanian Chamber of Deputies" class="mw-redirect">Romanian Assembly of Deputies</a>?</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Mother_.28Gorky_novel.29">The Mother (Gorky novel)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Mother_%28Gorky_novel%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Mother_(Gorky_novel)" title="The Mother (Gorky novel)">The Mother</a></b></i> is the best known novel of <a href="/wiki/Maxim_Gorky" title="Maxim Gorky">Maxim Gorky</a> and the only novel of Gorky on the Russian revolutionary movement?</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Program_for_Action">Program for Action</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FProgram_for_Action&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Program_for_Action&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, a US$1.23 billion <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">action program</a></b> paid for three tunnels and six holes?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, was drastically truncated in the 1970s due to a lack of funds?</li>
<li><b>ALT1a</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a> in the 1960s, was drastically truncated in the 1970s due to a <a href="/wiki/History_of_New_York_City_(1946%E2%80%9377)#1970s" title="History of New York City (1946–77)">major fiscal crisis</a> in the city?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b> was originally envisioned as a 40-mile expansion of the <a href="/wiki/New_York_City_Subway" title="New York City Subway">New York City Subway</a>, but ended up becoming 15 miles?</li>
<li><b>ALT3a</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, would have converted several branches of the <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Rail_Road" title="Long Island Rail Road">Long Island Rail Road</a> for subway service?</li>
<li><b>ALT3b</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, would have converted several commuter and freight railroad branches for subway service?</li>
<li><b>ALT3c</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, would have converted portions of the <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Rail_Road" title="Long Island Rail Road">Long Island Rail Road</a>, <a href="/wiki/Metro-North_Railroad" title="Metro-North Railroad">Metro-North Railroad</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Amtrak" title="Amtrak">Amtrak</a> for subway service?</li>
<li><b>ALT4</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, would have constructed subway lines along <a href="/wiki/Interstate_Highway_System" title="Interstate Highway System">Interstate highways</a>, including the <a href="/wiki/Interstate_495_(New_York)" title="Interstate 495 (New York)">Long Island Expressway</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT4a</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, would have constructed subway lines along existing <a href="/wiki/Interstate_Highway_System" title="Interstate Highway System">Interstate highways</a> and railroad lines?</li>
<li><b>ALT5</b>:... that the 1960s <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b> would have constructed several crosstown <a href="/wiki/People_mover" title="People mover">people mover</a> systems across <a href="/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan" title="Midtown Manhattan">Midtown Manhattan</a> in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT5</b>:... that the 1960s <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b> would have constructed several high-speed <a href="/wiki/People_mover" title="People mover">people mover</a> "distribution systems" across <a href="/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan" title="Midtown Manhattan">Midtown Manhattan</a> in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT6a</b>:... that plans and projects under the 1960s <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b> were the precursors to 21st Century mass transit projects in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a>, including <a href="/wiki/AirTrain_JFK" title="AirTrain JFK">AirTrain JFK</a>, <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Rail_Road" title="Long Island Rail Road">Long Island Rail Road</a> <a href="/wiki/East_Side_Access" title="East Side Access">East Side Access</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Second_Avenue_Subway" title="Second Avenue Subway">Second Avenue Subway</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT6b</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a> in the 1960s, was the precursor to several 21st Century transit projects, including <a href="/wiki/AirTrain_JFK" title="AirTrain JFK">AirTrain JFK</a>, <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Rail_Road" title="Long Island Rail Road">Long Island Rail Road</a> <a href="/wiki/East_Side_Access" title="East Side Access">East Side Access</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Second_Avenue_Subway" title="Second Avenue Subway">Second Avenue Subway</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT7</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Program_for_Action" title="Program for Action">Program for Action</a></b>, a transportation proposal in <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">New York City</a> in the 1960s, would have also constructed transportation hubs and airports in <a href="/wiki/Upstate_New_York" title="Upstate New York">Upstate New York</a> and suburban <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">Long Island</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Pilak,_Tripura_and_Tripura_Government_Museum" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Pilak, Tripura and Tripura Government Museum"><i>Pilak, Tripura</i> and <i>Tripura Government Museum</i></a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: The first hook is quite humorous, so I've offered ALT1. Also, the article is pretty long.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Converted from a redirect by <a href="/wiki/User:Epicgenius" title="User:Epicgenius">Epicgenius</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Epicgenius" title="User talk:Epicgenius">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Tdorante10" title="User:Tdorante10">Tdorante10</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Tdorante10" title="User talk:Tdorante10">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Epicgenius" title="User:Epicgenius">Epicgenius</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Epicgenius" title="User talk:Epicgenius">talk</a>) at 03:44, 2 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Louis_Fles">Louis Fles</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLouis_Fles&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Louis_Fles&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Louis_Fles.jpg" class="image" title="Louis Fles"><img alt="Louis Fles" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Louis_Fles.jpg/120px-Louis_Fles.jpg" width="120" height="132" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Louis_Fles.jpg/180px-Louis_Fles.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/9d/Louis_Fles.jpg 2x" data-file-width="200" data-file-height="220" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Louis Fles</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in 1933, accountant and furniture importer <b><a href="/wiki/Louis_Fles" title="Louis Fles">Louis Fles</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> wrote an anti-Nazi radio address for Vrijdenkers Radio Omroep (VRO) (Freethinkers Radio Broadcasting) that was so strident, it was banned by the Dutch Government?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that anti-Nazi activist <b><a href="/wiki/Louis_Fles" title="Louis Fles">Louis Fles</a></b>, <i>(pictured)</i> who was of Jewish ancestry, advocated for the discontinuation of religious observance and replacing it with educational family activities?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the son of <b><a href="/wiki/Louis_Fles" title="Louis Fles">Louis Fles</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, Dutch socialist and activist, was arrested by the Stalinist regime and later died in prison?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:VaDawn" title="User:VaDawn">VaDawn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:VaDawn" title="User talk:VaDawn">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:07, 1 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Diptych_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini">Diptych by Giovanni da Rimini</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDiptych_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Diptych_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints,_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_(National_Gallery).jpg" class="image" title="Scenes from the Lives of the Virgin and other Saints, by Giovanni da Rimini"><img alt="Scenes from the Lives of the Virgin and other Saints, by Giovanni da Rimini" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints%2C_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_%28National_Gallery%29.jpg/120px-Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints%2C_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_%28National_Gallery%29.jpg" width="120" height="187" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints%2C_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_%28National_Gallery%29.jpg/180px-Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints%2C_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_%28National_Gallery%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints%2C_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_%28National_Gallery%29.jpg/240px-Scenes_from_the_Lives_of_the_Virgin_and_other_Saints%2C_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini_%28National_Gallery%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2307" data-file-height="3604" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Scenes from the Lives of the Virgin and other Saints, by Giovanni da Rimini</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Diptych_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini" title="Diptych by Giovanni da Rimini">an acquisition this year</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> by the <a href="/wiki/National_Gallery" title="National Gallery">National Gallery</a> was made possible by the family of <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A9e_Lauder_(businesswoman)" title="Estée Lauder (businesswoman)">Estée Lauder</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Luristan_bronzes" title="Luristan bronzes" class="mw-redirect">Luristan bronzes</a> (<a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Luristan_bronze" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Luristan bronze">here</a>)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Maculosae_tegmine_lyncis" title="User:Maculosae tegmine lyncis">Maculosae tegmine lyncis</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maculosae_tegmine_lyncis" title="User talk:Maculosae tegmine lyncis">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 19:54, 1 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Details on impressive work of art, on good sources, Italian sources accepted AGF, hook ok and sourced. There must be projects to mention on the talk. The image is free and the best hook. --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 20:30, 4 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="George_E._Morrow">George E. Morrow</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FGeorge_E._Morrow&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/George_E._Morrow" title="George E. Morrow">George E. Morrow</a></b>, the founder of the <a href="/wiki/Morrow_Plots" title="Morrow Plots">Morrow Plots</a> at the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Illinois_at_Urbana%E2%80%93Champaign" title="University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign">University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign</a>, was also president of <a href="/wiki/Oklahoma_State_University" title="Oklahoma State University" class="mw-redirect">Oklahoma State University</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>

</dd>
</dl>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

<dd>
<ul>

Long enough at 4996 characters. Article is neutral and cites sources with inline citations. Copyvios confidence 0.0%. AGF offline sources for the hook. QPQ done. <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">✈</a> 11:40, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Nahem_Shoa">Nahem Shoa</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNahem_Shoa&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nahem_Shoa&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben,_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg" class="image" title="Nahem Shoa standing beside Giant Head of Ben"><img alt="Nahem Shoa standing beside Giant Head of Ben" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben%2C_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg/120px-Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben%2C_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg" width="120" height="160" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben%2C_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg/180px-Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben%2C_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5d/Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben%2C_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg 2x" data-file-width="207" data-file-height="276" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Nahem Shoa standing beside <i>Giant Head of Ben</i></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that artist <b><a href="/wiki/Nahem_Shoa" title="Nahem Shoa">Nahem Shoa</a></b> (pictured) increased the number of portraits of Black and mixed-race British people on display in British art museums?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that some of British painter <b><a href="/wiki/Nahem_Shoa" title="Nahem Shoa">Nahem Shoa</a></b>‍ '​s portraits (pictured) were painted at up to 15 times life size?</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: OTRS is pending for the image; we're hopeful it will be reviewed in time for the DYK.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Arttalk1984&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Arttalk1984 (page does not exist)">Arttalk1984</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Arttalk1984" title="User talk:Arttalk1984">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist">talk</a>) at 17:19, 6 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The image is <a class="external text" href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Commons:Deletion_requests/File:Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben,_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg">nominated for deletion</a> at Wikimedia Commons. It's claimed that the copyright status of the painting is not definite. <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 18:59, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>That phrasing is somewhat disingenuous, <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a>. <i>You</i> nominated the file for deletion and <i>you</i> "claimed that the copyright status of the painting is not definite" — even though OTRS received Nahem Shoa's declaration before <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Arttalk1984&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Arttalk1984 (page does not exist)">Arttalk1984</a>'s. No one else is denying that the artist has licensed the file in a way compatible with its use on Commons and Wikipedia. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 08:04, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I would not call it "disingenuous" assuming <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:AGF" title="Wikipedia:AGF" class="mw-redirect">good faith</a>, because there's no contradiction between the nomination and that claim. No one denied the license being granted, rather it was due to an OTRS pending template pasted there. How would you guarantee that both emails are checked? There's only one addressed ticket at the moment. By the way, I withdrew the nomination because an admin said there was no problem as far as he saw. <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 10:36, 12 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>What made it disingenuous was the implication that someone else made the claim and you were just reporting it here. (As for <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:AGF" title="Wikipedia:AGF" class="mw-redirect">WP:AGF</a>, did you have that in mind when you nominated the file for deletion despite it being tagged with one OTRS ticket pending and another accepted?) But thank you for withdrawing the nomination. Perhaps you will exercise more care with future nominations, and not <i>assume</i> which ticket has been assessed. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 14:13, 12 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Good faith takes <a class="external text" href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Commons:Assume_good_faith#Good_faith_and_copyright">a different meaning</a> when it comes to copyright issues. Even now, I think that I did the best thing possible by nominating the file. Unfortunately, the files are suspicious until a volunteer from OTRS team <a class="external text" href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=File:Nahem_Shoa_next_to_his_Giant_Portrait_of_Ben,_Hartlepool_Art_Gallery.jpg&amp;diff=175413299&amp;oldid=175413286">addresses them</a>. I withdrew only due to what the admin said. Please consider that, the nomination was not based on an "assumption" rather a problem existing in the description page of the file. Btw, who made the claim? <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 16:27, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Full review needed now that image issues have been settled. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 15:41, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Province_of_Cremona">Province of Cremona</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FProvince_of_Cremona&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Province_of_Cremona&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that sixteenth century irrigation channels assist in the production of rice in the <b><a href="/wiki/Province_of_Cremona" title="Province of Cremona">Province of Cremona</a></b> in northern Italy?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Rice" title="Rice">rice</a> is grown in the <b><a href="/wiki/Province_of_Cremona" title="Province of Cremona">Province of Cremona</a></b> in northern Italy?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Ezekiel_Airship" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Ezekiel Airship">Ezekiel Airship</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 06:15, 5 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Nice expansion, good sources. I am sorry I don't find Cremona in the book given, nor rice, please explain. To me, the ALT would be nothing new, --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 18:50, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Faskally_Forest">Faskally Forest</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFaskally_Forest&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Faskally_Forest&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg" class="image" title="Faskally Forest"><img alt="Faskally Forest" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg/120px-Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg/180px-Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg/240px-Reflections_at_Loch_Dunmore_-_geograph.org.uk_-_73870.jpg 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="480" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Faskally Forest</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that a colorful event held in the setting of the <b><a href="/wiki/Faskally_Forest" title="Faskally Forest">Faskally Forest</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, "The Enchanted Forest" received awards as the "Best Cultural Event in Scotland" consecutively for three years since 2011?</li>
</ul>

</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Seoul_International_Fireworks_Festival">Seoul International Fireworks Festival</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSeoul_International_Fireworks_Festival&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Seoul_International_Fireworks_Festival&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG" class="image" title="Seoul international fireworks festival 2011"><img alt="Seoul international fireworks festival 2011" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG/120px-Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG/180px-Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG/240px-Seoul_international_fireworks_festival_2011-001.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1200" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Seoul international fireworks festival 2011</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that about 100,000 fireworks are used, and more than a million viewers visit the <b><a href="/wiki/Seoul_International_Fireworks_Festival" title="Seoul International Fireworks Festival">Seoul International Fireworks Festival</a></b> every year?</li>
</ul>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPost_Malone&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg" class="image" title="Allen Iverson"><img alt="Allen Iverson" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg/120px-Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg" width="120" height="149" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg/180px-Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg/240px-Allen_Iverson_headshot.jpg 2x" data-file-width="777" data-file-height="964" /></a>

</div>
</div>

<li>... that after getting braids in his hair, <b><a href="/wiki/Post_Malone" title="Post Malone">Post Malone</a></b> coined the song name "<a href="/wiki/White_Iverson" title="White Iverson">White Iverson</a>", a reference to <a href="/wiki/Allen_Iverson" title="Allen Iverson">Allen Iverson</a> <i>(pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>
