<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit">Pendant portraits of Maerten Soolmans and Oopjen Coppit</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg" class="image" title="Pendant portraits side by side"><img alt="Pendant portraits side by side" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg/120px-Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg" width="120" height="86" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg/180px-Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg/240px-Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit.jpeg 2x" data-file-width="620" data-file-height="445" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Pendant portraits side by side</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that in September 2015, <b><a href="/wiki/Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit" title="Pendant portraits of Maerten Soolmans and Oopjen Coppit">two pendant portraits</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> broke a record for the most expensive pair of pendant wedding portraits ever, and individually the most expensive works by <a href="/wiki/Rembrandt" title="Rembrandt">Rembrandt</a>?</s></li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Jane023" title="User:Jane023">Jane023</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jane023" title="User talk:Jane023">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 08:01, 4 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, neutrally written, no close paraphrasing seen. Regarding the title: It is unclear why you're calling them "pendant portraits", as they are full-length portraits. I didn't see that term in the sources. Perhaps just "Portraits" would suffice? Regarding the hook facts, these need to be stated and cited in the article. The first fact, that it broke a record for the most expensive pair of pendant wedding portraits ever, doesn't appear in the article. The second fact, that the purchase price broke a record for the most expensive works by <a href="/wiki/Rembrandt" title="Rembrandt">Rembrandt</a>, appears in the article but not in the source. No QPQ necessary for nominator with less than 5 DYKs. Image is PD. <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 23:09, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd>Yoninah, thanks for your comments! The word "pendant" in the case of paintings refers to the fact that the paintings form a pair (a "painting series", but not a larger series than 2) and are meant to hang together. The <a href="/wiki/Portrait_of_Oopjen_Coppit" title="Portrait of Oopjen Coppit">supporting</a> <a href="/wiki/Portrait_of_Maerten_Soolmans" title="Portrait of Maerten Soolmans">articles</a> about the paintings individually quote the expert Hofstede de Groot who refers to them explicitly as pendants of each other. Though the word "pendant" may be missing from the current sources in this article, I don't see a need to include a specific reference for this word, as it is so common in this context. The NYtimes source does say that the only comparable Rembrandt is the Aristotle which sold for $2.3 million in 1961. That makes it a pretty safe bet to say this is the most expensive pair and the most paid individually. Not sure what else you can compare it to. This is also the only entry in the List of most expensive paintings, which I linked to. Without access to insurance premiums we can't show the actual market value of others (though I imagine the reason these have appeared on the market in March is due to <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2015/02/12/de-rembrandttentoonstelling-is-geopend-de-duurste-expositie-in-nederland-ooit">this</a> enormously expensive show of Late Rembrandt in the Rijksmuseum this year. <a href="/wiki/User:Jane023" title="User:Jane023">Jane</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jane023" title="User talk:Jane023">talk</a>) 08:23, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><b>Comment</b> - Jane is quite correct. <li>Added source that mentions that when the "<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.theartnewspaper.com/news/news/160333/">portrait of Catrina Hooghsaet</a> sold earlier this year, it was a record price for the artist. However, three weeks ago, in an unusual move, the Rijksmuseum and the Louvre in Paris agreed jointly to buy a pair of Rembrandt portraits of Maerten Soolmans and his wife Oopjen Coppit (1634) from the Eric de Rothschild collection, for €160m for the pair". <a href="/wiki/User:Ceoil" title="User:Ceoil">Ceoil</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ceoil" title="User talk:Ceoil">talk</a>) 21:01, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<p>Yes thanks for adding those (quite interesting) references! I moved the NYTimes article ref up too. Yoninah, I think that indeed the Catrina Hooghsaet (1657) portrait and its proposed price of 50 million euros is proof enough that Oopjen's portrait is the most expensive female portrait by Rembrandt, but again, it is more the fact that these Rembrandts don't come on the market at all, and certainly not as a pair. That fact in and of itself means it is a record, since the art market in general has exploded since the 1980s and there have been no Rembrandt wedding pendants sold together since that time. Let me know if you want me to expand it a bit about the Catrina Hooghsaet portrait (could use its own article!) -- I am especially intrigued to read that it came on the market after being lent out to the Rijksmuseum, which just goes to prove my theory that the insurance premiums have gone up so high that it is maybe getting too expensive to hold such paintings if you don't have the paying public to help with the costs of ownership. <a href="/wiki/User:Jane023" title="User:Jane023">Jane</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jane023" title="User talk:Jane023">talk</a>) 21:26, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<dl>
<dd>forgot to mention that in general portraits of women are cheaper than portraits of men, and so the pendants are probably valued at 100/60 rather than 80/80 but we will never know for sure, and the Hooghsaet price helps with that. <a href="/wiki/User:Jane023" title="User:Jane023">Jane</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jane023" title="User talk:Jane023">talk</a>) 21:30, 17 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Jane, the DYK rules <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYK#Cited_hook" title="Wikipedia:DYK" class="mw-redirect">specifically state</a> that any facts mentioned in the hook must be sourced. Without sources, your conclusions are considered <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:NOR" title="Wikipedia:NOR" class="mw-redirect">OR</a>. You have adequately sourced the record-breaking Rembrandt part, but not the most expensive pair of pendant wedding portraits ever part. Would you like to shorten the hook so we can pass this?</li>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: <s>... that in September 2015, <b><a href="/wiki/Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit" title="Pendant portraits of Maerten Soolmans and Oopjen Coppit">two pendant portraits</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> broke a record for the most expensive works by <a href="/wiki/Rembrandt" title="Rembrandt">Rembrandt</a> ever sold?</s> <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 23:17, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>: ... that in September 2015, the <b><a href="/wiki/Pendant_portraits_of_Maerten_Soolmans_and_Oopjen_Coppit" title="Pendant portraits of Maerten Soolmans and Oopjen Coppit">portraits of Maerten Soolmans and Oopjen Coppit</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> broke the record as the most expensive works by <a href="/wiki/Rembrandt" title="Rembrandt">Rembrandt</a> sold at auction? <a href="/wiki/User:Ceoil" title="User:Ceoil">Ceoil</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ceoil" title="User talk:Ceoil">talk</a>) 00:08, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Yes, I could go with either one of those! Meanwhile, I have already been moving on and just created <a href="/wiki/Portrait_of_Catharina_Hooghsaet" title="Portrait of Catharina Hooghsaet">Portrait of Catharina Hooghsaet</a>. Now it's done I see I have to go write her bio too, as I find her quite a fascinating woman besides just the portrait after reading her biography - she managed to achieve a divorce without giving up her wealth and more importantly, was *not* shunned by the Mennonites (which generally happened whenever women left their husbands in those days). <a href="/wiki/User:Jane023" title="User:Jane023">Jane</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jane023" title="User talk:Jane023">talk</a>) 08:30, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dd>Oooh the plot thickens! Thanks for that - I guess then that the Rijksmuseum is in fact the mystery overseas buyer probably. Of course it's great for Amsterdam if all these Rembrandts come home to roost, but personally I like the idea of them spread all over the place. And sources on the inside tell me that these old paintings can stand ages of neglect hanging on castle walls with no specific room temperature controls or any of the things top museums claim. <a href="/wiki/User:Jane023" title="User:Jane023">Jane</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jane023" title="User talk:Jane023">talk</a>) 11:53, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Maikel_Kieftenbeld">Maikel Kieftenbeld</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMaikel_Kieftenbeld&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Maikel_Kieftenbeld&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Kieftenbeld_2014.png" class="image" title="Kieftenbeld in 2014"><img alt="Kieftenbeld in 2014" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Kieftenbeld_2014.png/120px-Kieftenbeld_2014.png" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Kieftenbeld_2014.png/180px-Kieftenbeld_2014.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Kieftenbeld_2014.png/240px-Kieftenbeld_2014.png 2x" data-file-width="308" data-file-height="232" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Kieftenbeld in 2014</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Maikel_Kieftenbeld" title="Maikel Kieftenbeld">Maikel Kieftenbeld</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> captained <a href="/wiki/FC_Groningen" title="FC Groningen">FC Groningen</a> to victory in the <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_KNVB_Cup#Final" title="2014–15 KNVB Cup">2014–15 KNVB Cup Final</a> to win the first major trophy in the club's history?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: First of two at <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Black_oropendola" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Black oropendola">Black oropendola</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This substantial article is a five-fold expansion and is new enough and long enough. The hook fact has an inline citation and the image is appropriately licensed. The article is neutral. Many of the references are in Dutch but I found no close paraphrasing in the English language sources I checked. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 19:14, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Nako.2C_Himachal_Pradesh">Nako, Himachal Pradesh</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNako%2C_Himachal_Pradesh&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nako%2C_Himachal_Pradesh&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Nako_9_Stevage.jpg" class="image" title="Nako and the monastery"><img alt="Nako and the monastery" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Nako_9_Stevage.jpg/120px-Nako_9_Stevage.jpg" width="120" height="160" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Nako_9_Stevage.jpg/180px-Nako_9_Stevage.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Nako_9_Stevage.jpg/240px-Nako_9_Stevage.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2136" data-file-height="2848" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Nako and the monastery</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the Nako Monastery <i>(pictured)</i> in <b><a href="/wiki/Nako,_Himachal_Pradesh" title="Nako, Himachal Pradesh">Nako</a></b> has sculptures of five <a href="/wiki/Dhyani_Buddhas" title="Dhyani Buddhas" class="mw-redirect">Dhyani Buddhas</a> made of clay in the main hall where there are also many <a href="/wiki/Thangkas" title="Thangkas" class="mw-redirect">thangkas</a> on the walls?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:the <b><a href="/wiki/Nako,_Himachal_Pradesh" title="Nako, Himachal Pradesh">Nako</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> has a more than 500 years old prayer wheel made of <a href="/wiki/Yak" title="Yak">yak</a> skin in the Chango <a href="/wiki/Gompa" title="Gompa">gompa</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Agnes_Ellen_Harris" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Agnes Ellen Harris">Template:Did you know nominations/Agnes Ellen Harris</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FOwari_no_Hoshi_no_Love_Song&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Fatimid_desecration_of_Jerusalem">Fatimid desecration of Jerusalem</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFatimid_desecration_of_Jerusalem&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fatimid_desecration_of_Jerusalem&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Golgotha_cross-section.svg" class="image" title="Church of the Holy Sepulchre destroyed by Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah"><img alt="Church of the Holy Sepulchre destroyed by Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Golgotha_cross-section.svg/120px-Golgotha_cross-section.svg.png" width="120" height="92" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Golgotha_cross-section.svg/180px-Golgotha_cross-section.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Golgotha_cross-section.svg/240px-Golgotha_cross-section.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="548" data-file-height="419" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><a href="/wiki/Church_of_the_Holy_Sepulchre" title="Church of the Holy Sepulchre">Church of the Holy Sepulchre</a> destroyed by <a href="/wiki/Al-Hakim_bi-Amr_Allah" title="Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah">Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Fatimid_desecration_of_Jerusalem" title="Fatimid desecration of Jerusalem">Fatimid desecration of Jerusalem</a> was ordered by a <a href="/wiki/Mad_Caliph" title="Mad Caliph" class="mw-redirect">Mad Caliph</a> who self-proclaimed himself to be the <a href="/wiki/Mahdi" title="Mahdi">Mahdi</a>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Guru_Noel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Guru Noel (page does not exist)">Guru Noel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Guru_Noel" title="User talk:Guru Noel">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:01, 3 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Considerably problematic in its current form. The article is new enough and (barely) long enough, but I cannot judge it as within policy. Both article and hook present an exceedingly non-neutral point of view regarding the controversial historical figure <a href="/wiki/Al-Hakim_bi-Amr_Allah" title="Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah">Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah</a>. The second paragraph is entirely unreferenced. Whatever the Morris 2005 reference is isn't formatted correctly; it appears to be taken from another article that used shortened footnotes and harvard referencing. Because of this problem, I cannot verify claims sources to it; this is especially problematic because it appears to take the writings of <a href="/wiki/Ad%C3%A9mar_de_Chabannes" title="Adémar de Chabannes">Adémar de Chabannes</a> at face value, which further compounds NPOV concerns. Indeed, the article title itself is problematic, with an alternative such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Destruction_of_the_Church_of_the_Holy_Sepulchre&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Destruction of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre (page does not exist)">Destruction of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre</a> perhaps being preferable, if it is even determined that this is a necessary spinout from <a href="/wiki/Church_of_the_Holy_Sepulchre" title="Church of the Holy Sepulchre">Church of the Holy Sepulchre</a>. In any case, this article, as it stands currently, is not in my opinion suitable for display on the Main Page. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 16:59, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>Comment</b> Thanks for your review. The article has now been substantially re-written to better show clear title is correct and the scope of the desecration to Jewish and Christian sites outside of Jerusalem. Morris source has been replaced. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Guru_Noel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Guru Noel (page does not exist)">Guru Noel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Guru_Noel" title="User talk:Guru Noel">talk</a>) 21:30, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Still no. This article, from title to text to proposed DYK hook, presents an exceedingly Western/Judeo-Christian biased accounting of the 1009 destruction of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and its consequences. Neglecting any consideration of the Fatimid perspective is not neutral. Deeming the destruction of the church the "desecration of Jerusalem" is not neutral. Newly-added text equating the actions of Al-Haqim with the Biblical <a href="/wiki/Abomination_of_desolation" title="Abomination of desolation">abomination of desolation</a> phrase is <i>absolutely</i> not neutral. The proposed hook is worse, essentially using the words of Adémar de Chabannes to call Al-Haqim the Antichrist. The article's topic is a complex, nuanced, and sensitive event. The article itself is not; I will not approve it for DYK. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 02:32, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>Comment</b> Excuse me, but the entire of Wikipedia is Western/Judeo-Christian biased accounting! What do you think our University system is based on? There are no Fatimid perspectives, they all likely killed Al-Hakim. We don't give <a href="/wiki/Hitler" title="Hitler" class="mw-redirect">Hitler</a>'s perspective on the <a href="/wiki/Holocaust" title="Holocaust" class="mw-redirect">holocaust</a> because no-one (or a negligible minority) support his view and think that was a good thing to have done. I don't think you have re-read the article carefully enough to notice that the "desecration" extended beyond the Church of the Holy Sepulchre at all and with that sort of neglect request another reviewer's attention to this article. I have however changed the hook on your advice to make it suitable. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Guru_Noel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Guru Noel (page does not exist)">Guru Noel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Guru_Noel" title="User talk:Guru Noel">talk</a>) 08:12, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Wikipedia is built on consensus; you are welcome to seek a second opinion, although I assure you that I examined the article, its claims, and its sourcing quite thoroughly. An appropriately balanced, neutral article on the topic would need to address scholars' opinions of Al-Haqim's motivations (which will probably need to address his shifting religious allegiances), such as concerns that the <a href="/wiki/Holy_Fire" title="Holy Fire">Holy Fire</a> was fraudulent,<a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="http://www.brepolsonline.net/doi/abs/10.1484/M.CELAMA-EB.3.1476">[3]</a> or that the destruction was potentially taken as a consequence of the complex <a href="/wiki/Byzantine%E2%80%93Arab_wars_(780%E2%80%931180)" title="Byzantine–Arab wars (780–1180)">Byzantine-Arab relations</a> during the period.<a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="http://www.jstor.org/stable/1523174?seq=1#page_scan_tab_contents">[4]</a> A neutral article will also need to take a more measured approach to the chain of events connecting the 1009 destruction of the church to the First Crusade. <a href="/wiki/Rodulfus_Glaber" title="Rodulfus Glaber">Rodulfus Glaber</a> probably needs to be addressed along with Adémar, and context needs to be provided for their writings (Adémar especially was prone to hyperbole or outright fabrication). The First Crusade's causes were more complex and nuanced; indeed, Al-Haqim was long dead and the church rebuilt before the Crusades were even conceived of. Not all scholars agree whether its destruction was even mentioned by Urban II at Clermont.<a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1468-229X.1970.tb02491.x/abstract">[5]</a> And, finally, it goes without saying that a neutral article would require neutral <i>language</i>. This is simply not Hitler and the Holocaust. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 14:16, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Thanks for these helpful pointers. It is more complex than the Holocaust. I have made an attempt to incorporate a lot of this information with a new motivations section and clarified the crusades. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Guru_Noel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Guru Noel (page does not exist)">Guru Noel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Guru_Noel" title="User talk:Guru Noel">talk</a>) 21:07, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article is much improved from the state at its original DYK nomination, but I am still not comfortable approving this for DYK. I retain the belief that the title is problematic, and that some of the phrasing (especially, but not limited to, "abomination of desolation") is far from neutral. It remains my opinion that this is not suitable, but the nominator has requested a third party reviewer, and I have no objection to someone else giving the article due consideration. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 14:10, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Thank you for your valuable contribution Squeamish. Much appreciated. I have taken the <a href="/wiki/Abomination_of_desolation" title="Abomination of desolation">Abomination of desolation</a> topic up on the talk page and further discussion is welcome there, not limited to that but other possibly problematic phrasing I am open to address. I understand your concerns about title and am open to discussion about that, also the hook. This article has become a bit of a <a href="/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes" title="Sherlock Holmes">Sherlock Holmes</a> <a href="/wiki/Whodunit" title="Whodunit">Whodunit</a> case since I started it. After a lot of researching it seems likely in my opinion that <a href="/wiki/Al-Hakim_bi-Amr_Allah" title="Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah">Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah</a> did likely have a Christian mother and did likely execute his uncle Arsenius, Patriarch of Jerusalem as part of the "desecration" for the Holy Fire fraud on the suggestion of the disenchanted Christian monk John, making the whole matter a lot more involved than generally understood, prior to writing the article. I think this clarification of multiple complicity actually presents a great message of peace right now, with everything going on with Shi'ite Muslims and Christians in Syria. Perhaps a revised hook and some advice could put that message across on the main page to your better satisfaction? <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Guru_Noel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Guru Noel (page does not exist)">Guru Noel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Guru_Noel" title="User talk:Guru Noel">talk</a>) 15:49, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Black_Hours_.28Morgan_Library.29">Black Hours (Morgan Library)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBlack_Hours_%28Morgan_Library%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Black_Hours_%28Morgan_Library%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg" class="image" title="&quot;Black Book of Hours&quot;"><img alt="&quot;Black Book of Hours&quot;" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg/120px-Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg" width="120" height="83" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg/180px-Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg/240px-Schwarzes_Stundenbuch_edit.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4681" data-file-height="3257" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">"Black Book of Hours"</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Parchment" title="Parchment">parchment</a> of the 15th-century <a href="/wiki/Illuminated_manuscript" title="Illuminated manuscript">illuminated manuscript</a> "<b><a href="/wiki/Black_Hours_(Morgan_Library)" title="Black Hours (Morgan Library)">Black Book of Hours</a></b>" <i>(pictured)</i> was presoaked in black ink, creating a dark, mournful visual tone appealing to high ranking members of the ruling <a href="/wiki/Burgundian" title="Burgundian" class="mw-disambig">Burgundian</a> court?</li>
<li>ALT1:* ... that the <a href="/wiki/Parchment" title="Parchment">parchment</a> of the 15th-century <a href="/wiki/Illuminated_manuscript" title="Illuminated manuscript">illuminated manuscript</a> "<b><a href="/wiki/Black_Hours_(Morgan_Library)" title="Black Hours (Morgan Library)">Black Book of Hours</a></b>" <i>(pictured)</i> appealing to the high ranking member of the ruling court?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Jauchzet_Gott_in_allen_Landen,_BWV_51" title="Jauchzet Gott in allen Landen, BWV 51">Jauchzet Gott in allen Landen, BWV 51</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Ceoil" title="User:Ceoil">Ceoil</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ceoil" title="User talk:Ceoil">talk</a>) at 04:13, 10 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_4">Articles created/expanded on October 4</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=37" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 4">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2015_Dadri_mob_lynching">2015 Dadri mob lynching</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F2015_Dadri_mob_lynching&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2015_Dadri_mob_lynching&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that following the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Dadri_mob_lynching" title="2015 Dadri mob lynching">Dadri mob lynching</a></b>, Prime Minister of India <a href="/wiki/Narendra_Modi" title="Narendra Modi">Narendra Modi</a> urged <a href="/wiki/Hindus" title="Hindus" class="mw-redirect">Hindus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Muslims" title="Muslims" class="mw-redirect">Muslims</a> to fight against poverty and not against each other?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>Alt</b> . . . that after the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_Dadri_mob_lynching" title="2015 Dadri mob lynching">Dadri mob lynching</a></b>, Prime Minister of India <a href="/wiki/Narendra_Modi" title="Narendra Modi">Narendra Modi</a> urged <a href="/wiki/Hindus" title="Hindus" class="mw-redirect">Hindus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Muslims" title="Muslims" class="mw-redirect">Muslims</a> to fight poverty and not each other?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>suggestion by <a href="/wiki/User:Jointed.owl" title="User:Jointed.owl">Jointed.owl</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jointed.owl" title="User talk:Jointed.owl">talk</a>) 13:00, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ayd.C4.B1n_Archaeological_Museum">Aydın Archaeological Museum</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAyd%C4%B1n_Archaeological_Museum&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ayd%C4%B1n_Archaeological_Museum&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that a <a href="/wiki/Urn#Cremation_urns" title="Urn">burial urn</a> on display in <b><a href="/wiki/Ayd%C4%B1n_Archaeological_Museum" title="Aydın Archaeological Museum">Aydın Archaeological Museum</a></b> depicts destiny's god <a href="/wiki/Moirai" title="Moirai">Moirai</a>, the god of the underworld <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>, the judges of the underworld, and Hades' <a href="/wiki/Polycephaly" title="Polycephaly">three-headed</a> guard dog <a href="/wiki/Cerberus" title="Cerberus">Cerberus</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Levant_Quartet" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Levant Quartet">Levant Quartet</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:CeeGee" title="User:CeeGee">CeeGee</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:CeeGee" title="User talk:CeeGee">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 11:12, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<ul>

If this is a list, and it can be argued that it is, the prose count would be affected. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ion_Buzdugan.2C_Bessarabian_Peasants.27_Party">Ion Buzdugan, Bessarabian Peasants' Party</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FIon_Buzdugan&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ion_Buzdugan&amp;action=history">Ion Buzdugan</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bessarabian_Peasants%27_Party&amp;action=history">Bessarabian Peasants' Party</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that, having co-founded the "radical leftist" <b><a href="/wiki/Bessarabian_Peasants%27_Party" title="Bessarabian Peasants' Party">Bessarabian Peasants' Party</a></b>, poet <b><a href="/wiki/Ion_Buzdugan" title="Ion Buzdugan">Ion Buzdugan</a></b> became noted for his recourse to "anti-Semitic buzzwords"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ion_Buzdugan" title="Ion Buzdugan">Ion Buzdugan</a></b>, poet and deputy of the Romanian nationalist <b><a href="/wiki/Bessarabian_Peasants%27_Party" title="Bessarabian Peasants' Party">Bessarabian Peasants' Party</a></b>, was chided for his poor grasp of the Romanian language?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Goa_Vikas_Party" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Goa Vikas Party">Goa Vikas Party</a> + <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/George_Panu" title="Template:Did you know nominations/George Panu">George Panu</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Dahn" title="User:Dahn">Dahn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Dahn" title="User talk:Dahn">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 13:00, 7 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Llanos_long-nosed_armadillo">Llanos long-nosed armadillo</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLlanos_long-nosed_armadillo&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Llanos_long-nosed_armadillo&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Llanos_long-nosed_armadillo" title="Llanos long-nosed armadillo">Llanos long-nosed armadillo</a></b> typically has quadruplets, all developed from a single <a href="/wiki/Zygote" title="Zygote">zygote</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Santa_Maria_in_Turri" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Santa Maria in Turri">Santa Maria in Turri</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 05:30, 7 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, and well referenced without copyvio. The hook fact is very interesting and although the source doesn't explicitly use the word "quadruplets", I'm going to go out on a limb and say that it is obvious to anyone with a modest understanding of how reproduction works that a litter of four from a single zygote must be identical quadruplets. QPQ is done. Great work as always. <a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:97198" title="User talk:97198">talk</a>) 10:40, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Civility">Civility</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCivility&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Civility&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Civility" title="Civility">civility</a></b> is the act of engaging with others in a constructive manner?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Civility" title="Civility">civility</a></b> is derived from the <a href="/wiki/Latin" title="Latin">Latin</a> word civis, meaning "<a href="/wiki/Citizen" title="Citizen" class="mw-redirect">citizen</a>"?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Istv%C3%A1n_Simicsk%C3%B3" title="Template:Did you know nominations/István Simicskó">István Simicskó</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: AfC submission accepted by <a href="/wiki/User:Kvng" title="User:Kvng">Kvng</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Blippincott" title="User:Blippincott">Blippincott</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Blippincott" title="User talk:Blippincott">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Kvng" title="User:Kvng">Kvng</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kvng" title="User talk:Kvng">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">SSTflyer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer" title="User talk:SSTflyer">talk</a>) at 13:03, 6 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ununennium">Ununennium</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FUnunennium&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ununennium&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ununennium" title="Ununennium">ununennium</a></b> is the element with the lowest atomic number that has not yet been synthesized?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Artists_with_the_most_number-ones_on_the_U.S._Mainstream_Top_40_chart" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Artists with the most number-ones on the U.S. Mainstream Top 40 chart">Artists with the most number-ones on the U.S. Mainstream Top 40 chart</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Double_sharp" title="User:Double sharp">Double sharp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Double_sharp" title="User talk:Double sharp">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">SSTflyer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer" title="User talk:SSTflyer">talk</a>) at 13:54, 5 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article passess!</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Article:</p>
<ul>
<li>Has far more than 1500 characters</li>
<li>Is not new, but has been expanded more than 5x by nominator in the past week</li>
<li>Is Good Article status</li>
<li>Has sufficient inline citations</li>
<li>Meets core policies, etc.</li>
</ul>
<p>Hook:</p>
<ul>
<li>Hook is interesting</li>
<li>Hook is very concise and short</li>
<li>Has a citation in article</li>
</ul>
<p>Nominator:</p>
<ul>
<li>Has reviewed another article</li>
<li>5x expanded article</li>
</ul>
<p>Well done! <a href="/wiki/User:Fritzmann2002" title="User:Fritzmann2002">Fritzmann2002</a> 7 October 2015 8:19 (UTC)</p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Prado_Navarette_v._California">Prado Navarette v. California</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPrado_Navarette_v._California&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Prado_Navarette_v._California&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States" title="Supreme Court of the United States">Supreme Court of the United States</a> ruled <b><a href="/wiki/Prado_Navarette_v._California" title="Prado Navarette v. California">in a 2014 decision</a></b> that police officers may conduct traffic stops even if they never personally observe a traffic violation?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that Justice <a href="/wiki/Antonin_Scalia" title="Antonin Scalia">Antonin Scalia</a> said <b><a href="/wiki/Prado_Navarette_v._California" title="Prado Navarette v. California">a 2014 United States Supreme Court opinion</a></b> was a "freedom-destroying cocktail"?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Almendralejo" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Almendralejo">Almendralejo</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 22:43, 4 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Almost_Impossible_Game_Show">The Almost Impossible Game Show</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Almost_Impossible_Game_Show&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Almost_Impossible_Game_Show&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/The_Almost_Impossible_Game_Show" title="The Almost Impossible Game Show">The Almost Impossible Game Show</a></b> is based on a German format?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Du%27a_Arafah" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Du'a Arafah">Template:Did you know nominations/Du'a Arafah</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer">Launchballer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:25, 4 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I think there could potentially be a very interesting or funny hook for this article, especially if the hook mentions one of the games from the show, but there are two problems with this nomination at the moment. First, per <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKSG" title="Wikipedia:DYKSG" class="mw-redirect">WP:DYKSG</a> D6, the dispute tags should be resolved. Additionally, <s>per <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKSG" title="Wikipedia:DYKSG" class="mw-redirect">WP:DYKSG</a> D7, the unexpanded headers should be expanded</s>. I am happy to review this again later once these issues are resolved. Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 00:10, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>What unexpanded headers? They've all got at least one subsection.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 07:46, 13 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>After taking a closer look at this, it does appear that the unexpanded headers do, in fact, have expanded subsections. I was thrown off by the fact that the major headers are the same size/font as the minor headers. Although this may technically satisfy the requirements for D7, I think there may be a better way to present this information. Maybe you can put it into a table? Also, have you thought about using one of the games from the show as the basis for a hook? I think that could potentially be more interesting than telling readers the show was based on a German format. Once you resolve the issues with the dispute tags, I will take another look at this nomination. Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 07:53, 13 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>There is a difference, as the contents page shows. I have college now but I'll have a look later in the day.--<span style="background:#FF0;font-family:Rockwell Extra Bold"><a href="/wiki/User:Launchballer" title="User:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">Laun</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Launchballer" title="User talk:Launchballer"><font color="#00F">chba</font></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Launchballer" title="Special:Contributions/Launchballer"><font color="#00F">ller</font></a></span> 08:00, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_5">Articles created/expanded on October 5</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=38" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 5">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Frame_Lake">Frame Lake</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFrame_Lake&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Frame_Lake&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Frame_Lake_02.jpg" class="image" title="Frame Lake in 2005"><img alt="Frame Lake in 2005" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Frame_Lake_02.jpg/120px-Frame_Lake_02.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Frame_Lake_02.jpg/180px-Frame_Lake_02.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Frame_Lake_02.jpg/240px-Frame_Lake_02.jpg 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="480" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Frame Lake in 2005</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that biologists who studied <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/Frame_Lake" title="Frame Lake">Frame Lake</a></b> (<i>pictured</i>) in 1972 found its <a href="/wiki/Zooplankton" title="Zooplankton">zooplankton</a> population to be much more typical of lakes west of the <a href="/wiki/Continental_Divide_of_the_Americas" title="Continental Divide of the Americas">Continental Divide</a> than east?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknifers</a> no longer swim in the city's <b><a href="/wiki/Frame_Lake" title="Frame Lake">Frame Lake</a></b> (<i>pictured</i>) out of fear of <a href="/wiki/Leech" title="Leech">leeches</a> in the water?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/El_Hijo_de_Dos_Caras" title="Template:Did you know nominations/El Hijo de Dos Caras">El Hijo de Dos Caras</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Sorry I'm a little late with this ... I blame the U.S. holiday weekend</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 03:42, 13 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Andreas_Panayiotou_.28businessman.29">Andreas Panayiotou (businessman)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAndreas_Panayiotou_%28businessman%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Andreas_Panayiotou_%28businessman%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Andreas_Panayiotou_(businessman)" title="Andreas Panayiotou (businessman)">Andreas Panayiotou</a></b> was once the UK's largest private landlord, until he sold up in 2006/07 and moved into hotels?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Andreas_Panayiotou_(businessman)" title="Andreas Panayiotou (businessman)">Andreas Panayiotou</a></b> was kicked out of school aged 14, for punching his teacher, and became an amateur boxing champion and the UK's largest private landlord?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: yet to be done</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Other hooks welcome</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 22:20, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Chilly_McIntosh">Chilly McIntosh</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FChilly_McIntosh&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chilly_McIntosh&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Chilly_McIntosh" title="Chilly McIntosh">Chilly McIntosh</a></b> became a leading figure in the Creek Nation after he escaped the death penalty for signing an agreement to sell Creek tribal land?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Chilly_McIntosh" title="Chilly McIntosh">Chilly McIntosh</a></b> was the son of one Creek principal chief, and the nephew of another?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that, nearly assassinated for agreeing to sell Creek tribal lands, <b><a href="/wiki/Chilly_McIntosh" title="Chilly McIntosh">Chilly McIntosh</a></b> later became a respected and influential figure in the <a href="/wiki/Creek_Nation" title="Creek Nation" class="mw-redirect">Creek Nation</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: QPQ <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/James_Scott_(marine)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/James Scott (marine)">James Scott (marine)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Bruin2" title="User:Bruin2">Bruin2</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bruin2" title="User talk:Bruin2">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:11, 9 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="US_federal_recognition_of_Native_Hawaiians">US federal recognition of Native Hawaiians</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FUS_federal_recognition_of_Native_Hawaiians&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=United_States_federal_recognition_of_Native_Hawaiians&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a> is creating a <a href="/wiki/Native_Hawaiians" title="Native Hawaiians">Native Hawaiian</a> <a href="/wiki/Tribe_(Native_American)" title="Tribe (Native American)">tribal nation</a> in <a href="/wiki/Hawaii" title="Hawaii">Hawaii</a> with elections of <a href="/wiki/Delegates" title="Delegates" class="mw-redirect">delegates</a> for a $2.6 million <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_convention_(political_meeting)" title="Constitutional convention (political meeting)">constitutional convention</a> for <b><a href="/wiki/United_States_federal_recognition_of_Native_Hawaiians" title="United States federal recognition of Native Hawaiians">its federal recognition of Native Hawaiians</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Mark_Miller" title="User:Mark Miller">Mark Miller</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mark_Miller" title="User talk:Mark Miller">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 04:02, 7 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<p><br /></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Chronicler_of_the_Winds">Chronicler of the Winds</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FChronicler_of_the_Winds&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chronicler_of_the_Winds&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg" class="image" title="Henning Mankell in 2011"><img alt="Henning Mankell in 2011" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg/120px-Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg" width="120" height="150" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg/180px-Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg/240px-Henning_Mankell_3_2011_Shankbone.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1539" data-file-height="1924" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Henning Mankell in 2011</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Henning_Mankell" title="Henning Mankell">Henning Mankell</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, known for Inspector Wallander, made a 10-year-old <a href="/wiki/Street_children" title="Street children">street boy</a> in a port city in Africa the main character in his novel <i><b><a href="/wiki/Chronicler_of_the_Winds" title="Chronicler of the Winds">Chronicler of the Winds</a></b></i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/The_Punishment_of_Lust" title="Template:Did you know nominations/The Punishment of Lust">The Punishment of Lust</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: a work by an author who just died, - can we honour him with an image?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Vartan_Mahokian">Vartan Mahokian</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVartan_Mahokian&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Vartan_Mahokian.jpg" class="image" title="Vartan Mahokian"><img alt="Vartan Mahokian" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Vartan_Mahokian.jpg/120px-Vartan_Mahokian.jpg" width="120" height="165" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Vartan_Mahokian.jpg/180px-Vartan_Mahokian.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/9e/Vartan_Mahokian.jpg 2x" data-file-width="196" data-file-height="269" /></a>

</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that having escaped a massacre, painter <b><a href="/wiki/Vartan_Mahokian" title="Vartan Mahokian">Vartan Mahokian</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> continued to paint and earned himself a Legion of Honor?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Sonam_Kapoor" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Sonam Kapoor">Template:Did you know nominations/Sonam Kapoor</a></li>

</dd>
</dl>

<ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Goa_Vikas_Party">Goa Vikas Party</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FGoa_Vikas_Party&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Goa_Vikas_Party&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Goa_Vikas_Party" title="Goa Vikas Party">Goa Vikas Party</a></b>, which has two seats in the 40-member <a href="/wiki/Goa_Legislative_Assembly" title="Goa Legislative Assembly">legislature</a> of the Indian state of <a href="/wiki/Goa" title="Goa">Goa</a>, is a part of the ruling coalition in the state?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Bharatiya29" title="User:Bharatiya29">Bharatiya29</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bharatiya29" title="User talk:Bharatiya29">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 14:26, 5 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Not an uninteresting hook, though I think it could be improved by quoting the commentary from the source as to this being a "thank you" to Pacheco (but that is my purely subjective opinion). New enough, (barely) long enough. Neutral, well-sourced, no copyvios or plagiarism of any sort. <a href="/wiki/User:Dahn" title="User:Dahn">Dahn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Dahn" title="User talk:Dahn">talk</a>) 12:06, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>The "thank you" to Pacheco was his induction to the cabinet. His party was a part of the ruling coalition from earlier. <a href="/wiki/User:Bharatiya29" title="User:Bharatiya29">Bharatiya29</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bharatiya29" title="User talk:Bharatiya29">talk</a>) 17:26, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="South_American_tern">South American tern</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSouth_American_tern&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=South_American_tern&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that in 1877, on a single beach in Argentina there were estimated to be 67,500 nests containing 112,500 eggs of the <b><a href="/wiki/South_American_tern" title="South American tern">South American tern</a></b>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Hacksaw_Ridge" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Hacksaw Ridge">Hacksaw Ridge</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 05:49, 9 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><b>ALT 1:</b> … that an estimated 67,500 <b><a href="/wiki/South_American_tern" title="South American tern">South American tern</a></b> nests containing 112,500 eggs were found on a single 150 yards (140&#160;m) stretch of beach in <a href="/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>?</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article was expanded 5x in past 5 days; article is long enough and is adequately references with no evidence of plagiarism; hook is appropriate length and reference is good. However, I suggest the hook be changed to emphasize the small size of the beach rather than the year of the observation (see <b>ALT 1</b> above)…I think that’s more interesting. In either case, DYK is good to go.--<a href="/wiki/User:Orygun" title="User:Orygun">Orygun</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Orygun" title="User talk:Orygun">talk</a>) 19:42, 11 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Thanks. ALT1 is better, and I have struck the original. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 05:00, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Harry_Anthony">Harry Anthony</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FHarry_Anthony&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Harry_Anthony&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Billy_Murray_(singer)" title="Billy Murray (singer)">Billy Murray</a> referred to <b><a href="/wiki/Harry_Anthony" title="Harry Anthony">Harry Anthony</a></b> as one of the "Come-to-Jesus-Twins"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Harry_Anthony" title="Harry Anthony">Harry Anthony</a></b> replaced <a href="/wiki/John_Bieling" title="John Bieling">John Bieling</a> in the <a href="/wiki/American_Quartet_(ensemble)" title="American Quartet (ensemble)">American Quartet</a>?</li>

</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="American_Crane_Corporation">American Crane Corporation</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAmerican_Crane_Corporation&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the construction of the <a href="/wiki/Panama_Canal" title="Panama Canal">Panama Canal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mount_Rushmore" title="Mount Rushmore">Mount Rushmore</a> used cranes from <b><a href="/wiki/American_Crane_Corporation" title="American Crane Corporation">American Crane Corporation</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Emma_Martin_(socialist)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Emma Martin (socialist)">Emma Martin (socialist)</a></li>

</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Excel23" title="User:Excel23">Excel23</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Excel23" title="User talk:Excel23">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:MatthewVanitas" title="User:MatthewVanitas">MatthewVanitas</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:MatthewVanitas" title="User talk:MatthewVanitas">talk</a>). <dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough (promoted from draft on day of submission), long enough (just under 2,000 characters), within policy and <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=American+Crane+Corporation&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">free of copyright violations</a>, QPQ is done, and there is no image. There was one issue - that the hook wasn't cited - but I saw which source it was and <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=American_Crane_Corporation&amp;type=revision&amp;diff=686118597&amp;oldid=684365134">fixed the issue</a>. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:The Squirrel Conspiracy (page does not exist)">The Squirrel Conspiracy</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy" title="User talk:The Squirrel Conspiracy">talk</a>) 03:40, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

BTW, I think the hook would be better to show the name of the company at the time of the construction of those landmarks. --<a href="/wiki/User:PFHLai" title="User:PFHLai">PFHLai</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:PFHLai" title="User talk:PFHLai">talk</a>) 13:34, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

I'll defer to the second opinion though. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:The Squirrel Conspiracy (page does not exist)">The Squirrel Conspiracy</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy" title="User talk:The Squirrel Conspiracy">talk</a>) 19:50, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Max_Birnstiel">Max Birnstiel</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMax_Birnstiel&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Max_Birnstiel&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Swiss biologist <b><a href="/wiki/Max_Birnstiel" title="Max Birnstiel">Max Birnstiel</a></b> was one of the first scientists to purify a single <a href="/wiki/Gene" title="Gene">gene</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that Swiss biologist <b><a href="/wiki/Max_Birnstiel" title="Max Birnstiel">Max Birnstiel</a></b> was the founding director of the <a href="/wiki/Research_Institute_of_Molecular_Pathology" title="Research Institute of Molecular Pathology">Research Institute of Molecular Pathology</a>, which helped establish the <a href="/wiki/Biotechnology" title="Biotechnology">biotechnology</a> industry in <a href="/wiki/Vienna" title="Vienna">Vienna</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Reversible_cellular_automaton" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Reversible cellular automaton">Reversible cellular automaton</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Opabinia_regalis" title="User:Opabinia regalis">Opabinia regalis</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Opabinia_regalis" title="User talk:Opabinia regalis">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 06:10, 7 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I love the first hook, but I am concerned that the article says "His research group is <i>sometimes</i> cited as the first to purify single genes", suggesting that it is not as definite as the hook makes it sound. I can't access the full source so I can't see the wording used. I would also suggest repeating that claim (and the one that follows it in the lead, about gene enhancer elements) in the section about his career. <a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:97198" title="User talk:97198">talk</a>) 10:48, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a>:</span> Hmm, you don't think "one of" is enough of a hedge? The lac operon isolation mentioned in the article is more commonly recognized as "the first", but that's not accurate. The PNAS obit says "This was the first time a single gene had been purified, predating the isolation of the bacterial lac operon gene—sometimes hailed as the first gene isolation—by 3 years." I also added a book by another scientist who was active in early molecular genetics, citing his discussion of Birnstiel's work. <a href="/wiki/User:Opabinia_regalis" title="User:Opabinia regalis">Opabinia regalis</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Opabinia_regalis" title="User talk:Opabinia regalis">talk</a>) 18:45, 7 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Actually on second thought, I agree that the hook is fine – "one of" covers all bases. Both hooks are interesting and cited (primarily to offline sources) but I think the original is snappier. The article itself is new enough, long enough, well referenced, neutral, and has no close paraphrasing from the sources I can access. Nice work! <a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:97198" title="User talk:97198">talk</a>) 05:48, 8 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Local_authorities_swaps_litigation">Local authorities swaps litigation</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLocal_authorities_swaps_litigation&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Local_authorities_swaps_litigation&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that over 200 separate lawsuits were filed as part of <b><a href="/wiki/Local_authorities_swaps_litigation" title="Local authorities swaps litigation">local authorities swaps litigation</a></b> after the English courts ruled that <a href="/wiki/Swap_(finance)" title="Swap (finance)">swap transactions</a> between banks and <a href="/wiki/Local_government_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="Local government in the United Kingdom">local authorities</a> were unlawful ....?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Legis" title="User:Legis">Legis</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Legis" title="User talk:Legis">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:52, 6 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Golem_Arcana">Golem Arcana</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FGolem_Arcana&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Golem_Arcana&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Golem_Arcana" title="Golem Arcana">Golem Arcana</a></b></i> is a <a href="/wiki/Miniature_wargaming" title="Miniature wargaming">miniature wargaming</a> game that interfaces with a digital app through the use of a <a href="/wiki/Bluetooth" title="Bluetooth">Bluetooth</a> stylus?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Miniature_wargaming" title="Miniature wargaming">miniature wargaming</a> game <i><b><a href="/wiki/Golem_Arcana" title="Golem Arcana">Golem Arcana</a></b></i> collects <a href="/wiki/Aggregate_data" title="Aggregate data">aggregate data</a> on the decisions that players make in the game and uses it to alter the game's lore?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/American_Crane_Corporation" title="Template:Did you know nominations/American Crane Corporation">Template:Did you know nominations/American Crane Corporation</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:The Squirrel Conspiracy (page does not exist)">The Squirrel Conspiracy</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy" title="User talk:The Squirrel Conspiracy">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 03:36, 6 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
