<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_7">Articles created/expanded on October 7</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=40" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 7">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Corruption_in_South_Sudan">Corruption in South Sudan</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCorruption_in_South_Sudan&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Corruption_in_South_Sudan&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_South_Sudan" title="Corruption in South Sudan">Corruption in South Sudan</a> is surpassed only by <a href="/wiki/Somalia" title="Somalia">Somalia</a>, <a href="/wiki/North_Korea" title="North Korea">North Korea</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sudan" title="Sudan">Sudan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Afghanistan" title="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the "Dura Saga" in which food shipments to combat famine disappeared and were appropriated by government officials is considered the worst instance of <a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_South_Sudan" title="Corruption in South Sudan">Corruption in South Sudan</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the worst instance of <a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_South_Sudan" title="Corruption in South Sudan">Corruption in South Sudan</a> was the "Dura Saga" in which millions of dollars worth of grains and cereals were stolen by government officials?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_South_Sudan" title="Corruption in South Sudan">Corruption in South Sudan</a> allowed for nearly a billion dollars to vanish from 2005-2006 in the newly independent nation?</li>
<li><b>ALT4</b>:... that President <a href="/wiki/Salva_Kiir_Mayardit" title="Salva Kiir Mayardit">Salva Kiir Mayardit</a> has made attempts to combat <a href="/wiki/Corruption_in_South_Sudan" title="Corruption in South Sudan">Corruption in South Sudan</a> but has lacked the resources and domestic support to do so?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:DaltonCastle" title="User:DaltonCastle">DaltonCastle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:DaltonCastle" title="User talk:DaltonCastle">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:46, 15 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Transylvanian_rugs">Transylvanian rugs</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FTransylvanian_rugs&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transylvanian_rugs&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that "Transylvanian rugs" were woven in Anatolia and used to adorn Christian churches?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:HajjiBaba" title="User:HajjiBaba">HajjiBaba</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:HajjiBaba" title="User talk:HajjiBaba">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 08:16, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Karl_Uchermann">Karl Uchermann</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FKarl_Uchermann&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Karl_Uchermann&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg" class="image" title="Five dogs. Painting from 1880 by Karl Uchermann."><img alt="Five dogs. Painting from 1880 by Karl Uchermann." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg/120px-Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg" width="120" height="89" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg/180px-Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg/240px-Karl_Uchermann_Flamsk_hundeforspann.jpg 2x" data-file-width="513" data-file-height="380" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Five dogs. Painting from 1880 by Karl Uchermann.</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Karl_Uchermann" title="Karl Uchermann">Karl Uchermann</a></b> is known for his many portraits of dogs <i>(example pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Karl_Uchermann" title="Karl Uchermann">Karl Uchermann</a></b> designed the world's first practical <a href="/wiki/Franking" title="Franking">franking</a> machine?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Stephanie_Langhoff" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Stephanie Langhoff">Stephanie Langhoff</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Foreign_Direct_Investment_in_India">Foreign Direct Investment in India</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FForeign_Direct_Investment_in_India&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Foreign_Direct_Investment_in_India&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in 2015 <a href="/wiki/India" title="India">India</a> surpassed <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="People's Republic of China" class="mw-redirect">China</a> and the <a href="/wiki/USA" title="USA" class="mw-redirect">USA</a> to become <b><a href="/wiki/Foreign_Direct_Investment_in_India" title="Foreign Direct Investment in India">top destination for Foreign Direct Investment</a></b> in the world?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Anniyan" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Anniyan">Template:Did you know nominations/Anniyan</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

At the moment, 6 refs are just pasted there. Let the readers know which ref is supporting which sentence(s). <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 05:50, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dd>None of what <a href="/wiki/User:Dharmadhyaksha" title="User:Dharmadhyaksha">Dharmadhyaksha</a> mentioned, although were worthy of attention, had nothing to do with <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYK#Eligibility_criteria" title="Wikipedia:DYK" class="mw-redirect">DYK criteria</a> and the DYK process for this article won't be stopped by them. You can address those problems thorough the article talk page. However, let's see what <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> thinks about it. <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 18:05, 12 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Actually this article can be extended at any length, there are 25-30 sectors in which India gets FDI, one can make subsection on each sector and can write 2-4 paras on each. There are 25-50 nations who invest in India, whole details can be written on this, as far as history is concerned, history of FDI since independence of India or even before that can be written. So this article can become as long as we want. But this much iprovement may takes week, so I nominated it within time because it was having 1500 characters and was summarizinf thigngs. Article already says FDI norms in 25 sectors have been relaxed. Points of Dharmadhyaksha are good as fae as improvement in article is concerned. But it will take time. I have to do some economic research for that. I will improve article. If we follow Dharmadhyakshas advice then article can even get GA status. But I think article serves DYK purpose. Still I will improve article as much as possible till it gets promoted. For example you can see my sandbox, <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Human3015/sandbox" title="User talk:Human3015/sandbox">User talk:Human3015/sandbox</a>, I have prepared chart, does that chet is encyclopedic or not? Can I include that in article? --<a href="/wiki/User:Human3015" title="User:Human3015"><b><span style="color:#0000FF;">Human</span><span style="color:#808000&#160;;">3015</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Human3015" title="User talk:Human3015"><span style="color:#FF1493"><b><small><sup>TALK</sup></small></b></span></a>&#160; 19:09, 12 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:Human3015" title="User:Human3015">Human3015</a>: As I said above, there's no need to expand the article for the DYK to be passed and the current state (size &amp; content) of the article is acceptable. However, you're suggested to expand it whenever you find reliable materials about the subject. <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 13:20, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Thanks <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> for guidance, I was also thinking that article has enough length and info for the subject. I'm relatively new at DYK arena, have 2 DYK credits (both of them got within last one week including today's). So suggestions and support from people like you are always helpful and encouraging. --<a href="/wiki/User:Human3015" title="User:Human3015"><b><span style="color:#0000FF;">Human</span><span style="color:#808000&#160;;">3015</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Human3015" title="User talk:Human3015"><span style="color:#FF1493"><b><small><sup>TALK</sup></small></b></span></a>&#160; 18:10, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="University_of_Hong_Kong_pro-vice-chancellor_selection_incident">University of Hong Kong pro-vice-chancellor selection incident</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FUniversity_of_Hong_Kong_pro-vice-chancellor_selection_incident&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=University_of_Hong_Kong_pro-vice-chancellor_selection_controversy&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg" class="image" title="Johannes Chan"><img alt="Johannes Chan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg/120px-Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg" width="120" height="82" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg/180px-Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg/240px-Johannes_Chan_Man-mun.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1980" data-file-height="1357" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Johannes Chan</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Hong_Kong" title="University of Hong Kong">University of Hong Kong</a> council's decision to reject <a href="/wiki/Johannes_Chan" title="Johannes Chan">Johannes Chan</a>'s <i>(pictured)</i> appointment to <a href="/wiki/Pro-vice-chancellor" title="Pro-vice-chancellor">pro-vice-chancellor</a> <b><a href="/wiki/University_of_Hong_Kong_pro-vice-chancellor_selection_controversy" title="University of Hong Kong pro-vice-chancellor selection controversy">sparked protests</a></b> by students and staff members of the University?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Jerome_A._Cohen" title="Jerome A. Cohen">Jerome A. Cohen</a> criticised the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Hong_Kong" title="University of Hong Kong">University of Hong Kong</a> council's <b><a href="/wiki/University_of_Hong_Kong_pro-vice-chancellor_selection_controversy" title="University of Hong Kong pro-vice-chancellor selection controversy">decision to reject</a></b> <a href="/wiki/Johannes_Chan" title="Johannes Chan">Johannes Chan</a>'s <i>(pictured)</i> appointment to <a href="/wiki/Pro-vice-chancellor" title="Pro-vice-chancellor">pro-vice-chancellor</a> as "very sad news for Hong Kong's autonomy and freedom"?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Arthur_Darby_Nock" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Arthur Darby Nock">Arthur Darby Nock</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Failing ITN nom, which I participated. Writing hooks related to the topic isn't easy, but I hope I pulled it off. Otherwise, feel free to write suggestions.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The hook seems to be diametrically opposed to the article: the hook says "bias toward" which indicates to me that it's favoring the Arabic-speaking residents, while the article says "bias against", which indicates to me that it's favoring the Hebrew-speaking residents at the expense of the Arabic-speaking ones, and this latter is what's stated in the source's lede. Please revise the hook to reflect the article and its sources. Thanks. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 16:24, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>
<li>Sorry about that. I fixed the hook. <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 16:30, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ermua">Ermua</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FErmua&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 06:07, 9 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="1987_Carapintada_mutiny">1987 Carapintada mutiny</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F1987_Carapintada_mutiny&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=1987_Carapintada_mutiny&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg" class="image" title="Argentine president Raúl Alfonsín during the mutiny"><img alt="Argentine president Raúl Alfonsín during the mutiny" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/70/Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg/120px-Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg" width="120" height="67" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/70/Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg/180px-Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/70/Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg/240px-Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn_con_i_carapintadas_1987.jpg 2x" data-file-width="700" data-file-height="390" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Argentine president <a href="/wiki/Ra%C3%BAl_Alfons%C3%ADn" title="Raúl Alfonsín">Raúl Alfonsín</a> during the mutiny</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the mutineers of the Argentine <b><a href="/wiki/1987_Carapintada_mutiny" title="1987 Carapintada mutiny">1987 Carapintada mutiny</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> were named "<a href="/wiki/Carapintadas" title="Carapintadas">Carapintadas</a>" for their use of <a href="/wiki/Military_camouflage" title="Military camouflage">military camouflage</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: (<i>pending</i>)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Cambalachero" title="User:Cambalachero">Cambalachero</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cambalachero" title="User talk:Cambalachero">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 18:51, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="It_Is_the_Law">It Is the Law</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FIt_Is_the_Law&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=It_Is_the_Law&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that moviegoers in 1924 saw Justin Victor get away with murder because <i><b><a href="/wiki/It_Is_the_Law" title="It Is the Law">It Is the Law</a></b></i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/It_Is_the_Law" title="It Is the Law">It Is the Law</a></b></i> was the final film directed by <a href="/wiki/J._Gordon_Edwards" title="J. Gordon Edwards">J. Gordon Edwards</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Fatimid_desecration_of_Jerusalem" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Fatimid desecration of Jerusalem">Fatimid desecration of Jerusalem</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: It is admittedly debatable whether the first hook "involves the real world in some way" sufficient to satisfy that criterion. On the other hand, it's much punchier. ALT1 is an absolutely real-world alternative, but uninteresting to most readers (who won't be familiar with Edwards).</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>This was submitted as a new-article DYK, but it is now additionally a Good Article. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 13:46, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:43, 7 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I'm dubious that the moviegoers and the year sufficiently involves the real world, and am proposing a slight alteration that adds another layer of real world info, which I hope doesn't reduce the interest level that much:</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT2</b> ... that moviegoers in 1924 saw <a href="/wiki/Herbert_Hayes" title="Herbert Hayes" class="mw-redirect">Herbert Hayes</a> as Justin Victor get away with murder because <i><b><a href="/wiki/It_Is_the_Law" title="It Is the Law">It Is the Law</a></b></i>?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd>If you don't like it, <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a>, feel free to strike it. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 16:39, 15 October 2015 (UTC)

<dd>No objection here. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 16:44, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Chikan.2C_Kaiping">Chikan, Kaiping</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FChikan%2C_Kaiping&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chikan%2C_Kaiping&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road(European_Styled_Street).jpg" class="image" title="Chikan waterfront dominated by Tong Lau dating from the early 20th century"><img alt="Chikan waterfront dominated by Tong Lau dating from the early 20th century" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road%28European_Styled_Street%29.jpg/120px-Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road%28European_Styled_Street%29.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road%28European_Styled_Street%29.jpg/180px-Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road%28European_Styled_Street%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road%28European_Styled_Street%29.jpg/240px-Tong_Lau_along_Dixi_Road%28European_Styled_Street%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2624" data-file-height="1968" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Chikan waterfront dominated by Tong Lau dating from the early 20th century</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the historic town of <b><a href="/wiki/Chikan,_Kaiping" title="Chikan, Kaiping">Chikan, Kaiping</a></b> has more than 600 <a href="/wiki/Tong_lau" title="Tong lau">Tong lau</a>, stretching along over 3 kilometers of roads?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Wishds" title="User:Wishds">Wishds</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Wishds" title="User talk:Wishds">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 09:22, 7 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article is new enough and has over the required number (1896) characters. However, the sources are kind of problematic. Ref 1 (qcoco.com), for instance, is a forum and thus cannot be used as a reliable source. The article does not cite a single academic source. <a href="/wiki/User:Yerevantsi" title="User:Yerevantsi"><font color="red"><b>Ե</b></font><font color="black">րևանցի</font></a> <a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yerevantsi" title="User talk:Yerevantsi"><sup>talk</sup></a> 10:23, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> At least one of those sources is a government source. One seems to be a news site. This is a fairly new editor, so maybe someone else familiar with Chinese articles can have a look at this. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 23:25, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election.2C_October_2015">Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election, October 2015</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSpeaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election%2C_October_2015&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election%2C_October_2015&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 100px;"><a href="/wiki/File:John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg" class="image" title="John Boehner"><img alt="John Boehner" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg/100px-John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg" width="100" height="125" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg/150px-John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg/200px-John_Boehner_official_portrait.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="1280" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">John Boehner</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that according to members of the <a href="/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="United States House of Representatives">United States House of Representatives</a>, the <b><a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election,_October_2015" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election, October 2015">October 2015 election</a></b> to succeed <a href="/wiki/John_Boehner" title="John Boehner">John Boehner</a> <i>(pictured)</i> as <a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives">Speaker of the House</a> has turned the body into a "<a href="/wiki/Banana_republic" title="Banana republic">banana republic</a>"?
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... open to suggestions.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Kate_Macintosh" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Kate Macintosh">Template:Did you know nominations/Kate Macintosh</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: This election is sort of unprecedented and an ongoing shitshow (to use parliamentary terminology, so facts will change, and so will the ideal hook. "Banana republic" is a direct quote from <a href="/wiki/Peter_T._King" title="Peter T. King">Peter T. King</a> (as cited in the article) and <a href="/wiki/Thomas_Massie" title="Thomas Massie">Thomas Massie</a> (not cited in the article, but <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://blogs.rollcall.com/218/speaker-election-delay-stirs-conservative-anger/">here's his quote</a>). Images could be used for any relevant House member since their headshots are PD-US.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Muboshgu" title="User:Muboshgu">Muboshgu</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Muboshgu" title="User talk:Muboshgu">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 18:13, 10 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article is new enough and long enough. The image is in the public domain, the article is neutral and no close paraphrasing was found. My query concerns the hook - in the article only a single member has an inline citation for his "banana republic" quip (the hook says "members"), and what exactly does the comment apply to, the House of Representatives or the process of electing a speaker? <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 05:19, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>
<ul>
<li>I added that Massie said "banana republic" to that part of the article. Their specific quotes and source are:
<ul>
<li>Thomas Massie: <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://blogs.rollcall.com/218/speaker-election-delay-stirs-conservative-anger/">“What’s this tell the American people? It looks like a banana republic here.”</a></li>
<li>Peter King: <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/republicans-struggle-to-regain-their-footing-as-a-party/2015/10/08/ed24da96-6de1-11e5-9bfe-e59f5e244f92_story.html">“it is total confusion — a banana republic,”</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>I think the comments refer to the House itself, but in the context of the election. I'm still open to a better hook, though, if there is one. –&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Muboshgu" title="User:Muboshgu">Muboshgu</a>&#160;(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Muboshgu#top" title="User talk:Muboshgu">talk</a>) 20:27, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ni_no_Kuni">Ni no Kuni</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNi_no_Kuni&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ni_no_Kuni&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni" title="Ni no Kuni">Ni no Kuni</a></b></i> was conceived as a project for <a href="/wiki/Level-5_(video_game_company)" title="Level-5 (video game company)">Level-5</a>'s tenth anniversary?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni" title="Ni no Kuni">Ni no Kuni</a></b></i> series consists of three <a href="/wiki/Role-playing_video_game" title="Role-playing video game">role-playing</a> games and one <a href="/wiki/Collectible_card_game" title="Collectible card game">social card</a> game?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that only one <i><b><a href="/wiki/Ni_no_Kuni" title="Ni no Kuni">Ni no Kuni</a></b></i> game was <a href="/wiki/Dub_localization" title="Dub localization">localized</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Kirby%27s_Block_Ball" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Kirby's Block Ball">Kirby's Block Ball</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Rhain1999" title="User:Rhain1999">Rhain1999</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rhain1999" title="User talk:Rhain1999">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 11:06, 10 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Promoted to GA in a timely manner, and certainly long enough. Well-written and cited, per GA demands. First hook is well sourced, the second does not have a source immediately after the information in the article. I looked on the nearest reference to it but couldn't find the information. On the third hook, I can't find affirmation that only one game was localized: reference 37 does not say which game was localized, it is named in #38, but that has no mention that it was the only one. The first hook should be good to go, if you are preferring the alternatives we may have to work on the referencing <a href="/wiki/User:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User:The Almightey Drill">'''tAD'''</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User talk:The Almightey Drill">talk</a>) 17:15, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Thanks, <a href="/wiki/User:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User:The Almightey Drill">The Almightey Drill</a>. The alternatives are not directly mentioned in any of the references; instead, they're implied through multiple references (one stating that <i>Wrath of the White Witch</i> was localised, and one stating that <i>Dominion of the Dark Djinn</i> was not, etc.). If this isn't allowed, then I'm very happy with using the main hook instead. – <a href="/wiki/User:Rhain1999" title="User:Rhain1999"><span style="color: #008;"><i><b>Rhain</b></i>1999</span></a> <sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rhain1999" title="User talk:Rhain1999">talk to me</a>)</sup> 07:30, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Impossible_Is_Nothing_.28Iggy_Azalea_song.29">Impossible Is Nothing (Iggy Azalea song)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FImpossible_Is_Nothing_%28Iggy_Azalea_song%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Impossible_Is_Nothing_%28Iggy_Azalea_song%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that <a href="/wiki/Iggy_Azalea" title="Iggy Azalea">Iggy Azalea</a>'s "<b><a href="/wiki/Impossible_Is_Nothing_(Iggy_Azalea_song)" title="Impossible Is Nothing (Iggy Azalea song)">Impossible Is Nothing</a></b>" was compared to songs by <a href="/wiki/Eminem" title="Eminem">Eminem</a>, specifically from his 2010 album, <i><a href="/wiki/Recovery_(Eminem_album)" title="Recovery (Eminem album)">Recovery</a></i>?</s></li>
</ul>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Coolmarc" title="User:Coolmarc">Coolmarc</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Coolmarc" title="User talk:Coolmarc">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:03, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Article was promoted to GAN on October 3, nominated for DYK on October 8.</li>
<li>At 6720 character, it exceeds 1500 minimum requirement.</li>
<li>Hook is sourced and cited.</li>
<li>It is within policy.</li>
<li>Nominator has received five DYK credits. The rules are slightly ambiguous ("nominator has fewer than five DYK credits (whether or not self-nominated) then the nomination is exempt from QPQ") so I assume nominator is exempt, but will not be next time.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>However, the hook is boring and is not interesting. It doesn't even give an example of how or why it received comparisons, and this detail can't be done in a DYK hook. I don't understand why so many clauses are being used either, because it makes it longwinded. Reading the article, a hook about the song being about "underdog triumphalism", or "raps the track's aspirational lyrics with a mantra technique" would be far more likely to grab my attention and make me click to read more. Saying it is similar to Eminem songs without explaining why would not make me click to read more. <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> &#160;—&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Calvin999" title="User:Calvin999"><b style="color:#595454">Calvin999</b></a> 18:17, 10 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Hello <a href="/wiki/User:Calvin999" title="User:Calvin999">Calvin999</a>. First of all, thank you for fixing the template for me. This is my first DYK nomination, it was purely by accident. I thought had I explained why it was similar to Eminem's songs, the hook would have become too long. I appreciate your alternative hook suggestions, is there one you specifically think would work? Please let me know. Thanks. <b><a href="/wiki/User:Coolmarc" title="User:Coolmarc"><font face="tahoma" color="#000000">Cool</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Coolmarc" title="User talk:Coolmarc"><font face="tahoma" color="#00BFFF">Marc</font></a></b> 06:50, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've given you suggestions, it's up to you to provide alternative hooks, not me. You could probably come up with a way of combing both of my suggestions into a short, snappy hook. People will click on that. &#160;—&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Calvin999" title="User:Calvin999"><b style="color:#595454">Calvin999</b></a> 10:38, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>How does this sound: <b>ALT1</b>: ... that <a href="/wiki/Iggy_Azalea" title="Iggy Azalea">Iggy Azalea</a> raps the "<a href="/wiki/Underdog_(term)" title="Underdog (term)">underdog</a> <a href="/wiki/Triumphalism" title="Triumphalism">triumphalism</a>" lyrics to "<b><a href="/wiki/Impossible_Is_Nothing_(Iggy_Azalea_song)" title="Impossible Is Nothing (Iggy Azalea song)">Impossible Is Nothing</a></b>" with a <a href="/wiki/Mantra" title="Mantra">mantra</a> technique? <b><a href="/wiki/User:Coolmarc" title="User:Coolmarc"><font face="tahoma" color="#000000">Cool</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Coolmarc" title="User talk:Coolmarc"><font face="tahoma" color="#00BFFF">Marc</font></a></b> 11:57, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>How about <b>ALT2</b>: ... that <a href="/wiki/Iggy_Azalea" title="Iggy Azalea">Iggy Azalea</a> employs a <a href="/wiki/Mantra" title="Mantra">mantra</a> technique to <a href="/wiki/Rapping" title="Rapping">rap</a> "<b><a href="/wiki/Impossible_Is_Nothing_(Iggy_Azalea_song)" title="Impossible Is Nothing (Iggy Azalea song)">Impossible Is Nothing</a></b>"‍ '​s "<a href="/wiki/Underdog_(term)" title="Underdog (term)">underdog</a> <a href="/wiki/Triumphalism" title="Triumphalism">triumphalism</a>" lyrics? &#160;—&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Calvin999" title="User:Calvin999"><b style="color:#595454">Calvin999</b></a> 12:10, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Thanks for the suggestion. That sounds a lot better, though I'm not sure if "underdog triumphalism" needs quotation marks, it's quite a basic, non-bias term... <b><a href="/wiki/User:Coolmarc" title="User:Coolmarc"><font face="tahoma" color="#000000">Cool</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Coolmarc" title="User talk:Coolmarc"><font face="tahoma" color="#00BFFF">Marc</font></a></b> 12:24, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>It's a direct quote from a review cited in the article, so best to quote it, because it's quote a specific thing to say. <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <b>ALT2</b>. &#160;—&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Calvin999" title="User:Calvin999"><b style="color:#595454">Calvin999</b></a> 12:28, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

</div>
<ul>

</ul>

<dd>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F2015_FA_Women%27s_Cup_Final&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_(19586687064)_(2).jpg" class="image" title="Chelsea Ladies lift the FA Women's Cup at Wembley Stadium"><img alt="Chelsea Ladies lift the FA Women's Cup at Wembley Stadium" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_%2819586687064%29_%282%29.jpg/120px-Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_%2819586687064%29_%282%29.jpg" width="120" height="96" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_%2819586687064%29_%282%29.jpg/180px-Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_%2819586687064%29_%282%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/10/Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_%2819586687064%29_%282%29.jpg/240px-Chelsea_Ladies_1_Notts_County_Ladies_0_%2819586687064%29_%282%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3242" data-file-height="2592" /></a>

</div>
</div>

<li>*... that the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_FA_Women%27s_Cup_Final" title="2015 FA Women's Cup Final">2015 FA Women's Cup Final</a></b> was the first edition to be staged at <a href="/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>?</li>

<dd>

<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Ji_So-yun" title="Ji So-yun">Ji So-yun</a> scored for <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_L.F.C." title="Chelsea L.F.C.">Chelsea</a> to win the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_FA_Women%27s_Cup_Final" title="2015 FA Women's Cup Final">2015 FA Women's Cup Final</a></b>, in the first edition to be staged at <a href="/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>?</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Chris_Gheysens">Chris Gheysens</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FChris_Gheysens&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chris_Gheysens&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that as President and CEO of <a href="/wiki/Wawa_Inc." title="Wawa Inc.">Wawa Inc.</a>, <b><a href="/wiki/Chris_Gheysens" title="Chris Gheysens">Chris Gheysens</a></b> carries business cards that identify him as the company's "Lead Goose"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Isaac_Dripps" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Isaac Dripps">Isaac Dripps</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Alansohn" title="User:Alansohn">Alansohn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Alansohn" title="User talk:Alansohn">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:42, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New and long enough, QPQ review performed, all non lead paragraphs have inline citations, content of the hook is backed with an inline citation to a reliable source in the article, checks for copyvio reveals no problems (e.g. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Chris+Gheysens&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">[6]</a>). As far as DYK requirements go, the article is good to go.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>However, the article is presently being discussed at AfD at <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Chris_Gheysens" title="Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Chris Gheysens">Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Chris Gheysens</a>, so this has to wait until the AfD discussion has concluded. <span class="smallcaps" style="font-variant:small-caps;"><a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">North America</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Northamerica1000" title="User talk:Northamerica1000"><font size="-2">1000</font></a></sup></span> 21:34, 9 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">Northamerica1000</a>, the associated AfD has closed as "Keep". Let me know if there are any other issues with this nomination. <a href="/wiki/User:Alansohn" title="User:Alansohn">Alansohn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Alansohn" title="User talk:Alansohn">talk</a>) 05:24, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Good to go. <span class="smallcaps" style="font-variant:small-caps;"><a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">North America</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Northamerica1000" title="User talk:Northamerica1000"><font size="-2">1000</font></a></sup></span> 05:29, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Richard_Wright_.28musician.29">Richard Wright (musician)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRichard_Wright_%28musician%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that at the time of his death, <b><a href="/wiki/Richard_Wright_(musician)" title="Richard Wright (musician)">Richard Wright</a></b> had been working on an album thought to comprise a series of instrumental pieces?</li>
</ul>

<dd>

</ul>
</dd>

<dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Henry_Fox_.28cricketer.29">Henry Fox (cricketer)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FHenry_Fox_%28cricketer%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Harry_Fox_%28sportsman%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Harry_Fox.jpg" class="image" title="Harry Fox"><img alt="Harry Fox" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Harry_Fox.jpg/120px-Harry_Fox.jpg" width="120" height="168" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Harry_Fox.jpg/180px-Harry_Fox.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Harry_Fox.jpg/240px-Harry_Fox.jpg 2x" data-file-width="509" data-file-height="713" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Harry Fox</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the Russian authorities claimed that the <a href="/wiki/Svans" title="Svans">Svans</a> had murdered <b><a href="/wiki/Harry_Fox_(sportsman)" title="Harry Fox (sportsman)">Harry Fox</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, but they almost certainly did not?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Harry_Fox_(sportsman)" title="Harry Fox (sportsman)">Harry Fox</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, who played cricket and rugby for <a href="/wiki/Somerset" title="Somerset">Somerset</a>, died whilst <a href="/wiki/Mountaineering" title="Mountaineering">climbing</a> in Russia?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Tennessee_cave_salamander" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Tennessee cave salamander">Tennessee cave salamander</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Second of two QPQ credits from multi-nom hook</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Note that I have moved the page to <a href="/wiki/Harry_Fox_(sportsman)" title="Harry Fox (sportsman)">Harry Fox (sportsman)</a> which I think is a more accurate title.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Harrias" title="User:Harrias">Harrias</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Harrias" title="User talk:Harrias">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:23, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the extinct ant <i><b><a href="/wiki/Cananeuretus" title="Cananeuretus">Cananeuretus</a></b></i> was preserved in amber from Alberta?</li>

<dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Arba.27een_Pilgrimage">Arba'een Pilgrimage</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FArba%27een_Pilgrimage&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Arba%27een_Pilgrimage&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg" class="image" title="2013 Arbaeen Pilgrimage, streets are full of pilgrims."><img alt="2013 Arbaeen Pilgrimage, streets are full of pilgrims." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg/120px-%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg" width="120" height="78" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg/180px-%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg/240px-%D9%BE%DB%8C%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%87_%D8%B1%D9%88%DB%8C_%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B9%DB%8C%D9%86_%D8%AD%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="519" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">2013 Arbaeen Pilgrimage, streets are full of pilgrims.</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Arba%27een_Pilgrimage" title="Arba'een Pilgrimage">Arba'een Pilgrimage</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> is the world's largest gathering which is held every year 40 days after <a href="/wiki/Day_of_Ashura" title="Day of Ashura">Ashura</a> for the commemoration of <a href="/wiki/Husayn_ibn_Ali" title="Husayn ibn Ali">Husayn ibn Ali</a>'s death&#160;?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 13:54, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:B*Witched_in_Manchester.jpg" class="image" title="B*Witched performing in Manchester"><img alt="B*Witched performing in Manchester" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/33/B%2AWitched_in_Manchester.jpg/120px-B%2AWitched_in_Manchester.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/33/B%2AWitched_in_Manchester.jpg/180px-B%2AWitched_in_Manchester.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/33/B%2AWitched_in_Manchester.jpg/240px-B%2AWitched_in_Manchester.jpg 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="540" /></a>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Microprinting">Microprinting</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMicroprinting&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Microprinting&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Microprinting" title="Microprinting">microprint</a></b> was invented by Albert Boni in 1943?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Microprinting" title="Microprinting">microprint</a></b> can be found not only on currency but also bank cheques, postage stamps, security seals, and other important documents?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the first US postage stamp to incorporate <b><a href="/wiki/Microprinting" title="Microprinting">microprinting</a></b> was the American Wildflower Series in 1992?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>:... that true <b><a href="/wiki/Microprinting" title="Microprinting">microprint</a></b> (text less than 1px tall) can not be reproduced by digital methods but microtext can (text approx 4 to 1px tall)?</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I have spent the past few days significantly expanding and improving this article.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:David_Condrey" title="User:David Condrey">David Condrey</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:David_Condrey" title="User talk:David Condrey">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 09:09, 8 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I will review this one.... <font face="Helvetica"><a href="/wiki/User:Hassocks5489" title="User:Hassocks5489"><font color="#00BFFF"><b>Hassocks</b></font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Hassocks5489" title="User talk:Hassocks5489"><font color="#228B22">5489</font> <font color="#C71585"><small>(Floreat Hova!)</small></font></a></font> 19:50, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> There is some further work needed here. An expansion of about 2.5x has been achieved so far (based on expansion starting on nomination date of 4 Oct), and a large number of good sources have been introduced, but more content is needed to reach the DYK yardstick of a 5x expansion. There may be scope to include info about microprinting on other countries' banknotes, for example. There is an {{Expert-subject}} tag in one section, which I think is justified, but some expert help would really need to be forthcoming before this could run at DYK. Has the Science wikiproject been approached directly? Could the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Numismatics" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Numismatics">Numismatics</a> and/or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Technology" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Technology">Technology</a> wikiprojects help as well? There are also some paragraphs needing citations.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>This article has excellent potential, especially given that good sources have been added as part of the expansion so far, and it would be good to keep this nomination on hold for a while to see if further expansion could be achieved. I have watchlisted the article. <font face="Helvetica"><a href="/wiki/User:Hassocks5489" title="User:Hassocks5489"><font color="#00BFFF"><b>Hassocks</b></font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Hassocks5489" title="User talk:Hassocks5489"><font color="#228B22">5489</font> <font color="#C71585"><small>(Floreat Hova!)</small></font></a></font> 20:41, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Navroji_Mistri">Navroji Mistri</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNavroji_Mistri&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Navroji_Mistri&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Navroji_Mistri" title="Navroji Mistri">Navroji Mistri</a></b> donated <a href="/wiki/Singapore_dollar" title="Singapore dollar">SGD$</a>950,000 to build a <a href="/wiki/Pediatric" title="Pediatric" class="mw-redirect">pediatric</a> ward because he "cannot bear to think of sick children&#160;... lying on the floors of hospital wards"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Navroji_Mistri" title="Navroji Mistri">Navroji Mistri</a></b>'s soft drinks business was so successful that he was able to purchase the entire <a href="/wiki/Caldecott_Hill" title="Caldecott Hill">Caldecott Hill Estate</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Owari_no_Hoshi_no_Love_Song" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Owari no Hoshi no Love Song">Owari no Hoshi no Love Song</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Lionratz" title="User:Lionratz">Lionratz</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Lionratz" title="User talk:Lionratz">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 07:39, 11 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<dd>
<ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="List_of_places_of_worship_in_Waverley_.28borough.29.2C_Park_Lane_Chapel.2C_Farnham">List of places of worship in Waverley (borough), Park Lane Chapel, Farnham</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FList_of_places_of_worship_in_Waverley_%28borough%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_places_of_worship_in_Waverley_%28borough%29&amp;action=history">List of places of worship in Waverley (borough)</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Park_Lane_Chapel%2C_Farnham&amp;action=history">Park Lane Chapel, Farnham</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel,_Bear_Lane,_Farnham_(May_2015)_(3).JPG" class="image" title="The former Park Lane chapel in Farnham, Surrey"><img alt="The former Park Lane chapel in Farnham, Surrey" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel%2C_Bear_Lane%2C_Farnham_%28May_2015%29_%283%29.JPG/120px-Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel%2C_Bear_Lane%2C_Farnham_%28May_2015%29_%283%29.JPG" width="120" height="120" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel%2C_Bear_Lane%2C_Farnham_%28May_2015%29_%283%29.JPG/180px-Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel%2C_Bear_Lane%2C_Farnham_%28May_2015%29_%283%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel%2C_Bear_Lane%2C_Farnham_%28May_2015%29_%283%29.JPG/240px-Former_Park_Lane_Baptist_Chapel%2C_Bear_Lane%2C_Farnham_%28May_2015%29_%283%29.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1800" data-file-height="1800" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">The former Park Lane chapel in Farnham, Surrey</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/List_of_places_of_worship_in_Waverley_(borough)" title="List of places of worship in Waverley (borough)">places of worship in Waverley, Surrey</a></b> include a <b><a href="/wiki/Park_Lane_Chapel,_Farnham" title="Park Lane Chapel, Farnham">former Strict Baptist chapel</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> founded in a loft by a Polish Jew?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Derby_Racecourse" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Derby Racecourse">Template:Did you know nominations/Derby Racecourse</a> and <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Microprinting" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Microprinting">Template:Did you know nominations/Microprinting</a> (both currently at "on hold" status)</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: The list was moved to mainspace with <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_places_of_worship_in_Waverley_(borough)&amp;oldid=684888234">this edit</a> on 9th Oct, although it was under prep for some time in a sandbox. <a href="/wiki/Park_Lane_Chapel,_Farnham" title="Park Lane Chapel, Farnham">Park Lane Chapel, Farnham</a> was new today (12th Oct). The hook fact is covered by refs in the second and third paragraphs of the "History" section of the chapel article, and is also mentioned in the "Overview of the borough and its places of worship" paragraph in the list (current ref [61]).</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Hassocks5489" title="User:Hassocks5489">Hassocks5489</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Hassocks5489" title="User talk:Hassocks5489">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:51, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Not eligible for DYK since the album currently fails WP:NALBUMS for no confirmed release date or full tracklist. Feel free to renominate when it has a confirmed release date and track list. <a href="/wiki/User:SNUGGUMS" title="User:SNUGGUMS"><b style="color:#454545">Snuggums</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SNUGGUMS" title="User talk:SNUGGUMS"><b style="color:#454545">talk</b></a> / <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/SNUGGUMS" title="Special:Contributions/SNUGGUMS"><b style="color:#454545">edits</b></a>) 14:46, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>An article does not need to meet the stricter requirements of <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:NALBUMS" title="Wikipedia:NALBUMS" class="mw-redirect">WP:NALBUMS</a> if it meets <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:GNG" title="Wikipedia:GNG" class="mw-redirect">WP:GNG</a>. Your move of the article into draft space is inappropriate. <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">sst</a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer#top" title="User talk:SSTflyer">✈</a> 14:54, 11 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New reviewer needed. Restoring nomination history after prematurely closed by reviewer <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:SNUGGUMS" title="User:SNUGGUMS">SNUGGUMS</a>:</span>. A reviewer should not close out their own review. <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">SSTflyer</a>:</span> has challenged your review, and this nomination needs to be given a chance for others to look at it. <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKR#Finishing_the_review" title="Wikipedia:DYKR" class="mw-redirect">WP:DYKR</a>: <span class="inline-quote-talk" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #008560;">...an uninvolved editor will soon review the discussion and likely close it and promote the article. If the article does not qualify for DYK for some technical reason or if the participants cannot agree on at least one viable hook, the discussion will eventually be closed by an uninvolved editor and the article will not be promoted.</span> <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 12:47, 12 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Whoever looks at it should keep <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:SNUGGUMS&amp;diff=685252986&amp;oldid=685209100">this</a> in mind for why it <i><b>DOES</b></i> need to meet WP:NALBUMS in order to warrant an article in mainspace. <a href="/wiki/User:SNUGGUMS" title="User:SNUGGUMS"><b style="color:#454545">Snuggums</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SNUGGUMS" title="User talk:SNUGGUMS"><b style="color:#454545">talk</b></a> / <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/SNUGGUMS" title="Special:Contributions/SNUGGUMS"><b style="color:#454545">edits</b></a>) 14:23, 12 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:SNUGGUMS" title="User:SNUGGUMS">SNUGGUMS</a>:</span> if the article does not meet notability guidelines, the place for that discussion is at AfD. DYK nominations are put on hold during AfD proceedings, and only restarted should the article be retained. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 18:35, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Santa_Coloma_de_Queralt">Santa Coloma de Queralt</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSanta_Coloma_de_Queralt&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Santa_Coloma_de_Queralt&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in the fourteenth century, the Catalan town of <b><a href="/wiki/Santa_Coloma_de_Queralt" title="Santa Coloma de Queralt">Santa Coloma de Queralt</a></b> had a large Jewish population?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Lasioglossum_zephyrum" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Lasioglossum zephyrum">Lasioglossum zephyrum</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:07, 11 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> nice expansion on good sources, hook interesting and sourced. I wonder if Catalan is known enough to be not linked. --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 20:41, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Rubus_durescens">Rubus durescens</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRubus_durescens&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rubus_durescens&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg" class="image" title="Linton's Flora of Derbyshire"><img alt="Linton's Flora of Derbyshire" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg/120px-Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg" width="120" height="176" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg/180px-Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg/240px-Linton%27s_1903_Flora_of_Derbyshire.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2775" data-file-height="4070" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Linton's <i>Flora of Derbyshire</i></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/William_Richardson_Linton" title="William Richardson Linton">Reverend Linton</a>'s book has <i><b><a href="/wiki/Rubus_durescens" title="Rubus durescens">Rubus durescens</a></b></i> in gold leaf on its cover <i>(pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Rubus_durescens" title="Rubus durescens">Rubus durescens</a></b></i> is a rose by another name?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Band-tailed_fruiteater" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Band-tailed fruiteater">QPQ = 7 of 8 Orange-breasted fruiteater</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Parkywiki" title="User:Parkywiki">Parkywiki</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Parkywiki" title="User talk:Parkywiki">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Sam_Sailor" title="User:Sam Sailor">Sam Sailor</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sam_Sailor" title="User talk:Sam Sailor">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) at 13:22, 10 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT2</b>: ... that botanist <a href="/wiki/William_Richardson_Linton" title="William Richardson Linton">Reverend Linton</a> didn't gild the lily, but he did discover a bramble, <i><b><a href="/wiki/Rubus_durescens" title="Rubus durescens">Rubus durescens</a></b></i> and then gilded its image on the cover of his book, <i>The Flora of Derbyshire</i>? <small><span class="autosigned">—&#160;Preceding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Signatures" title="Wikipedia:Signatures">unsigned</a> comment added by <a href="/wiki/User:Parkywiki" title="User:Parkywiki">Parkywiki</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Parkywiki" title="User talk:Parkywiki">talk</a> • <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Parkywiki" title="Special:Contributions/Parkywiki">contribs</a>) 23:55, 10 October 2015 (UTC)</span></small></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article was moved to mainspace on October 9, the text is over 1500 characters, and it is within policy. The image here is licensed via CC, and QPQ is satisfied. The suggested hooks are under 200 characters and supported by inline citations (I am not an expert in botany, and I am assuming that the flower is a "rose by another name" because it was identified as being within the genus <i>Rubus</i>, a fact that is substantiated by inline citations). Although the illustration is lovely, I like the poetic and catchy cadence of <b>ALT1</b>, and I think <b>ALT2</b> is also very clever. Excellent work with hook-writing for this nomination! Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 04:46, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Texas_A.26M.E2.80.93Commerce_Lions_women.27s_soccer">Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FTexas_A%26M%E2%80%93Commerce_Lions_women%27s_soccer&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Texas_A%26M%E2%80%93Commerce_Lions_women%27s_soccer&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_(15373863647).jpg" class="image" title="Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer in action"><img alt="Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer in action" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_%2815373863647%29.jpg/120px-Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_%2815373863647%29.jpg" width="120" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_%2815373863647%29.jpg/180px-Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_%2815373863647%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_%2815373863647%29.jpg/240px-Athletics-Soccer_vs_MWU-5228_%2815373863647%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4256" data-file-height="2832" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer in action</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M%E2%80%93Commerce_Lions_women%27s_soccer" title="Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer">Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer</a></b> team <i>(pictured)</i> plays on a field once occupied by a botanical nursery and <a href="/wiki/Tennis_court" title="Tennis court">tennis courts</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M%E2%80%93Commerce_Lions_women%27s_soccer" title="Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer">Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer</a></b> team <i>(pictured)</i> has won four <a href="/wiki/Lone_Star_Conference" title="Lone Star Conference">Lone Star Conference</a> regular season championships and three conference tournament titles?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Texas_A%26M%E2%80%93Commerce_Lions_women%27s_soccer" title="Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer">Texas A&amp;M–Commerce Lions women's soccer</a></b> team <i>(pictured)</i> played as an <a href="/wiki/NCAA_Division_II_independent_schools" title="NCAA Division II independent schools">independent</a> for one year before the <a href="/wiki/Lone_Star_Conference" title="Lone Star Conference">Lone Star Conference</a> officially sponsored the sport?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Ray_Black,_Jr." title="Template:Did you know nominations/Ray Black, Jr.">Ray Black, Jr.</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
