<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ioan_Missir">Ioan Missir</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FIoan_Missir&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ioan_Missir&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ioan_Missir" title="Ioan Missir">Ioan Missir</a></b>, twice mayor of <a href="/wiki/Boto%C8%99ani" title="Botoșani">Botoșani</a>, <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>, was born in <a href="/wiki/New_Jersey" title="New Jersey">New Jersey</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the literary reputation of <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/Ioan_Missir" title="Ioan Missir">Ioan Missir</a></b> rests on the single novel he published?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that opponents of fare reductions for World War I veterans on the <a href="/wiki/C%C4%83ile_Ferate_Rom%C3%A2ne" title="Căile Ferate Române">state railways</a> prompted <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/Ioan_Missir" title="Ioan Missir">Ioan Missir</a></b> to write his only novel?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Yonne" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Yonne">Template:Did you know nominations/Yonne</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Biruitorul" title="User:Biruitorul">Biruitorul</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Biruitorul" title="User talk:Biruitorul">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 00:05, 10 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Dibaeis_baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDibaeis_baeomyces&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dibaeis_baeomyces&amp;action=history">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Baeomyces_rufus&amp;action=history">Baeomyces rufus</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg" class="image" title="pink earth lichen"><img alt="pink earth lichen" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg/120px-Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg" width="120" height="84" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg/180px-Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg/240px-Dibaeis_baeomyces_pink_earth_lichen_cropped.jpg 2x" data-file-width="716" data-file-height="504" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">pink earth lichen</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></b></i>, the <b>pink earth lichen</b>, looks like a pink-tipped version of the unrelated lichen called <a href="/wiki/British_soldiers_lichen" title="British soldiers lichen" class="mw-redirect">British soldiers</a>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></b></i> (pink earth lichen) was once thought to be in the same genus as the similar-looking <i><b><a href="/wiki/Baeomyces_rufus" title="Baeomyces rufus">Baeomyces rufus</a></b></i> (brown beret lichen), until DNA sequencing proved otherwise?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>:</li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: I'm hoping to have an actual botanist contribute to the article. Will update authors listing if any do.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:58, 9 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I have wikilinked the other species in ALT1, since it's no longer a redlink. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 15:00, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a>Article long enough and new enough. off line references taken AGF, with the hook and the alt both sourced and verified. Im not totally sure why monophyletic group is in scare quotes though?--<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin"><font color="#120A8F">Kev</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin"><font color="#228B22">min</font></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Kevmin" title="Special:Contributions/Kevmin">§</a> 21:10, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>What you call scarequotes was me being perhaps overzealous in avoiding too-close paraphrasing, <a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin">Kevmin</a>. I couldn't figure out a way to state that information <i>without</i> it being a close paraphrase of one source or another, so I went with a direct quotation. Thank you for such a prompt review! —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 21:33, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin">Kevmin</a>, I've just found out from <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset#About_QPQ_rules_for_DYK" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">here</a>) that it's not too late to convert this to a double DYK, with <i><a href="/wiki/Baeomyces_rufus" title="Baeomyces rufus">Baeomyces rufus</a></i> as the other article — if, obviously, you don't mind reviewing a second article and what had been the alternate hook. This would be my first 2-in-1, so I'm not sure if the two articles can have separate reviewers. If not, and Kevmin isn't interested in taking on the other review, I'm fine with the original hook and this DYK being just for <i><a href="/wiki/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></i>. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 22:00, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a>:</span> It's a fairly normal biology parlance to use that phrase and that its a three word combination makes it hard to be a copy-violation. I would say it doesn't need them. Lets ping <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a>:</span> As for the double nomination, I have no problem with a second review at all!--<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin"><font color="#120A8F">Kev</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin"><font color="#228B22">min</font></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Kevmin" title="Special:Contributions/Kevmin">§</a> 22:07, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've just updated the nomination's DYK nompage links template, and added a DYKmake template, both to reflect the addition of the new article. So this template is all set. I'm glad that Kevmin's available to review the second article, though it would have been possible to have two separate reviewers for the two articles if he hadn't been. As for the use of "a monophyletic group", I agree that the quotes are not necessary for a basic scientific term, but I'm not sure that the context is appropriate. The article seems to be saying that although Dibaesis baeomyces isn't related to the Baeomyces after all, it is related to these other two species being in a monophyletic group with them, but the source says that Baeomyces is in that same monophyletic group with D. baeomyces and Gyalecta ulmi and Pertusaria trachythallina. This doesn't affect the hook at all, but it will affect the article, assuming I haven't misread that "Lichen clade IV" sentence in the source. (Apologies in advance if I have!) <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 22:51, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Reading through the conclusions of Stenroos &amp; DePreist, I agree with what <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a>:</span> notes, <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a>:</span> it looks like you missread the Genus <i>Baeomyces</i> as the species <i>D. baeomyces</i> on page 1557 of the article.--<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin"><font color="#120A8F">Kev</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin"><font color="#228B22">min</font></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Kevmin" title="Special:Contributions/Kevmin">§</a> 02:55, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I am more than willing to accept that I may have misread something in the densely-technical sources I used. I like science, but I am not a scientist by training. That said, in reviewing the source, I found three statements I had used to build the article. Two are unambiguous, I think — "Our data suggest that Baeomyces rufus and Dibaeis baeomyces (syn. Baeomyces roseus) are phylogenetically distant and more closely related to taxa from other orders and suborders than to each other." and "Siphula ceratites and Thamnolia vermicularis form a monophyletic assemblage together with Dibaeis baeomyces." — and seem to support what's in the article I created. Then there is "Pertusaria trachythallina of the Lecanorales forms a monophyletic group with Gyalecta ulmi of the Gyalectales, <b>and Baeomyces rufus</b> and Dibaeis baeomyces of the Leotiales." (emphasis added). The inclusion of B. rufus in that sentence contradicts the rest of the article, so I was taking it as a misprint. Shall I perhaps add a quote= parameter to the citation to clarify where the information is coming from?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>As for the quotation marks, I will take them out. Thanks for reassuring me they were not needed, <a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin">Kevmin</a> and <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a>. I also struck the original hook since it only applied to the first article. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 04:07, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>

</dd>

</dd>
</dl>
<p><span class="outdent-template" style="display:block; margin-top:-0.5em; color:#AAA;"><span style="display:inline-block; overflow:hidden;">┌</span><span style="display:inline-block; overflow:hidden; word-wrap:normal; width:15.2em;">────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────</span><span style="display:inline-block; overflow:hidden;">┘</span></span>*<a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Initial review of <i><a href="/wiki/Baeomyces_rufus" title="Baeomyces rufus">Baeomyces rufus</a></i>, article new enough, long enough, and well referenced. No obvious problems with it, and the hook is cited, and checks out. We still await clarification of the monophyly paragraph in <i><a href="/wiki/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></i>, due to probable missreading of the source as identified above. Also "phylogentically distant" doesn't need quotes either.--<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin"><font color="#120A8F">Kev</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin"><font color="#228B22">min</font></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Kevmin" title="Special:Contributions/Kevmin">§</a> 03:00, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a>:</span> I come to the same conclusion as you on the one sentence being out of place given the consistency of the article on the unrelated nature of the two species. I would clarify in the article that there is some confusion on the nature of the relation and see if there is any new papers that clarify. --<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin"><font color="#120A8F">Kev</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin"><font color="#228B22">min</font></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Kevmin" title="Special:Contributions/Kevmin">§</a> 22:34, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin">Kevmin</a>:</span> It's a relief to read that you don't think I misread the article after all. I have added a footnote to the <i><a href="/wiki/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></i> article explaining the apparent contradiction in the Stenroos and DePriest paper. I also found and added a third study that also established <i>Baeomyces</i> and <i>Dibaeis</i> as distinct genera. I don't think a similar note is necessary in <i><a href="/wiki/Baeomyces_rufus" title="Baeomyces rufus">Baeomyces rufus</a></i> as that article only asserts that <i>D. baeomyces</i> was found not to belong to genus <i>Baeomyces</i> and says nothing further about the relatedness of the two species. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 00:02, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Perhaps you ought to omit the monophyletic group material altogether, if you believe the source is incorrect, rather than include the parts you think are correct and omit those you don't (albeit with explanation). There is no obligation to include every fact in a source; eventually there will be further publication and a more clear statement of the facts. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 15:28, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>That was an excellent suggestion, <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a>, and I have followed it. Reference to monophyly has been removed, along with the corresponding footnote. What do you think, <a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin">Kevmin</a>? —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 04:06, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> with those changes, and no major shift in the articles quality or policy neutrality, I think the hook is good to go.--<a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin"><font color="#120A8F">Kev</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin"><font color="#228B22">min</font></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Kevmin" title="Special:Contributions/Kevmin">§</a> 14:52, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Crescentina">Crescentina</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCrescentina&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Crescentina&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Gnocco_fritto.jpg" class="image" title="Crescentina served with cured meat and cheese"><img alt="Crescentina served with cured meat and cheese" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Gnocco_fritto.jpg/120px-Gnocco_fritto.jpg" width="120" height="163" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Gnocco_fritto.jpg/180px-Gnocco_fritto.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Gnocco_fritto.jpg/240px-Gnocco_fritto.jpg 2x" data-file-width="590" data-file-height="800" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Crescentina served with cured meat and cheese</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the name of <b><a href="/wiki/Crescentina" title="Crescentina">crescentina</a></b> bread <i>(example pictured)</i> is derived in part from the Italian word <a href="//en.wiktionary.org/wiki/crescere" class="extiw" title="wikt:crescere"><i>crescere</i></a>, which means "to grow?"</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Chris_Gheysens" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Chris Gheysens">Chris Gheysens</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, meets core content policies. Hook cited to RS. GTG. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 02:30, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Francisco_Pacheco_.28politician.29">Francisco Pacheco (politician)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFrancisco_Pacheco_%28politician%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Francisco_Pacheco_%28politician%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that Indian politician <b><a href="/wiki/Francisco_Pacheco_(politician)" title="Francisco Pacheco (politician)">Francisco Pacheco</a></b> slapped a junior engineer for not attending his personal assistant's call?</s></li>
</ul>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Bharatiya29" title="User:Bharatiya29">Bharatiya29</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bharatiya29" title="User talk:Bharatiya29">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:03, 9 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough and long enough. Unfortunately, the hook may concentrate too much on a negative aspect of a living individual. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 02:02, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT1</b> ... that Indian politician <b><a href="/wiki/Francisco_Pacheco_(politician)" title="Francisco Pacheco (politician)">Francisco Pacheco</a></b> had to resign from his ministerial post after getting convicted for assaulting a government official?</s></li>
<li><b>ALT2</b> ... that Indian politician <b><a href="/wiki/Francisco_Pacheco_(politician)" title="Francisco Pacheco (politician)">Francisco Pacheco</a></b> dropped out of school when he was in seventh standard, and became a tailor "to support his family"? <a href="/wiki/User:Bharatiya29" title="User:Bharatiya29">Bharatiya29</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bharatiya29" title="User talk:Bharatiya29">talk</a>) 04:00, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li>ALT2 would be acceptable, but which source is it in? --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 17:26, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-others/francisco-mickky-pacheco-from-humble-beginning-to-flashy-lifestyle-run-ins-with-law/">Here</a> is the source. It quotes Pacheco's party's general secretary Lyndon Monteiro, who is also known to be his aide. The fact about Pacheco's education qualification is also supported by his <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://myneta.info/goa2012/candidate.php?candidate_id=102">election affidavit</a>. <a href="/wiki/User:Bharatiya29" title="User:Bharatiya29">Bharatiya29</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bharatiya29" title="User talk:Bharatiya29">talk</a>) 17:42, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Now I see it. GTG with ALT2 only. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 12:57, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

</ul>

</ul>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_10">Articles created/expanded on October 10</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=43" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 10">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ronald_Reagan_Cross_County_Highway">Ronald Reagan Cross County Highway</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRonald_Reagan_Cross_County_Highway&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ronald_Reagan_Cross_County_Highway&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ronald_Reagan_Cross_County_Highway" title="Ronald Reagan Cross County Highway">Ronald Reagan Cross County Highway</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Hamilton_County,_Ohio" title="Hamilton County, Ohio">Hamilton County, Ohio</a>, was the first highway to be <a href="/wiki/List_of_things_named_after_Ronald_Reagan" title="List of things named after Ronald Reagan">named after</a> U.S. President <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Reagan" title="Ronald Reagan">Ronald Reagan</a>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Converted from a redirect by <a href="/wiki/User:Mxn" title="User:Mxn">Mxn</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mxn" title="User talk:Mxn">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 22:33, 17 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Female_Figure_.28Giambologna.29">Female Figure (Giambologna)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFemale_Figure_%28Giambologna%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Female_Figure_%28Giambologna%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg" class="image" title="Female Figure"><img alt="Female Figure" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg/120px-Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg" width="120" height="182" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg/180px-Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg/240px-Giambologna_Female_Figure.jpg 2x" data-file-width="507" data-file-height="768" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i>Female Figure</i></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that <a href="/wiki/Giambologna" title="Giambologna">Giambologna</a>'s untitled 1571-73 <b><a href="/wiki/Female_Figure_(Giambologna)" title="Female Figure (Giambologna)">sculpture of a woman bathing</a></b> (pictured) was known as <i>Bathsheba</i> in the seventeenth century, perhaps in an attempt to justify her nudity through biblical association?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Evangelienmotetten" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Evangelienmotetten">Evangelienmotetten</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Ceoil" title="User:Ceoil">Ceoil</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ceoil" title="User talk:Ceoil">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Kafka_Liz" title="User:Kafka Liz">Kafka Liz</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kafka_Liz" title="User talk:Kafka Liz">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Ceoil" title="User:Ceoil">Ceoil</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ceoil" title="User talk:Ceoil">talk</a>) at 18:58, 11 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article is long enough, new enough and the content looks well-cited (sources are offline, but I spot checked some bits where I could). The hook is cited, but I do have a couple of issues: it's a *long* hook with a picture. In fact it's exactly 200 characters. Is there any way to shorten it? A more important problem, I feel, is that the hook is a close paraphrase of the direct quote from the source. Can it be directly quoted? Or re-written to remove the closeness? Happy to discuss any of these issues if I am incorrect (it's been a while since I did DYK!). --<b><a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">Errant</a></b> <sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ErrantX" title="User talk:ErrantX">chat!</a>)</sup> 21:23, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li>You and me both Errant.</li>
</ul>
<p><b>ALT1:</b> ... that 17th century <a href="/wiki/Reformation" title="Reformation" class="mw-redirect">reformist</a> defenders of <a href="/wiki/Giambologna" title="Giambologna">Giambologna</a>'s 1571-73 <b><a href="/wiki/Female_Figure_(Giambologna)" title="Female Figure (Giambologna)">sculpture of a woman bathing</a></b> (pictured) justified her nudity by identifying her as either <a href="/wiki/Bathsheba" title="Bathsheba">Bathsheba</a> or <a href="/wiki/Venus_(mythology)" title="Venus (mythology)">Venus</a>? <a href="/wiki/User:Ceoil" title="User:Ceoil">Ceoil</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Ceoil" title="User talk:Ceoil">talk</a>) 02:11, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I think that works, thanks! Happy to sign off on it. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">Errant</a></b> <sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ErrantX" title="User talk:ErrantX">chat!</a>)</sup> 08:08, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Amorebieta-Etxano">Amorebieta-Etxano</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAmorebieta-Etxano&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amorebieta-Etxano&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the municipality of <b><a href="/wiki/Amorebieta-Etxano" title="Amorebieta-Etxano">Amorebieta-Etxano</a></b> was formed in 1951 by the merger of two very unequal-sized communities?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>

K. Simmons">J.&#160;K.&#160;Simmons</a> won awards in the Best Supporting Actor category at the <a href="/wiki/Academy_Awards" title="Academy Awards">Academy Awards</a>, <a href="/wiki/BAFTAs" title="BAFTAs" class="mw-redirect">BAFTAs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Golden_Globe_Awards" title="Golden Globe Awards" class="mw-redirect">Golden Globe Awards</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Screen_Actors_Guild_Awards" title="Screen Actors Guild Awards" class="mw-redirect">Screen Actors Guild Awards</a>?</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life_and_career_of_Gene_Roddenberry">Early life and career of Gene Roddenberry</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEarly_life_and_career_of_Gene_Roddenberry&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Early_life_and_career_of_Gene_Roddenberry&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg" class="image" title="Gene Roddenberry in 1976"><img alt="Gene Roddenberry in 1976" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg/120px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg" width="120" height="149" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg/180px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg/240px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="931" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Gene Roddenberry in 1976</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that prior to working on <i><a href="/wiki/Star_Trek" title="Star Trek">Star Trek</a></i>, <b><a href="/wiki/Early_life_and_career_of_Gene_Roddenberry" title="Early life and career of Gene Roddenberry">Gene Roddenberry</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> was a combat pilot for the <a href="/wiki/United_States_Army_Air_Forces" title="United States Army Air Forces">US Army Air Force</a> and an <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_Police_Department" title="Los Angeles Police Department">LAPD</a> officer?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <i><a href="/wiki/Star_Trek" title="Star Trek">Star Trek</a></i> creator <b><a href="/wiki/Early_life_and_career_of_Gene_Roddenberry" title="Early life and career of Gene Roddenberry">Gene Roddenberry</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> claimed to have flown 89 combat missions during the <a href="/wiki/Second_World_War" title="Second World War" class="mw-redirect">Second World War</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:that <i><a href="/wiki/Star_Trek" title="Star Trek">Star Trek</a></i> creator <a href="/wiki/Gene_Roddenberry" title="Gene Roddenberry">Gene Roddenberry</a> <i>(pictured)</i> survived three plane crashes during his <b><a href="/wiki/Early_life_and_career_of_Gene_Roddenberry" title="Early life and career of Gene Roddenberry">career as a military and commercial pilot</a></b>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Champagne_or_Guinness" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Champagne or Guinness">Champagne or Guinness</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Crane_Mountain">Crane Mountain</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCrane_Mountain&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Crane_Mountain&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in 1867, <a href="/wiki/United_States_Army" title="United States Army">United States Army</a> scouts fought a battle with a band of <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">Native Americans</a> on the eastern slope of <b><a href="/wiki/Crane_Mountain" title="Crane Mountain">Crane Mountain</a></b> in south-central <a href="/wiki/Oregon" title="Oregon">Oregon</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/South_American_tern" title="Template:Did you know nominations/South American tern">South American tern</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_11">Articles created/expanded on October 11</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=44" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 11">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Dominik_W.C3.B6rner">Dominik Wörner</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDominik_W%C3%B6rner&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dominik_W%C3%B6rner&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Dominik_W%C3%B6rner" title="Dominik Wörner">Dominik Wörner</a></b>, winner of the <a href="/wiki/International_Johann_Sebastian_Bach_Competition" title="International Johann Sebastian Bach Competition">International Bach Competition</a> in 2002, recorded Bach's solo cantatas for bass, including <a href="/wiki/Ich_will_den_Kreuzstab_gerne_tragen,_BWV_56" title="Ich will den Kreuzstab gerne tragen, BWV 56"><i>Ich will den Kreuzstab gerne tragen</i>, BWV 56</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Dominik_W%C3%B6rner" title="Dominik Wörner">Dominik Wörner</a></b>, winner of the <a href="/wiki/International_Johann_Sebastian_Bach_Competition" title="International Johann Sebastian Bach Competition">International Bach Competition</a> in 2002, recorded <a href="/wiki/Lied" title="Lied">Lieder</a> from Vienna written in the <a href="/wiki/Fin_de_si%C3%A8cle" title="Fin de siècle">fin de siècle</a> period, including works by <a href="/wiki/Alban_Berg" title="Alban Berg">Berg</a>, <a href="/wiki/Arnold_Sch%C3%B6nberg" title="Arnold Schönberg" class="mw-redirect">Schönberg</a>, <a href="/wiki/Franz_Schreker" title="Franz Schreker">Schreker</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hugo_Wolf" title="Hugo Wolf">Wolf</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Santa_Coloma_de_Queralt" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Santa Coloma de Queralt">Santa Coloma de Queralt</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:2A02:8109:740:1E28:B41F:6DB7:678:763&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:2A02:8109:740:1E28:B41F:6DB7:678:763 (page does not exist)">2A02:8109:740:1E28:B41F:6DB7:678:763</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:2A02:8109:740:1E28:B41F:6DB7:678:763" title="User talk:2A02:8109:740:1E28:B41F:6DB7:678:763">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) at 21:01, 18 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Georgie_Wolton">Georgie Wolton</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FGeorgie_Wolton&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Georgie_Wolton&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that architect <b><a href="/wiki/Georgie_Wolton" title="Georgie Wolton">Georgie Wolton</a></b> designed the first house in the UK to use <a href="/wiki/Corten" title="Corten" class="mw-redirect">CorTen</a> steel as the primary structure?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Safeword_(game_show)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Safeword (game show)">Safeword (game show)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Only just long enough, but it qualifies; good sourcing; new enough at the time of nomination; within policy and the hook is OK and reliably sourced. QPQ has been done. Everything checks out, so I'm giving this one a tick. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 21:53, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Palamu_Forts">Palamu Forts</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPalamu_Forts&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Palamu_Forts&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Palamau_Fort.jpg" class="image" title="Entrance gate of the Palamau_Fort"><img alt="Entrance gate of the Palamau_Fort" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Palamau_Fort.jpg/120px-Palamau_Fort.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Palamau_Fort.jpg/180px-Palamau_Fort.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Palamau_Fort.jpg/240px-Palamau_Fort.jpg 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="540" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Entrance gate of the Palamau_Fort</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the central gate is the largest of three gates built in the <b><a href="/wiki/Palamu_Forts" title="Palamu Forts">fort in the plains</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> and is known as "Singh Dwar"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the external boundary walls of the <b><a href="/wiki/Palamu_Forts" title="Palamu Forts">fort in the plains</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, all along its length, are built with "lime-surki sun-baked bricks"?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Ardstinchar_Castle" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Ardstinchar Castle">Template:Did you know nominations/Ardstinchar Castle</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Sinn_F.C3.A9in_Funds_case">Sinn Féin Funds case</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSinn_F%C3%A9in_Funds_case&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sinn_F%C3%A9in_Funds_case&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the ruling in the 1948 <b><a href="/wiki/Sinn_F%C3%A9in_Funds_case" title="Sinn Féin Funds case">Sinn Féin Funds case</a></b> was that the <a href="/wiki/Sinn_F%C3%A9in" title="Sinn Féin">Sinn Féin</a> party was not legally a continuation of the Sinn Féin party that governed the <a href="/wiki/Irish_Republic" title="Irish Republic">Irish Republic</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Anglo-Irish_War" title="Anglo-Irish War" class="mw-redirect">Anglo-Irish War</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: I have fewer than five DYK credits</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Jnestorius" title="User:Jnestorius">Jnestorius</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jnestorius" title="User talk:Jnestorius">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Scolaire" title="User:Scolaire">Scolaire</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Scolaire" title="User talk:Scolaire">talk</a>) at 10:01, 15 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I suggest reordering to "that the 1948 ruling in the <b><a href="/wiki/Sinn_F%C3%A9in_Funds_case" title="Sinn Féin Funds case">Sinn Féin Funds case</a></b>" since the case ran from 1942 to 1948 and there was a separate significant ruling in 1947. <a href="/wiki/User:Jnestorius" title="User:Jnestorius">jnestorius</a><sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jnestorius" title="User talk:Jnestorius">talk</a>)</sup> 17:08, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Butterfly">Butterfly</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FButterfly&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Butterfly&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_(by).jpg" class="image" title="Old World swallowtail"><img alt="Old World swallowtail" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_%28by%29.jpg/120px-Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_%28by%29.jpg" width="120" height="120" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_%28by%29.jpg/180px-Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_%28by%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_%28by%29.jpg/240px-Fesoj_-_Papilio_machaon_%28by%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="931" data-file-height="931" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Old World swallowtail</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that there are around 18,500 species of <b><a href="/wiki/Butterfly" title="Butterfly">butterfly</a></b> <i>(<a href="/wiki/Papilio_machaon" title="Papilio machaon">Old World swallowtail</a> pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>

</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Agar.io">Agar.io</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAgar.io&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Agar.io&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that some Turkish political parties used photos of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Agar.io" title="Agar.io">Agar.io</a></b></i>, a <a href="/wiki/Browser_game" title="Browser game">browser</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mobile_game" title="Mobile game">mobile</a> game, as symbols of support in the <a href="/wiki/Turkish_general_election,_June_2015" title="Turkish general election, June 2015">June 2015 Turkish election</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Agar.io" title="Agar.io">Agar.io</a></b></i>, a <a href="/wiki/Browser_game" title="Browser game">browser</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mobile_game" title="Mobile game">mobile</a> game, was used in the <a href="/wiki/Turkish_general_election,_June_2015" title="Turkish general election, June 2015">June 2015 Turkish election</a> for political reasons?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the mobile versions of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Agar.io" title="Agar.io">Agar.io</a></b></i>, an <a href="/wiki/Action_game" title="Action game">action game</a>, were downloaded more than ten million times during its first week?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: fewer than five DYK credits.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Bu.C3.A7aco_Forest">Buçaco Forest</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBu%C3%A7aco_Forest&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bu%C3%A7aco_Forest&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png" class="image" title="cold fountain"><img alt="cold fountain" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png/120px-Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png" width="120" height="199" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png/180px-Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png/240px-Fonte_Fria_Bussaco_Forest.png 2x" data-file-width="402" data-file-height="667" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">cold fountain</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Bu%C3%A7aco_Forest" title="Buçaco Forest">Buçaco Forest</a></b> <i>(cold fountain pictured)</i> contains an olive tree to which the future <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Wellesley,_1st_Duke_of_Wellington" title="Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington">Duke of Wellington</a> tethered his horse?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Cccan%27t_You_See" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Cccan't You See">Template:Did you know nominations/Cccan't You See</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Nathan_Waller_.28soldier.29">Nathan Waller (soldier)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FNathan_Waller_%28soldier%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nathan_Waller_%28soldier%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that according to legend, <b><a href="/wiki/Nathan_Waller_(soldier)" title="Nathan Waller (soldier)">Nathan Waller</a></b> once killed a bear with only a pine knot?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Kemil_Road_(NICTD_station)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Kemil Road (NICTD station)">Template:Did you know nominations/Kemil Road (NICTD station)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakec</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:32, 11 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I sorta question whether this meets GNG, but that's not a criteria for DYK, all of which this meets. GO! <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 01:22, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Please list review details, as a courtesy to the nominator, especially if meant to be used as a QPQ. Please don't leave room for this being pulled from promotion because of inadequate review. <a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 20:03, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

Further, I hereby assert that a copy of this declaration has been signed in wet ink, notarized, and submitted - via certified post (return receipt requested) - to the registered agent of the Wikimedia Foundation for archive and filing as a permanent record of the completeness of this review. Signed in my hand on this, the 19th day of October in the Year our Lord, Two Thousand and Fifteen, and of Wikipedia the Fourteenth - <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 19:08, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

After Lois Weisberg, one of the group's founders, wrote a personal check to cover the cost, the railroad agreed to pay in exchange for Weisberg moderating her public criticism of the railroad and its president, Albert Dudley.</span> And sorry about the silly rule (I did try to get rid of it once, but it never went anywhere). --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 21:57, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Pasticciotto">Pasticciotto</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPasticciotto&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pasticciotto&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg" class="image" title="Ricotta-filled pasticciotto"><img alt="Ricotta-filled pasticciotto" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg/120px-Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg" width="120" height="69" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg/180px-Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg/240px-Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="459" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Ricotta-filled pasticciotto</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that one variety of <b><a href="/wiki/Pasticciotto" title="Pasticciotto">pasticciotto</a></b> pastry is filled with meat but topped with sugar?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: &lt;a&gt;... that <b><a href="/wiki/Pasticciotto" title="Pasticciotto">pasticciotto</a></b> pastry may take their name from their creator's view of them as a "mishap"?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 05:30, 11 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I seem to have messed up adding an image to this nomination. The file is <a href="/wiki/File:Pasticciotto_filled_with_ricotta_cheese.jpg" title="File:Pasticciotto filled with ricotta cheese.jpg">File:Pasticciotto filled with ricotta cheese.jpg</a> and the caption is "Ricotta-filled pasticciotto", if it's not too late. —<a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist"><span style="color:green;;;"><b>Grammar</b>Fascist</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist" title="Special:Contributions/GrammarFascist"><span style="color:darkgreen;;;"><sub>contribs</sub></span></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist"><sup>talk</sup></a> 05:46, 11 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Nice dish, on good sources. Looking at <a href="/wiki/Pasticcio" title="Pasticcio">Pasticcio</a>, "mishap" seems not to be the only translation of the term, - please check that for the article, - I would not approve it for a hook. Article: it's a filled pastry, no? Why "type"? How about crust first, explain lard vs. olive oil, then filling. Don't recall "composition" for food&#160;;) - perhaps not so many headers anyway? Please have Easter pastry with a source in the body of the article. Mention Puglia,Sicily and Naples in the lead? No problem with a late image, but I think the sugar-coated one would illustrate the hook better. - Is this your fourth nomination? --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 20:10, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a>, the review does not cover the remainder of the "within policy" criteria, such as close paraphrasing and neutrality. Please complete this review, being sure to check all the DYK criteria. <a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BlueMoonset" title="User talk:BlueMoonset">talk</a>) 05:40, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd>Close paraphrasing and neutrality checks and is ok. I still suggest alt1 hook. <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) 17:53, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_12">Articles created/expanded on October 12</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=45" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 12">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Salve_Regina_.28Latry.29">Salve Regina (Latry)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSalve_Regina_%28Latry%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Salve_Regina_%28Latry%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg" class="image" title="Great organ of Notre Dame de Paris"><img alt="Great organ of Notre Dame de Paris" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4e/Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg/120px-Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg" width="120" height="179" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4e/Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg/180px-Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4e/Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg/240px-Organ_of_Notre-Dame_de_Paris.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2478" data-file-height="3700" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Great organ of Notre Dame de Paris</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Olivier_Latry" title="Olivier Latry">Olivier Latry</a>, organist of the great organ of <a href="/wiki/Notre_Dame_de_Paris" title="Notre Dame de Paris">Notre Dame de Paris</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, derived <i><b><a href="/wiki/Salve_Regina_(Latry)" title="Salve Regina (Latry)">Salve Regina</a></b></i> from his own improvisation?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Olivier_Latry" title="Olivier Latry">Olivier Latry</a>, organist of the great organ of <a href="/wiki/Notre_Dame_de_Paris" title="Notre Dame de Paris">Notre Dame de Paris</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, evokes in <i><b><a href="/wiki/Salve_Regina_(Latry)" title="Salve Regina (Latry)">Salve Regina</a></b></i> moments of despair and bliss?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Pasticciotto" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Pasticciotto">Pasticciotto</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:21, 19 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="John_Peirce">John Peirce</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJohn_Peirce&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=John_Peirce&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:John_Peirce,_ca_1900.jpg" class="image" title="John Peirce"><img alt="John Peirce" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/John_Peirce%2C_ca_1900.jpg/120px-John_Peirce%2C_ca_1900.jpg" width="120" height="136" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/John_Peirce%2C_ca_1900.jpg/180px-John_Peirce%2C_ca_1900.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/John_Peirce%2C_ca_1900.jpg/240px-John_Peirce%2C_ca_1900.jpg 2x" data-file-width="282" data-file-height="319" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">John Peirce</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that when the early telephone was being developed <b><a href="/wiki/John_Peirce" title="John Peirce">John Peirce</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> invented the mouthpiece that was used for the hand-held version?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Mining_industry_of_Senegal" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Mining industry of Senegal">Template:Did you know nominations/Mining industry of Senegal</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know#New" title="Wikipedia:Did you know">New Enough</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>

<p><b>Overall:</b> <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Passes DYK checklist.</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Review</b> <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Good to go! Meets core policies and guidelines, and in particular: is neutral; cites sources with inline citations; is free of close paraphrasing issues, copyright violations and plagiarism. DYK nomination was timely and article is easily long enough. Every paragraph is cited. Hook references are verified and cited. No copyright violations or too close paraphrasing. <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=John+Peirce&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">Earwig's copy violation detector John Peirce</a> report gives it a clean bill. All hooks are hooky enough, I think, and relate directly to the essence of the article. It is interesting, decently neutral, and appropriately cited. QPQ done. <span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><a href="/wiki/User:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#060">7&amp;6=thirteen</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User talk:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#000">☎</b></a>)</span> 12:59, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ardstinchar_Castle">Ardstinchar Castle</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FArdstinchar_Castle&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ardstinchar_Castle&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>

</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ardstinchar_Castle,_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg" class="image" title="Remains of Ardstinchar Castle"><img alt="Remains of Ardstinchar Castle" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ardstinchar_Castle%2C_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg/120px-Ardstinchar_Castle%2C_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ardstinchar_Castle%2C_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg/180px-Ardstinchar_Castle%2C_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ardstinchar_Castle%2C_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg/240px-Ardstinchar_Castle%2C_Ballantrae_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692808.jpg 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="479" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Remains of Ardstinchar Castle</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ardstinchar_Castle" title="Ardstinchar Castle">Ardstinchar Castle</a></b>, a 15th-century castle, was demolished and stone was used to build a bridge over the <a href="/wiki/River_Stinchar" title="River Stinchar">river Stinchar</a> in 1770?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Moved to mainspace by <a href="/wiki/User:Supdiop" title="User:Supdiop">Supdiop</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Supdiop" title="User talk:Supdiop">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 04:31, 13 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article is long enough and posted by due date. Hook is cited and verified. No copy vio noted and the text is neutral. Author has less than 5 DYKs as verified from his talk page, hence QPQ is not required. Good to go.<b><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nvvchar" title="User talk:Nvvchar"><span style="font-variant:small-caps;color:#003366">Nvvchar</span></a></b>. 12:28, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Melon_soup">Melon soup</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMelon_soup&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Melon_soup&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_(8318628657).jpg" class="image" title="Cantaloupe soup is a type of melon soup"><img alt="Cantaloupe soup is a type of melon soup" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_%288318628657%29.jpg/120px-MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_%288318628657%29.jpg" width="120" height="71" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_%288318628657%29.jpg/180px-MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_%288318628657%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_%288318628657%29.jpg/240px-MuskMelonPowderedShrimpBrokenHoneydewNasturtiumProsciutto_%288318628657%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3024" data-file-height="1796" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Cantaloupe soup is a type of melon soup</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that several varieties of <b><a href="/wiki/Melon_soup" title="Melon soup">melon soup</a></b> exist, such as bitter melon soup, cantaloupe soup <i>(example pictured)</i> and winter melon soup?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Baryonyx" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Baryonyx">Baryonyx</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<li><b>Review</b> <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Good to go! Meets core policies and guidelines, and in particular: is neutral; cites sources with inline citations; is free of close paraphrasing issues, copyright violations and plagiarism. DYK nomination was timely and article is easily long enough. Every paragraph is cited. Hook references are verified and cited. No copyright violations or too close paraphrasing. <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Melon+soup&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">Earwig's copy violation detector Melon Soup</a> report gives it a clean bill. The hook is hooky enough, I think, and relates directly to the essence of the article. It is interesting, decently neutral, and appropriately cited. QPQ done. <span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><a href="/wiki/User:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#060">7&amp;6=thirteen</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User talk:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#000">☎</b></a>)</span> 01:23, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Baryonyx">Baryonyx</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBaryonyx&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Baryonyx&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Baryonyx_BW.jpg" class="image" title="Baryonyx with a fish"><img alt="Baryonyx with a fish" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Baryonyx_BW.jpg/120px-Baryonyx_BW.jpg" width="120" height="42" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Baryonyx_BW.jpg/180px-Baryonyx_BW.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Baryonyx_BW.jpg/240px-Baryonyx_BW.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="277" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Baryonyx with a fish</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that with a head shape likened to a <a href="/wiki/Gharial" title="Gharial">gharial</a>, the dinosaur <i><b><a href="/wiki/Baryonyx" title="Baryonyx">Baryonyx</a></b></i> is thought to have eaten fish?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Kosherfest" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Kosherfest">Template:Did you know nominations/Kosherfest</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:FunkMonk" title="User:FunkMonk">FunkMonk</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:FunkMonk" title="User talk:FunkMonk">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Casliber" title="User:Casliber">Casliber</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Casliber" title="User talk:Casliber">talk</a>) at 00:25, 13 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Promoted to GA status on 12 October 2015, content of the hook is backed with inline citation to reliable sources in the article, checks for copyvio reveals no problems (e.g. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Baryonyx&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">[7]</a>), all non-lead paragraphs have inline citations, QPQ review performed by the nominator. Interesting hook that generates interest in the topic. Image is properly licensed.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I added an inline citation to the article at the end of a sentence about the dinosaur being thought to have eaten fish. I cannot find an inline citation to a reliable source at the end of a sentence in the article stating that the dinosaur has a head shaped like a gharial. As per <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WIADYK" title="Wikipedia:WIADYK" class="mw-redirect">WP:WIADYK</a> point #3, "Each fact in the hook must be supported in the article by at least one inline citation to a reliable source, <i>appearing no later than the end of the sentence(s) offering that fact</i>" (italic emphasis mine). After this is performed, this will be good to go. <span class="smallcaps" style="font-variant:small-caps;"><a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">North America</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Northamerica1000" title="User talk:Northamerica1000"><font size="-2">1000</font></a></sup></span> 01:03, 13 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Baryonyx&amp;type=revision&amp;diff=685471900&amp;oldid=685470090">Added</a> now. <a href="/wiki/User:Casliber" title="User:Casliber">Cas Liber</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Casliber" title="User talk:Casliber">talk</a> <b>·</b> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Casliber" title="Special:Contributions/Casliber">contribs</a>) 01:17, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
