<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Pachycondyla_petrosa">Pachycondyla petrosa</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPachycondyla_petrosa&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pachycondyla_petrosa&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg" class="image" title="Pachycondyla petrosa holotype"><img alt="Pachycondyla petrosa holotype" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg/120px-Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg" width="120" height="74" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg/180px-Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg/240px-Pachycondyla_petrosa_holotype_SMFMEI12273_01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1315" data-file-height="808" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i>Pachycondyla petrosa</i> holotype</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the one known fossil of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Pachycondyla_petrosa" title="Pachycondyla petrosa">Pachycondyla petrosa</a></b></i> <i>(pictured)</i> might be a queen or a worker?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Reviewed <i><a href="/wiki/Dibaeis_baeomyces" title="Dibaeis baeomyces">Dibaeis baeomyces</a></i> of the nomination.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Kevmin" title="User:Kevmin">Kevmin</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Kevmin" title="User talk:Kevmin">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 22:19, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Martel.2C_Lot">Martel, Lot</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMartel%2C_Lot&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Martel%2C_Lot&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the town of <b><a href="/wiki/Martel,_Lot" title="Martel, Lot">Martel</a></b> is said to have been named after <a href="/wiki/Charles_Martel" title="Charles Martel">Charles Martel</a>, nicknamed "Martellus" after his victory in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Tours" title="Battle of Tours">Battle of Tours</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the town of <b><a href="/wiki/Martel,_Lot" title="Martel, Lot">Martel</a></b> is said to have been named after an eighth century <a href="/wiki/Charles_Martel" title="Charles Martel">Frankish statesman</a> nicknamed "Martellus" after his victory in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Tours" title="Battle of Tours">Battle of Tours</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Gunfright" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Gunfright">Gunfright</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 19:40, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> 5x expanded within timeframe, so long enough and recent enough. It's well written and provided with sources. QPQ done. The hook, however, is problematic. The source doesn't claim the town is named after Charles Martel, only that "Martel" means hammer, and that a legend credits Charles Martel with founding the city. For all we know it could be an example of <a href="/wiki/False_etymology" title="False etymology">false etymology</a>. But how about something like this:</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><b>Alt 1</b> ... that the town of <b><a href="/wiki/Martel,_Lot" title="Martel, Lot">Martel</a></b> is said to have been founded by <a href="/wiki/Charles_Martel" title="Charles Martel">Charles Martel</a>, nicknamed "the hammer" after his victory in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Tours" title="Battle of Tours">Battle of Tours</a>?</dd>
<dd>Let me know what you think. <a href="/wiki/User:Yakikaki" title="User:Yakikaki">Yakikaki</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yakikaki" title="User talk:Yakikaki">talk</a>) 19:41, 15 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Yakikaki" title="User:Yakikaki">Yakikaki</a>:</span> Alt1 is fine by me. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 04:53, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> OK, then a new reviewer has to take a look on the alt hook. <a href="/wiki/User:Yakikaki" title="User:Yakikaki">Yakikaki</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yakikaki" title="User talk:Yakikaki">talk</a>) 16:27, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Kate_Macintosh">Kate Macintosh</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FKate_Macintosh&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Kate_Macintosh" title="Kate Macintosh">Kate Macintosh</a></b> designed a social housing complex in London that was described as "one of the most remarkable housing developments in the country"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Llanos_long-nosed_armadillo" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Llanos long-nosed armadillo">Llanos long-nosed armadillo</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:97198" title="User talk:97198">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 14:58, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New article, long enough, well sourced, hook fact supported by inline citation. Article is neutral in tone, looks good to me. –&#160;<a href="/wiki/User:Muboshgu" title="User:Muboshgu">Muboshgu</a>&#160;(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Muboshgu#top" title="User talk:Muboshgu">talk</a>) 19:37, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="BDS-1">BDS-1</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBDS-1&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=BDS-1&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/BDS-1" title="BDS-1">BDS-1</a></b>, a <a href="/wiki/Neurotoxin" title="Neurotoxin">neurotoxin</a> produced by the <a href="/wiki/Snakelocks_anemone" title="Snakelocks anemone">snakelocks anemone</a>, is being investigated for therapeutic uses in the treatment of <a href="/wiki/Alzheimer%27s_disease" title="Alzheimer's disease">Alzheimer's</a> and <a href="/wiki/Parkinson%27s_disease" title="Parkinson's disease">Parkinson's</a> diseases?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Oz1na1&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Oz1na1 (page does not exist)">Oz1na1</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Oz1na1" title="User talk:Oz1na1">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:WikiDan61" title="User:WikiDan61">WikiDan61</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:WikiDan61" title="User talk:WikiDan61">talk</a>) at 13:34, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The hook is not even mentioned in the article. <a href="/wiki/User:FunkyCanute" title="User:FunkyCanute">FunkyCanute</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:FunkyCanute" title="User talk:FunkyCanute">talk</a>) 16:29, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>It was. It has been <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=BDS-1&amp;type=revision&amp;diff=685839875&amp;oldid=685436785">removed</a> as a speculative <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:NOR" title="Wikipedia:NOR" class="mw-redirect">synthesis</a> of the available sources. Nomination withdrawn. <a href="/wiki/User:WikiDan61" title="User:WikiDan61"><font color="green">WikiDan61</font></a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:WikiDan61" title="User talk:WikiDan61">ChatMe!</a></sup><sub><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/WikiDan61" title="Special:Contributions/WikiDan61">ReadMe!!</a></sub> 16:53, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Suillus_bovinus">Suillus bovinus</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSuillus_bovinus&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Suillus_bovinus&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_(%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1)%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG" class="image" title="Suillus bovinus (left, right) and Gomphidius roseus (centre)"><img alt="Suillus bovinus (left, right) and Gomphidius roseus (centre)" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_%28%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%29%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG/120px-Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_%28%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%29%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_%28%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%29%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG/180px-Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_%28%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%29%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_%28%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%29%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG/240px-Suillus_bovinus_%26_Gomphidius_roseus_%28%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%E3%81%A8%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%82%AE%E3%82%BF%E3%82%B1%29%E7%AF%A0%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E7%9B%83%E3%83%B6%E5%B2%B3_DSCF9456.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2304" data-file-height="1728" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Suillus bovinus (left, right) and Gomphidius roseus (centre)</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Suillus_bovinus" title="Suillus bovinus">Jersey cow mushroom</a></b> is parasitised by the <b><a href="/wiki/Gomphidius_roseus" title="Gomphidius roseus">rosy spike-cap</a></b> <i>(both pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Frozen_Fever">Frozen Fever</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFrozen_Fever&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Frozen_Fever&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that it took only six months to complete the production of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Frozen_Fever" title="Frozen Fever">Frozen Fever</a></b></i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:<s>... that the entire <i><a href="/wiki/Frozen_(2013_film)" title="Frozen (2013 film)">Frozen</a></i> animation team returned for the short film <i><b><a href="/wiki/Frozen_Fever" title="Frozen Fever">Frozen Fever</a></b></i>?</s></li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: Soon</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Captain_Assassin!" title="User:Captain Assassin!">Captain Assassin!</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Captain_Assassin!" title="User talk:Captain Assassin!">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 01:35, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Length, date of GA status both check out fine. Spotchecks reveal no evidence of copyvio or close para-phrasing. The original hook is appropriately referenced inline. I'm not keen on ALT1; for one thing the article doesn't explicitly state that it is true, and secondly, what defines an animation team? I'm happy to pass this with the original hook once a QPQ has been completed. <a href="/wiki/User:Harrias" title="User:Harrias"><b style="color:#00cc33">Harrias</b></a> <sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Harrias" title="User talk:Harrias"><span style="color:#009900">talk</span></a></sup> 15:15, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSulawesi_myna&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Sulawesi_myna" title="Sulawesi myna">Sulawesi myna</a></b> sometimes issues a "meeow"-like sound with its head thrusting forwards and its back feathers fluffed up?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election,_October_2015" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election, October 2015">Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election, October 2015</a></li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Jack_jumper_ant">Jack jumper ant</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJack_jumper_ant&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jack_jumper_ant&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Shattuck_36015,_ANIC32-042178,_Myrmecia,_near_Bungendore,_NSW_(3821202295)_(2).jpg" class="image" title="Jack jumper ant worker foraging on top of a dry flower"><img alt="Jack jumper ant worker foraging on top of a dry flower" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Shattuck_36015%2C_ANIC32-042178%2C_Myrmecia%2C_near_Bungendore%2C_NSW_%283821202295%29_%282%29.jpg/120px-Shattuck_36015%2C_ANIC32-042178%2C_Myrmecia%2C_near_Bungendore%2C_NSW_%283821202295%29_%282%29.jpg" width="120" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Shattuck_36015%2C_ANIC32-042178%2C_Myrmecia%2C_near_Bungendore%2C_NSW_%283821202295%29_%282%29.jpg/180px-Shattuck_36015%2C_ANIC32-042178%2C_Myrmecia%2C_near_Bungendore%2C_NSW_%283821202295%29_%282%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Shattuck_36015%2C_ANIC32-042178%2C_Myrmecia%2C_near_Bungendore%2C_NSW_%283821202295%29_%282%29.jpg/240px-Shattuck_36015%2C_ANIC32-042178%2C_Myrmecia%2C_near_Bungendore%2C_NSW_%283821202295%29_%282%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="853" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Jack jumper ant worker foraging on top of a dry flower</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Jack_jumper_ant" title="Jack jumper ant">Jack jumper ant</a></b> workers <i>(pictured)</i> are <a href="/wiki/Gamergate" title="Gamergate">gamergates</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Magellanic_oystercatcher" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Magellanic oystercatcher">Magellanic oystercatcher</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJohn_Martin_%28judge%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/John_Martin_(judge)" title="John Martin (judge)">John Martin</a></b>, first Chief Justice of the Cherokee Supreme Court, had no formal legal training?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:...<b><a href="/wiki/John_Martin_(judge)" title="John Martin (judge)">John Martin</a></b>, first Chief Justice of the Cherokee Supreme Court, was a great grandson of <a href="/wiki/Joseph_Martin_(general)" title="Joseph Martin (general)">Joseph Martin</a>, a noted American leader in the American Revolutionary War?</li>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>

</ul>
</div>

</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Temperance_songs">Temperance songs</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FTemperance_songs&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Temperance_songs&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG" class="image" title="Temperance song sheet music cover"><img alt="Temperance song sheet music cover" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG/120px-Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG" width="120" height="152" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG/180px-Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG/240px-Temperance_song_sheet_music_cover_by_M.Evans.PNG 2x" data-file-width="484" data-file-height="614" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Temperance song sheet music cover</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Stephen_Foster" title="Stephen Foster">Stephen Foster</a> wrote a <b><a href="/wiki/Temperance_songs" title="Temperance songs">song against the dangers of alcohol</a></b> <i>(another temperance song pictured)</i> set to the same tune as "<a href="/wiki/Oh!_Susanna" title="Oh! Susanna">Oh! Susanna</a>"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the tune for "<a href="/wiki/Oh!_Susanna" title="Oh! Susanna">Oh! Susanna</a>" by <a href="/wiki/Stephen_Foster" title="Stephen Foster">Stephen Foster</a> was used ten years later by Foster to write a <b><a href="/wiki/Temperance_songs" title="Temperance songs">song</a></b> <i>(another temperance song pictured)</i> against the dangers of alcohol?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Barbara_(WVS)" title="User:Barbara (WVS)">Barbara (WVS)</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Barbara_(WVS)" title="User talk:Barbara (WVS)">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:46, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<p><br /></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Comments, not a review. <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Barbara_(WVS)" title="User:Barbara (WVS)">Barbara (WVS)</a>:</span> Commendable subject, first of all. Secondly, I'm not sure you can claim Stephen Foster and Oh Susanna! as DYK, although you can link them in the hooks. I'm guessing that's what you really meant to do, but are uncertain about the process steps here.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Temperance songs created by Barbara (WVS) on October 14, 2015 - no problem with the date on this one.</li>
<li>Oh Susanna! is too old for DYK credit (but you can link it). It was created May 19, 2005 and has not been expanded.</li>
<li>Stephen Foster was created January 30, 2003 and was 10065 characters (0 words) "readable prose size" on Aug 25, 2015, the last date before you began expansion with your alternate account of Bfpage. It would have to be 50,325 characters of readable prose to qualify as 5X expansion. At present, it's only 12991 characters (0 words) "readable prose size" Also, the expansion needs to be done within 7 days of the nomination. You started that expansion on Sept 14, 2015.</li>
<li>You need to source the Political developments section.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> So, I'm giving the turn-around arrow here, to make sure somebody gives this nomination a complete review. And I'm pinging <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Mandarax" title="User:Mandarax">Mandarax</a>:</span> and <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:BlueMoonset" title="User:BlueMoonset">BlueMoonset</a>:</span> to see if any technical tweaks about the two hooks need to be given to this template.<a href="/wiki/User:Maile66" title="User:Maile66">— Maile</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Maile66" title="User talk:Maile66">talk</a>) 22:12, 17 October 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li>Done. I also added a caption and <i>(pictured)</i>, which anyone should feel free to shorten or otherwise tweak. <a href="/wiki/User:Mandarax" title="User:Mandarax"><span style="color:green">M<small>AN</small>d<small>ARAX</small></span></a>&#160;<span style="color:blue">•</span>&#160;<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mandarax" title="User talk:Mandarax"><span style="color:#999900"><small>XAЯA</small>b<small>ИA</small>M</span></a> 01:43, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Thank you so much for the fix and I apologize for not fully understanding the process, which resulted in someone else having to take the time to clarify my submission to highlight the <a href="/wiki/Temperance_songs" title="Temperance songs">Temperance songs</a> article. I knew the others didn't meet the standards but thought they all had to be submitted because they all appear in the hook. The graphic that accompanies the submission is a cover from another Temperance song, not the Stephen Foster song. The text on the graphic is quite amusing and says something like "the lips that touch liquor shall never touch mine" but it is not the temperance song he wrote. The graphic is meant to represent an example of a Temperance song, not the Stephen Foster song. Sorry to bore you with the details but the exact lyrics to Foster's temperance song is contained in the article Temperance songs. You'll have to hum "Oh Susanna" along with the new lyrics sometime, it will make you laugh.
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:Barbara_(WVS)" title="User:Barbara (WVS)">Barbara (WVS)</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Barbara_(WVS)" title="User talk:Barbara (WVS)">talk</a>) 02:08, 18 October 2015 (UTC)

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign.2C_2000">Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2000</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDonald_Trump_presidential_campaign%2C_2000&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign%2C_2000&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Trump_2000.png" class="image" title="Donald Trump 2000 campaign logo"><img alt="Donald Trump 2000 campaign logo" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Trump_2000.png/120px-Trump_2000.png" width="120" height="43" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Trump_2000.png/180px-Trump_2000.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Trump_2000.png/240px-Trump_2000.png 2x" data-file-width="2592" data-file-height="918" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Donald Trump 2000 campaign logo</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that during his <b><a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign,_2000" title="Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2000">2000 campaign</a></b> for <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">U.S. president</a>, <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a> (<i>pictured</i>) named <a href="/wiki/Oprah_Winfrey" title="Oprah Winfrey">Oprah Winfrey</a> as his ideal <a href="/wiki/Running_mate" title="Running mate">running mate</a>&#160;?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/United_States_presidential_election,_2016" title="United States presidential election, 2016">2016</a> <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">U.S. presidential</a> candidate <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a> (<i>pictured</i>) previously <b><a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign,_2000" title="Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2000">ran for president</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/United_States_presidential_election,_2000" title="United States presidential election, 2000">2000</a>&#160;?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/" title="Template:Did you know nominations/" class="mw-redirect">Suzanne Sjögren</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dd>
<ul>
<li>Article is new, meets Wikipedia policies, DYK hook is cited in article, and article is definitely long enough. Hook format is short enough and hook is interesting, but the formatting is a bit funny. The ellipses before the question mark are unnecessary, I believe. I also am unsure about the photo. It's from a new user and says it's their own work but it's hard to verify, imo. I would cut the photo just to be safe. <a href="/wiki/User:Fuzchia" title="User:Fuzchia">Fuzchia</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Fuzchia" title="User talk:Fuzchia">talk</a>) 17:04, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Rocio_Romero">Rocio Romero</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRocio_Roero&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rocio_Romero&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Chilean-born <b><a href="/wiki/Rocio_Romero" title="Rocio Romero">Rocio Romero</a></b> redesigned the <a href="/wiki/Kit_houses_in_North_America" title="Kit houses in North America">kit home</a> to feature modern, <a href="/wiki/Minimalism#Minimalist_design_and_architecture" title="Minimalism">minimalist</a> aesthetics, using natural airflow and lighting?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Shanakdakhete" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Shanakdakhete">Template:Did you know nominations/Shanakdakhete</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: For WikiProject Women in Red's Architecture editathon</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:29, 13 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table">2015 National Games of India medal table</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that an estimated 11,641 athletes participated in the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table" title="2015 National Games of India medal table">2015 National Games of India</a></b></s>?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>
<li>Hook wording trimmed a bit. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 22:32, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The hook is short enough, but it doesn't seem to be particularly well tied to the article. It needs a new hook that's related to the medal table. As for everything else, the article is new enough (started on the 12th), long enough (2000+ characters), is neutral, cites properly, and <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=2015+National+Games+of+India+medal+table&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">looks to be free of copyright violations</a>. QPQ isn't needed (second nomination), and there's no image. Let me know when you've got some new hooks and I'll re-review. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:The Squirrel Conspiracy (page does not exist)">The Squirrel Conspiracy</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy" title="User talk:The Squirrel Conspiracy">talk</a>) 20:17, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT1</b>: ... that 1334 medals were awarded in the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table" title="2015 National Games of India medal table">2015 National Games of India</a></b>?</s></li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>: ... that <a href="/wiki/Services_Sports_Control_Board" title="Services Sports Control Board">Services Sports Control Board</a> topped the <b><a href="/wiki/2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table" title="2015 National Games of India medal table">2015 National Games of India medal table</a></b>? <a href="/wiki/User:Bharatiya29" title="User:Bharatiya29">Bharatiya29</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Bharatiya29" title="User talk:Bharatiya29">talk</a>) 13:57, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT3</b>: ... that 1334 <b><a href="/wiki/2015_National_Games_of_India_medal_table" title="2015 National Games of India medal table">medals were awarded</a></b> in the <a href="/wiki/2015_National_Games_of_India" title="2015 National Games of India">2015 National Games of India</a>?</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> I reworded ALT1 so that it was clear that the bolded article referred to the medals table. <u>Either of ALT 2 or ALT 3 are good to go.</u> If you prefer one over the other, strike the one you don't like out, so that the one you like is the one that gets picked for the main page. If you don't have a preference, it'll be the choice of the admin that promotes this to the main page. <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:The Squirrel Conspiracy (page does not exist)">The Squirrel Conspiracy</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Squirrel_Conspiracy" title="User talk:The Squirrel Conspiracy">talk</a>) 22:52, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_14">Articles created/expanded on October 14</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=48" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 14">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Maria_M.C3.B6ller">Maria Möller</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMaria_M%C3%B6ller&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Maria_M%C3%B6ller&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg" class="image" title="Maria Möller"><img alt="Maria Möller" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg/120px-Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg" width="120" height="137" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg/180px-Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg/240px-Maria_M%C3%B6ller_2012.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3272" data-file-height="3744" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Maria Möller</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that actress <b><a href="/wiki/Maria_M%C3%B6ller" title="Maria Möller">Maria Möller</a></b> is a classically trained <a href="/wiki/Mezzo-soprano" title="Mezzo-soprano">mezzo-soprano</a> and soloist?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/IWGP_Heavyweight_Championship_(IGF)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/IWGP Heavyweight Championship (IGF)">IWGP Heavyweight Championship (IGF)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Werldwayd" title="User:Werldwayd">Werldwayd</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Werldwayd" title="User talk:Werldwayd">talk</a>). If you expand it, I can review it for you, but it needs to first meet the length requirements. Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 19:53, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

Let me know what you think.<a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) 19:59, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article was created on October 14, it is over the 1500 character threshold, and there are no policy violations. The image used here is licensed via CC. The hook is under 200 characters and I will AGF that because Möller is primarily known for her work on stage, the fact that she is a classically trained vocalist is unusual and interesting. However, there are two issues that need to be addressed before this nomination can pass. The first is that the link to the source supporting this hook is dead. Can you fix the link? The second is that another editor has stated the QPQ used for this nomination does not meet minimum standards necessary for a review. Can you supply another QPQ? Also, you say that Möller is a "suffler." I'm not too familiar with all the jobs associated with the stage and theater, but I couldn't find a definition for what a "suffler" is. Can you clarify this? Thanks, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 21:40, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<ul>

</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that ....<b><a href="/wiki/Salvatore_Grimaldi" title="Salvatore Grimaldi">Salvatore Grimaldi</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> received an <a href="/wiki/Honorary_doctorate" title="Honorary doctorate" class="mw-redirect">honorary doctorate</a> from Mälardalens College in 2004?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Navroji_Mistri" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Navroji Mistri">Navroji Mistri</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Werldwayd" title="User:Werldwayd">Werldwayd</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Werldwayd" title="User talk:Werldwayd">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) at 12:40, 18 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> It looks like this article is also below the 1500 character minimum. -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 20:02, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a>:</span> I have expanded it some. Take a look.<a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) 20:13, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article was created on October 14, the article is over the 1500 character threshold, and the article is within policy. The images are licensed by CC. QPQ is satisfied, though you really need to check for close paraphrasing when reviewing nominations. I double checked the <a href="/wiki/Navroji_Mistri" title="Navroji Mistri">Navroji Mistri</a> article (everything looked okay), but checking for plagiarism is an essential component of DYK reviews. The hook here is under 200 characters, but I don't think it satisfies the "interesting" requirement. People get honorary degrees all the time for all kinds of reasons -- there is nothing inherently noteworthy or interesting about receiving an honorary degree. Therefore, I would like to propose this alternate hook:
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b> ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Salvatore_Grimaldi" title="Salvatore Grimaldi">Salvatore Grimaldi</a></b> has been described as the "richest immigrant in Sweden"?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd>Let me know what you think of this new hook. If you like it, then we'll have to get another editor to approve it, because you cannot approve your own hooks. Best, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 23:03, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a>:</span> I agree with that hook.&#160;:)<a href="/wiki/User:BabbaQ" title="User:BabbaQ">BabbaQ</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:BabbaQ" title="User talk:BabbaQ">talk</a>) 17:33, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've reworded the first hook and unlinked Sweden in the ALT1, per <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:OVERLINK" title="Wikipedia:OVERLINK" class="mw-redirect">WP:OVERLINK</a>. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 20:43, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Because I am the author of <b>ALT1</b>, we'll need another editor to approve this. Many thanks to <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> for their editorial fine-tuning! -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 21:58, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Iranian_underground_missile_bases">Iranian underground missile bases</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FIranian_underground_missile_bases&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Iranian_underground_missile_bases&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that according to the commander of the <a href="/wiki/IRGC_AF" title="IRGC AF" class="mw-redirect">IRGC AF</a>, there are <a href="/wiki/Iranian_underground_missile_bases" title="Iranian underground missile bases"><b>underground missile bases</b></a> in all the provinces and cities of <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a> at a depth of 500 meters ready for launch by <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran" title="Supreme Leader of Iran">supreme leader</a>'s order?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:%D8%A8%D9%84%D8%AF%D9%87&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:بلده (page does not exist)">بلده</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:%D8%A8%D9%84%D8%AF%D9%87" title="User talk:بلده">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) at 07:29, 18 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_delete_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol delete vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Symbol_delete_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_delete_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article has been thoroughly and exhaustively reviewed and is found lacking, <i>to wit</i>: (1) Hook-2 - content is not interesting, and, (2) Article-3 - content is not neutral; it appears to intentionally frame alleged Iranian ballistic missiles as offensive weaponry, enforcing an idea advanced by some elements in contemporary U.S. political discourse of an "expansionist" Iranian state (the numerous userboxes this relatively new editor has placed on their userpage is not sufficient to overcome this concern). Further, the RS of Xinhua and Trend News Agency merits scrutiny. <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 11:59, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>I'm sorry, but can any one explain what <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> really means? The hook is so interesting to be repeated by numerous reliable sources, one could easily get it by a simple search through those news outlets some of which are used as references to this article. The reviewer would better exactly say which part of the article is not neutral and why (the reviewer has made some general comments!). Finally, I can't understand how my user page <span class="inline-quote-talk" style="font-family: Georgia, 'DejaVu Serif', serif; color: #008560;">"is not sufficient to overcome this [which I don't understand] concern."</span> The article is merely reflecting the facts presented by the sources. There's also an analysis section. I would add any other views if there existed! <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 12:57, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>IMO, the tone of this article presupposes Iranian ballistic missiles are offensive weapons, when there is a wide body of contention (e.g. Ken Waltz, et. al.) that advances the idea that Iranian ballistic missiles are a necessary power balancing technology (Ali Akbar Velayati, himself, has referred to them as "defensive weapons"). One-third of the article relies on a quote from an IDF official expressing fear of a "surprise attack," which - without any balancing statement - simply plays into an Islamophobic trope. This article seems to attempt to make Iran look like some kind of cartoon villain with secret bunkers inside volcanoes on skull-shaped islands. <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 13:11, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd>Those sources (Xinhua and Trend News Agency) were replaced by <a href="/wiki/The_Guardian" title="The Guardian">The Guardian</a>! <a href="/wiki/User:Mhhossein" title="User:Mhhossein">Mhhossein</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mhhossein" title="User talk:Mhhossein">talk</a>) 13:09, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Given that the issue of Xinhua and Trend has been addressed, I withdraw my DYKno - while maintaining my strenuous objections about neutrality and interest-level - and defer to a new editor to review. <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 13:18, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Roshanara">Roshanara</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FRoshanara&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Roshanara&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg" class="image" title="Roshanara by Robert Henri"><img alt="Roshanara by Robert Henri" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg/120px-Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg" width="120" height="155" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg/180px-Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg/240px-Roshanara-by-Robert-Henri-107.jpg 2x" data-file-width="618" data-file-height="800" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Roshanara by Robert Henri</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Roshanara" title="Roshanara">Roshanara</a></b>, who was born and trained in India, taught <a href="/wiki/Bette_Davis" title="Bette Davis">Bette Davis</a> to dance?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Band-tailed_fruiteater" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Band-tailed fruiteater">QPQ = 6 of 8 Barred fruiteater</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Richard_Arthur_Norton_(1958-_)" title="User:Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )">Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Richard_Arthur_Norton_(1958-_)" title="User talk:Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) at 21:57, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough (moved to articlespace on 14 October), long enough (2341 characters). Article is neutral, appropriately referenced, and spotchecked material did not reveal plagariasm or close paraphrasing. Hook is interesting, and appropriately worded. One correction should be made prior to acceptance and queuing: the sentence supporting the hook appears to be missing a word ("Craddock taught and the later film star, Bette Davis was one of her dance pupils", probably should read "taught dance").</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>The image requested has some licensing issues. In fact, all three images have licensing issues to a greater or lesser extent. The first two are both licensed <a href="/wiki/Template:PD-US" title="Template:PD-US">PD-US</a> as works published before 1923, but there needs to be evidence that they were actually <i>published</i> and not just <i>taken</i> prior to that date (I'm pretty sure these are both publicity photos, which would clearly have been distributed and, thus, published, but that should be clarified). The third image, which is requested as part of this DYK, is licensed <a href="//commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Template:PD-old-80" class="extiw" title="commons:Template:PD-old-80">PD-old-80</a>, but this is not sufficient to demonstrate the artwork is in the public domain <i>in the United States</i>. Because this image may have been cropped somewhat from the actual artwork, it is not safe to assume that it did not comply with the initial copyright registration formalities in 1926 when it was created; however, since Robert Henri died shortly after painting it, it is very unlikely that a copyright renewal was filed in 1954. That would, at a minimum, qualify it for <a href="/wiki/Template:PD-US-not_renewed" title="Template:PD-US-not renewed">PD-US-not renewed</a>, but you will need to check the 1954 <i>Catalog of Copyright Entries</i> to be certain of that. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 17:43, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>hmm you are setting some difficult problems. I'll answer the three of them in the order you raised them <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a>:</span></dd>
</dl>
<ol>
<li>As regards the hook - please suggest an alt that suits you. It makes sense to me, but I don't understand your suggested change that addresses the point you are making.</li>
<li>The first two images. You ask for prove that publicity pictures were distributed. I know how to show publishing but I have no idea how to do prove distribution if not published. Are you suggesting we delete them as one is from the Library of Congress. Maybe they have the evidence you say is required? Otherwise this might snowball into deleting a great number of photographs on Commons. Do you know how to prove that pictures were distributed? I think it unlikely that incontrovertible evidence exists and 'common sense/reasonable person view' may be required. If you are sure then we'll delete them.</li>
<li>Was the third image cropped? Strange question. (Can you supply a link to the rule as I've never seen that bit) But being as this image was placed on line and sold for 130,000 dollars then I would guess that it may be fairly complete. What evidence is required? There is a picture of it in a frame on commons.</li>
</ol>
<dl>
<dd>Thats a long reply I'm afraid, but you have raised some issues and it seems fair that I address them in detail. <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 22:31, 15 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>My apologies if some of my statements were unclear:
<ul>
<li>1) The hook is fine. I was just pointing out that the associated line of text in the article itself (that I quoted, above) reads awkwardly and should probably be cleaned up a little.</li>
<li>2) I know no one likes dealing with the technical details of image licensing! The issue here is that the pre-1923 date only ensures material is in the public domain if it was <i>published</i> prior to that cutoff, not merely <i>created</i>. Upon further review, the Underwood &amp; Underwood image is fine; it has their studio insignia, and is clearly a piece prepared for distribution rather than merely a photograph. I'll <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Richard_Arthur_Norton_(1958-_)" title="User:Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )">Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )</a>:</span>, who uploaded the other of these two images, to see if there's information available to ensure the licensing is all in order there as well.</li>
<li>3) I've done what I can to fix this for you. Mostly, it needed a US-PD notice. "Publication" for artwork is sometimes tricky, but there's very little chance of this being other than in the public domain now.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd>Sorry to be a stickler for the details of licensing. Hopefully everything will be squared away shortly. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 14:02, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Thats OK - we are trying to keep inside the law - whilst completing the prime directive (:-) ). The details of "Richard"s image are now available. I did think they were there but they were not obvious. If you follow the link then it will take to the Library of congress Flickr stream which confirmed that the image was published by the Bains new service in 1915 .... so the 1923 rule applies... and the Library of Congress say its PD <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 15:48, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Yep, I think we're good now. Ideally, that one line in the article could use rewording to improve the prose, but I'm not going to stand on principle over it. <a href="/wiki/User:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User:Squeamish Ossifrage">Squeamish Ossifrage</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Squeamish_Ossifrage" title="User talk:Squeamish Ossifrage">talk</a>) 16:39, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Thomas_.C3.A1_Jesu">Thomas á Jesu</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThomas_%C3%A1_Jesu&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Thomas_%C3%A1_Jesu&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that monks who wanted to live a life of solitude in the 16th-century "desert" hermitages founded by <b><a href="/wiki/Thomas_%C3%A1_Jesu" title="Thomas á Jesu">Thomas á Jesu</a></b> had to apply and meet strict criteria?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Melipona_beecheii" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Melipona beecheii">Melipona beecheii</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Date and expansion OK. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Pinol.2C_M.C3.A1chica">Pinol, Máchica</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FM%C3%A1chica&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( Article history links: <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pinol&amp;action=history">Pinol</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=M%C3%A1chica&amp;action=history">Máchica</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Milk,_machica_(in_bag)_and_pinol_mix_(in_tin).jpg" class="image" title="Milk, máchica (in bag) and pinol mix (in tin)"><img alt="Milk, máchica (in bag) and pinol mix (in tin)" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Milk%2C_machica_%28in_bag%29_and_pinol_mix_%28in_tin%29.jpg/120px-Milk%2C_machica_%28in_bag%29_and_pinol_mix_%28in_tin%29.jpg" width="120" height="96" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Milk%2C_machica_%28in_bag%29_and_pinol_mix_%28in_tin%29.jpg/180px-Milk%2C_machica_%28in_bag%29_and_pinol_mix_%28in_tin%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Milk%2C_machica_%28in_bag%29_and_pinol_mix_%28in_tin%29.jpg/240px-Milk%2C_machica_%28in_bag%29_and_pinol_mix_%28in_tin%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2808" data-file-height="2240" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Milk, <i>máchica</i> (in bag) and <i>pinol</i> mix (in tin)</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that although <i><b><a href="/wiki/Pinol" title="Pinol">pinol</a></b></i>, a drink made with <i><b><a href="/wiki/M%C3%A1chica" title="Máchica">máchica</a></b></i> (toasted barley flour), <i>panela</i> (unrefined sugar) and spices, was invented in the 20th century, it's already considered a traditional beverage of Ecuador?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:GrammarFascist" title="User:GrammarFascist">GrammarFascist</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:GrammarFascist" title="User talk:GrammarFascist">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 03:50, 15 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Saul_Adadi">Saul Adadi</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSaul_Adadi&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Saul_Adadi&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that scholars have uncovered the <a href="/wiki/Pinkasim" title="Pinkasim">record books</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Tripoli" title="Tripoli">Tripoli</a> Jewish community and unpublished manuscripts from the 18th century in the <a href="/wiki/Beth_midrash" title="Beth midrash">study hall</a> of <a href="/wiki/Hakham" title="Hakham">Hakham</a> <b><a href="/wiki/Saul_Adadi" title="Saul Adadi">Saul Adadi</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Teddy%27s_Bigger_Burgers" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Teddy's Bigger Burgers">Template:Did you know nominations/Teddy's Bigger Burgers</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:17, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="William_Donald_Scherzer">William Donald Scherzer</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FWilliam_Donald_Scherzer&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=William_Donald_Scherzer&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:MovableBridge_roll.gif" class="image" title="Rolling lift bridge"><img alt="Rolling lift bridge" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/MovableBridge_roll.gif/120px-MovableBridge_roll.gif" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/MovableBridge_roll.gif/180px-MovableBridge_roll.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/df/MovableBridge_roll.gif 2x" data-file-width="240" data-file-height="180" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Rolling lift bridge</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that <b><a href="/wiki/William_Donald_Scherzer" title="William Donald Scherzer">William Donald Scherzer</a></b> was the inventor of the <a href="/wiki/Bascule_bridge#Types" title="Bascule bridge">first rolling lift bridge</a> (animation)?</s></li>
<li><b>ALT1</b> ... that <b><a href="/wiki/William_Donald_Scherzer" title="William Donald Scherzer">William Donald Scherzer</a></b> invented the <a href="/wiki/Bascule_bridge#Types" title="Bascule bridge">first rolling lift bridge</a> (animation)?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Mining_industry_of_Senegal" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Mining industry of Senegal">Template:Did you know nominations/Mining industry of Senegal</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:41, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Lots of refs including one that supports the hook. Lengths are fine. I think animated gifs are great for this and they make a change from another head shot. I added some text to explain how the bridge works. Neutral and I saw no close paraphrasing but pay walls stopped me on some sources. Nice little artible. Thanks <a href="/wiki/User:Victuallers" title="User:Victuallers">Victuallers</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Victuallers" title="User talk:Victuallers">talk</a>) 14:21, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>In the interests of brevity, I've added a more concise <b>ALT1</b>. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 22:29, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>As originator of hook I have struck original, as I like <b>ALT1</b> better. Thanks Edwardx.--<a href="/wiki/User:Doug_Coldwell" title="User:Doug Coldwell">Doug Coldwell</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Doug_Coldwell" title="User talk:Doug Coldwell">talk</a>) 22:40, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Murder_of_Richard_Everitt">Murder of Richard Everitt</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMurder_of_Richard_Everitt&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Murder_of_Richard_Everitt&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the perpetrator of the <b><a href="/wiki/Murder_of_Richard_Everitt" title="Murder of Richard Everitt">murder of Richard Everitt</a></b> was never apprehended, because members of the gang who killed him fled to Bangladesh?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Apple_Pencil" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Apple Pencil">Apple Pencil</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User:The Almightey Drill">The Almightey Drill</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:The_Almightey_Drill" title="User talk:The Almightey Drill">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:33, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Verma_Panton">Verma Panton</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVerma_Panton&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Verma_Panton&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the first female architect from the <a href="/wiki/West_Indies#Regions" title="West Indies">West Indies</a> was the Jamaican <b><a href="/wiki/Verma_Panton" title="Verma Panton">Verma Panton</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Buttermilk_Creek_(Susquehanna_River)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Buttermilk Creek (Susquehanna River)">Template:Did you know nominations/Buttermilk Creek (Susquehanna River)</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: For WikiProject Women in Red architecture editathon</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:35, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article was nominated within 1 day of creation and is well over 1500 characters. The article reads neutrally, has in-line citations, and i'm not seeing any issues of close paraphrasing. Good job, actually, on extending sources with just listings of single item achievements into full sentence coverage in the Wiki article. You've done well at varying the sentences too so they don't sound repetitive. Anyways, the hook is within 200 characters, is interesting, neutral, and cited in-line (I extended one of the refs to cover the lede since that's where the hook is from, hope you don't mind. Hooks are required to have direct in-line citation. Stupid rule, I know.) The QPQ has been done and there is no image to review. This article is good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Silver_seren" title="User:Silver seren"><font color="silver">Silver</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Silver_seren" title="User talk:Silver seren"><font color="blue">seren</font></a><sup><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Silver_seren" title="Special:Contributions/Silver seren">C</a></sup> 20:59, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've tweaked the hook wording to avoid repeating "architect". <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 22:27, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>It sounds good to me. <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a>:</span>, you okay with it? <a href="/wiki/User:Silver_seren" title="User:Silver seren"><font color="silver">Silver</font></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Silver_seren" title="User talk:Silver seren"><font color="blue">seren</font></a><sup><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Silver_seren" title="Special:Contributions/Silver seren">C</a></sup> 05:47, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Totally fine. <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>) 05:49, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Eleanore_Pettersen">Eleanore Pettersen</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEleanore_Pettersen&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eleanore_Pettersen&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Richard_Nixon" title="Richard Nixon">Richard Nixon</a> lived in two houses designed by <b><a href="/wiki/Eleanore_Pettersen" title="Eleanore Pettersen">Eleanore Pettersen</a></b>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Eleanore_Pettersen" title="Eleanore Pettersen">Eleanore Pettersen</a></b> was the first woman to open an architectural firm in New Jersey?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Eleanore_Pettersen" title="Eleanore Pettersen">Eleanore Pettersen</a></b>, the first woman to open an architectural firm in New Jersey, designed two houses that were lived in by <a href="/wiki/Richard_Nixon" title="Richard Nixon">Richard Nixon</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/BattleTech_(video_game)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/BattleTech (video game)">BattleTech (video game)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:97198" title="User talk:97198">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 10:15, 14 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

</tr>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources" title="Wikipedia:Citing sources">Adequate sourcing</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>

<li>Free of <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Copyright_violations" title="Wikipedia:Copyright violations">copyright violations</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Plagiarism" title="Wikipedia:Plagiarism">plagiarism</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Close_paraphrasing" title="Wikipedia:Close paraphrasing">close paraphrasing</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>
