<table class="collapsible collapsed" border="1" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
<th style="font-weight:normal;"><b>Hook:</b> Hook has been verified by provided inline citation</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know#Cited_hook" title="Wikipedia:Did you know">Cited</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>

</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<p><b>Overall:</b> <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Passes DYK checklist.</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Review</b> <a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Good to go! Meets core policies and guidelines, and in particular: is neutral; cites sources with inline citations; is free of close paraphrasing issues, copyright violations and plagiarism. DYK nomination was timely and article is easily long enough. Every paragraph is cited. Hook references are verified and cited. No copyright violations or too close paraphrasing. <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Eleanore+Pettersen&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">Earwig's copy violation detector: Eleanore Petterson</a> report gives it a clean bill. Hooks are hooky enough, I think, and relate directly to the essence of the article: interesting, decently neutral, and appropriately cited. QPQ done. <span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><a href="/wiki/User:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#060">7&amp;6=thirteen</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User talk:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#000">☎</b></a>)</span> 12:17, 14 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Could we restate and use ALT 2 as "... that Eleanore Pettersen, one of the first women to open an architectural firm in New Jersey, designed two houses that were lived in by Richard Nixon?" I think it is clearer and better tracks the source's language. <span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><a href="/wiki/User:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#060">7&amp;6=thirteen</b></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:7%266%3Dthirteen" title="User talk:7&amp;6=thirteen"><b style="color:#000">☎</b></a>)</span> 12:31, 14 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.njwomenshistory.org/discover/biographies/eleanor-kendall-pettersen/">The source</a> explicitly says "the first New Jersey woman to open her own architectural firm", so I'm not sure what you're talking about. <a href="/wiki/User:97198" title="User:97198">97198</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:97198" title="User talk:97198">talk</a>) 06:09, 15 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_15">Articles created/expanded on October 15</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=49" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 15">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Boise_National_Forest">Boise National Forest</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBoise_National_Forest&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Boise_National_Forest&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg" class="image" title="Trinity Mountains in Boise National Forest"><img alt="Trinity Mountains in Boise National Forest" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg/120px-Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg/180px-Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg/240px-Boise_National_Forest_10.jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="675" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Trinity Mountains in Boise National Forest</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that mammals present in the <b><a href="/wiki/Boise_National_Forest" title="Boise National Forest">Boise National Forest</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> include <a href="/wiki/Mule_deer" title="Mule deer">mule deer</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elk" title="Elk">elk</a>, <a href="/wiki/Moose" title="Moose">moose</a>, <a href="/wiki/American_black_bear" title="American black bear">black bears</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pronghorn" title="Pronghorn">pronghorn</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cougar" title="Cougar">mountain lions</a>, <a href="/wiki/Coyote" title="Coyote">coyote</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bobcat" title="Bobcat">bobcat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Yellow-bellied_marmot" title="Yellow-bellied marmot">yellow-bellied marmot</a>, <a href="/wiki/North_American_beaver" title="North American beaver">beaver</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Gray_wolf" title="Gray wolf">gray wolves</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Highland_tuco-tuco" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Highland tuco-tuco">Highland tuco-tuco</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

Nominated by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Oceanh&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Oceanh (page does not exist)">Oceanh</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Oceanh" title="User talk:Oceanh">talk</a>) at 17:10, 18 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Eulie_Chowdhury">Eulie Chowdhury</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEulie_Chowdhury&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eulie_Chowdhury&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Eulie_Chowdhury" title="Eulie Chowdhury">Urmila Eulie Chowdhury</a></b>, from India, was the first woman to qualify as an architect in Asia?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Beatriz_del_Cueto" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Beatriz del Cueto">Template:Did you know nominations/Beatriz del Cueto</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="My_Scientology_Movie">My Scientology Movie</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMy_Scientology_Movie&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=My_Scientology_Movie&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg" class="image" title="The Hole at Gold Base, Hemet, California"><img alt="The Hole at Gold Base, Hemet, California" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg/120px-The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg" width="120" height="70" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg/180px-The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg/240px-The_Hole_Gold_Base.jpg 2x" data-file-width="904" data-file-height="529" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">The Hole at Gold Base, Hemet, California</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/My_Scientology_Movie" title="My Scientology Movie">My Scientology Movie</a></b></i> by <a href="/wiki/Louis_Theroux" title="Louis Theroux">Louis Theroux</a> re-enacts scenes of alleged abuse in the <a href="/wiki/Church_of_Scientology" title="Church of Scientology">Church of Scientology</a>'s punishment facility, <a href="/wiki/The_Hole_(Scientology)" title="The Hole (Scientology)">the Hole</a> <i>(pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Henry_Buehman" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Henry Buehman">Template:Did you know nominations/Henry Buehman</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article was created a few days ago, in conjunction with the film's release. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Gertrude_Leverkus">Gertrude Leverkus</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FGertrude_Leverkus&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gertrude_Leverkus&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Gertrude_Leverkus" title="Gertrude Leverkus">Gertrude Leverkus</a></b> was the only woman among 500 men to sit her final exams in architecture?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Gertrude_Leverkus" title="Gertrude Leverkus">Gertrude Leverkus</a></b> was the only woman among 500 men to sit her final exams in architecture at <a href="/wiki/University_College_London" title="University College London">University College London</a> in 1919?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Max_Birnstiel" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Max Birnstiel">Max Birnstiel</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Beverly_Loraine_Greene">Beverly Loraine Greene</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBeverly_Loraine_Greene&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Beverly_Loraine_Greene&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the memorial service for <b><a href="/wiki/Beverly_Loraine_Greene" title="Beverly Loraine Greene">Beverly L. Greene</a></b>, believed to be the first <a href="/wiki/African_American" title="African American">African American</a> woman licensed as an architect in the United States, took place in a funeral home that she had designed?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Ruth_Archer" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Ruth Archer">Template:Did you know nominations/Ruth Archer</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: For the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/Women_in_Red/3" title="Wikipedia:Meetup/Women in Red/3">Women in Red Virtual Editathon on Women in Architecture</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) at 23:50, 15 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The article is new enough, long enough, neutrally written and referenced. Interesting hook and content. A minor suggestion: cause of death (at such an early age) and images of her works may be included. <strike>Good to go</strike>. --<a href="/wiki/User:Clithering" title="User:Clithering">Clithering</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clithering" title="User talk:Clithering">talk</a>) 09:52, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a>:</span> Uh oh. These articles must be merged (although I think the present nomination is the better written one). <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 10:18, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Support is withdrawn for the time being pending clarifications from both the creator and the nominator. --<a href="/wiki/User:Clithering" title="User:Clithering">Clithering</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clithering" title="User talk:Clithering">talk</a>) 16:39, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<dl>
<dd>I have no idea how to fix that or what a merge even is. Not even sure how to initiate same. Apparently the creator of the other article was able to do that because they spelled the name wrong? What do we do about it? <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>) 17:36, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>No problem, I read <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:MERGEREASON" title="Wikipedia:MERGEREASON" class="mw-redirect">WP:MERGEREASON</a> and went ahead and redirected the other article to this page. This page has the correct spelling, and also has far better referencing than the other article. The content was almost identical; therefore, it's considered an obvious duplicate and any editor can <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:BE_BOLD" title="Wikipedia:BE BOLD" class="mw-redirect">be bold</a> and do the redirect. We can go ahead with the DYK now. <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 17:49, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Thanks <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> you know I have no technical skills with Wikipedia&#160;:) I am so grateful for those of you who do. <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>) 18:06, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
<dd>Since the most commonly used name should be used as the article title, please advise "Beverly Loraine Greene" and "Beverly L. Greene", which one should be adopted?--<a href="/wiki/User:Clithering" title="User:Clithering">Clithering</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clithering" title="User talk:Clithering">talk</a>) 01:34, 19 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Sources are about equal in what they call her. Thus, I would say her full name. Women's names don't work like men's names. More often than not, until the 1970s at least in the US, it was considered "impolite and too familiar" to refer to a woman by her given name. It makes finding sources for women really hard. You can always pare down what you know but if you start with a pared down version, it is often difficult to find the entirety and thus sources. I have little doubt that was a consideration in the naming protocols on Wikipedia, because no where does it advise that looking for Mrs. John Doe might help find sourcing.&#160;;) <a href="/wiki/User:SusunW" title="User:SusunW">SusunW</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SusunW" title="User talk:SusunW">talk</a>) 02:14, 19 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I was just wondering whether her middle name should be given in full in the hook for the sake of consistency with the article name. Thank you for your detailed explanation and the article is surely good to go now. --<a href="/wiki/User:Clithering" title="User:Clithering">Clithering</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clithering" title="User talk:Clithering">talk</a>) 03:20, 19 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Clithering" title="User:Clithering">Clithering</a>:</span> I worked on adding sources, and also wrote the hook. The sources equally refer to her as Beverly Greene and Beverly Loraine Greene. But the hook would go over 200 characters if we spell out her full name. There is really no requirement to spell out a name in a hook; for example, we often write <a href="/wiki/Johann_Sebastian_Bach" title="Johann Sebastian Bach">Bach</a> or <a href="/wiki/Wolfgang_Amadeus_Mozart" title="Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart">Mozart</a>, to keep it short. I only put the L. in because SusunW used her middle name in the title. I'm perfectly fine with deleting the initial in the interests of keeping the character count down:
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that the memorial service for <b><a href="/wiki/Beverly_Loraine_Greene" title="Beverly Loraine Greene">Beverly Greene</a></b>, believed to be the first <a href="/wiki/African_American" title="African American">African American</a> woman licensed as an architect in the United States, took place in a funeral home that she had designed? <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 09:13, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Meithalun.2C_Marj_Sanur">Meithalun, Marj Sanur</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMeithalun%2C_Marj_Sanur&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Meithalun%2C_Marj_Sanur&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg" class="image" title="Meithalun (foreground) and Marj Sanur (background)"><img alt="Meithalun (foreground) and Marj Sanur (background)" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg/120px-Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg/180px-Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg/240px-Meithalun_and_Marj_Sanur.jpg 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="480" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Meithalun (foreground) and Marj Sanur (background)</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Meithalun" title="Meithalun">Meithalun</a></b> (<i>pictured</i>) is the largest <a href="/wiki/Palestinian_people" title="Palestinian people" class="mw-redirect">Palestinian</a> village in the <b><a href="/wiki/Marj_Sanur" title="Marj Sanur">Marj Sanur</a></b> valley (<i>pictured</i>)?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Al_Ameer_son" title="User:Al Ameer son">Al Ameer son</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Al_Ameer_son" title="User talk:Al Ameer son">talk</a>) and <a href="/wiki/User:Huldra" title="User:Huldra">Huldra</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Huldra" title="User talk:Huldra">talk</a>). <div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FElephantomyia_longirostris&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Elephantomyia_(E.)_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg" class="image" title="Elephantomyia longirostris male"><img alt="Elephantomyia longirostris male" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg/120px-Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg" width="120" height="83" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg/180px-Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg/240px-Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_longirostris_fig_10_body_01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1248" data-file-height="864" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i>Elephantomyia longirostris</i> male</div>
</div>
</div>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Debra_Crew">Debra Crew</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDebra_Crew&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Debra_Crew&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Debra_Crew" title="Debra Crew">Debra Crew</a></b> surprised business observers when she became president of the <a href="/wiki/R._J._Reynolds_Tobacco_Company" title="R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company">R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company</a> only two months after being named president of <a href="/wiki/PepsiCo" title="PepsiCo">PepsiCo</a> North America Nutrition?</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>: ... that <b><a href="/wiki/Debra_Crew" title="Debra Crew">Debra Crew</a></b>, president and COO of <a href="/wiki/R._J._Reynolds_Tobacco_Company" title="R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company">R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company</a>, is a former U.S. Army captain in the field of <a href="/wiki/Military_intelligence" title="Military intelligence">military intelligence</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Pravina_Mehta" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Pravina Mehta">Template:Did you know nominations/Pravina Mehta</a></li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Schloss_Krobnitz">Schloss Krobnitz</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSchloss_Krobnitz&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Schloss_Krobnitz&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg" class="image" title="Schloss Krobnitz"><img alt="Schloss Krobnitz" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg/120px-Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg" width="120" height="90" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg/180px-Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg/240px-Schloss_Krobnitz.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2000" data-file-height="1500" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Schloss Krobnitz</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Schloss_Krobnitz" title="Schloss Krobnitz">Schloss Krobnitz</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> belonged to the <a href="/wiki/Prussia" title="Prussia">Prussian</a> Minister of War <a href="/wiki/Albrecht_von_Roon" title="Albrecht von Roon">Albrecht von Roon</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Martel,_Lot" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Martel, Lot">Template:Did you know nominations/Martel, Lot</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Yakikaki" title="User:Yakikaki">Yakikaki</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yakikaki" title="User talk:Yakikaki">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 19:21, 15 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Shisha_Gumbad">Shisha Gumbad</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FShisha_Gumbad&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Shisha_Gumbad&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG" class="image" title="Shisha Gumbad"><img alt="Shisha Gumbad" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG/120px-Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG" width="120" height="56" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG/180px-Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG/240px-Sheesh_Gumbad_evening.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4800" data-file-height="2251" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Shisha Gumbad</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Shisha_Gumbad" title="Shisha Gumbad">Shisha Gumbad</a></b> is a monument constructed between 1489 and 1517 CE and houses a tomb, perhaps of an unknown person from the last lineage of the <a href="/wiki/Lodhi_Dynasty" title="Lodhi Dynasty" class="mw-redirect">Lodhi Dynasty</a>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:AKS.9955" title="User:AKS.9955">AKS.9955</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:AKS.9955" title="User talk:AKS.9955">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 17:29, 15 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_possible_vote.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol possible vote.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/16px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/24px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Symbol_possible_vote.svg/32px-Symbol_possible_vote.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New and long enough, user exempt from performing QPQ review per QPQ check <a class="external text" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/betacommand-dev/cgi-bin/dyk.py?user=AKS.9955">results</a>, image to be used is properly licensed, article content is free from copyright infringement and close paraphrasing (e.g. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://tools.wmflabs.org/copyvios/?lang=en&amp;project=wikipedia&amp;title=Shisha+Gumbad&amp;oldid=&amp;action=search&amp;use_engine=1&amp;use_links=1">[9]</a>).</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>Matters that need to be addressed:
<ul>
<li>The first paragraph in the Construction section does not have any inline citations. Per the DYK <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKSG" title="Wikipedia:DYKSG" class="mw-redirect">supplementary rules</a> #D2, "The article in general should use inline, cited sources. A rule of thumb is one inline citation per paragraph, excluding the intro, plot summaries, and paragraphs which summarize other cited content."</li>
<li>Regarding the hook, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/society/down-memory-lane-who-rests-under-that-dome/article7141334.ece">this source</a> used in the article states that the person buried in the tomb is unknown, and it states that "There is no indication as to why these were built. In all probability they are buildings of the Lodhi period." <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://competentauthoritydelhi.co.in/MonumentViewer.aspx?ID=16">This source</a> states, "It is not known who lies buried. here. It was perhaps built during Sikandar Lodi's reign (A.D. 1489-1517)", but may not be a reliable source. Inre this matter, the article and hook needs to be updated to state that the era when this person was placed in the tomb is estimated, rather than (as worded) certain.</li>
<li>Regarding the construction dates, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.ndmc.gov.in/Departments/Horticulture/Important%20Gardens%20of%20NDMC.pdf">this source</a> used in the article states about the "Sheesh Gumbad (Tomb)" that "These monuments (Tombs) were built between 1433 to 1533". This contradicts the dates in the article and hook. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.orientalarchitecture.com/india/delhi/baragumbad.php">This source</a>, which I view to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:QUESTIONED" title="Wikipedia:QUESTIONED" class="mw-redirect">unreliable</a>, and hence not usable to verify content of the hook, states that "Sheesh Gumbad, which stands opposite, was built around the same time", in reference to the time period of 1494. Better sourcing is needed to verify the claim that the tomb was built between 1489-1517 CE. <span class="smallcaps" style="font-variant:small-caps;"><a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">North America</a><sup><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Northamerica1000" title="User talk:Northamerica1000"><font size="-2">1000</font></a></sup></span> 04:50, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Hello <a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">North America</a>, following are my comments and action taken.</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Inline citation. Apologies for the oversight, citations added.</li>
<li>Hook:Amended.</li>
<li>Construction dates: I have also provided <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://competentauthoritydelhi.co.in/MonumentViewer.aspx?ID=16">this source</a> in the article. Please let me know if this can be accepted for 1489-1517?</li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dd>Many thanks for your time and quick revert; appreciate it. <b><a href="/wiki/User:AKS.9955" title="User:AKS.9955"><span style="color:#000080">Arun Kumar SINGH</span></a> <a href="/wiki/User_talk:AKS.9955" title="User talk:AKS.9955"><span style="color:#01BFFF">(Talk)</span></a></b> 14:27, 16 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Roosevelt,_Jr." title="Theodore Roosevelt, Jr.">Theodore Roosevelt</a> was quoted in advertising for <a href="/wiki/Bela_Lugosi" title="Bela Lugosi">Bela Lugosi</a>'s first American film, <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Silent_Command" title="The Silent Command">The Silent Command</a></b></i>?</li>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJal_Mandir&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_(9243092471).jpg" class="image" title="Jal Mandir"><img alt="Jal Mandir" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_%289243092471%29.jpg/120px-Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_%289243092471%29.jpg" width="120" height="64" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_%289243092471%29.jpg/180px-Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_%289243092471%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_%289243092471%29.jpg/240px-Pawapuri_-_001_Temple_marking_Mahavira%27s_Passing_%289243092471%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3155" data-file-height="1695" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Jal Mandir</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Jal_Mandir" title="Jal Mandir">Jal Mandir</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> dedicated to <a href="/wiki/Lord_Mahavira" title="Lord Mahavira" class="mw-redirect">Lord Mahavira</a>, the 24th <a href="/wiki/Thirthankara" title="Thirthankara" class="mw-redirect">Thirthankara</a> and founder of <a href="/wiki/Jain_religion" title="Jain religion" class="mw-redirect">Jain religion</a>, marks the place of his cremation?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>

</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Up_Out_My_Face">Up Out My Face</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FUp_Out_My_Face&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Up_Out_My_Face&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Mariah_Carey" title="Mariah Carey">Mariah Carey</a> sings about <a href="/wiki/Lego" title="Lego">Lego</a>, <a href="/wiki/Harvard_University" title="Harvard University">Harvard University</a> and <a href="/wiki/Humpty_Dumpty" title="Humpty Dumpty">Humpty Dumpty</a> on her song "<b><a href="/wiki/Up_Out_My_Face" title="Up Out My Face">Up Out My Face</a></b>"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that a critic speculated "<b><a href="/wiki/Up_Out_My_Face" title="Up Out My Face">Up Out My Face</a></b>" to be about <a href="/wiki/Mariah_Carey" title="Mariah Carey">Mariah Carey</a>'s longstanding feud with <a href="/wiki/Eminem" title="Eminem">Eminem</a>?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that the music video for <a href="/wiki/Mariah_Carey" title="Mariah Carey">Mariah Carey</a>'s song "<b><a href="/wiki/Up_Out_My_Face" title="Up Out My Face">Up Out My Face</a></b>" was likened to a <a href="/wiki/Target_Corporation" title="Target Corporation">Target</a> commercial?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Rapid_strep_test" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Rapid strep test">Template:Did you know nominations/Rapid strep test</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: My preference is the original hook.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Vern_Miller">Vern Miller</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FVern_Miller&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vern_Miller&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in 1971, Kansas Attorney General <b><a href="/wiki/Vern_Miller" title="Vern Miller">Vern Miller</a></b> participated in an undercover drug raid by hiding in a trunk of a a car in order to make arrests?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:.. that <b><a href="/wiki/Vern_Miller" title="Vern Miller">Vern Miller</a></b> was elected <a href="/wiki/Attorney_General_of_Kansas" title="Attorney General of Kansas" class="mw-redirect">Attorney General of Kansas</a> in 1970 despite having never tried a case in court before?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: pending</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Connormah" title="User:Connormah">Connormah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Connormah" title="User talk:Connormah">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:59, 17 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> - Article was reviewed against criteria <a href="/wiki/Template:DYK_review_criteria" title="Template:DYK review criteria">one through seven</a> and found satisfactory. <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Beatriz_del_Cueto">Beatriz del Cueto</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBeatriz_del_Cueto&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 100px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg" class="image" title="Faro de Las Cabezas de San Juan"><img alt="Faro de Las Cabezas de San Juan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg/100px-Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg" width="100" height="70" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg/150px-Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg/200px-Las_Cabezas_de_San_Juan_Lighthouse2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4626" data-file-height="3258" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Faro de Las Cabezas de San Juan</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Conservation_architect" title="Conservation architect" class="mw-redirect">conservation architect</a> <b><a href="/wiki/Beatriz_del_Cueto" title="Beatriz del Cueto">Beatriz del Cueto</a></b> restored <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Rico" title="Puerto Rico">Puerto Rico</a>'s oldest lighthouse, <a href="/wiki/Cape_San_Juan_Light" title="Cape San Juan Light">Cape San Juan Light</a> <i>(pictured)</i>?</li>
</ul>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>

<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg" class="image" title="Marilyn Monroe as gangster's moll Angela in John Huston's film noir The Asphalt Jungle (1950)"><img alt="Marilyn Monroe as gangster's moll Angela in John Huston's film noir The Asphalt Jungle (1950)" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg/120px-Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg" width="120" height="91" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg/180px-Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg/240px-Marilyn_Monroe_Asphalt_Jungle.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2640" data-file-height="1998" /></a>

</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that in 1950, <b><a href="/wiki/Marilyn_Monroe" title="Marilyn Monroe">Marilyn Monroe</a></b> made a minor appearance as a gangster's moll <i>(pictured)</i> in the critically acclaimed crime film <i><a href="/wiki/The_Asphalt_Jungle" title="The Asphalt Jungle">The Asphalt Jungle</a></i>?</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Fizeau_experiment">Fizeau experiment</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFizeau_experiment&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fizeau_experiment&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fizeau-Mascart2.png" class="image" title="Fizeau's experiment, experimental setup"><img alt="Fizeau's experiment, experimental setup" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Fizeau-Mascart2.png/120px-Fizeau-Mascart2.png" width="120" height="54" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Fizeau-Mascart2.png/180px-Fizeau-Mascart2.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Fizeau-Mascart2.png/240px-Fizeau-Mascart2.png 2x" data-file-width="1435" data-file-height="648" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Fizeau's experiment, experimental setup</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Fizeau_experiment" title="Fizeau experiment">Fizeau experiment</a></b> <i>(setup pictured)</i> was one of the key experimental results that shaped <a href="/wiki/Albert_Einstein" title="Albert Einstein">Einstein</a>'s thinking about relativity?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Fizeau_experiment" title="Fizeau experiment">Fizeau experiment</a></b> <i>(setup pictured)</i> is supporting evidence for the collinear case of <a href="/wiki/Albert_Einstein" title="Albert Einstein">Einstein</a>'s velocity addition formula?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Red_Revenue" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Red Revenue">Red Revenue</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Stigmatella_aurantiaca" title="User:Stigmatella aurantiaca">Stigmatella aurantiaca</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Stigmatella_aurantiaca" title="User talk:Stigmatella aurantiaca">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Oceanh&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Oceanh (page does not exist)">Oceanh</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Oceanh" title="User talk:Oceanh">talk</a>) at 17:48, 17 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Environmental_issues_in_Tehran">Environmental issues in Tehran</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FEnvironmental_issues_in_Tehran&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Environmental_issues_in_Tehran&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Tehran_Pollution.jpg" class="image" title="Air pollution in Tehran"><img alt="Air pollution in Tehran" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Tehran_Pollution.jpg/120px-Tehran_Pollution.jpg" width="120" height="98" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Tehran_Pollution.jpg/180px-Tehran_Pollution.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Tehran_Pollution.jpg/240px-Tehran_Pollution.jpg 2x" data-file-width="872" data-file-height="713" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Air pollution in Tehran</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Environmental_issues_in_Tehran" title="Environmental issues in Tehran">environmental issues in Tehran</a></b> include severe <a href="/wiki/Air_pollution" title="Air pollution">air pollution</a> <i>(pictured)</i> and high risk of <a href="/wiki/Earthquake" title="Earthquake">earthquakes</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Greek_Constitution_of_1973" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Greek Constitution of 1973">Greek Constitution of 1973</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Rye-96" title="User:Rye-96">Rye-96</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rye-96" title="User talk:Rye-96">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:SSTflyer" title="User:SSTflyer">SSTflyer</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:SSTflyer" title="User talk:SSTflyer">talk</a>) at 01:28, 17 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> My first thoughts were that this article was a bit contrived to combine pollution and earthquakes as a single issue, but the cited Payvand article does indeed write about both as reasons for moving Iran's capital city. So unless someone objects to the article imminently, it looks okay to me, new enough, long enough, using inline citations appropriately. Hook is fine, interesting enough. I'd suggest the image is a bit weak and unnecessary, it's not overtly about pollution. Apart from that, good to go! <a href="/wiki/User:Sionk" title="User:Sionk">Sionk</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sionk" title="User talk:Sionk">talk</a>) 19:00, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Javanese_traditional_house">Javanese traditional house</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJavanese_traditional_house&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Javanese_traditional_house&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG" class="image" title="This style of roof, called the joglo, is associated with Javanese aristocrats."><img alt="This style of roof, called the joglo, is associated with Javanese aristocrats." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG/120px-TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG" width="120" height="71" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG/180px-TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG/240px-TMII_Central_Java_Pavilion_1.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1984" data-file-height="1169" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">This style of roof, called the <i>joglo</i>, is associated with Javanese aristocrats.</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the roof shape of <b><a href="/wiki/Javanese_traditional_house" title="Javanese traditional house">Javanese traditional houses</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> determined the social and economic status of the house owners?</li>
<li><b>ALT1</b>... that the roof shape of <b><a href="/wiki/Javanese_traditional_house" title="Javanese traditional house">Javanese traditional houses</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> is determined by the social and economic status of the house owners?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>... that the social and economic status of the house owners of a <b><a href="/wiki/Javanese_traditional_house" title="Javanese traditional house">Javanese traditional house</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> can be determined by the shape of the house's roof?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>... that the social and economic status of the owners of a <b><a href="/wiki/Javanese_traditional_house" title="Javanese traditional house">Javanese traditional house</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> can be ascertained by the shape of the roof?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Schloss_Krobnitz" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Schloss Krobnitz">Template:Did you know nominations/Schloss Krobnitz</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Rochelimit" title="User:Rochelimit">Rochelimit</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rochelimit" title="User talk:Rochelimit">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 16:51, 16 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I'm no expert, but surely it would be the other way round? I've added an <b>ALT1</b> to reflect that. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 22:23, 16 October 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li>Hi <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a>. The original hook refers to the fact that from outside of the house compound, you can only see the roof looming above the perimeter wall, and so you can determine what is the social status or the economic status of the house owner by observing the roof shape. I'm writing another <b>ALT2</b>, is this much understandable?
<ul>
<li>Thanks. ALT2 is even better. I think you could cut the first "house", and that "ascertained" would be less ambiguous than "determined". <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 11:07, 17 October 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li>Thanks for the review <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a>. I've fixed the wording. Anything missing? Oh and don't forget the approve it with the DYKtick&#160;;) --<a href="/wiki/User:Rochelimit" title="User:Rochelimit">Rochelimit</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rochelimit" title="User talk:Rochelimit">talk</a>) 11:43, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <b>ALT3</b> approved. New enough. Long enough. QPQ done. Good hook, which is cited. <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:AGF" title="Wikipedia:AGF" class="mw-redirect">WP:AGF</a> on the sources, which are all off-line. However, the hook fact can be confirmed with online sources. Not possible to assess close paraphrasing issues, copyright violations and plagiarism, but looking at some of the cumbersome English, I'm prepared to AGF on this. NPOV. Image license suitable for front page. Trimmed final "house's" from ALT3 hook. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 12:41, 17 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Old-fashioned_doughnut">Old-fashioned doughnut</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FOld-fashioned_doughnut&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Old-fashioned_doughnut&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg" class="image" title="Old-fashioned doughnuts (top)"><img alt="Old-fashioned doughnuts (top)" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg/120px-Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg" width="120" height="65" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg/180px-Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg/240px-Old_fashioned_doughnuts.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2324" data-file-height="1250" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Old-fashioned doughnuts (top)</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Old-fashioned_doughnut" title="Old-fashioned doughnut">old-fashioned doughnut</a></b> <i>(examples pictured)</i> may be <a href="/wiki/Deep_frying" title="Deep frying">deep fried</a> at a lower temperature compared to other styles?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Shisha_Gumbad" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Shisha Gumbad">Shisha Gumbad</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Northamerica1000" title="User:Northamerica1000">Northamerica1000</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Northamerica1000" title="User talk:Northamerica1000">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 05:04, 16 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, meets core content policies. Hook cited to RS. I don't see the part about deep-frying in the source, but I'll assume it's somewhere beyond the paywall. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 12:51, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>That said, the image may be misleading with the hook since not all of these are in fact old-fashioned doughnuts. --<b><a href="/wiki/User:Jakec" title="User:Jakec">Jakob</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Jakec" title="User talk:Jakec">talk</a>)</b> <small><small>aka Jakec</small></small> 12:52, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Corinne_Bennett">Corinne Bennett</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCorinne_Bennett&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Corinne_Bennett&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that cathedral architect <b><a href="/wiki/Corinne_Bennett" title="Corinne Bennett">Corinne Bennett</a></b>'s interest in stone came from her father, a geology professor?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Corinne_Bennett" title="Corinne Bennett">Corinne Bennett</a></b> was the first person to be appointed national cathedrals architect by <a href="/wiki/English_Heritage" title="English Heritage">English Heritage</a>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Harry_Tressler" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Harry Tressler">Harry Tressler</a></li>

</dd>
</dl>

Good to go. --<a href="/wiki/User:Human3015" title="User:Human3015"><b><span style="color:#0000FF;">Human</span><span style="color:#808000&#160;;">3015</span></b></a><a href="/wiki/User_talk:Human3015" title="User talk:Human3015"><span style="color:#FF1493"><b><small><sup>TALK</sup></small></b></span></a>&#160; 00:16, 20 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

It looks like you didn't check for close paraphrasing/plagiarism in the Catanzaro review. Also (and this is a moot point now that Catanzaro has already appeared on the main page) the hook was not supported by the source in that article. The source cited examples of crimes that had occurred in the province, but the source did <i>not</i> state that the crimes were committed by organized syndicates. Therefore, another review is needed here before this nomination can be approved. Thanks, -- <a href="/wiki/User:Notecardforfree" title="User:Notecardforfree">Notecardforfree</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Notecardforfree" title="User talk:Notecardforfree">talk</a>) 22:10, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Red_Sea_Sharks">The Red Sea Sharks</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Red_Sea_Sharks&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Red_Sea_Sharks&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Herg%C3%A9" title="Hergé">Hergé</a> was inspired to develop the plot for <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Red_Sea_Sharks" title="The Red Sea Sharks">The Red Sea Sharks</a></b></i> after reading a magazine article detailing the continued existence of the <a href="/wiki/Arab_slave_trade" title="Arab slave trade">slave trade within the Arab world</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Common_walkingstick" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Common walkingstick">Common walkingstick</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Midnightblueowl" title="User:Midnightblueowl">Midnightblueowl</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Midnightblueowl" title="User talk:Midnightblueowl">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Oceanh&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Oceanh (page does not exist)">Oceanh</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Oceanh" title="User talk:Oceanh">talk</a>) at 08:32, 18 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>

<table class="collapsible collapsed" border="1" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
<th style="font-weight:normal;"><b>General:</b> Article is new enough and long enough</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know#New" title="Wikipedia:Did you know">New Enough</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>

</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table class="collapsible collapsed" border="1" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
<th style="font-weight:normal;"><b>Policy:</b> Article is sourced, neutral, and free of copyright problems</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources" title="Wikipedia:Citing sources">Adequate sourcing</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:NPOV" title="Wikipedia:NPOV" class="mw-redirect">Neutral</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>
<li>Free of <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Copyright_violations" title="Wikipedia:Copyright violations">copyright violations</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Plagiarism" title="Wikipedia:Plagiarism">plagiarism</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Close_paraphrasing" title="Wikipedia:Close paraphrasing">close paraphrasing</a>: <img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Bara_Gumbad">Bara Gumbad</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FBara_Gumbad&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bara_Gumbad&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG" class="image" title="Bara Gumbad."><img alt="Bara Gumbad." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG/120px-Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG" width="120" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG/180px-Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG/240px-Bara_Gumbad_2015.JPG 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Bara Gumbad.</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Bara_Gumbad" title="Bara Gumbad">Bara Gumbad</a></b>, constructed by <a href="/wiki/Sikandar_Lodi" title="Sikandar Lodi">Sikandar Lodi</a> in 1490 CE as a gateway to the adjacent <a href="/wiki/Friday_mosque" title="Friday mosque" class="mw-redirect">Friday mosque</a> is commonly (and mistakenly) believed to be a <a href="/wiki/Tomb" title="Tomb">tomb</a>?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:AKS.9955" title="User:AKS.9955">AKS.9955</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:AKS.9955" title="User talk:AKS.9955">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 06:11, 18 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Operation_Zeppelin_.28deception_plan.29">Operation Zeppelin (deception plan)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FOperation_Zeppelin_%28deception_plan%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Operation_Zeppelin_%28deception_plan%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that a <b><a href="/wiki/Operation_Zeppelin_(deception_plan)" title="Operation Zeppelin (deception plan)">Zeppelin</a></b> helped the Allies during World War II?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Reviewed: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Female_Figure_(Giambologna)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Female Figure (Giambologna)">Female Figure (Giambologna)</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Expanded more than fivefold since Oct. 14th</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">ErrantX</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ErrantX" title="User talk:ErrantX">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:15, 17 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Article is expanded enough, is well cited throughout, and is written in a neutral way and free of copyvio. The problem is with the hook, I can't find a citation for it, and whether it's correct or not is really a matter of interpreting what's actually cited, which is that "it is likely that it bolstered the belief that...", "According to Jacob Field, the operation successfully detained twenty five divisions in defensive positions", and "whether directly related to Zeppelin or not...", &amp;c. Could we please have a hook which is definitely supported by a reliable source? <a href="/wiki/User:Moonraker" title="User:Moonraker">Moonraker</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Moonraker" title="User talk:Moonraker">talk</a>) 20:33, 18 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Thanks for the review. Is this not sufficient: "the Allies considered it to have achieved the main objectives of tying down German forces in the region". The objective of Zeppelin was to do exactly that, tie up German forces in the area. Yes, there is no evidence that the German's really thought that an invasion would happen (note: if you dig into this topic everyone always couches analysis with caution because it was a confused time and the operations were complex) but they were cautious enough to do what the Allies wanted anyway. I always try to find interesting hooks that intrigue the reader; I could pull a dry fact from the article but that doesn't really excite me&#160;:) --<b><a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">Errant</a></b> <sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ErrantX" title="User talk:ErrantX">chat!</a>)</sup> 20:56, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Actually, what I have done is re-worked the Impact section to make clear the point: Zeppelin was a success, with some details about why and how much following. Does that address concerns? If it also helps a direct quote from the source is: "Plan Zeppelin had in general achieved the required objects" --<b><a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">Errant</a></b> <sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ErrantX" title="User talk:ErrantX">chat!</a>)</sup> 21:00, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">Errant</a>, I do sympathize, a dry fact would have less impact, but a DYK hook has to be cited, a hook can't be an inference or one that might well be correct. If you were saying "...that a <a href="/wiki/Operation_Zeppelin_(deception_plan)" title="Operation Zeppelin (deception plan)">Zeppelin</a> is believed to have tied down German forces in the Balkans", that would be fine, as you have a citation for it, but I couldn't find one to support "helped the Allies". <a href="/wiki/User:Moonraker" title="User:Moonraker">Moonraker</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Moonraker" title="User talk:Moonraker">talk</a>) 23:10, 18 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>So your concern is with the word helped? If so, I've found a source that explicitly says this &amp; rewritten part of the impact section to reflect the wording in the hook with inline sourcing&#160;:) --<b><a href="/wiki/User:ErrantX" title="User:ErrantX">Errant</a></b> <sup>(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:ErrantX" title="User talk:ErrantX">chat!</a>)</sup> 08:10, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Yes, indeed, because the hook must be cited. Offline source accepted AGF. Ready to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Moonraker" title="User:Moonraker">Moonraker</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Moonraker" title="User talk:Moonraker">talk</a>) 22:01, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</p>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJoseph_Hobson&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Joseph_Hobson" title="Joseph Hobson">Joseph Hobson</a></b> designed the first underwater railroad tunnel to a foreign country?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Louis_H._Fead" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Louis H. Fead">Template:Did you know nominations/Louis H. Fead</a></li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Qatar_Airways_Flights_15_and_16">Qatar Airways Flights 15 and 16</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FQatar_Airways_Flights_15_and_16&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Qatar_Airways_Flights_15_and_16&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg" class="image" title="A Qatar Airways A319"><img alt="A Qatar Airways A319" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg/120px-Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg" width="120" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg/180px-Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg/240px-Airbus_A319-133LR_Qatar_Airways_A7-CJA.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="683" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">A Qatar Airways A319</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Qatar_Airways" title="Qatar Airways">Qatar Airways</a> launched <b><a href="/wiki/Qatar_Airways_Flights_15_and_16" title="Qatar Airways Flights 15 and 16">an all-business class flight between London and Doha</a></b> in 2014 with an <a href="/wiki/Airbus_A320_family" title="Airbus A320 family">Airbus A319</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, which is going to end soon?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Qatar_Airways" title="Qatar Airways">Qatar Airways</a> launched <b><a href="/wiki/Qatar_Airways_Flights_15_and_16" title="Qatar Airways Flights 15 and 16">an all-business class flight between London and Doha</a></b> in 2014 with an <a href="/wiki/Airbus_A320_family" title="Airbus A320 family">Airbus A319</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, but discontinued it after a little more than a year?</li>
<li><b>ALT2</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Qatar_Airways" title="Qatar Airways">Qatar Airways</a> uses an <a href="/wiki/Airbus_A320_family" title="Airbus A320 family">Airbus A319</a> <i>(pictured)</i> to operate <b><a href="/wiki/Qatar_Airways_Flights_15_and_16" title="Qatar Airways Flights 15 and 16">an all-business class flight between London and Doha</a></b>?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Aiol_and_Mirabel" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Aiol and Mirabel">Aiol and Mirabel</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Main hook should be used after November 16, and ALT1 hook before November 15. ALT2 has no time limit.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_18">Articles created/expanded on October 18</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=52" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 18">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ancient_grains">Ancient grains</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FAncient_grains&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ancient_grains&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_(Zieramaranth).JPG" class="image" title="Amaranth, an ancient grain"><img alt="Amaranth, an ancient grain" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_%28Zieramaranth%29.JPG/120px-3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_%28Zieramaranth%29.JPG" width="120" height="180" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_%28Zieramaranth%29.JPG/180px-3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_%28Zieramaranth%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_%28Zieramaranth%29.JPG/240px-3836_-_Amaranthus_caudatus_%28Zieramaranth%29.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2000" data-file-height="3008" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><a href="/wiki/Amaranth" title="Amaranth">Amaranth</a>, an ancient grain</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ancient_grains" title="Ancient grains">ancient grains</a></b> are considered to be more nutritional than other grains and remained unchanged for thousands of years?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Ancient_grains" title="Ancient grains">ancient grains</a></b> are <a href="/wiki/Gluten" title="Gluten">gluten</a>-free and beneficial in controlling various diseases?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Corinne_Bennett" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Corinne Bennett">Template:Did you know nominations/Corinne Bennett</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Article was <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Ancient_Grains" title="Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Ancient Grains">nominated for AfD</a> <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ancient_grains&amp;oldid=686471250">on this version</a> created by new user, but later it was improved.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Harveys_Lake_(Pennsylvania)" title="Harveys Lake (Pennsylvania)">Harveys Lake</a>, the largest natural lake in Pennsylvania by volume, drained into <b><a href="/wiki/Beaver_Run_(Bowman_Creek)" title="Beaver Run (Bowman Creek)">Beaver Run</a></b> and <a href="/wiki/Bowman_Creek" title="Bowman Creek">Bowman Creek</a> in preglacial times, but no longer does so?</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Sorber_Run.2C_Cider_Run_.28Bowman_Creek.29">Sorber Run, Cider Run (Bowman Creek)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSorber_Run%2C_Cider_Run_%28Bowman_Creek%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a> )</li>

<div class="plainlinks hlist">

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Sorber_Run" title="Sorber Run">Sorber Run</a></b> and <b><a href="/wiki/Cider_Run_(Bowman_Creek)" title="Cider Run (Bowman Creek)">Cider Run</a></b> are the only two Wilderness Trout Streams in <a href="/wiki/Wyoming_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Wyoming County, Pennsylvania">Wyoming County, Pennsylvania</a>?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>

</ul>
</dd>
