<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Keiz.C5.8D_Hayashi">Keizō Hayashi</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FKeiz%C5%8D_Hayashi&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Keiz%C5%8D_Hayashi&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Keizo_Hayashi_01_(cropped_version).jpg" class="image" title="Keizō Hayashi"><img alt="Keizō Hayashi" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Keizo_Hayashi_01_%28cropped_version%29.jpg/120px-Keizo_Hayashi_01_%28cropped_version%29.jpg" width="120" height="93" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Keizo_Hayashi_01_%28cropped_version%29.jpg/180px-Keizo_Hayashi_01_%28cropped_version%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Keizo_Hayashi_01_%28cropped_version%29.jpg/240px-Keizo_Hayashi_01_%28cropped_version%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="524" data-file-height="408" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Keizō Hayashi</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Keiz%C5%8D_Hayashi" title="Keizō Hayashi">Keizō Hayashi</a></b> was a Japanese <a href="/wiki/Civil_servant" title="Civil servant" class="mw-redirect">civil servant</a> and <a href="/wiki/General_officer" title="General officer">general officer</a> who was instrumental in founding the <a href="/wiki/Japan_Self-Defense_Forces" title="Japan Self-Defense Forces">Japan Self-Defense Forces</a> after the Second World War in 1954?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Beverly_Loraine_Greene" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Beverly Loraine Greene">Beverly Loraine Greene</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Wow, great job, Clithering! What an interesting article. I had to use Google Translate to confirm the hook and, while that is not a good resource for Chinese, the stilted result was close enough I'm convinced it is accurately cited. Beyond that, it meets all criteria in the DYK Big 7. Queue it up! <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 08:25, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<li>I have unlinked Japanese and Second World War, per <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:OVERLINK" title="Wikipedia:OVERLINK" class="mw-redirect">WP:OVERLINK</a>. <a href="/wiki/User:Edwardx" title="User:Edwardx">Edwardx</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Edwardx" title="User talk:Edwardx">talk</a>) 13:00, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a>:</span> Thank you very much for your review and encouragement! I would also like to take this opportunity to thank <a href="/wiki/User:Howard61313" title="User:Howard61313">Howard61313</a> for creating the original article in the Chinese Wikipedia. --<a href="/wiki/User:Clithering" title="User:Clithering">Clithering</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Clithering" title="User talk:Clithering">talk</a>) 13:25, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_19">Articles created/expanded on October 19</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=53" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 19">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="DakshinaChitra">DakshinaChitra</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDakshinaChitra&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=DakshinaChitra&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Agraharam.jpg" class="image" title="Heritage homes from Tirunelveli"><img alt="Heritage homes from Tirunelveli" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Agraharam.jpg/120px-Agraharam.jpg" width="120" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Agraharam.jpg/180px-Agraharam.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Agraharam.jpg/240px-Agraharam.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="681" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Heritage homes from <a href="/wiki/Tirunelveli" title="Tirunelveli">Tirunelveli</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that exhibits in the <b><a href="/wiki/DakshinaChitra" title="DakshinaChitra">DakshinaChitra</a></b> museum highlights the cultural aspects of the high status of <a href="/wiki/Brahminical" title="Brahminical" class="mw-redirect">Brahminical</a> people, and the craft traditions of heritage homes <i>(pictured)</i> of <a href="/wiki/South_India" title="South India">South India</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: shortly</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/w/index.php?title=User:Nvvchat&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User:Nvvchat (page does not exist)">Nvvchat</a> (<a href="/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Nvvchat&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User talk:Nvvchat (page does not exist)">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:Nirinsanity" title="User:Nirinsanity">Nirinsanity</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Nirinsanity" title="User talk:Nirinsanity">talk</a>), <a href="/wiki/User:Rosiestep" title="User:Rosiestep">Rosiestep</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Rosiestep" title="User talk:Rosiestep">talk</a>), and <a href="/wiki/User:Zwerg_Nase" title="User:Zwerg Nase">Zwerg Nase</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Zwerg_Nase" title="User talk:Zwerg Nase">talk</a>). <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Spit_.26_Eggs">Spit &amp; Eggs</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FSpit_%26_Eggs&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Spit_%26_Eggs&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that for one scene in "<b><a href="/wiki/Spit_%26_Eggs" title="Spit &amp; Eggs">Spit &amp; Eggs</a></b>", an episode of <i><a href="/wiki/Veronica_Mars" title="Veronica Mars">Veronica Mars</a></i>, director Rob Thomas used 27 camera angles in a scene that took 11 hours to film?</li>
</ul>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Johanna" title="User:Johanna">Johanna</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Johanna" title="User talk:Johanna">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 03:03, 20 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Isabelle_Eberhardt">Isabelle Eberhardt</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FIsabelle_Eberhardt&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Isabelle_Eberhardt&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that while in <a href="/wiki/Algeria" title="Algeria">Algeria</a> in the 1890s, <b><a href="/wiki/Isabelle_Eberhardt" title="Isabelle Eberhardt">Isabelle Eberhardt</a></b> dressed as an Arabic man, challenging both gender and racial norms?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <b><a href="/wiki/Isabelle_Eberhardt" title="Isabelle Eberhardt">Isabelle Eberhardt</a></b>'s first story, published in 1895, was about a medical student's physical attraction to a woman's corpse?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Al-Istibsar" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Al-Istibsar">Al-Istibsar</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Freikorp" title="User talk:Freikorp">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:33, 19 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2002_FA_Cup_Final">2002 FA Cup Final</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>

</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/BBC" title="BBC">BBC</a>'s pre-match coverage of the <b><a href="/wiki/2002_FA_Cup_Final" title="2002 FA Cup Final">2002 FA Cup Final</a></b> included a sketch featuring <a href="/wiki/Ricky_Gervais" title="Ricky Gervais">Ricky Gervais</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a> were allocated the <a href="/wiki/Millennium_Stadium" title="Millennium Stadium">Millennium Stadium</a>'s south dressing room for the <b><a href="/wiki/2002_FA_Cup_Final" title="2002 FA Cup Final">2002 FA Cup Final</a></b>, considered a jinx?</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="John_Shelton_.28British_Army_officer.29">John Shelton (British Army officer)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FJohn_Shelton_%28British_Army_officer%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=John_Shelton_%28British_Army_officer%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the "imperious" and "tyrannical" Colonel <b><a href="/wiki/John_Shelton_(British_Army_officer)" title="John Shelton (British Army officer)">John Shelton</a></b> was so unpopular with his men that they gave three cheers when he died after falling off his horse?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that Colonel <b><a href="/wiki/John_Shelton_(British_Army_officer)" title="John Shelton (British Army officer)">John Shelton</a></b> survived the massacre of a 16,500-strong British Army column in Afghanistan, only to die after falling off his horse in Dublin?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Georgie_Wolton" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Georgie Wolton">Template:Did you know nominations/Georgie Wolton</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Two hooks suggested - take your pick.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Papakating_Creek">Papakating Creek</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FPapakating_Creek&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Papakating_Creek&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Triadenum_fraseri.jpg" class="image" title="Fraser's Saint John's wort (Triadenum fraseri)"><img alt="Fraser's Saint John's wort (Triadenum fraseri)" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Triadenum_fraseri.jpg/120px-Triadenum_fraseri.jpg" width="120" height="117" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Triadenum_fraseri.jpg/180px-Triadenum_fraseri.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Triadenum_fraseri.jpg/240px-Triadenum_fraseri.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2068" data-file-height="2016" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Fraser's Saint John's wort (<i>Triadenum fraseri</i>)</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Papakating_Creek" title="Papakating Creek">Papakating Creek</a></b> watershed offers <a href="/wiki/Wetlands" title="Wetlands" class="mw-redirect">wetland</a> habitats for the endangered <a href="/wiki/Bog_turtle" title="Bog turtle">bog turtle</a> and rare <a href="/wiki/Fraser%27s_Saint_John%27s_wort" title="Fraser's Saint John's wort" class="mw-redirect">Fraser's Saint John's wort</a> (<i>pictured</i>)?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/List_of_Formula_One_Grand_Prix_wins_by_Ayrton_Senna" title="Template:Did you know nominations/List of Formula One Grand Prix wins by Ayrton Senna">Template:Did you know nominations/List of Formula One Grand Prix wins by Ayrton Senna</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Expanded the article from a 4kb stub to a 42kb article.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Elephantomyia_pulchella">Elephantomyia pulchella</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FElephantomyia_pulchella&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elephantomyia_pulchella&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Elephantomyia_(E.)_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg" class="image" title="Elephantomyia pulchella male"><img alt="Elephantomyia pulchella male" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg/120px-Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg" width="120" height="84" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg/180px-Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg/240px-Elephantomyia_%28E.%29_pulchella_Fig_12_body_01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1239" data-file-height="867" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i>Elephantomyia pulchella</i> male</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that when the crane fly <i><b><a href="/wiki/Elephantomyia_pulchella" title="Elephantomyia pulchella">Elephantomyia pulchella</a></b></i> <i>(pictured)</i> was redescribed in 2015, one of the fossils was in a private collection?</li>
</ul>

<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Sulawesi_myna" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Sulawesi myna">Sulawesi myna</a></li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2014_White_House_intrusion">2014 White House intrusion</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2F2014_White_House_intrusion&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2014_White_House_intrusion&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Omar Gonzalez scaled the fence of the <a href="/wiki/White_House" title="White House">White House</a>, and was able to <b><a href="/wiki/2014_White_House_intrusion" title="2014 White House intrusion">intrude into the building</a></b> as the doors were left unlocked?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Sorber_Run,_Cider_Run_(Bowman_Creek)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Sorber Run, Cider Run (Bowman Creek)">Sorber Run, Cider Run (Bowman Creek)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Articles_created.2Fexpanded_on_October_20">Articles created/expanded on October 20</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=54" title="Edit section: Articles created/expanded on October 20">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Special_occasion_holding_area">Special occasion holding area</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=55" title="Edit section: Special occasion holding area">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<dl>
<dd><i>Do <b>not</b> nominate articles in this section—​nominate all articles in the <a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Did_you_know#Nominations" title="Template talk:Did you know">nominations</a> section above, under the date on which the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#article" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">article</a> was created or moved to mainspace, or the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:DYKTN#expansion" title="Wikipedia:DYKTN" class="mw-redirect">expansion</a> began; indicate in the nomination any request for a specially timed appearance on the main page.</i></dd>
<dd><i>Note: Articles nominated for a special occasion should be nominated (i) within seven days of creation or expansion (as usual) and (ii) between five days and six weeks before the occasion, to give reviewers time to check the nomination. April Fools' Day is an exception to these requirements; see <b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:April_Fool%27s_Main_Page/Did_You_Know" title="Wikipedia:April Fool's Main Page/Did You Know">Wikipedia:April Fool's Main Page/Did You Know</a></b>.</i></dd>
</dl>
<p>(Occcasion for which work was written)</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="October_22_.28date_of_disappearance.29">October 22 (date of disappearance)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=56" title="Edit section: October 22 (date of disappearance)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Disappearance_of_Atsumi_Yoshikubo">Disappearance of Atsumi Yoshikubo</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDisappearance_of_Atsumi_Yoshikubo&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Disappearance_of_Atsumi_Yoshikubo&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Canadian_Mounted_Police" title="Royal Canadian Mounted Police">Royal Canadian Mounted Police</a> believe <b><a href="/wiki/Disappearance_of_Atsumi_Yoshikubo" title="Disappearance of Atsumi Yoshikubo">Atsumi Yoshikubo</a></b> intended to disappear when she was last seen on <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Ingraham_Trail" title="Ingraham Trail">Ingraham Trail</a> a year ago today, but won't be specific about why?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:<s>... that concerns that the <b><a href="/wiki/Disappearance_of_Atsumi_Yoshikubo" title="Disappearance of Atsumi Yoshikubo">disappearance of Atsumi Yoshikubo</a></b> near <a href="/wiki/Yellowknife" title="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a> a year ago today would scare away other Japanese tourists from coming to see the <a href="/wiki/Aurora" title="Aurora">northern lights</a> proved unfounded?</s></li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Howard_Sims" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Howard Sims">Howard Sims</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: As we might guess from the hooks, I would like this to run <b>October 22</b>, the anniversary of the day she was last seen</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Daniel_Case" title="User:Daniel Case">Daniel Case</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Daniel_Case" title="User talk:Daniel Case">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:41, 30 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, neutrally written, well referenced, no close paraphrasing seen. The first hook is super hooky, and hook refs are verified and cited inline. QPQ done, although you may want to follow up since the nominator added a cite to verify the hook. Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>) 18:48, 12 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="October_31_.28Halloween.29">October 31 (Halloween)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=57" title="Edit section: October 31 (Halloween)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Apparition_of_Mrs._Veal">The Apparition of Mrs. Veal</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FThe_Apparition_of_Mrs._Veal&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Apparition_of_Mrs._Veal&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg" class="image" title="Portrait of Daniel Defoe"><img alt="Portrait of Daniel Defoe" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg/120px-Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg" width="120" height="143" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg/180px-Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg/240px-Daniel_Defoe_Kneller_Style.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2000" data-file-height="2391" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Portrait of Daniel Defoe</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Apparition_of_Mrs._Veal" title="The Apparition of Mrs. Veal">The Apparition of Mrs. Veal</a></b></i>, attributed to <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Defoe" title="Daniel Defoe">Daniel Defoe</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, has been called the first modern ghost story?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Conca_de_Barber%C3%A0" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Conca de Barberà">Template:Did you know nominations/Conca de Barberà</a></li>
<li>This one's for Halloween, naturally.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Metal_corset">Metal corset</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMetal_corset&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Metal_corset&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fig9Corset_en_fer_(Musee_de_Cluny).gif" class="image" title="Iron corset engraved in 1893 by Saint-Elme Gautier"><img alt="Iron corset engraved in 1893 by Saint-Elme Gautier" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Fig9Corset_en_fer_%28Musee_de_Cluny%29.gif/120px-Fig9Corset_en_fer_%28Musee_de_Cluny%29.gif" width="120" height="181" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Fig9Corset_en_fer_%28Musee_de_Cluny%29.gif/180px-Fig9Corset_en_fer_%28Musee_de_Cluny%29.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Fig9Corset_en_fer_%28Musee_de_Cluny%29.gif/240px-Fig9Corset_en_fer_%28Musee_de_Cluny%29.gif 2x" data-file-width="1963" data-file-height="2955" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Iron corset engraved in 1893 by Saint-Elme Gautier</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Metal_corset" title="Metal corset">metal corsets</a></b> <i>(illustrated)</i> probably served a medical purpose rather than being a "cruel, tortuous fashion" enforced by a <a href="/wiki/Catherine_de%27_Medici" title="Catherine de' Medici">dominant 16th-century queen</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Meuse_(department)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Meuse (department)">Template:Did you know nominations/Meuse (department)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Mabalu" title="User:Mabalu">Mabalu</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Mabalu" title="User talk:Mabalu">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 18:36, 30 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> 5x expansion checks due to copyrighted text being removed. Spot-checks finds no close paraphrasing or copyright violations. Online source checks; offline sources accepted in good faith. Image has appropriate licensing. I think your wikilink to Catherine de' Medici should encompass "dominant 16th-century queen", rather than just "queen", but up to you and the closer. Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Freikorp" title="User:Freikorp">Freikorp</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Freikorp" title="User talk:Freikorp">talk</a>) 12:09, 1 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Henry_Buehman">Henry Buehman</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FHenry_Buehman&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Henry_Buehman&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Henry_H_Buehman.jpg" class="image" title="Herny Buehman"><img alt="Herny Buehman" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/Henry_H_Buehman.jpg/120px-Henry_H_Buehman.jpg" width="120" height="179" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/Henry_H_Buehman.jpg/180px-Henry_H_Buehman.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/Henry_H_Buehman.jpg/240px-Henry_H_Buehman.jpg 2x" data-file-width="590" data-file-height="881" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Herny Buehman</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that photographer <b><a href="/wiki/Henry_Buehman" title="Henry Buehman">Henry Buehman</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> advertised his services as a dentist?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that "even the dead sit for <b><a href="/wiki/Henry_Buehman" title="Henry Buehman">Buehman</a></b>"?</li>
<li><s><b>ALT2</b>:... that <i>Buehman's Babies</i>, by <b><a href="/wiki/Henry_Buehman" title="Henry Buehman">Henry Buehman</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, contains the faces of 2551 children?</s></li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/A%C3%AFn_Kassimou" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Aïn Kassimou">Template:Did you know nominations/Aïn Kassimou</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: ALT1 is a possible Halloween hook</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Resident_Evil:_The_Final_Chapter">Resident Evil: The Final Chapter</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FResident_Evil%3A_The_Final_Chapter&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Resident_Evil%3A_The_Final_Chapter&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the upcoming film <i><b><a href="/wiki/Resident_Evil:_The_Final_Chapter" title="Resident Evil: The Final Chapter">Resident Evil: The Final Chapter</a></b></i> would really be the final chapter in the <a href="/wiki/Resident_Evil_(film_series)" title="Resident Evil (film series)"><i>"Resident Evil"</i> film series</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <s>Soon</s> <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Eric_Steelberg" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Eric Steelberg">Eric Steelberg</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Long enough; new enough; no copyvio, close paraphrasing etc., now that the plot has been deleted; QPQ done; hook needs rewording or another hook suggesting though as whatever the directors' intentions we can't know this will be the last film in the series; there's nothing studios like more than milking every last drop out of some withered old cow of a franchise. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>) 22:56, 27 September 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Francis_Doughty_.28clergyman.29">Francis Doughty (clergyman)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FFrancis_Doughty_%28clergyman%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Francis_Doughty_%28clergyman%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the early American minister <b><a href="/wiki/Francis_Doughty_(clergyman)" title="Francis Doughty (clergyman)">Francis Doughty</a></b> had a proclivity for <a href="/wiki/Witch-hunt" title="Witch-hunt">witch-hunting</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Werewolves_of_Ossory" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Werewolves of Ossory">Werewolves of Ossory</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: Possible Halloween hook</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:StAnselm" title="User:StAnselm">StAnselm</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:StAnselm" title="User talk:StAnselm">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 02:58, 10 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Long enough, new enough, and hook is cited to RS. Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 10:17, 10 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> <span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a>:</span> What about all the other DYK criteria? Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:LavaBaron" title="User:LavaBaron">LavaBaron</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:LavaBaron" title="User talk:LavaBaron">talk</a>) 07:59, 19 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Werewolves_of_Ossory">Werewolves of Ossory</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FWerewolves_of_Ossory&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Werewolves_of_Ossory&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Werewolves_of_Ossory.png" class="image" title="Depiction of the werewolves of Ossory"><img alt="Depiction of the werewolves of Ossory" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Werewolves_of_Ossory.png/120px-Werewolves_of_Ossory.png" width="120" height="99" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Werewolves_of_Ossory.png/180px-Werewolves_of_Ossory.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Werewolves_of_Ossory.png/240px-Werewolves_of_Ossory.png 2x" data-file-width="666" data-file-height="552" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Depiction of the werewolves of Ossory</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that the legendary <b><a href="/wiki/Werewolves_of_Ossory" title="Werewolves of Ossory">werewolves of Ossory</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> were said to have founded a dynasty of Irish kings?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut,_BWV_199" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199">Template:Did you know nominations/Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199‎</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: This one's for Halloween.</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 21:01, 9 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_question.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol question.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/16px-Symbol_question.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/24px-Symbol_question.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e0/Symbol_question.svg/32px-Symbol_question.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> New enough, long enough, image checks out. The problem is with the hook, which says "founded a dynasty of Irish kings". However, the (main body) of the article says that the werewolf Laignech Fàelad was a <i>brother</i> of kings - i.e. not an ancestor. Now, I see the "ancestor of kings" is in the cited source (Sconduto, p. 34), but that doesn't seem to be "ancestor" in the strict sense. Would you be able to explain this a bit more (i.e. to me here, but possibly also in the article)? <a href="/wiki/User:StAnselm" title="User:StAnselm"><b>St</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/StAnselm" title="Special:Contributions/StAnselm">Anselm</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:StAnselm" title="User talk:StAnselm">talk</a>) 02:46, 10 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>The main body of the article does call him an ancestor - "He was said to be the brother of Feradach mac Duach, the king of Ossory, and the ancestor of its subsequent kings who ruled until being deposed by the Normans." Sconduto, and also John Carey in 'Werewolves in Ireland', <i>Cambrian Medieval Celtic Studies</i> 44 (Winter 2002) 37–72, both state explicitly that Laignech Fàelad was "ancestor of [Ossory's] kings thereafter" (as Carey puts it). They don't explain how this came about so I've not expanded on it further as it would be original research on my part, but the most likely answer is that Laignech Fàelad's kingly brother died childless and the throne was inherited by one of Laignech Fàelad's children. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 07:27, 10 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>Yes, I can understand not wanting to OR, but for DYK we really need to get to the bottom of this. I see the <i>Cóir Anmann</i> text <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.maryjones.us/ctexts/fitness_of_names.html">here</a>: it doesn't seem to say anything about kings, and so I question the second sentence in the "Laignech Fàelad" section. The Sconduto source has a footnote for the "ancestor of its future kings" sentence, but it doesn't seem to be visible on Google Books. <a href="/wiki/User:StAnselm" title="User:StAnselm"><b>St</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/StAnselm" title="Special:Contributions/StAnselm">Anselm</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:StAnselm" title="User talk:StAnselm">talk</a>) 08:40, 10 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>It's not from the <i>Cóir Anmann</i> but from another work - <i>De Ingantaib Érenn</i>, specifically the manuscript held by Trinity College Dublin, according to Carey. I've made the attribution clearer in the article. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 09:19, 10 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Is there any reason the Carey source isn't in the article, by the way? And do you have access to a translation of <i>De Ingantaib Érenn</i>? I'd like to know what it actually says, because all that I see in Sconduto is that <i>De Ingantaib Érenn</i> talks about Laignech Fàelad being an ancestor of a line of <i>werewolves</i>. <small>(It sounds a lot like the brothers <a href="/wiki/Elrond" title="Elrond">Elrond</a> and <a href="/wiki/Elros" title="Elros" class="mw-redirect">Elros</a>, by the way...)</small> Anyway, I can't help feeling Sconduto is misreading Carey. <a href="/wiki/User:StAnselm" title="User:StAnselm"><b>St</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/StAnselm" title="Special:Contributions/StAnselm">Anselm</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:StAnselm" title="User talk:StAnselm">talk</a>) 19:10, 10 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>The misreading is mine, I'm afraid - I had thought Carey was referring to <i>De Ingantaib Érenn</i> but on a second reading it's clear that he is referring to other genealogies. The exact line I'm citing is on page 57 and reads: "This Laignech Faelad is in fact a figure of considerable dynastic importance. The genealogies portray him not only as the brother of Feradach mac Duach, a king of Ossory who died in 583 or 584, but as ancestor of its kings thereafter." I've added a reference to this in the article. The genealogies in question are discussed on <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://sbaldw.home.mindspring.com/Ireland/Osr/lists/Osraige.htm">this page</a>, which usefully has a copy of what they say along with a geneaological table (see table 1). <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 20:36, 10 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>OK, thank you. I think we're getting close to a resolution here. I had seen that genealogical page already, and had noted that it doesn't mention werewolves. But it seems that we have some sources saying that Laignech is a werewolf, and some sources saying that he is an ancestor of kings. However, we don't seem to have any <i>primary</i> source that conflates the too - it is something that Carey has noticed. This is definitely worth including in the article, and in the DYK hook, but we have to be careful of wording. Maybe something like, "He was said in some sources to be the ancestor of a tribe of werewolves, and in others to be an ancestor of the kings of Ossory." What do you think? <a href="/wiki/User:StAnselm" title="User:StAnselm"><b>St</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/StAnselm" title="Special:Contributions/StAnselm">Anselm</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:StAnselm" title="User talk:StAnselm">talk</a>) 21:27, 10 October 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I'm not sure that's entirely accurate. Sconduto writes that <i>De Ingantaib Érenn</i> says that the werewolves were "descendants of Laigne[ch] Faelad in Ossory" (page 34). Unfortunately I can't find a translation or transcript of that work online. Basically, we have three facts (or rather claims) from different sources: that Laignech Faelad was the brother of the king of Ossory (according to the genealogies), that he was a werewolf (according to <i>Cóir Anmann</i>), and that he was the ancestor of the werewolves of Ossory (according to <i>De Ingantaib Érenn</i>). So perhaps a viable alternative hook might be something like the following? <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 12:22, 13 October 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li><b>ALT 1:</b> ... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Werewolves_of_Ossory" title="Werewolves of Ossory">werewolves of Ossory</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> were said to be descended from a werewolf who was the brother of an Irish king?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Yes, I would be happy with that. <a href="/wiki/User:StAnselm" title="User:StAnselm"><b>St</b></a><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/StAnselm" title="Special:Contributions/StAnselm">Anselm</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:StAnselm" title="User talk:StAnselm">talk</a>) 18:23, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut.2C_BWV_199">Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FMein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut%2C_BWV_199&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut%2C_BWV_199&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... Bach's early cantata <b><a href="/wiki/Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut,_BWV_199" title="Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199"><i>Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut</i>, BWV 199</a></b>, on a text by <a href="/wiki/Georg_Christian_Lehms" title="Georg Christian Lehms">Georg Christian Lehms</a> <i>(pictured)</i> was the first church solo cantata Bach showed to his Leipzig audience?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Diptych_by_Giovanni_da_Rimini" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Diptych by Giovanni da Rimini">Diptych by Giovanni da Rimini</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 20:49, 4 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I'd quite like to save this for Halloween as part of a Halloween-themed set, with a new hook (see below). Would you be OK with this? I'll see if I can find an appropriate heart-themed photo to go with it. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 15:31, 5 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>ALT1</b>: ... that an audience in <a href="/wiki/Leipzig" title="Leipzig">Leipzig</a> was the first to hear <a href="/wiki/Johann_Sebastian_Bach" title="Johann Sebastian Bach">Bach</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut,_BWV_199" title="Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199"><i>My heart swims in blood</i></a></b>?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Tempting idea, but as far as I understand we have to be factually correct. We don't know about the first audience. We know that a Weimar audience heard it (possibly in 1715 but not sure, could be 1716, could have been the first but we don't know), only then a Leipzig audience (1723). Please rephrase as ALT2, perhaps using also "a monster [in God's eyes]". --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 15:39, 5 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>OK, how about the following then, with the image on the right? <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 06:53, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd><s><b>ALT2</b> ... that <a href="/wiki/Johann_Sebastian_Bach" title="Johann Sebastian Bach">Bach</a>'s <b><a href="/wiki/Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut,_BWV_199" title="Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199"><i>My heart swims in blood</i></a></b> <i>(heart pictured)</i> is about the redemption of a "monster"?</s>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I think better no image&#160;;) - unless you have one of a swimming heart. Leave room for imagination. Do we have to mantion Bach?</li>
<li><b>ALT3</b>: ... that a "monster" confessed dramatically: "<b><a href="/wiki/Mein_Herze_schwimmt_im_Blut,_BWV_199" title="Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut, BWV 199">My heart swims in blood</a></b>"? --<a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>) 08:46, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Much better than my suggestion! Nice one. Now let's review the article: it was granted GA status on the nomination date, so no problem there. Clearly long enough and within policy, with a good assortment of reliable sources. ALT3 is interesting and sourced, and a QPQ review has been done. This should be fine to run now. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 15:35, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Zombi_2">Zombi 2</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Zombi_2&amp;action=edit&amp;section=T-1" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Zombi 2">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FZombi_2&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Zombi_2&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Lucio_Fulci" title="Lucio Fulci">Lucio Fulci</a>'s 1979 film <i><b><a href="/wiki/Zombi_2" title="Zombi 2">Zombi 2</a></b></i> has been released under eleven different titles?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Zhou%E2%80%93Chu_War" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Zhou–Chu War">Zhou–Chu War</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Grapple_X" title="User:Grapple X">Grapple X</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Grapple_X" title="User talk:Grapple X">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 09:26, 22 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Recently promoted to GA, well written, within policy, hook is interesting and there are eleven titles mention in the "Release" section including the original title. QPQ is done too, so good to go. --<a href="/wiki/User:Captain_Assassin!" title="User:Captain Assassin!"><span style="font-variant:small-caps;color:Green;font-family:Trajan Pro;"><i><b>Captain Assassin!</b></i></span></a> <sup><span style="color:Red;font-size:85%;">«<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Captain_Assassin!" title="User talk:Captain Assassin!">T</a> ♦ <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Captain_Assassin!" title="Special:Contributions/Captain Assassin!">C</a> ♦ <a href="/wiki/User:Captain_Assassin!/Guestbook" title="User:Captain Assassin!/Guestbook">G</a>»</span></sup> 10:11, 22 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<dd>
<ul>

If you'd prefer not to do this, please do say. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 22:12, 29 September 2015 (UTC)

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Modern_Vampires_of_the_City">Modern Vampires of the City</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FModern_Vampires_of_the_City&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Modern_Vampires_of_the_City&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li><s>... that in <a href="/wiki/The_Independent" title="The Independent">The Independent</a>, <a href="/wiki/Simon_Price" title="Simon Price">Simon Price</a> called <i><b><a href="/wiki/Modern_Vampires_of_the_City" title="Modern Vampires of the City">Modern Vampires of the City</a></b></i> <a href="/wiki/Vampire_Weekend" title="Vampire Weekend">Vampire Weekend</a>'s "most cohesive and convincing effort yet" featuring their most accessible compositions?</s></li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Constitution_of_Mississippi" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Constitution of Mississippi">Constitution of Mississippi</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Dan56" title="User:Dan56">Dan56</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Dan56" title="User talk:Dan56">talk</a>). Nominated by <a href="/wiki/User:Sovereign_Sentinel" title="User:Sovereign Sentinel">Sovereign Sentinel</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Sovereign_Sentinel" title="User talk:Sovereign Sentinel" class="mw-redirect">talk</a>) at 11:53, 7 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol redirect vote 4.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/16px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/24px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg/32px-Symbol_redirect_vote_4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Length and nom date check out. No copyvios or other policy violations. Content is fine. The hook is okay, but I think I thought of one that is more interesting, and would fit more with a Halloween theme:</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><b>ALT 1</b> ... that <i><b><a href="/wiki/Modern_Vampires_of_the_City" title="Modern Vampires of the City">Modern Vampires of the City</a></b></i> was called "a deeply God-haunted work"?</p>
<p>This article is good to go once the above hook is approved.--<a href="/wiki/User:3family6" title="User:3family6"><font color="navy"><b>3family6</b></font></a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:3family6" title="User talk:3family6"><font color="black"><u>Talk to me</u></font></a> | <small><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/3family6" title="Special:Contributions/3family6"><font color="purple">See what I have done</font></a></small>) 19:29, 4 October 2015 (UTC)</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> The ALT1 hook is satisfactory and the other DYK criteria are met, so this is good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 05:01, 5 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Just a note to say that we're looking at running this hook on Halloween, as the subject matter lends itself well to the date. See <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK#Halloween_hooks.3F" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">WT:DYK#Halloween hooks?</a> for more info. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 15:42, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Tufted_ground_squirrel">Tufted ground squirrel</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FTufted_ground_squirrel&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tufted_ground_squirrel&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 120px;"><a href="/wiki/File:SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg" class="image" title="Rheithrosciurus macrotis"><img alt="Rheithrosciurus macrotis" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg/120px-SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg" width="120" height="83" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg/180px-SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg/240px-SciurusMacrotisWolf.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2963" data-file-height="2038" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i>Rheithrosciurus macrotis</i></div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the "<b><a href="/wiki/Tufted_ground_squirrel" title="Tufted ground squirrel">vampire squirrel</a></b>" of Borneo <i>(pictured)</i>, which is reputed to eat the livers and hearts of chickens and deer, has the largest known tail to body size ratio of any mammal?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Elephantomyia_bozenae" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Elephantomyia bozenae">Template:Did you know nominations/Elephantomyia bozenae</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 09:26, 7 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>The source for "the largest known tail to body size ratio" says "one of the largest" and is from the Washington Post not a scientific publication; I'm not saying it isn't true but you need better sourcing for such a bold claim. The "vampire squirrel" is also a bit tabloidesque; it's hooky but doesn't really rate inclusion in the same sentence as the observed feeding habits; I'll be back later, I'm going to rub a toad on my lips; I think that summons a prince, or is it cures warts?; gives you warts?!?? Oh great. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>) 17:05, 8 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>I've added an extra reference for the tail from <i>Science</i> magazine, though it doesn't say anything different to the <i>WaPo</i>. It also refers to the squirrel as a vampire; I would hope you don't consider <i>Science</i> to be a tabloid! The inclusion of the alleged vampirism in conjunction with the observed feeding habits is a deliberate bit of debunking. As virtually all of the recently published sources about the squirrel refer to vampirism, I thought it would be important to state up front exactly what is known about its feeding habits. I think using the vampire description in the hook is eminently justifiable as a means of making it more interesting (it seems to have made you look, so it evidently works). But be careful what you do with toads; <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.foxnews.com/health/2011/07/06/toad-suckers-not-just-urban-myth/">you can also get high on them</a>... <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 11:53, 10 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Actually it was the picture that hooked me, not the threat of a squirrel making me its vampire bride. Long enough, new enough, neutral (even if I think the vampire rumours get too much coverage); no copyphrasing or close vio; pic is free to use and intriguing if a bit conservative on the tail; hook fact cited; good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>) 14:30, 10 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>A note for promoters - <b>this article is being saved for Halloween - don't run it before then.</b> <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 12:49, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Demon_core">Demon core</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FDemon_core&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Demon_core&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Demon_core" title="Demon core">demon core</a></b> killed <a href="/wiki/Manhattan_Project" title="Manhattan Project">Manhattan Project</a> scientists <a href="/wiki/Harry_Daghlian" title="Harry Daghlian" class="mw-redirect">Harry Daghlian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Louis_Slotin" title="Louis Slotin">Louis Slotin</a>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Work_(Iggy_Azalea_song)" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Work (Iggy Azalea song)">Template:Did you know nominations/Work (Iggy Azalea song)</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Improved to Good Article status by <a href="/wiki/User:Hawkeye7" title="User:Hawkeye7">Hawkeye7</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Hawkeye7" title="User talk:Hawkeye7">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 22:34, 27 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_voting_keep.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol voting keep.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/16px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/24px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Symbol_voting_keep.svg/32px-Symbol_voting_keep.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> Long enough; newly GA'ed enough; neutral (unbiased that is, not inert); hook fine and cited (though I'd drop "plutonium" to make it more intriguing; I'm "prepassing" that altered hook too); no copyvio or any of that nasty stuff in the sources I could examine; QPQ done. Non-DYK points: please explain what a "pit" is; try to substitute another word for "gadgets"; are "cataracts" really an aggravating factor for a myocardial infarction? Please make a note of why the 1978 end date is given for Theodore Perlman being "still alive" (I guess this is the last time a study was made?). Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>) 02:07, 28 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>Thanks for that. I have switched to the proposed hook. "Pit" is another word for "core"; I have switched to using "core" consistently throughout. "Gadget" is Los Alamos-speak for what a layman might call an "atomic bomb"; I have switched to using "bomb" instead. <a href="/wiki/User:Hawkeye7" title="User:Hawkeye7">Hawkeye7</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Hawkeye7" title="User talk:Hawkeye7">talk</a>) 10:06, 28 September 2015 (UTC)
<dl>
<dd>I have a "gadget" in my car for opening the gates at the end of the drive; I think I'll take my bike. <a href="/wiki/User:Belle" title="User:Belle">Belle</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Belle" title="User talk:Belle">talk</a>) 10:39, 28 September 2015 (UTC)</dd>
</dl>
</dd>
</dl>
</li>
<li>Just to note that we'd like to save this for Halloween for a day of spooky hooks (see <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK#Halloween_hooks.3F" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">WT:DYK#Halloween hooks?</a>. If you'd prefer not to do this, please do say. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 21:32, 29 September 2015 (UTC)
<ul>
<li>Sounds like a great idea to me. <a href="/wiki/User:Hawkeye7" title="User:Hawkeye7">Hawkeye7</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Hawkeye7" title="User talk:Hawkeye7">talk</a>) 22:15, 29 September 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Cooloola_monster">Cooloola monster</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCooloola_monster&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cooloola_monster&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that a <b><a href="/wiki/Cooloola_monster" title="Cooloola monster">monster</a></b> was discovered in 1980 in <a href="/wiki/Great_Sandy_National_Park" title="Great Sandy National Park">Great Sandy National Park</a> in Queensland, Australia?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><b>ALT1</b>:... that the <b><a href="/wiki/Cooloola_monster" title="Cooloola monster">Cooloola monster</a></b> was discovered in 1980 in <a href="/wiki/Great_Sandy_National_Park" title="Great Sandy National Park">Great Sandy National Park</a> in Queensland, Australia?</li>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Tonight:_Franz_Ferdinand" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Tonight: Franz Ferdinand">Tonight: Franz Ferdinand</a></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Lawrence_Joseph_Bader">Lawrence Joseph Bader</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FLawrence_Joseph_Bader&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lawrence_Joseph_Bader&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that when <b><a href="/wiki/Lawrence_Joseph_Bader" title="Lawrence Joseph Bader">Lawrence Joseph Bader</a></b> returned from the dead, he ruined his wife's wedding plans?</li>
</ul>
<p><br /></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><s><b>Alt1</b>...that <a href="/wiki/KETV" title="KETV">KETV-7</a> broadcaster "Fritz" Johnson was in reality, amnesia victim <b><a href="/wiki/Lawrence_Joseph_Bader" title="Lawrence Joseph Bader">Lawrence Joseph Bader</a></b>?</s></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created/expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Inkwell765" title="User:Inkwell765">Inkwell765</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Inkwell765" title="User talk:Inkwell765">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:29, 9 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> This article is new enough and long enough. I have struck ALT1 because it is unclear whether he was an amnesia victim or a hoaxer. The original hook has an inline citation which does not work for me (error 404). However the other sources fully support the hook. The article is neutral, interesting, and free from copyright issues as far as I can see. <a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Cwmhiraeth" title="User talk:Cwmhiraeth">talk</a>) 05:22, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dd>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><span class="template-ping">@<a href="/wiki/User:Cwmhiraeth" title="User:Cwmhiraeth">Cwmhiraeth</a>:</span> Thank you. That was the easiest review I ever had! <a href="/wiki/User:Inkwell765" title="User:Inkwell765">Inkwell765</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Inkwell765" title="User talk:Inkwell765">talk</a>) 15:22, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li>Just a note to say that we're looking at running this hook on Halloween, as the subject matter lends itself well to the date. See <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:DYK#Halloween_hooks.3F" title="Wikipedia talk:DYK" class="mw-redirect">WT:DYK#Halloween hooks?</a> for more info. <a href="/wiki/User:Prioryman" title="User:Prioryman">Prioryman</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Prioryman" title="User talk:Prioryman">talk</a>) 15:40, 6 October 2015 (UTC)</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="November_2_.28All_souls.27_day.29">November 2 (All souls' day)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=58" title="Edit section: November 2 (All souls' day)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Cantique_de_Jean_Racine_.28Faur.C3.A9.29">Cantique de Jean Racine (Fauré)</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FCantique_de_Jean_Racine_%28Faur%C3%A9%29&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cantique_de_Jean_Racine_%28Faur%C3%A9%29&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div style="float:right; margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-dyk-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 100px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg" class="image" title="Fauré in uniform of l'Ecole Niedermeyer, Paris"><img alt="Fauré in uniform of l'Ecole Niedermeyer, Paris" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg/100px-Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg" width="100" height="163" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg/150px-Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg/200px-Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9_en_uniforme_de_l%27Ecole_Niedermeyer.jpg 2x" data-file-width="388" data-file-height="632" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Fauré in uniform of l'Ecole Niedermeyer, Paris</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that Gabriel Fauré's <i><b><a href="/wiki/Cantique_de_Jean_Racine_(Faur%C3%A9)" title="Cantique de Jean Racine (Fauré)">Cantique de Jean Racine</a></b></i> is often performed with his <a href="/wiki/Requiem_(Faur%C3%A9)" title="Requiem (Fauré)">Requiem</a> although he composed it much earlier as a student <i>(pictured in school uniform)</i>?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Overseas_Passenger_Terminal" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Overseas Passenger Terminal">Overseas Passenger Terminal</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: suitable for the days of remembering the dead in November, such as 2 November</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>5x expanded by <a href="/wiki/User:Gerda_Arendt" title="User:Gerda Arendt">Gerda Arendt</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Gerda_Arendt" title="User talk:Gerda Arendt">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 12:47, 30 September 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> God, I love this piece. I'm glad you expanded it. The hook is reliably cited. It's expanded enough. No paraphrasing issues. The photograph is definitely PD. We're good to go. By the way, if you want to have this go up on November 2, you should refer to the special occasion holdings down bellow. They'll help you out with that. Good work! C'est magnifique! <a href="/wiki/User:EtienneDolet" title="User:EtienneDolet" class="mw-redirect">Étienne Dolet</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:EtienneDolet" title="User talk:EtienneDolet">talk</a>) 17:13, 4 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="November_10_or_11_.28Kosherfest.29">November 10 or 11 (<a href="/wiki/Kosherfest" title="Kosherfest">Kosherfest</a>)</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Did_you_know&amp;action=edit&amp;section=59" title="Edit section: November 10 or 11 (Kosherfest)">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Kosherfest">Kosherfest</span></h4>
<div class="plainlinks hlist">
<ul>
<li>( <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ADid_you_know_nominations%2FKosherfest&amp;action=edit">Review or comment</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kosherfest&amp;action=history">Article history</a> )</li>
</ul>
</div>
<ul>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Kosherfest" title="Kosherfest">Kosherfest</a></b>, an annual trade fair for the <a href="/wiki/Kosher_certification_agency" title="Kosher certification agency">kosher-certified</a> food industry, has been called "a cross between a professional trade show and the buffet line at your cousin's <a href="/wiki/Bar_and_Bat_Mitzvah" title="Bar and Bat Mitzvah">bar mitzva</a>"?</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><i>Reviewed</i>: <a href="/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Disappearance_of_Atsumi_Yoshikubo" title="Template:Did you know nominations/Disappearance of Atsumi Yoshikubo">Template:Did you know nominations/Disappearance of Atsumi Yoshikubo</a></li>
<li><i>Comment</i>: <b>Date request</b>: November 10 or 11, the dates of this year's trade show in New Jersey</li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><small>Created by <a href="/wiki/User:Yoninah" title="User:Yoninah">Yoninah</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Yoninah" title="User talk:Yoninah">talk</a>). Self-nominated at 23:56, 12 October 2015 (UTC).</small></p>
<dl>
<dd>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:Symbol_confirmed.svg" class="image"><img alt="Symbol confirmed.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/16px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/24px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/41/Symbol_confirmed.svg/32px-Symbol_confirmed.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></a> size and age ok, article written neutrally, Earwig's copyvio negative. Hook referenced and faithful to source material. Good to go. <a href="/wiki/User:Casliber" title="User:Casliber">Cas Liber</a> (<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Casliber" title="User talk:Casliber">talk</a> <b>·</b> <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Casliber" title="Special:Contributions/Casliber">contribs</a>) 00:14, 13 October 2015 (UTC)</li>
</ul>

<dd>
